<Author>rosanne1
<Content>Beautiful Resort The resort was absolutely beautifule. We had a great 7 day vacation. If you do go buy up to the platinum membership, this allows you premium drinks including Corona, personal concierge service, 20 minute massage, cigars, etc. We did have a hard time getting our premium drinks from the pool and beach bars, they would send us to the platinum lounge, but if a female requested the premium drinks they would get them at those bars. Also, make sure they put Rum in your tropical drinks, they try to serve these without. The atmosphere was great, October was a great time to visit.

<Author>SaskatchewanGypsy
<Content>Great Resort We stayed at the Punta Cana Princess over New Year's. We loved the resort. We found all the staff friendly. They were constantly cleaning. The grounds were beautiful. The food was good, we have stayed at other resorts that had more selection, but we always found something we liked.The rooms were probably the most spacious that we have stayed in. We had a great view.New Year's Eve there were fireworks on the beach. All the resorts up and down the beach put on a display. We would go back.

<Author>CdnGal836
<Content>What a Great Experience 13-20 December 2008I am sure you have read a few reviews on the Punta Cana Princess - we read quite a few before going and we were really looking forward to our trip. The fact that many of the residents at the Punta Cana Princess are return visitors should tell you that it's an amazing place.Upon our arrival at the Resort, the check-in was quick and efficient. We were extremely satisfied with our room and even though it was quite late at night our first task was to check out the facilities. The beach was amazing that first night. Throughout the week whether it was day or night, whenever we did go swimming the water was exhiliarating - leaving Canada and being able to swim in December is indeed a novelty. One review we had seen stated that the food had been barely palatable - well there's an amazing selection of food for each meal. For breakfast a very pleasant gentleman made eggs any way you wanted them - including an amazing omelet! There was also a vast assortment of all kinds of different foods, whether it was fruits, cereals, oatmeal, etc. For lunch and supper the selection was also amazing. At lunch they would have a BBQ set up outside and the variety of the different meats was pleasing and tasty. I particularly enjoyed the pasta bar for supper - you could pick your favorite type of pasta and the gentleman would add your selected spices, ingredients and sauces and voila you would have an amazing little pasta dish. At some point during the week I did get ill - not sure what it was but I think it is something that a majority of us travellers will experience - my recommendation? Immodium is very quick in relieving any issues a person may have and you are able to continue on and enjoy your vacation.The staff was amazing - they would greet you at the entrance of the buffet area and bring you to your table and then would provide you with your drink of choice. In a previous review, someone had complained that the drinks were watered down? I didn't find this - I found the variety of the drinks pleasing and considering that the alcoholic beverages were provided from 1000 hrs in the morning to late at night - we had no complaints here!! There were bars set up at the beach, at the buffets and the swim up bar in the pool. All the bartenders were very friendly and would do their best to ensure we were well taken care of.The staff work so very hard to ensure that the diners are well taken care of for food and what not - every day you would normally see the same server/hostess. Many of the vacationers would slip a gratuity to the server/hostess to show their appreciation for their efforts.There were some complaints about the Entertainment personnel of the Hotel - they're job is to ensure that the residents of the Hotel are having a good time. They have very charismatic personalities and would do their best to engage the residents in volleyball, aerobics, Bingo, dancing, etc - if you didn't want to - then they would leave you be. The people that did join in did have fun - we played volleyball in the pool on our first day there and we had lots of fun (although our team lost against the Entertainment personnel). If anything these people worked very hard as they were often at the Resort early in the morning, were there throughout the day and would return for the evening activities.My sole complaint about the resort was the lack of English that some of the personnel spoke. But, when you think of it - I should have made more of an effort to have learned basic Spanish phrases prior to our departure - When we did speak Spanish they appreciated our efforts.In closing, if you do decide to go to the Punta Cana Princess, you will undoubtedly have an experience of a lifetime and will meet some amazing people also enjoying their stay at the resort.  
<Date>Jan 1, 2009

<Author>TCBaltimore
<Content>Beatiful resort...awful food! My boyfriend and I just returned from an 8-night stay at the Punta Cana Princess, and while we had a nice time, we won't be returning. We had read all of the reviews before going and were prepared for a lot of what we experienced, but not really for how much it would influence our vacation.A couple of really good points...The facility is beautiful; the grounds are immaculate, the room is spacious, and I slept like the dead while we were there. The place is so quiet and dark at night that you can't help but sleep well. A note...you want to be careful when you are getting up to use the restroom in the middle of the night. Get your bearings before you make your way there. It is so dark in the room (which I loved) that you can't see your hand in front of your face. I was a bit fearful of falling down the steps into the sunken living room. I might have brought a small flashlight with me had I know just how dark it was going to be. Also, the lights in the hallways of the building are shut down at night, so if you leave your room while it's still dark in the morning (like we did to get an early pickup for our only excursion to Sanoa Island), be careful! You will have a hard time making it out of the building without some assistance.The beach is gorgeous; the Punta Cana Princess has one of the nicest stretches of beach in the area. The water was a bit chilly, but definitely refreshing and easy to get used to. It is still the Atlantic Ocean, so you will get waves, hence, no snorkeling! The waves were actually pretty intense at times, but I was still able to go out pretty deep. The staff of the resort is very friendly; some speak English, many don't. Learning a little Spanish goes a long way at this resort. Just having a couple of phrases in my repetoire was very helpful and much appreciated. The animacion team was a bit annoying, especially when we were trying to nap on the beach beds. My boyfriend was happily napping one day and was interupted by the shrieks of the animacion team trying to get people to play soccer on the beach). The excursion that we took to Sanoa Island was amazing. This was well worth the extra $100/person. The boat ride out was great, the time on the beach was great, even the bus ride was amazing.On to the bad stuff...the food. We had read that the food was not good. I had no idea. Like someone else who recently reviewed this place, when we got to the Punta Cana airport and saw Wendy's we stuffed ourselves and I almost cried with how good it was to taste something good. I found myself relying a lot on the pasta station at the buffet (which was mediocre) and I ate a lot of bread. The specialty restaurants were horrible. My boyfriend ordered filet mignon, and it was 90% fat. The loaded baked potato was a joke, and the wine is not good. We both got sick (not sure if was from food at Mare Nostrum or the fact that the bartenders wash out the blenders with water from the tap) on our vacation, and while it didn't ruin the vacation, it put a huge damper on it. We came back from vacation not really feeling de-stressed, because much of our vacation was spent being sick and/or worrying about being sick. For this, and this alone, I would not return to this resort and would be hesitant to return to the DR at all.  
<Date>Dec 22, 2008

<Author>bigdog02645
<Content>Could be world class, but the food is horrible! I need to start off by saying this could be a world class hotel. The rooms are great, large, clean, good a/c, roomy bathroom, with no issues with water temp in the nice shower, and great pressure as well. The daily housekeeping was nice, and included a late nite turndown service as well. the mini bar is a great asset as well, stocked daily with soda and beer. The beach is awesome, and is one of my favorites, they have it being cleaned all day, white sand, blue water, nice waves. the vip package includes the use of the beach beds and they are great too, you can even have drinks brought to you by the waiter, though the bar is close and quicker to use.No issues with getting towels, there seemed to be plenty. The grounds and pool are well kept, and very nice, many people working on the upkeep all day, they really do a nice job. Internet access is available in the lobby, starting at 9am and is included free in the vip package, they give you a 20 minute pass code daily, though most days i got a few no problem. We dont stay up too late, so cant say much about the entertainment, karaoke one night was fun, and our friend went to the sister resort next door for a show they said was great and included fireworks. Check in and out was a breeze, very helpful, friendly, and courtious staff for the most part, though language can be a bit of a stumbling point at times, and chalenging at others, But I am a visitor, so not too many points off for that. So Jay you ask, whats up with 2 stars?? the place sounds wonderful! OK, now it gets ugly... Judi and I travel 3 times a year to all inclusives at least, we've do not go away for the food, we go for beach and fun, we usually ignore reviews about food complaints because we've never had an issue, until this place. The two ala cart restaurants we ate at for dinner were just ok, and only open for dinner, the breakfast and lunch buffets were just plain weak to gross, no better, seriously, just plain nasty, though thebeach buffet/grill I have to admit was nasty times 2. In the airport on the way home,, we ran to Wendys for a burger because we were so hungry, and i must say it was soooo good! In fact we then had pizza next door as well, we were stuffed, it was like we hadnt eaten in a week! OOOPS, we realized we actually ate at least 30 cheese sandwiches between us throughout the week for breakfast, and lunch, and snacks too. I publicly apologise to all the reviewers, and complainers that in my mind Ive character assinated, I now feel your pain, Must be Karma.LOL Hey, did i mention the wine? YUK! We are really easy people to pleas when it comes to wine, although we like fine wine, at home we we enjoy fairly cheap, though good stuff, Im telling you the house wines they serve are positivly disgusting, undrinkable, did i mention nasty? You can purchase other wines, but only at dinner at the ala cart restaurants, $22 a bottle for a cheap mondavi sav blanc, hey we drink it at home. so not too bad. They will make you sign for the bottle, no cash accepted at the restaurants, you know why? cause they add $6 to the price called a convience fee, what is that? $28 dollars a bottle, oh well, at least we got to enjoy a glass of wine with our newly made friends. Well at least I could also drink a nice absolute on the rocks right? Not so fast, hmm, this tasts funny, kinda like lighter fluid.. the manager was kind enough to get a new bottle for me though, and after sniffing both admitted there was a problem with the bottle at the bar, LOL caught ya filling the good bottles with the bad booze! any way, he let me keep the new bottle, which I tipped the bartender well to only pour for me. Ya know, I could go on ang on, which I have ,and now Im done, will we return to the PCP, not even if it was free! Unless they fire the and fix the food and beverage dept.  
<Date>Dec 18, 2008

<Author>Judy090
<Content>Great time at the Princess We have just returned from the Punta Cana Princess having spent a wonderful week with 6 of our friends. We have been to this hotel on 3 previous occasions and again were not disappointed. There is nothing negative to say about the whole holiday from our point of view. If you are looking to go to a big resort, walk for miles to get to the beach, bar, restaurants or your room, line up at the buffet and bar and like the disco at night, then this is not the resort for you.The Princess has 270 rooms so everything you need is close at hand. The beach is beautiful and the pool is well maintained. All the lounge chairs are comfortable and plenty and there is lots of shade.The food is good and the bars stock premium liquor for Regency Club guests. The other Princess resorts have a la carte restaurants that are available to the PCP visitors but we have found that they are no better than the 3 at the PCP.What sets the PCP apart we believe are the incredibly good staff. They are the friendliest people that we have found in all our travels. Year after year they remember us and there doesn't seem to be much staff turnover.There have been many improvements since our last visit to the beach bar area and the lobby is now undergoing a renovation. The hotel is 5 years old and it appears that mangement is working to keep everything in good repair.This may not be the place for the very young who can get bored easily but for us retired people it's the perfect place to relax, enjoy the beach and the company of our friends.Ron  Judy Toronto  
<Date>Dec 6, 2008

<Author>ggstar
<Content>Poor Customer Service Then the adventure continues, we arrived at the resort and had absolutely no complaints, well except that the maid left a dirty towel that she cleaned with on our dresser, which was most disgusting, and the room had a bad smell to it, which is really not much compared to the following events:On December 2, 2008, our last full day/night of our vacation, around 4:30 p.m., the hotel entertainment staff washaving a game at the pool. The game consisted of people walking around the pool perimeter with eggs (not hollowed out, nor were they hard boiled) the eggs were carried on a spoon, which the spoon was held by their mouth. The staff did not have anyone cleaning up the eggs that fell off the spoons during or immediately after the game. My boyfriend was walking in the pool area to go back and retrieve belongings left at our chair by the pool. As he was walking around the pool he stepped on and slipped on a broken egg resulting from said activity. He slipped and fell hurting his back. After we returned to the room and took a hot shower in hopes of soothing some of the pain resulting from the fall. After showering he was still in excruciating pain. We walked up to the guest services to report the incident, as we were reporting it the woman at the desk phoned someone (I believe Diana the guest service manager), speaking in Spanish, not knowingly that he understands and speaks Spanish as well. She was asked by Diana what nationality we were. We then reported the accident, filled out a accident report form, and was told to wait for the Diana to come out and speak with us, we were then told to wait again for the doctor to arrive. After the doctor arrived we proceeded to go to the medical facility for an examination of the injured area. He was examined and then given a shot, which knocked him out for theevening. The doctor informed us that she would call in a few hours to see how he was feeling, and then for him to come the following day to see her, there was no phone call that evening. That evening was completely ruined as we had lots of activities planned for our LAST night on vacation. The next day we went up to guest relations wanting to speak to Diana and the general manager, who stated that he does not speak to guests. Diana told us that he needed to go the hospital to get an XRAY of his back so they could determine whether or not he could travel. They refused to pay for the hospital, after arguing the fact that the injury was a direct result of the resorts entertainment activities, Diana said she would phone the hospital and take care of it. Then came back and said that they would only pay for the cab fare.Our VIP travel representative, Pedro, also met us in the lobby. Pedro was extremely useless as well as rude. He acted as if he was frightened by the manager and would not address any of the problems that we were having. I then spoke to Pedro explaining that Diana said she would take care of the hospital, as I was speaking Pedro turned to my boyfriend totally dismissing as if anything I said did not matter. This vacation was booked and looked forward to immensely. We booked the vacation while my boyfriend was in the hospital having surgery. This vacation was supposed to be OUR time, after he had spent 2 months in the hospital. Our last two days were completely ruined, and quite a disappointment and the resort and VIP did nothing to try to resolve the issue, nor did they apologize or show any concern for our situation.

<Author>Maineacs
<Content>Punta Cana Princess - Superb!!!!!!!!!!! November 4 to November 14 - Punta Cana Princess My girlfriend, Cyndie and I, (The Maineacs), just returned from another super fantastic vacation to the Dominican Republic, this time at Punta Cana Princess, Nov. 4 to Nov. 14. This was our ninth trip to the DR, and 2nd time to a Princess Resort (1st was Bavaro Princess).. First year at the Iberostar Costa Dorado in Puerta Plata, second year at Bavarro Princess in Punta Cana, third year at the Iberostar Hacienda Dominicus in Bayahibe, fourth year at the Iberostar Punta Cana. Fifth year at Casa del Mar. Sixth year at Sunscape the Beach. Seventh year at Punta Cana Grand. Eight year at Casa del Mar. Read on to get some pointers on the resort. Thanks to all who gave input in helping us decide where to go (Especially Lea).Flight/Airport We are from Maine, and our trip departed from Boston on American Airlines. We took the bus from Portland, ME and it drops you off right at your terminal. Worked out great Our vacation was booked through Vacation Travel Mart, and Beth Miller again found us the best deal anywhere, for the ninth straight year. No one has come close to their prices, plus you accumulate mileage, which we will use next year for our 2nd free trip!!!!!!!  We were able to use the check-in kiosk at Logan and it took us 5 minutes to check in. Glad we didn't get to the airport 2 hours ahead of time. Flight down was thru San Juan and flight back was thru JFK. Flights were all on time.Arrival in DR Arrived in Punta Cana and we were met by our tour representative from Caribe. Had one other couple on our van and we dropped them off first, Took about 30 minutes. Nice new van.Check-in No wait whatsoever. No large tour (Apple, etc.) was checking in. No greeting drink!! Who cares. I had a drink in my had from the lobby bar right away. No charge for room safe - yeah!!! We thought we had VIP but I didn't ask then. We were on 3rd floor of Bldg. 4 facing pool and ocean. Fantastic room and view. Cathederal ceiling. Luggage was whisked away to our room, and by the time we arrived at our room the bags were right behind. As to VIP, the only thing I cared about was the gourmet dinner at La Cava and the internet access.Room Room was fantastic. AC worked great, always on - they had a card in the wall switch. The best hot water and water pressure of all our trips to date. Coffee pot in room. Everything was perfect. No bugs. When I saw that there were no bottles of liquor I figured out that there must have been a mix-up. Later that night I emailed Beth miller at Vacation Travel Mart telling her that I thought we didn't get VIP. The next day our room phone rings and it is Beth!!! She had called the front desk and corrected the mix-up and we had our VIP. She also said that because of the mix-up she bought us a private dinner on the beach!!!!! Talk about fantastic service. None better!!!!!They were all set to move us into Bldg. 5, etc., but we were all settled and we loved our room. We went to the front desk and tols them we were all set, and they gave us our new wrist bands, and cards for massage, inernet and gourmet dinner. We were all set!!!!!!! Beach As many of you know, you can walk for miles to the left or right. Not as calm and clear as CDM, but always kept clean. Did miss the snorkeling somewhat, but we became pool Maineacs for this trip. No major problems getting a palapa or bed if you wanted. We didn't use a bed at all. I was in the water (pool bar) all the time Always stayed at the palapa closest to the pool bar.  Pool It was fantastic and large with sloped gradual entry at each end. Brought our own floats. Nelson at the pool bar was the best. Every time I would turn around he would have another drink ready for me. What a guy!!!!!Food The best food overall that we have had to date. Buffet was great. Seafood night was super. Fantastic fish and sushi. We probably ate half of our dinners at the buffet, it was that good. The ala carte restaurants!!!! Since you didn't have to sign up to eat there, and you could eat there as many times as you like, this made for great dining. We didn't find a bad thing to say about any of them. (Mexican) - Great. As other have said - the filet, the filet, the filet!!!!!!!!!!!!! And many margaritas!!! (Gourmet) La Cava (next door at Caribe) - Maybe the best ala cart restaurant for food and atmosphere that we have ever had in the Dominican Republic. It is like going into a wine cellar. Food was exquisite. I had snapper and Cyndie had duck (quack, quack). Just fantastic(Seafood) mare Nostrum - This was also great. The appetizer was to die for. Very simple. Shrimp broiled in a butter sauce. We were there asking for more bread so we could sop up the remaining butter sauce. We definetly took an extra cholestrol pill that night!!Dinner on the beach/wedding gazebo!!!!! About as goog as it gets. Appetizer was again simple but delicious. Large avacado filled with shrimp with a Romalade (sp?) Sauce. We almost got filled just eating that. Then we had steak (filet) and lobster. Great bottle of wine, or was it two??Julius (Julio) Caesar was our waiter. Great guy. He also worked lunch and dinner at Mare Nostrum.Had a great beach party on Tues?? It was all great but they had all the food on tables in one long line, which made for a long line of people waiting. If they had it broken up in stations then it would have been better. Drink What can I say. Anything and everything you want - just ask. Top shelf drinks aren't a high priority for us, but when it is available, we will and did partake. Caiprinha's. and many Manhattan's ;-) Had any drink or liquor that you could think of. If you thought the drinks were too weak, just ask for more ron. They will give it to you with a smile. Met a nice gentlemen from Toronto(via England) at the lobby bar and he was sipping on a Scotch. So asked him what kind, he said Johnny Walker Black, and I said that sounds great. So I was sipping on many of these the rest of our stay. Staff Everyone was wonderful, friendly, and always going out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. Maids were great. Fridge always restocked each day. Animation team. They were great kids, but with this being an adults only, they could do without the constant chatter. Also at night in the lobby, they would show up and try and entertain. One night they had a piano player/singer which was great, and another night they had a band and singers which was great. Until the animation team would get involved and try to singBADLY.. If they just kept the piano player and band it would have been great. Never made it next door for entertainment. We were there to relax and unwind, and we did. Hi to all the people we met from afar Okla., Canada (all over - especially Palsmom), PA, England, and Ireland. I think we Americans were in the minority, which is fine with us. It lets us meet more people from away.Flight back No problem at the airport. Flew through JFK, We arrived back late in Boston and we stayed at a local hotel, and took the bus back to cold Maine the next morning. So sad to leave. We would go back to this resort in a minute. Maybe even next year!!Overall it was another fantastic trip to the DR. We never made it to any of the local bars to meet up with some of you. We just vegged out and lost all sense of time. We were on vacation to decompress, and we surely did that. As usual, please email or PM us if you have any questions. Photos will be up in a couple of weeks on Webshots. [-]Mike  Cyndie - The Mainiacs

<Author>MommaNeedsATan
<Content>A nice resort ..... with room for improvement The resort is a perfect size if you are looking for a quiet and relaxing holiday. The beach is spectacular and the pool is huge for such a small resort. Always ample chairs and beds. We had the upgrade package which was a nice touch, especially when it came to alcohol - Absolut, Smirnoff, MGD and Bailey's. The staff is wonderful. It truly was a nice vacation. Our only complaint - the food! You'd never go hungry but meals were hit or miss at both the buffet and a la cartes.

<Author>subwayslave
<Content>Nice Resort Stayed at PCP Nov.17-22,2008 . VIP Package, got bathrobe, slipers, fruit basket, bottle of rum and cigars. I had requested a room in buld. 5 and got room # 5003. Nice room close to the beach and pool. never a problem with towels. The mini fridge was always stocked and extra bottled water left in the room. The bed was always turned down at night. The housekeeping staff was wonderful. TV had NBC, ABC Showtime, HBO etc. came in handy when it rained. The weather was warm sunny and beautiful, with a nice breeze for most of the trip. It did rain one evening and most of the following day.The entertainment staff did a very good job at keeping us occupied and having fun. They set up dart game, Bingo, we had all types of board games, dancing etc. They set up in the lobby during the bad weather. In the evening, they had lite entertainment, Music, Karoke. You could take a shuttle to the big stage at the Caribe Princess for the nightly show, or to the Tower Casino. Went to the Tower Casino one nite and won aprox. $40. It is a nice sized venue. Didn't go to the Arieto Disco, if you choose to go, they will bring you there.Food I always found something I liked. Tried the Fondue Restraunt liked it. How often do I have fondue (never). Loved the Asian buffet. Enjoyed Lobster at the Seafood Restaraunt. The Mare Nostrum on the beach had a lovely brekfast each morning in addition to the buffet.Nice pool with swim-up bar. There were plenty of chairs and bali beds both at the pool and the beach. Love the beach the water has waves but they aren't too big. I found the beach clean, nice soft light sand.The PCP is on the quite side. I would've liked a bit more entertainment at the resort ,but all in all it was a very nice vacationIn addition, if you check out late and leave your luggage in the luggage room, lock your bags or take money and valuables with you. I was due to be picked up at 2:45 PM. The hotel was kind enought to let me shower in a courtesy suite and keep my bags in a locked room so I could enjoy the pool and sun for a few more hours. This was greatly appriceated. I had a large beach bag where I put the clothes to wear after the shower, my travel doucments and money were in a zippered pouch from the TA. I left the pouch in the bag with my clothes, I had ment to take it with me but overlooked it.. after my shower I got my luggage gave the bellman a tip and waited for my ride. As I was leaving I was touched by the enthusastic goodbye the bellman gave me. Waving giving thumbs up with a 1000 watt smile. As we were nearing the airport , I opened my pouch to get a tip for the driver, when, I noticed that two $50. bills were gone. I still had about 40 singles and a few $5's and $20's. Now that enthuastic goodbye took on a whole new meaning. Bye Fool. At least I had enough to get home.

<Author>ally973
<Content>The Low-Budget Honeymoon Our travel agent BEGGED us not to select this resort... but the price was right. We selected quantity over quality. He suggested a short trip to a high-end resort. We got what we paid for.My biggest complaint is that I found the food inedible. I was sick the entire trip, but found out I had gall stones the entire time. My luck! I hated that the restaurants I loved most were closed randomly. The buffet was so nasty, yet always open. I lost 5 lbs by skipping breakfast and lunch for 7 days. The dinners are by far better than the other meals. The drinks to me were super sweet and cheap tasting and we had the honey moon package VIP.Here's what I loved: The room. We had a lovely honeymoon suite overlooking the beach, actually it was ON the beach. We had an amazing TWO patios. We were in Bldg 5 which is actually cooler temp. wise so you may want to request it as it's also right near the beach and pool. We always got a beach bed and seat. The staff is amazing. They are super friendly and helpful - though bring your Spanish dictionary, they speak very little English. Our maid left our room spotless and with the help of some singles every day, she jammed our fridge with waters and soda. Note that the staff works so very hard. They will do anything in their power to make you happy. The place is spotless, the janitorial staff does not stop for a minute. I didn't see one bug in our bathroom or room, this was a big fear for me as I have never been to location like Punta Cana where people warned me of weird tropical bugs. Ha ha!I was bummed that the Internet was constantly down - we lugged our laptop there for nothing. They have what I refer to as fun nazis that run around the pool and beach area trying to get you to do aerobics and other games. I told them I was fat and lazy and just wanted to chill out after planning a wedding for a year. I found out the other guests LOVE the fun squad and so I'm just a cranky American. Speaking of which, we were almost the only Americans. I found everyone who spoke English were from Canada and they were SOOOO nice! The other guests were very helpful and would say hello and chat with you in the pool. We had a blast gabbing with people poolside and my husband loved the bartenders and barflies. There are lots of choices for excursions, though I wasn't into this at all, my husband enjoyed them while I laid around by the pool. It's a nice small resort, you won't get lost or feel overwhelmed with choices. I picked this resort also to escape kids and there weren't any spring breaker types - it was a very relaxing, quiet environment which is what I was seeking.I knew the food was not their best quality so I wasn't expecting anything really. Funny thing is, I'm happy with TGI Friday's and Applebees, I'm by no means a gourmet - but it was just icky. The fondue was a big big let down - even the onion soup was nasty. Oh well. Stick with Tex Mex and the Seafood place. We loved La Cava which is at the other resort. That was great!

<Author>Jenniferh
<Content>Don't use the ATM at the resort and cancel your card if you did! This review will definately be tainted based on a bad experience, but rightly so. My husband and I stayed at the resort from September 27-October 3 and overall had a good time, but found everything about the DR, including this resort to be sketchy. We both used the ATM at the resort several times during our stay as no one would take a credit card for anything - shops, excursions, etc. In the past week, BOTH of our checking accounts have been cleaned out with fradulant ATM withdrawls in foreign countries. We have separate accounts and never use the same ATMs for withdrawls except for this one. Basically the resort machine was hacked and our account numbers and pins were stolen and it would have been an inside job. Oh, and either housekeeping or airport staff stole my husband's electric shaver and belt.We are definately left with a bad taste in our mouths, but wished it would have been a better trip in the first place. On the plus side, we met some great people and had a lot of fun with them. Our room was big and clean and we had a pool view. The beach was pretty and the excursions we went on were nice. The bar and restaurant staff were really friendly and nice as well. We had a very lovely private beach dinner for our anniversary. I think we would have found these things though or had hoped to find them at any resort and unfortunately nothing stood out as outstanding and the bad things really stood out., beyond the theft. I will list out a few:1. The ala carte restaurants were hardly open - only one at once and I don't think the Italian place ever opened. And you couldn't plan ahead because it was never listed which would be open when anywhere.2. They shut down the seafood restaurant on the beach while we were there and started constuction on a new restaurant closer to the beach. We were treated to bright lights, bulldozers and LOUD noises on the beach day and night - not very relaxing.3. The buffet food was edible, but not necessarily good. 4. The salespeople on the terrace each night were beyond annoying. 5. It was inconvenient and it turns out costly that the gift shop, excursion representative, and dive shop on the resort would not take credit cards - cash only. I think many of these things are the case at most all-inclusive resorts and that you get what you pay for. We've stayed at a Secrets in Mexico and a Couples in Jamaica which are top of line resorts and did not find these problems at all. So, I don't even know if I would have posted this review before the ATM theft because the resort isn't marketed as a 4-star or superior resort. I am surprised so many others have posted such glowing reviews here and that it ranks so highly.  
<Date>Nov 28, 2008

<Author>poozieny
<Content>Totally pleasant, totally comfortable resort Just returned from a week's stay at the Punta Cana Princess resort. Overall, it was a great week. The resort is lovely and met all of my expectations.Check-in and check-out were a breeze. Couldn't have asked for a quicker or more efficient process. During the week, all of the writing on my wristband wore away, but there was no problem having it replaced (I believe the continuous spray sunscreens were the culprit). Other than that, I didn't need to speak with the front desk all week, so really can't comment on how they handle true crises.Bell services were also excellent. My suitcase was delivered and picked up promptly.Maid service was excellent. I'm sure it helps to leave that little marker in your key slot, so they know when you're in your room and when you're out. Plenty of towels were provided (no wash cloths), extras when requested, and plenty of bottled water provided. I did not drink the sodas/beer from the minibar, so don't know how quickly they would have been replenished. Only one very minor maintenance issue in the room - a burnt out lightbulb in the bathroom. I left a note about it before leaving for dinner, and it was replaced before I returned to the room for the night.Room decor is simple...almost stark. Plenty of storage. Bed was comfy, and the day bed in the living room was a nice place to relax. Bathroom was fine. Double sinks I guess is considered an upscale feature, but it left minimal counter space. I'd have rather had the counter space. Shampoo, conditioner, bath gel and lotion all provided.Grounds are beautiful and very well maintained. The patio area around the pool is hosed down and scrubbed each morning, and the pool is meticulously cleaned each morning, as well. Public restrooms were also very clean. The deck area attached to the Mare Nostrum bar was a wonderful place to hang out - very comfy seating, lovely atmosphere.Beach was great. Not sure how full the resort was, but there were always plenty of chairs available, even if you showed up late. not sure when the palapas were claimed, but, unless you really need one in the front row, you could show up at 9:30 and still find one. I never made it over to the beach beds - really preferred the palapa/ chair arrangement and that you could sit up to read. The beds seemed popular, though. Surf was gentle enough but big enough for some fun. There were some strands of sea grass floating, for those of you who don't like that.Did not go in the pool and only spent two hours on my final morning in one of the pool chairs. Seemed like the younger guests gravitated to the pool.Food was, overall, pretty good. There were a few things that were not the best, but overall, pretty well done. I had most of my breakfasts and lunches at the beach buffet - Mare Nostrum. Limited selection, but plenty enough. Dinner buffets at the main restaurant were good - went to the Mexican and Asian. Also tried three of the four a la cartes - Rio Grande Tex Mex, Fondue and Mare Nostrum. All were good meals. The steak at Rio Grande was actually pretty excellent. There were late night snacks at Mare Nostrum but never made it down there to check it out. Didn't use room service at all.Drinks were good, overall. There was a little shack right on the beach or you could go to the bar at Mare Nostrum. There was also the lobby bar and pool bar. There's a bar in the large buffet restaurant, but I believe that's only a service bar - not for guests. Remember - if the drink isn't strong enough for you, ask for more rum....it's gladly poured.Service was outstanding. Always with a smile. Special kudos to Santa at Mare Nostrum and Yenny, bar waitress at Mare Nostrum and lobby bar. Lovely women, both. Santa is a mother hen sort, always making sure I had the drink(s) I needed, table setting, etc. Entertainment - the Animacion team worked very hard to get guests involved, especially during the day. But, it became a little annoying when they would just not let it go, when it was clear that no one was interested in what they were offering. Please don't sit down on my beach chair and try to talk me into doing something I really don't want to do... when I'm very clearly not interested. I know they have to try, but..... it's a minor complaint. No big deal. Evening shows were not much. Karaoke a few times, some games, some music. I guess for the real shows, you have to go next door. But, I found the little trolley system to be lacking. Trolleys were infrequent, and the drivers were kinda surly, except for the one I got on the last night - Gabino. The little pathways that the trolley takes are really dark, and kinda spooky. There's one spot, on the way to the casino, where you pass through a back stage area where there was always a bunch of men hanging out, not doing a whole lot.... nothing bad happened other than feeling uncomfortable, as a woman traveling alone.My biggest complaint about the resort is that it is soooooo dark. The lighting along the pathways is just not sufficient. And, after returning to the resort late one night, the lamp posts had been shut off - no lighting whatsoever. This is a very quiet, very sleepy resort. If you're into late night partying, look elsewhere. The guests were of all ages, but probably leaning towards the 50+ range. There were a couple of groups of younger couples who seemed to be able to create their own party, so that was good for them. But otherwise, the resort really isn't conducive to socializing with other guests, so everyone either turns in early or leaves the premises.Overall, I give the resort a thumbs-up. Was torn as to whether I should give it 3 or 4 circles but settled on 4, because what they did, they did well. No reason not to return, but not sure I will, with so many other resorts to try. Would depend a lot on who I'm traveling with, I guess.  
<Date>Nov 24, 2008

4	23(little):1	349(lack):1	518(system):1	1079(trolley):1	

<Author>mare123
<Content>Great vacation at Punta Cana Princess We just returned from a weeks stay at the Punta Cana Princess Resort  Spa. We have been to other resort areas in the Dominican Republic, but had never been to Punta Cana.Of all the resort choices in Punta Cana, Punta Cana Princess met a few of our top criterias- less then 300 rooms, adults only, and more then 1 a la carte dinner options. We were very pleased with our choice.The rooms are decent sized. We had a king size bed, but 2 double beds are an option. There were plenty of drawers and the closet was double sized making it possible to unpack and not live out of a suitcase. Two steps down from the bed area is the seating area with a daybed, coffee table, a chest with the minifridge  tv, and sliders to the balcony. The bathroom has a double sink vanity with the tub/shower combo. The tiling/vanity in the bathroom appeared updated, but the tub itself was, in my opinion, old and in need of updating. They should consider ripping the tubs out to make it a large walk-in shower or replace the tubs with ones that are actually deep enough for someone over 5??to have a proper soak. We never had a problem with water temperature or pressure. In general the room/bathroom was in good condition and the housekeepers did a fantastic job keeping it clean and well stocked.Personal observations about the room- I HATE flat sheets instead of fitted sheets! Nothing feels worse then waking up in the middle of the night wrapped up in the sheets and your arms/legs/both are itching from the mattress pad. Our 2nd floor room had a very musty smell pretty much 24/7 even with the AC running, but I find that typical in many of the resorts I have stayed in. From past experineces I now travel with a scented candle or a glade plug-which cures the problem. I also found the clothes in the closet were getting the same musty smell so the travel size bottle of Febreeze I brought with me went quickly.Dining- as I mentioned one of the reason we chose PCP was because it offers 4 a la carte restaurants on site as well as the others at the sister resorts. I don mind buffet for breakfast or even lunch, but I much prefer a la carte for dinner. The a la cartes at PCP do not require reservations. Twice we walked in and sat right away, two other times we had about 45 minutes to wait. A 45 minute wait is not bad except your waiting options for the Tex Mex  Italian are.. loiter in front of the restaurant, go to the lobby bar and if you are lucky you may find an empty chair/couch, or walk around. I think it would be a great addition if there were chairs outside the restaurants so people could comfortably sit and wait- which is what they have at the sister resort. At Mare Nostrum and the Swiss you can get a drink at the Mare Nostrum bar which seemed to have plenty of seating. Of the 4 a la cartes at PC, Mare Nostrum was our favorite. Our second favorite was the Italian. We also ate at the Tex-Mex which was good, but the other 2 just happened to be better. We did not try the Swiss.At the sister resort we ate at both gourmet restaurants. You have to make reservations at least a day in advance. We booked both our reservations the day after we arrived. Because it was ff season?and rather then having both gourmet restaurant open, the La Cava restaurant alternated its menu with El Pescadors. El Pescador (with tax) was $32 per person and La Cava $35 per person. Both were a great dining experience- the menu and food presentation was definitely gourmet as well as delicious. The service was top notch. It was well worth the extra money. Some people may argue that being an all inclusive resort one should not have to pay for gourmet food... well my feeling is that everyone does what they like to do on vacation. I personally would prefer to spend $35 for fabulous dining experience rather then any amount of money for a parasail or banana boat ride. To each their own. And that is why I am so happy that the Princess resorts have the gourmet surcharge restaurants as an option- I think more all inclusive resorts should do the same!We did not try any of the other restaurants at the sister resorts- just not enough nights!Comments on dining at PCP- the main buffet for breakfast and lunch had plenty to offer. I never walked away from a meal hungry. However, I think at a resort this size, that caters to adults only, and is rated as well as it is, Mare Nostrum may be more suited as an a la carte for breakfast and omit the buffet at lunch offering more grill food items. The resort property is beautiful. It is well kept and has a very natural, tropical feel. The lobby is a great place to have drinks before or after dinner. There is a well stocked gift shop and if you are planning to shop at the airport on your return, don count on it! Limited shopping at the Punta Cana airport?you are better off shopping at your resort- either at the gift shop or down the beach at the vendors. The spa and fitness center facilities are nice. However, I did not use any of the fitness equipment because they do not open til 8am! I was up and ready to work out by 7am and for the week stuck to power walks. Waiting til 8am to workout would have meant a late breakfast and a late start to my beach reading days! A 50 minute massage was $80.The beach is gorgeous! You could walk either direction for a very long distance. I loved that! Although we had acess to the beach beds we never used them?in our opinion they were way too close together and unless you draped towels on the side, provided little shade. But most of the week they were all being used which verifies their popluarity. We prefer to spread out and have a little personal space and there are lots of huts and shade from palm trees. However, if we wanted a front row hut, we had to go down and save one by 7:30am. In the paper work that you are given at check-in it says you can hold chairs for 30 minutes. My husband and I took turns getting a hut and waiting there for the other to return from their walk and then we would go to breakfast. We saw many huts being saved with personal belongings and the people not showing up til mid-late morning, hours beyond the 30 minute time allowance.... which noone was enforcing anyway.We spent all day at the beach. We were pleasantly surprised and impressed with the beach bar service. The bartender/server Jose was one busy man.. but he had a great system and I think for once we were served at our chairs more often then we had to go to the bar ourselves. Jose not only makes the drink, he serves them. No back up whatsoever! We have had beach service at other resorts where there is a bartender and server(s) and they could not even compare to Jose one man show! The pool area is lovely, but we are beach people. Whenever we walked by it was pretty busy and in the afternoon it seemed to get more lively and social. We did notice that there was hut/bed saving along the pool as well. It appears there is less shade poolside so people were up and saving huts/beds earlier then at the beach.Since we are exhausted by full days of sun and reading, we did not take advantage of the night life. On site at PCP there is no night life.. although one night there was a band set up in the lobby... so the resort is very quiet  peaceful which was perfect for us. You can take a short huttle?ride to the sister resort for the nightly show which start at 9:45pm. Unless you want a front row seat, don plan to arrive much before 10pm, you will save yourself 15-20 minutes of introductions in 3-4 different languages! The casino  disco are also a shuttle ride away.Other then taking out the Hobie Cat ($11 to get pproved?by waterports), we did not participate in any organized activities or tours. For those who want to be more active, there are enough things offered to keep you entertained.A most often discussed topic- tipping. We choose to tip for good service we receive rather then tip with hopes of getting better service. The service at PCP is great! So we did a fair amount of tipping thru out the resort. All the staff members we interacted with were exceptionally friendly. Considering there were staff members working the breakfast/lunch buffet and then later that night you would see them at an a la carte restaurant with the same big smile is pretty incredible. Whomever is in charge of the staff at PCP is doing a great job with employee morale. We were quite impressed. ( a quick thanks to Diana in Guest Services who replied to my many email questions!)Overall it was great vacation. We would definitely return to PCP.  
<Date>Nov 23, 2008

7	4(nice):1	29(minute):1	101(center):1	211(facility):1	314(spa):1	730(massage):1	983(fitness):1	

<Author>Niffer78
<Content>LOVED IT! LOVED IT! LOVED IT! Three of us just returned home from 10 days at the Punta Cana Princess and we all loved it.Property - Was just the right size, not large but not too small. The hotel was at full capacity, but it never felt full. It was easy to walk through the property and not feel cramped. We used the facilities at the sister property too, the Caribe Club and it was too big. You had to take a trolley from the lobby to the restaurants and beach.Staff - they were all super friendly, everyone says Hola! And are genuinely excited to see you. Lots of fun activities and the animation team is great!Food - We all enjoyed the food, even the buffet was good. there are 4 a la carte restaurants. Tex Mex was ok, Fondue was fun, Pasta was amazing, and the Mediterranean I recommend the grilled lobster.Beach - Was beautiful!!! We made it down to the beach between 930-10 every day and still got a cabana. For the best boogie boarding, walk down the beach about 10 minutes and the waves are awesome!Over all we loved it and i would go back in a heartbeat!  
<Date>Nov 18, 2008

<Author>CaribbeanStud
<Content>It's what you make of it Well, I read reviews for months prior to my group of 6 going to PCP from 11/6 - 11/15/08. The range of comments and ratings really boils down to it's what you make of it. It is not a 5 star resort, and it's not priced that way. If you are an entertainment, food, or beverage critic, you will have plenty to write about. The best advice I can give is get the VIP Package that gives you the premium drinks. ASK FOR the Baily's, Tanqueray Gin or what ever you want. They did not have Grey Goose Vodka. The cigars in the room are OK. Don't plan on drinking the rum they give you in the room. If you go to the bar to get juices, you mught as well have them make the drinks. It's all included anyway.The rooms and resort is kept very clean. That was great. The beach is great and we loved the beach beds, that they also have at the pool by the way. Be sure to schedule your dinners at the different restaurants. Those that complain about the food or the fact that they only ate at the buffets, just didn't make the reservations correctly. You can only make them 1 day in advance, but it's worth it to just be in different places each night. The walks to the other resorts are fun. keep in mind you are in the Caribbean, and look at the stars. They are beautiful!My opinion is that the resort is fine. Great beach, everything is clean, and the food is OK. There is plenty to do with Banana Rides, boat rides, Kayaks, Para-Sailing, ATV and other excursions. Going out of the resort was not fun. Actually it is a little scary. We went to the Casino 3 nights, and even that ride passes an area that make you feel like someone might jump you and take your money. It's a very poor country, and the roads and local housing are terrible.Would I go back? Probably not. But the biggest reason is I am more of a ben there, done that kind of guy. (Except for Vegas)If you are booked and are reading this, GO. Enjoy the beach and pool, get the VIP package and be sure to ask for the good stuff. Just don't expect too much. Again, you will get what you paid for. It's actually a really good deal.  
<Date>Nov 17, 2008

<Author>cochinillo
<Content>First Time to the Caribbean We have recently returned home from our first trip to the Caribbean, and our first experience with an all inclusive. We stayed at the Punta Cana Princess Oct 23- Nov 6 and loved the fact that it was small, very clean, very friendly, beautiful beach, staff absolutely wonderful and friendly. We appreciated that it was quiet later in the night, knowing that if we wanted more excitement we just had to go next door to the sister hotels. The Food: We are not picky eaters, and found the food to be good. The a la carte restaurants were delicious, no complaints. The buffets had various theme nights and if you weren't particular on that theme nights food, there was still always plenty to eat with the standard pasta, salad, ect food bars.The room: We were very fortunate to have room 5114, the view was beautiful from our balcony, and we enjoyed it everyday! We could view the beach to the left and the pool to the right. The room itself is spacious and was always attended to thanks to the lovely maids we had. They always cleaned our room, turned down our bed at night and kept our fridge full of water and coke lite, which is exactly what we liked. The beach: Like I said absolutely beautiful and clean. The workers did a wonderful job at keeping it clean, the beach beds were a nice touch. My husband and I enjoyed the long walks along the beach both day and night. When you went left up the beach there were shop sellers and they were pretty good at not hustling you, which was a wonderful change from what we found out when going to the Bravaro Shopping Plaza. We lasted 20 minutes there and caught a cab quickly back, due to the constant barrage of hustling, not something we were at all used to! If you walked right of the PCP there was plenty of beach to walk as well, but beware of the woman selling hair braiding not a pleasant experience either as I so found out, while having my hair braided.Tours: We took 2 tours while there - The Bravaro Runners Safari Tour. What a wonderful day this was. We lucked out with a wonderful bunch of tourists on our safari truck. If you want to see how these wonderful people actually live, what the schools look like, and enjoy a little bit of everything, like seeing a sugar cane field, a cigar factory, where they grow and make coffee and cocoa, go horseback riding then this is the tour for you. The tour guides were very nice and very infomative. Thanks Andy and Adam! Our second tour was Zip lining. We enjoyed this tour as well. My husband had never been zip lining and I think this was a great beginner zip line tour. Having done the one in Mexico in Puerto Vallarta, it didn't quite measure up for me, but still a good tour none the less. The staff: All that we met and conversed with (even though our spanish was very limited) were above and beyond! Very helpful, friendly and enjoyable. We made a few new friends and wish them all the best. We will miss you all! Thanks to Luis, Nelson, Jose Doria, Grisdelda, our lovely maids - sorry didn't catch your names and the many other waiter and waitresses!In closing we would definately go back to this resort, and will definitely recommend it to all our friends and family! We will cherish our experience there and take home with us many happy wonderful memories!  
<Date>Nov 11, 2008

<Author>TorontoMoma
<Content>Absolutely Awesome Vacation!!! Recently spent FANTASTIC 2 weeks there, Oct. 5 - 19. I just had to write a review after reading that one from Rhode Island. Honestly I had to check their review to make sure it was the same place! I couldn't belive the bad experience when ours was just unbelievable.I too did months of research and reading of reviews on different DR resorts and decided on Punta Cana Princess because it was the one with the most consistent great reviews, also it was smaller (270 rooms, and it was Adults Only. We were not disappointed one iota. Check in went fast, got the nice cold drink, but no wash cloth (big whoop - needed the drink more). Room was as requested and paid for - ocean view in building 5, also right near the pool. Mini-bar was not in our room on check in (bottle of rum, vodka, whiskey), mentioned it to guest services next day - was in our room before we got back to it. Food was excellent, whether in buffet or a la cartes. We did take a tablespoon of Pepto Bismal every morning as I had seen suggested and neither of us had the tourista trots or any nausea at all. Breakfast there is many, many things to chose from, made to order omelettes, scrambled/hard boiled eggs, yogurt, boxed cereals and always pancakes/french toast. Of course there were some things on the dinner/lunch buffet menus that didn't appeal so we just stayed away from them, but there was always so much to choose from we never had any problems. There was always a great pasta bar. I didn't care for the milk only because it is the boxed, sterilized kind and I couldn't get use to the taste. Honestly never had a bad meal and we are used to eating in some very good places. There is fish offered and also lobster, both at the a la cartes and at the buffet. Salmon at one a la carte and grilled lobster at both - they are the Carribean lobster tails so much smaller.Facecloths - don't know why they don't readily supply these but I had also read about this before leaving so packed a couple to take and used them instead of worrying about asking for them all the time. Staff was just great - don't worry about the language they know enough English to help or someone else does, or sign lanuage goes a long way. Our maid service was terrific, we did tip $2 a day which we left on the bathroom vanity beside the water we used for brushing teeth and 9 out of 10 times got an extra big bottle of water in the bathroom, besides the 2 always left in the fridge. We drank the drinks, ate the salads - they are supposed to have a purified water system and we did see huge bags of ice delivered - again we never had any GI problems and neither did anyone we talked to, honestly, and they weren't even doing the Pepto Bismal thing!Place is kept amazingly clean and if you get up early you will see the groundskeeping crew and maids washing and scrubbing the walkways every day. Wait staff at resort very accommodating. Guest services was excellent (especially Adriana) Our original room was on 3rd floor (4 flights of stairs) which we asked to change after 1 week as my husband had knee surgery about 6 weeks earlier and it was getting a bit much for him - we moved to ground floor same day we asked about it, same building, the morning we asked about it.Guest services arranged breakfast in our room the day of our 30th Anniversary and when we returned later in the day it was beautifully decorated, also enjoyed the 'towel swans/hgearts' they made up during our stay.Sorry this is so long, but wanted to let everyone know this was one great place and since our return we have already talked about going back again to this wonderful spot - if you decide to go there I know you will have a great time!Yes there were some vendors on the way to the buffet/restaurantes - ususally just either Friday or Saturday - just say no thanks and keep moving - didn't really interfere with our enjoyment and I understand this is the case at most of the resorts on different nights.If you have any questions I'm happy to answer best I can.  
<Date>Nov 4, 2008

<Author>kkllmm
<Content>I won't be returning This place was OK, but as I said in my review title, I will not be returing and I cannot say I'd recommend it. Usually each year my husband and I go on vacation to Couples Negril in Jamaica (where we will be returning for sure, I like it there a thousand times better) but this year wanted to try something new.Here's what I thought of Punta Cana Princess:1) the grounds were very well kept.2) the rooms themselves were nice, better than I expected3) english is sort of a problem for many of the staff members4) the Tex Mex restaurant was decent, the only decent place. But, it is not open each night.5) the buffets were HORRIBLE. Seriously, unedible food. Especially the beach buffet....gag me. Especially the meat. Yuck. Really, really bad.6) the drinks were SUPER weak. I drank three rum drinks in a row and felt zero effect. We watched them pour the drinks, and they were adding plenty of whatever was in the rum bottle. My guess is, when they buy a bottle of booze, they dump half of it into a different bottle, and fill it up with water. Finally, my husband and I went to the gift shop and bought a bottle of rum. We asked the bartenders only for pineapple juice and then we took out our own bottle of rum to add to the juice.7) the beach was pretty nice8) the pool was pretty nice too. Except, at about 3pm, just when everyone wants to relax, they start some horrible music and beging screaming into microphones for people to play water polo, play bingo (this is an all-adults resort, right?) or to do water aerobics. Very annoying. Maybe some people enjoy that. Aerobics, in my opinion, would be an activity better for the morning. In any case, the shouting and screaming into microphones was too much.9) skip the fondue restaurant at all costs.10) they serve wine, or what they call wine, with lunch and dinner. I'm no wine expert or anything, but this wine they serve was extremely bad. I've never tasted anything like it. Both the red and white, awful awful awful.11) internet access in the lobby was very spotty. You can bring your own laptop and pay $15/day for wireless access. I'll give you a hint. You pay the $15 and they give you a user name and password to log on to the network. It's user name mili and password 123456. It did not change the whole time we were there, so don't bother paying $15 each day.12) the weather was great and I got a nice tan :)  
<Date>Nov 4, 2008

<Author>offwegoPa
<Content>PCP - Mixed Feelings We stayed at the Punta Cana Princess (building #4 - nice room overlooking the pool) during the last week of October.....we have mixed feelings about this hotel.The hotel grounds are lovely, the rooms are clean and neat - the staff works very hard to take care of everything. The bathroom was a big problem......most of the time the water pressure for the toilet was SO BAD that it would never flush! We reported this to guest services but nothing was corrected. The pool and beach are beautiful - that is a big part of our enjoyment on a tropical vacation. We weren't too impressed by the Animacion Team - it was very loud and started at 3 pm each day at the pool. Also, we didn't appreciate the animacion team members approaching us to go to the bar and get them orange juice and beer.......very tacky!! If management of the Princess is reading this you might want to remind these employees that the guests are there to relax - not to be asked to wait on them!!Another disappointment was having to eat at the buffet so many times for dinner because they didn't have the gourmet restaurants open. My husband and I do enjoy the fine dining in the restaurants in the evening and look forward to that. It may have been because the hotel was not full so they don't keep everything open.The majority of the hotel guests were from Germany........we met several couples from the USA and Canada. In general, everyone was very polite.We did like the Adults Only feature at this hotel.......a good place for quiet time!Thank you to Daniela and Nelson at the pool bar for such good service......delicious mamajuana!!This was our fourth trip to the D.R. and we have already been discussing our return but I don't think it will be to the Punta Cana Princess.  
<Date>Nov 2, 2008

<Author>morgan0
<Content>Can't wait to go back!! AWESOME!!!!!! Beautiful, beautiful resort. When my husband and I got there, check in was not even 10 minutes. We were greeted with a nice smile and a cold drink. When we got to our room, within 2 minutes our luggage was there. The grounds are so beautiful. I can't believe how hard the staff work to keep the grounds looking so spectacular. They still manage to smile.The food and drinks were incredible. The white wine looks stronger than it actually is, but it was great.The staff, awesome, awesome. They make you feel sooo welcome. They are constantly going around making sure you are ok. They were great!!!Overall, there is nothing bad to say about this resort. we can't wait to go back, my favourite by far.This is the resort we are sticking to from now on. Truly amazing!!

<Author>JoiaLee
<Content>Great way to loose weight We've just returned from our vacation at Punta Cana Princess Resort. I would like to thank everyone who takes the time to write reviews, good or bad. I have been checking TripAdvisor since we booked this vacation in April and have found very useful information.Upon arrival at the PCP, we were not given cold towels as many of you wrote about. We were however given a fruit punch drink and that was nice. Our room was on the ground floor level of buiding #4. It had been flooded in the past - you could tell from the water marks around the furniture, musty smell in general, and mildrew on the couch cushions. I would suggest getting a room on a higher level than the ground floor. We paid for a platium all inclusive package, top shelf liquor included. We did have a mini bar in our room as we were told (a mini fridge stocked with 2 bottles of beer, 2 bottles of sprite, 2 bottles of Coke, and 2 bottled waters). We did not get the assortment of liquor I expected to get in this package , although we met other people, same package, and they had bottles of gin, vodka, etc. Not really a big deal, drinks were free wherever you went - it would have been nice to have them in the privacy of our room though. There are no ice machines in this hotel. You have to call room service whenever you need ice. We only received face cloths and hand towels one day. Just the two shower towels (and beach towels) were changed daily. If you wanted a wash cloth, you had to call and ask for it. I had a problem right away with anything with ice. I found the food to be edible but that also didn't agree with me. All the mixed drinks were made with ice, so I couldn't enjoy them. I did try everyday to have something different, a daquiri, a marguerita, a mixed drink...aside from the GI upset, everything tasted like bubble gum. No matter what liquor you had, bubble gum. When I asked for diet soda, they went to the machine and I thought, uh-oh, this will have that water again, so instead I asked for something bottled or canned. There was nothing diet to be had. Just regular coke and sprite, warm because you can't have the ice. The Mexican restaurant so many people have raved about was only open one night and I got very very sick after eating there. I did order, again, as I read the reviews, the filet mignon. It tasted wonderful. We also had the mozzarella sticks for an appetizer. They brought you nachos with different dipping sauce and automatically gave you a margueritta....so I can't say what exactly made me nauseated (with severe vomiting). In the main buffet area, if you asked for cream/milk for your coffee, they bring out a square plastic container that simply says Cow's Milk. I got sick on that also. There was no seafood at all - I would have thought being on an island and all, there would be plenty but absolutely none at PCP.We thought we would try the Caribe since we weren't having any luck at PCP. Basically the same food but birds everywhere, waiting around your feet for you to drop something. When we left, my husband had bird poop on his pants. We didn't even try the Tropical after that experience. Our package also included 24/7 room service. When you call to order something, they let you know it is not included and you will be charged. There are prices listed next to the items and at the bottom it says that there will be a 27% fee also added. A small cup of soup would have cost me around $8 - and this was supposed to be all inclusive ??We ended up getting Pringles and cheese crackers in the little gift shop and that's what we ate for the last two days we were there (that cost $14). I lost 6 pounds on vacation! Like I said, nothing actually tasted bad, but 1/2 hour after eating, we had to go back to the room, we both had severe GI upset.I agree with most of the reviews regarding the grounds - beautifully maintained. The pool was wonderful, except I heard more than one person say that they peed in the pool - kind of disgusting to think about. At night, there is a main walkway you have to go through to get to the lobby or dinner. They had flea-market style tables set up and pushy, pushy people trying to sell you stuff. You actually dreaded having to walk by them. I found that to be tacky.Many of you rated this hotel to be great, maybe we were just expecting too much. I can't believe there would be such a difference when we went in October unless it had something to do with the hurricaine they recently had ?? My advice to anyone going here, bring plenty of cup-a-soup and crackers. I am sorry to review this as a bad vacation but it really was. We could have done a lot more with the money we spent on this trip. I would not return here.  
<Date>Oct 27, 2008

<Author>inotfob
<Content>Loved loved loved it!!!! This places is so beautiful, i'm sitting here at work and wishing i was back at PCP! My boyfriend and i are 24 and 29 and we absolutly fell in love with this resort.The ride to the resort isn't THAT bumpy, i don't know why people complain. It's fun jumping up and down a bit. We arrived at the resort about an hour after we landed and were greeting with drinks and cold towel. The receptionist (jose) was VERY nice. He upgraded us to VIP, and we stayed in building 5, which i must say had the most beautiful view. One morinig we got up early enough to see the sunrise from our room, so beautiful!Food- since we are vegetarian the choices for us was very minimum, we never went hungry tho !! the pasta for lunch and dinner at the buffet is more then engouhg food. We tried 3 of the restaurant. please note that not ALL the restaurants are open everyday!! we tried the tex mex( surpriseingly they had no veggie food, but they did fo out of their way to make veggie fajitas for us) the fodu resturant which was really good and the italian place. all the restuarants we tried were amazing food! Didnt try any meat so can't comment on that.Beach!- Omg.. that all i can say. Just beautiful! the princesses beachs are the nicest, we went walking along the beach( only a short walk) and found the other resorts werent as nice as ours..I was happy! there are some vendors along the beach but just a smile and a no thanks will keep them away from you. and remeber the prices you pay should be less then half of what they ask. This is for stuff they sell on the beach.Services- The most friendliest people i have ever met. Eveyone has a smile and go out of you way to help you. We would tip everyone that would help us and they did a fantastic job! Please tip everyone they deserve it! the Animacion team do such a great job in trying to get people to join in on the fun!! from veronica, mosquito, chocolate and everyone else, they are sooo funny and knwo how to dance! the resort get a bit dull after the pool closes but they is always stuff to do in the lobby after dinner, like karaoke or going over to the sister resort to the club( which i had a lot of fun in!) the only bad experience i had and it has NOTHING to do with the resort is that we had our digital camera stolen by these 2 ladies( mid-40's) one of them had been diganise with breat cancer and had maybe 2 months to live. My bf ..being a doctor took his time out to talk to her and give advise. We eventually found out they didnt bring a camera, so we were like hey we'll take some pics for you and email them to you.. we had a bit too many shots and ended up leaving the pool bar at 8 45, drunk. we went upstairs to our room and with in 10 mins realized the camera was gone, we went back down and it was no where to be found. i remeberd one of them telling me thier room number so we went to thier room to see if they thad it .. they said no( which they liedddddddd!!!!!) The ladies were leavign the next morining at 5 am... but the staff was so friendly! I told Fransico what happened and he keept on calling security every day to see if the camera had been found but not luck! we bough a disposable and we madefriends with ppl and took pics on thier camera which they will email to us!! i Loved the resort!! Highly reccoment it!! did not get bitten by any bugssss nor did anyother person i met..!! but on of out resort friends did..

<Author>bubblesHull
<Content>cant make my mind up I was so looking forward to this trip, and wasnt greatly at all disappointed. The complex as a whole is absolutely fantastic, staff all really pleasant and willing to help, it amazes me how they manage to keep a smile on their faces all the time, so very helpful. We stayed in the Platinum Suite area (4 of us in all, 2 couples), I can only say the rooms and domestic service every day is a 10 out of 10 for everything. The villa was only a 5 minute walk to the breathtaking beach, with lots of free activites or paid activities. The shop within the complex is very expensive, so if any Brits going make sure you take plenty of things, my hubby run out of shaving foam, I bought him a small gillette tin which cost in English money around 6, about 25 q tips for roughly 4, so take plenty of things including shower gel. The food is absolutely excellent 10 out of 10 in all the restaurants including the Hespaniola in the main lobby, if you get the chance go to the Gaucho on the beach (steak house), brilliant. The only downside was the theatre bar which is within the main lobby, phew what can I say, Brits take a battery operated fan, you're going to need it, the humidity in an evening is unbearable and no air con, we found we were totally exhausted from the humidity. When you go to the beach, have some of the Mama Juana, its great fun and the bar tender gives as much as you want, the drinks are plentyful. I will warn you about going shopping outside the complex, its a very scary experience, as soon as you leave the complex, the men from the shops across the road are coming over to you and saying lady you come into my shop I have plenty of cheap things, but believe me its not just 1 man its a possey of them, and once your in their shop be warned they close the door behind you, I did feel intimidated but gradually became quite calm, however do haggle, dont pay the price they are asking, stick to your guns and the price you have fixed in your head, dont go over. The tip is just tell them you're leaving the shop. they soon come round. If you can go on the quad bike trip, really good fun, would recommend that. Hope this review helps anyone going. Have a good trip  
<Date>Oct 11, 2008

<Author>jpeck1981
<Content>Great Honeymoon other than getting sick My wife and I went here on our honeymoon from July 4, 2008 to July 12, 2008 adn had a great time. The only issue we had was we got sick around halfway through our trip and stayed that way for weeks. It was just a small stomach issue, but it does need to be said that we still loved this place in spite of what happened. We are still contimplating going back because everything else about our trip was unbelievable.ARRIVAL: Our arrival went without any problems. From the time we landed on the runway to the time we got to the resort it only took about an hour and once we got to the resort the front desk was awesome. They checked us in and gave us cold washcloths and drinks. We were in our room within minutes and a few minutes later our luggage arrived. ATMOSPHERE: This place was immaculate. The grounds were beautiful and the gardens were nice. Everything looked just like the picutres and was great.ROOM: We got a room in the building that we requested, building five and it overlooked the pool and the ocean. The view from our room was great and we were only a few steps from the ocean. We had a bottle of Rum waiting for us in our room and our maid cleaned our room thoroughly everyday and would make nice animals out of the towels on our bed with flowers.BARS: The pool bar and lobby bar were awesome. Emelio in the Lobby Bar was so much fun to be around. He certainly knows how to have a good time. The pool bar was always a blast, who doesn't love to sit in a pool and drink?RESTAURANTS: All of the food we felt was very good. We went to the buffet for breakfast and lunch everyday. I loved the fact that I could get an omelette every morning. We went to all of the al a carte dinners other than the Italian. The Tex-Mex and Fondue were our favorites. We also ate at the Seafood Restaurant which was also good. The Filet Mignon at the Tex-Mex was delicious. We didn't feel the food tasted badly, but we did get sick after about 4 days of being there and it took several weeks for our stomaches to start feeling better.The Beach beds were awesome and we never had any problems finding a place to sit on the beds or on the chairs at the pool. The hotel dies down really early which was alright with us because after a long day of drinking we were usually in bed early. If you get the Platinum Package you have access to all the upper shelf liquors, which they have at all of the bars, you just need to ask. I really miss the Coco-Locos they were delicious. All in all even with getting sick my wife and I are debating still going back again next year because the staff was excellent, the resort was beautiful and we liked that it was a smaller adults only resort. I would defintely recommend this hotel to a friend just be careful of what you eat.  
<Date>Sep 3, 2008

<Author>ssc71
<Content>Welcoming, beautiful place but bad wine. We had fun at the Princess the grounds are beautiful, the service was outstanding, the rooms were immaculate and the food was good. We were surpised that all of the restaraunts are not open every night so that limits your selection. Its important to know the wine is terrible you can't even buy a decent bottle so bring it with you (this is not the all inclusive to go to if you only drink wine, I would go to Club Med then for their French wine). Allow yourself enough time to pick up a few bottles at the duty free shop. If I had it to do again I would have upgraded just for the name brand liquor and beer. We met very nice friendly couples there. I'm sure you'll have a great time.

<Content>The BEST honeymoon thanks to Punta Cana Princess       beautiful landscaping  
<Date>Aug 20, 2008
