<Author>CozumelDreams
<Content>Paradise is Punta Cana Princess Let me begin by saying that I will gladly answer any private messages/questions from anyone. There were 4 of us traveling: Me, my husband, and our 2 daughters (20  22). We arrived July 16th and departed July 26. We also renewed our vows on the 21st.First, I booked the trip through Resort Vacations to Go, AKA Travel Impressions, and it could not have been simpler. The agent was willing to take care of all of my requests and questions with a quick yes! Everything was handled and we had no worries, including not having to pay the $20 exit fee. We also had a representative on resort daily to assist with questions or booking excursions if we needed.Upon arrival at the resort, we were greeted by Carol. She saw to it that we were given a cold towel (very appreciated) and a refreshing drink. Check-in was so quick and easy. We were directed to our rooms, 5007 for the girls  5106 for us. Our bags arrived within 10 minutes. The room: Just as lovely as the pictures. We had rum  cigars waiting for us. A lovely fruit basket arrived shortly after. As we were honeymooners, a lovely bottle of champagne also arrived quickly. Our rooms were always impeccably cleaned, smelled wonderful, and never failed to have extra touches. The service: Wow! Did they pamper me every single moment, no, but they always went above and beyond for us. Anything we needed or wanted was simply one phone call away. Guest services would make sure everything was quickly handled. Housekeeping always made sure we had lovely flowers. When we returned to our room after our vow renewal, the turn down maid had even gone to the extra trouble of using palm fronds  flowers to decorate the floor and spell out happy wedding and placed flowers on the bed. These lovely touches made everything special. Everyone was willing to do whatever to make you happy. Emilio in the lobby bar was so entertaining and wonderful. He was always a good way to end the day. Niki, Jose Q.  Luis always made sure dinner was a worry-free affair. This included the dinner for our renewal. The wedding cake was supposed to have been moved to the steak restaurant and set up for us. It was not there when we arrived and I became anxious. Jose Q. said that he was there and to have no worries. We finished our dinner and were just about ready for the still unseen cake. Jose Q. had been on the phone and then rushed out. He returned a short while later with our cake. As it turned out, it had been left at the beach restaurant and, Jose, rather than disappoint me, ran all the way there and back (with the cake!). Such wonderful people! Food: I had no issues what so ever with the food. Between the 4 ala cartes and the 2 buffets (not to mention room service), we always had plenty to eat. The filet mignon at the steak restaurant was our favorite. The Italian restaurant had wonderful pizza and pasta choices. We only did the seafood restaurant once and had a surf  turf. The fondue restaurant was wonderful as well. We also enjoyed the Asian night at the buffet and the Dominican party on the beach (so many choices!). We only went to the neighboring resort for one meal (chose not to be around the kids). We went to the Mexican restaurant. It was okay. Perhaps we are more picky about Mexican food coming from Texas. We did the main buffet for breakfast and lunch every day and snacks at the beach buffet. We never failed to find many things that pleased each of us (at least 2 very picky eaters!). I have nothing but good things to say about the food and drinks!Spa: We 3 girls did the mini spa for massages that were wonderful. It was $34 US for about 30 minutes and well worth it. One daughter also had her hair braided there for about $80 US. We did not use the main spa so I can't speak about that but the mini spa was great!Excursions: My husband and youngest daughter did the zipline tour with the Bavorro Runners. They completely enjoyed themselves. My husband came back so jazzed! My oldest daughter and I did the parasailing with the company right there on the resort's beach. The parasailing itself was incredible but the boat ride was not so great. I do get a little sea sick but I am usually able to control it. However, they kept us on the boat for a very long time for no reason. Boats came to put more people on but would leave empty. We were on the boat for over an hour after we did the parasail. I regret that I did get sick. They finally called for a boat but instead of taking us to our beach first, they went to the other end and began dropping people off. We were to be last but as I could not take any more, we got off and walked the rest of the way. So bottom line, loved the parasailing but if you have a tendency to get sick in rougher waters, make sure you get their word to let you off as soon as possible!Grounds: So well kept and absolutely beautiful. They are constantly taking care of the grounds and pool. Who could ask for more!Vow Renewal: We had our ceremony on the beach. They thought of everything from decorating the cart to drive us to making a decorative aisle on the beach for me to walk down. Everything was provided for and we were treated like royalty. Francelia, the wedding coordinator, was fully prepared for our arrival and took care of everything for us. I would definitely suggest them for anyone wanting to renew or even have their wedding.Shopping: There are many shops on the beach for shopping. As you come onto the beach from the resort, if you begin walking to your left down the beach, you will encounter the beach shops after about a 10 minute walk. Stay by the water to avoid the timeshare guys and even the shop sellers if you are not shopping. Do not be afraid to negotiate the price. You should never pay more than 50% of the original asking price and you can get it even cheaper. Simply be polite and friendly and stick to your pricing.Airport: Upon arrival, we had no problems getting our luggage. Be prepared that plenty of people will be more than ready to take your luggage for you. There's no problem with this except it is just right around the corner. As soon as we turned the corner, our representative was waiting for us and immediately got us into the van with AC and loaded our luggage. Upon departure, the line was not bad and moved quickly enough to get checked in. There were two more lines (customs  security), both of which moved quickly enough. There are places to eat right after that, including a Wendy's. This part of the airport is open-air and can be rather hot. If you move over to the other part where the gates are, you will find AC, snacks, ice cream, bar  shops as well. Definitely more comfortable.Overall: I would highly recommend this resort. Is it for families? No, this is an adult only resort. We enjoyed this aspect quite a bit. The rooms, service, food, people, and grounds were all that we expected and more! Everything is geared to insuring you have a good time from the beach/pool beds to the people always waiting on you. You can book a trip to the Punta Cana Princess and rest assured that you will have a wonderful trip!  
<Date>Aug 14, 2008

<Author>Cirquecrazy
<Content>Loved the hotel and the staff       Beds on the beach for the VIP's, very comfy.

<Author>Adamflyers
<Content>We loved it! No major complaints here! My now fiance and I went to the Princess last summer and had arguably one of the best trips of our lives. To start with, the staff was fantastic. We were making friends with all the staff members, which really gave the resort a personal touch. We felt that they knew us and treated us like VIP's. It really does make a difference when you go out of your way to treat people nicely, because a lot of times, they will reciprocate. The rooms were more than large enough for the 2 of us. The maids kept them clean and turned down our beds for us each night.I notice the bad reviews are picking on the food here at the resort. I personally did not expect gourmet meals, so maybe this is why the food did not bother me. I'll admit, their idea of pizza and hot dogs at the snack bar or not what most of us would get at home, but the restaurants and buffet did not make me sick or make me think that the food is terrible. The food was just above average. Not the best, but certainly not as bad as some seem to think. The beaches were fantastic! We upgraded to the VIP package and had access to the beach beds. Well worth the extra money in my opinion!On nights when we could think of nothing better to do, we would head out to the casino nearby. Someone from the resort will drive you in a golf cart off the resort grounds and drop you off right in front of the casino door. The casino had some black jack, craps, roulette, slots and a poker table. Perfect for any gambler! When you wanted to go home, just go out front and tell the guys where you need to go and if a Princess cart was not already there, they would call one in for you. Very easy and never felt unsafe.Some nights, we just felt like walking off our dinner, so we would just walk the resort and enjoy our surroundings. The resort contains unique plant and wild life. I do not fault anyone for writing a bad review if they had a bad experience. It is possible that sometimes we get lucky and encounter very few problems, while others do not get so lucky. So while I will not guarantee that you have a flawless vacation, but I will say that the Punta Cana Princess holds the potential for an amazing vacation!  
<Date>Aug 10, 2008

<Author>devybug
<Content>Read before you go (and don't believe any bad reviews!) Let me start by saying that before leaving for this resort I was a little trepidatious because people had complained about several different things. However, upon the conclusion of my week at this resort I was left wondering if the people who wrote those bad reviews stayed at the same resort! The resort was truly one of the best vacations that my family has ever been on. I do not normally write reviews but was compelled to write this one in the hope that people will read this and not listen to the other reviewers who clearly have expectations that could not be met by any resort, much less one at this price point. I traveled with my parents, sister, her boyfriend and my boyfriend. My boyfriend and I are in our 20's, my sister and her boyfriend are in their 30's and my parents are in their late 50's/early 60's and we all had the same opinion about the resort. Beach and Pool:First and foremost, the beach was one of the most beautiful that I have seen. Between myself and my family, we have traveled pretty extensively through the Caribbean and Europe and still found it one of the nicest. The tanning beds were quite possibly one of the best inventions that was ever created for the beach and we never had a problem getting three, even when we slept in and had a late breakfast before heading to the beach. The sand was wonderfully soft and white and the water was beautiful and turquoise. There was very little seaweed and what little seaweed there was, was quickly raked up by the resort staff and removed. There was great butler service on the beach for drinks and unlike previous reviews we did not find that this service was non-existent. The pool was also wonderful. The swim up bar was great and there was plenty of activities if you wanted to participate. Again, unlike other reviews we did not find the Animation team annoying. They would recruit you for activities if you desired to participate but would leave you alone if you did not wish to do so. They did a great job keeping the guests entertained and really made an effort to have a variety of activities available. My boyfriend especially liked the beach volleyball!Spa:My Mom, sister, and I all had appointments at the spa and found the experience great. The massages were in a great hut near babbling water and the staff was nice. As a regular spa goer in a big city at home, I found the atmosphere was exactly what a spa should be and the prices were relatively reasonable for a resort.Food:Now this was the area that I was most worried about after reading previous reviews but those worries were misguided. The staff truly makes such an effort to provide a variety of food and excellent service. The morning and lunch buffets had a great selection. I think the key to the food at this resort is picking things that you know are fresh and have not sat out. The lunch buffet had a great pasta station where fresh pasta was made to your individual taste and the morning buffet did the same thing with omelets. I did not have one problem with any of the food and I normally have a very tempermental stomach and am also an extremely picky eater. We talked to several other guests and found they did not have any problems either. The a la carte restaurants were also great. My family and I ate at the Italian restaurants at our resort and at the neighboring resort and both were wonderful. They truly do special touches such as bringing bruschetta for the table or delicious welcome drinks. We also ate at the Mare Nostrum restaurant which had the most beautiful atmosphere right on the beach. The fondue restaurant was also a crowd pleaser and was my personal favorite. The shrimp there was fantasic!Room and Staff:Our room was truly lovely. The room was cleaned twice daily and we always had fresh towels and beautiful flowers upon our return to the room. Bottled water was restocked daily as well as Coke and beer. All of the water at the resort is filtered except the shower and sink water so that was never a problem! We did tip our housekeeper two dollars daily but she did such a great job, it was well deserved. The room is spacious and the beds were very comfortable. We were in building four and my parents were in five but both were close to the pool and beach. The staff all throughout the resort were so upbeat and always willng to help. You can really tell how much effort they put in to keep the guests happy. Resort Grounds/Check-in:The resort grounds were beautiful. The landscaping was well-maintained and always clean. The resort itself was spotless. The lobby was spacious and had a lovely bar. Our check in went smoothly with a cold towel and welcome drink to greet us. The bus ride from the airport was not nearly what other reviewers have written. Although it was a bit bumpy and the town you drive through is poor, this is neither the fault of the resort or the responsibility. If you have traveled to any other Islands in the Caribbean, you will find that most of them share this quality in that they are poor countries with neither the resources or the manpower to have the road systems we have at home.Overall, I have come to the conclusion that some people forget what the art of traveling is about and that is that you are experiencing another culture. In this same vein, this means that you should acclimate to their culture, not the other way around. The people who wrote bad reviews also seem to forget that this is an all-inclusive resort. Therefore you are never going to get five-star dining because you are not paying for five-star dining. The resort did a fantastic job getting as close to this standard as they could get and we were very appreciative. If you are going on vacation for five star dining then go to NYC and spend hundreds of dollars instead of an all-inclusive resort on an island in the Caribbean. My parents have stayed at several Sandals resorts which were triple the price of this resort and found the food to be the same quality. I hope this review helps those that felt the same trepidation as I did upon reading previous reviews. Don't listen to them! My boyfriend and I just completed the Bar exam two days before leaving for this vacation and needed a break from the real world after three years of law school and two months of 24/7 studying. This was the perfect relaxing, stress-free vacation!  
<Date>Aug 10, 2008

<Author>HobieCat27
<Content>A Perfect Honeymoon (although more vegetarian menu items would be nice) We are so happy that we chose this resort. Being adults-only meant that it was a much more mature and peaceful environment. Yes, people still had fun, especially in the pool area, but there were no screaming kids (and no turds in the pool! Yes, we saw a poo in the pool at the sister resort where we did scuba instruction). The sister resort was a couple-minute walk away, plus they had shuttles. There are more food options, nightly entertainment (moderately entertaining), a late-night disco, and nice grounds to walk around there. There are a lot more birds wandering the grounds over there. We took a random early morning walk along the mangrove path to the neighbor lobby and were delighted by all the birds and fish we saw along the way.The room was very nice. We were concerned about some little ant-like bugs when we first arrived. We told the front desk and they took care of it. We later realized that every time the cleaning lady put new flowers in the bathroom, the little bugs came out of the flowers. Harmless, and we happened to have a little natural bug repellent that took care of them. The cleaning ladies work hard and long hours. Sometimes they'd forget a towel or something, but if it was important enough to call the desk or ask her in the hall, we always got what we needed in minutes. Even when we broke a lamp late in the night, she was there in minutes to clean it up. She certainly deserved a little tip left daily.It does help to know some spanish. It will get you things you need much easier!The staff there was wonderful. There is even one guy on the grounds-crew that will take off his boots and shimmy up a tree for coconuts and cut them open for you to drink, and refill at the bar with more drinks! He did not ask for payment, but we tipped him decent for all the effort, and we loved our fresh coconut! Try to catch their names and you can fill-out a smile form to hand in at the desk and hopefully help your favorite staff earn incentives. (the forms are in your room when you arrive)The food was all good. The buffets always had good selections. The smaller buffet has a wonderful view of the ocean. My vegetarian wife always found decent meals at the buffets. The restaurants however are not vegetarian delights. Only the Italian restaurants at both resorts had vegetarian options. The fondu place was nice also, but for some reason we only got bread to dip in the cheese, no veggies like the menu said. The seafood restaurant did make a special dish for my wife by running to the buffet for a few veggies and cooking them. Nothing special, but at least she wasn't eating bread while I ate shrimp and salmon. It was sort of frustrating to be limited so much by vegetarian needs. Doesn't seem like it should be so difficult. Overall the grounds were immaculate and beautiful! The stone walkways did get hot so remember sandles. The VIP beds on the beaches were really great, and the other bungalows for beach chairs were great too. Another nice thing about this small resort is that you don't have to worry about reserving your chairs early in the AM. There are always open chairs. We never left blankets to reserve spots while we left to eat. We always found a nice place to relax when we got back. Granted, the VIP beds helped the cause a lot. I'd highly recommend this place to honeymooners and couples not looking for wild night life.  
<Date>Aug 7, 2008

<Author>AngieFromVA
<Content>Most Beautiful Beaches!       Grounds

<Author>mrbmom
<Content>What a Wonderful Vacation!!! We just returned from a week @ the Punta Cana Princess (from July 25 - Aug.1). It was everything we hoped for - nice accomodations, beautiful beaches, a wonderful pool and terrific service.The room was exactly as pictured - we were in building 5 (room 5105). The building is the closest to the beach and to the pool - it was a little noisy in the late afternoon when the Animacion Team was at the pool, but not a problem. Our room was made up by early afternoon every day, and was turned down each evening, with clean beach towels left for the next day. The minibar was restocked every day, as well.The food was okay - not gourmet, but we didn't expect that. Breakfast and lunch are buffets, either at Casabe or at Mare Nostrum (this was a smaller buffet). There certainly was enough to choose from, even for picky eaters. Dinners can either be at Casabe (if you want buffet) or at the a la carte restaurants. We enjoyed the Tex-Mex place (the filet mignon was wonderful!) the most. The fondue place was very enjoyable, as was the Italian restaurant (food was a little salty for me, but I don't use any salt on my food!). We didn't like the seafood restaurant too much because everything was cooked in lots of butter. The grounds are beautiful - and looked after every day - the beach is cleaned, and there never was any trouble finding a lounge chair at either the beach or the pool. The resort is very quiet, without much of a nightlife.We went on two excursions - to Saona Island and the Truck Safari. Saona is beautiful, but the bus ride to get there is very long (2 hours each way!) The truck safari was great - very informative about the Dominican and the people.All in all, this was a perfect vacation - restful and relaxing, and very hard to come home and go back to real life!!!  
<Date>Aug 4, 2008

<Author>Wildw00d
<Content>I did not want to go home! We spent 6 wonderful days and 5 restfull nights at the Punta Cana Princess. The resort is beautiful. The lobby is open air and clean! The tile floors are kept spotless. Any questions we had were answered by the wonderful people at the front desk or guest services. They offer free internet service ,there was never a long wait. The tram service they offer to get to the other hotels are safe and smooth. Remember do not leave the hotel property!The grounds are kept spotless also. Every morning while most guest are still sleeping the staff are hosing the sidewalks down and sweeping. The pool is kept clean and a nice temperature. The bar has stools in the water to relax on. The pool bar is a great place to meet other travelers, try a Banana Mama, or a Coco Loco. The rum is awesome. Our room was top floor facing the pool and ocean. The view from the balcony was heaven every morning. The color of the ocean is nothing I have ever seen before. (The Jersey shore will never be the same) The whole room has tiled floors so do use the fluffy slippers they give you or you will be ice skating across the room! The flowers by the sink everyday and the turn down service at night is so sweet. The maids were great ,what ever you needed they gave you. All you need to do is ask. The beach is kept clean and is never crowded the VIP beach beds were so relaxing. The food was interesting. We were so afraid at first to eat anything. We were cautious and stayed to the basics, rice, bread, steamed veggies, chicken, fruit, lots of fruit, Then as the days go on we found ourselves trying alot of different dishes. The Italian place was not our favorite there is something different with the cheese???? All the other places were nice. You need to just pick and choose and do not pig out! We drank bottle water the whole time, coke with ice and the mixed drinks. We did not get sick. We did love the deserts. The half of coconut with coconut pudding at the buffet place was great, as well the cakes and pies and cookies!We did snorkle and parasail ,we booked it through the private boats on the beach. (Look for Pedro) It was great and a low price. I have been recommending the resort to anyone who is looking for an affordable and relaxing place to run away to. We did like that it is adults only. After visiting the other resorts next door with kids, wow what a difference to come back to ours. QUIET and CLEAN. All we said on our last day to all the great people we met was We do not want to go home!!! This is Paradise!  
<Date>Aug 1, 2008

<Author>princesscana
<Content>Punta Cana Princess My boyfriend and I stayed at the Punta Cana Princess in May and our experience was wonderful. It is a pretty quiet resort and a perfect getaway for couples, with lots of time to focus on each other. We were very pleased with our room, it was on the top floor and we had ocean view. the staff was very friendly and polite and we had no problems whatsoever. The food was good and everything was always clean and well maintained.I would highly recommend this hotel to couples who are not really into the party scene.

<Author>NYMpotter
<Content>Go for a good time, just don't eat! I was a bit hesitant to write the following review based on the many excellent reviews I read prior to booking my trip to the Punta Cana princess. Many fellow reviewers stated that they had an excellent time, the food was wonderful, the beach, the beds, service, all of it wonderful. This is the first time that I stayed at an all-inclusive resort, so I had no idea what to expect and didn expect the Ritz. Due to the gut-wrenching illness I have endured for the past nine days, I will say this, go, if you love soft sand and clean beaches, excellent service, beautiful landscaped gardens, beach beds, clean pools with bars, and silly activitiesUT DO NOT EAT THE FOOD?or drink their drinks?I cannot pinpoint the exact cause of my illness, but nonetheless, the food was the worst I have ever eaten in my entire life, and I am not a food snob. The main buffet is open for all mealsach of which have typical buffet menusasta station, seafood, meat, salad (or the attempt at calling whatever it was they were serving), desserts and a theme station which, for dinner, could be sushi, Mexican, etc. It is true that restaurants close on certain nights and there is no schedule, so you are then forced to go elsewhere or eat at the buffet. By the way, you do not need a reservation to go to this resorts restaurants. If you must eat at the buffet, it is bearable, but eat simply. There were insects flying around the sushi, salad and hot buffet stations that are not covered. It is also an open-air restaurant, so bugs love it and items were never properly refrigerated. Stick to breads and perhaps the pasta with no sauces. The desserts are actually good, so if you are brave, go for it.The one plus about the food scene at the princess is that as a VIP guest you are allowed to share restaurant opportunities with the princess?sister hotels. Caribe club and Tropical?? For use of these restaurants you must make reservations a day in advance. Out of the ones we tried, the Mediterranean was the best. The Mexican, much better than the buffet but DO NOT go near the Chinese restaurantnless, you like super salty saucehink soy sauce with a half cup of salt. We left before our meal courses were over. The Creperie is decentow can you really screw up crepes, but be careful of the toppings you choose and you don need reservations to go to the Creperie.Luckily, both my boyfriend and I did not get sick until the last two days of our trip, so it is really hard to tell what it was that did us both in, and he is a vegetarian. It could have also been the water, but we were told that all drinks were safe because the water is filtered, even the ice. The bottled water they give you does taste off, but not horribly and we drank it anyways.Overall we did have a good time. The beaches there are amazing, clean, and the sand is super soft. If you are a VIP member (and I am not sure if everyone gets this right because it was the only option available when we booked), you get access to the lovely beach beds that line the beach. They are super comfortable and from time to time someone may ask you if you like a drink. You also have rights to premium liquor, but you really have to ask for it. Yes, the animation team can be really annoying, but not so much during the day unless you are around the pool area. Once they know your name, it all over and you will get dragged into their silly skits and games. We saw it happen over and over. The service itself is really greathe front desk, maids and most restaurant workers. And, the non-motorized water sports were decent, but did incur extra charges for certain activities.Do go on an excursion or two to get you away from the resort. We went on the Bavaro Runners tour of Punta Cana and it was amazing. You get to see how locals live and work, and also see the countryside, which is so beautiful. I highly recommend this tour if you are curious as how Dominicans live their life. The speedboat and snorkeling tour was good too, I just wish there was a little more time to snorkel.If you already booked your stay at the Princess, take my review for what it worth. As I said in the beginning, I booked my stay here based solely on the whole  didn get sick, had a great time?reviews I read back in April. Perhaps the issue with the food is cyclical? We stayed during the week of July 9 ?6th, and I really hope that future visitors will not get sick too.It is a beautiful resort and everyone is super friendly. If you have a planned stay here, you will have a good time because we sure did despite the sick feeling the last two days. If you are thinking of visiting this resort, wait a few months and see if the  got sick?reviews go away.  
<Date>Jul 23, 2008

<Author>nik128
<Content>Take soft Toilet Tissue If you only read one part of my review...skip down to Illness.Resort in General: It was very beautiful. Grounds were well kept, pool was perfect with a swim up bar, beach was clean white  powdery and the staff was very friendly. Never an issue finding a lounge chair and many tiki hut umbrellas were available for shade. They don't seem to believe in wash cloths so make sure to bring your own or a puff. Rooms were a bit musty so a candle is a great thing to pack.Bar: If you upgrade for the platinum be sure to ask for those premium products. Also, they are only available at the swim up bar and lobby bars. The other bars did not stock premium alcohol. Also, you can't get these drinks after 12 as those bars are closed and the resort becomes a ghost town. They don't seem to encourage socializing. Besides the swim up bar, there were no bar stools around the actual bar to sit around and mingle with other hotel guests. Pina Coladas were like dish water but the Coco Locos and rum were tasty.Food: Only 1 sit down restaurant open per night but no schedule provided as to what it was. We missed our first meal and thought we were going to be on a French Fry diet the entire trip because the food at the 24 hour location was HORRIBLE. Tasted bad, not cold, not hot, mayo on cold meat left out in the heat...just bad bad bad. Fondue was tasty. Italian was less than desirable. Heard Tex Mex was good but never made it. Casabe buffet was the most decent (rice, bread and noodles are hard to goof up). We had one great room service lunch and one wretched room service late night.Illness: Became horribly sick 1 1/2 days into it. Toilet tissue in the washroom was not conducive for the illness that hits. I say this with humor but I'm also not kidding. I've been to Cancun and Jamaica and always get a touch of an upset stomach but this is something I've never experienced. Almost missed a planned excursion because I was fearful that between the doubled over pain in my upper stomach and the trips to the restroom that I wouldn't make it. Airport waiting and airplane ride were interesting but somehow I made it home. Read this site and found that it seems to be a recent problem at this resort. At the advice from another reviewer I contacted my travel agent and she is investigating it to see if the resort had made and efforts to correct the situation. Traveled with 2 others and although they weren't as ill as I was, they felt it at 1 1/2 days into it as well. We drank only bottled water (however, it was bottled in the DR so pack some water from home in your checked luggage) but we did have ice in our drinks. I really think it was the food that did us all in. The precautions for food just weren't taken...see the Food section above for examples. All I can say is luckily I was with true friends and they listened to me complain the entire time of this illness without making me feel like a whiner.It's a shame that the food and sickness were such big problems because the resort has so much potential with its beauty.  
<Date>Jul 22, 2008

<Author>rsthomasHouston

<Author>perfectprincesslove
<Content>Paradise!-Paraiso! EVERYTHING is like PARADISE here! .....from the time you are greeted getting off of the plane....to the time you arrive and are warmly greeted with a sincere Hola! with a a smile with security , to the reception desk and a welcome drink, cool towels at the front desk and the welcoming feeling NEVER stops at the hotel by ALL ...to the time you have to say Hasta la vista to all who have made your vacation like HEAVEN on earth! We stayed in Bldg 5 ...I believe 5102 from April 24th -May 3rd and it was an AWESOME room and thx to all for helping us with those accomodations! The views of the ocean, the breeze, the accessibility and help doing that , the pool, the pool bar and bartenders, the animation team who showed all alot of fun and did not force ya to do anything but watched people have a ball joining in the fun who wanted to. ,,,,,and Emilio at the lobby bar and the others also.....do you remember my name Emilio? It's not a common one..ha ha The resort 's location is INCREDIBLE! The views , the beach and to feel silky,powdery, white sand on your feet , the aqua, teal and blue, warm, calm waters and the breeze and with all your senses being used....and then ya add the beach beds ( all included in VIP and all well worth the little extra)and butler service..a seafood restaurant and two bars and showers and restrooms if need be and a pool in the near distance....what more can ya say about that???? As they say, LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION! They got it going on there even with no resort...but the resort and it's staff are the icing on the cake and then some....When it comes to service they are TOPS! trust us on that one...we have worked in the hotel and cruise industry for many years in the past..at major world interantional hotels also..in FB and also as a concierge, and when it comes to this type of industry it is all about SERVICESERVICESERVICE and they sure know how to reach HIGH BEYOND EXCELLENCE.....hats off to ALL who work there! ..and MUCHAS GRACIAS! ....From ALL at the front desk including Diana in guest services who knows what excellent service is and how to do it .....to all who follow or lead along with her....to Karen and Carol and Steicy andeveryone else ...and for understanding when a person has ALL at the Seafood restaurant ( still waiting to hear from yas and we have pics we are gonna send soon which we love looking at remembering yas all too and miss yas alot! )and ALL others at ALL of the other restaurants .....and we went to ALL of them and had all the works..ALL were AWESOME from the servers to the prep cooks to the maintenance crew....you should ALL be proud of each other too.......4 course meals, drinks( both alcohol and not) and desserts too, of course!...and never ever were we ever sick and never had to take any meds from home for any stomach problems at all...(we took our antimalarial meds and used spray and all only as preventive to stay safe, that's all.)....to the MOST ROMANTIC and MOST UNFORGETTABLE private ANNIV dinner under the stars and on the beach in the pergola/gazebo with palm lined pathways with candles, warm smlies, our own private waiters, a 4 course dinner we could choose and drinks and champagne and a menu to keep and ALL decorated soooo beautifully from the food, and hat's off to ALL of the chefs in ALL of the restaurants, and the presentation to the most caring service we have EVER received! ...and even LOTS of pics to remember such an INCREDIBLE ONCE IN A LIFETIME EVENT....and more pics for the same to CHERISH FOREVER! All we can say is that if you want a MOST MEMORABLE and MOST BREATHTAKING place with EXCELENTE service than GO TO PUNTA CANA PRINCESS and if anyone has anything to complain about here than you shouldn't be on any vacation but stay home and stay unhappy ......cause this place itself just sitting at the water's edge makes ya forget all your troubles and adding the service and people here is , as I said, the icing on the cake,...who are sooooo down to earth I can't emphasize that enough, and who offer you the most incredible service imaginable ! Please tip all who work here ...ALL...they appreciate your appreciation! We would be back here again in a heartbeat!!!!! and as we said to all who have touched our lives and hearts and made our vacation the BEST so far and our 10 yr ANNIVERSARY like paradise....we will never forget you and pretty soon .....Hasta la vista! and Muchas Gracias to ALL! <Author>TexasWillHouston_TX
<Content>Great Resort, Lousy Food! What a beautiful place! The staff was fantastic and the resort was in impecible shape! We read all the reviews before we left and we took all the advice that people had wrote about ie: take bug spray, etc. We didn't have any problems with bugs on the beach or at night. The rooms were very nice and the housekeeping staff was very prompt and courteous. However, during our second day, Montezuma swam across the gulf and landed at the resort. While we took extra caution to NOT drink tap water and only drink bottled water, Montezuma still found his way to the food and the buffett food was terrible and the selection was plain and not very assorted on each day. Fresh fruit was served with a cover and not protected from the local flies. I fell ill then my wife on the third day. After talking with at least 12 other couples, we learned that they had fallen ill as well and they had met even more couples that had attracted the gut wrenching sickness too. By the fifth night of our visit, we just wanted to go home. We couldn't pin point if it was something we ate or drank, but none-the-less, we all got it. The entertainment group was very pushy and didn't get the hint that we just wanted to be left alone while on the beach or at the pool. We just got up and relocated when they would show up. We weren't into the type of music that they played loudly every day. While most of the people at the resort seemed to be in their late 20's, 30's and 40's, the nerve wracking rap music and dance music was just very unwelcoming and would have suited a younger, single crowd rather than a romantic couples get-a-way. Other than the food and entertainment, the resort, the rooms, the staff, the bar staff, the pool and the beaches were very pleasent. Would I recommend this place to my friends? Probably not, due to the food and what the end result would be more visiting the bathrooms, rather enjoying the friendly people from around the world. Oh, one more thing. Guys....take a pants for the ala carte restaurants. Had it not been for the front desk clerk Julio Ceasar lending me a pair, I would have been regulated to the buffett for days! The ala carte restaurants were very average adn not really any different than what you would experience in your home town, and get there early. They don't have circulating air and it get's very stuffy and hot in there. Especially the Fondu restaurant. You'd think if they were going to give you an open fire to dip food into, they would at least have air conditioning and vents to pull the hot air out! When we arrived we were so looking forward to a beautiful vacation and it would have been had the food been better. We now have been home for 3 weeks and we are still experiencing stomach problems. This resort could easily be rated a 5 star place, but, as most of us know, we can be sitting in the most beautiful restaurants in the world, but if the food is bad, we won't be going back. The overall experience we had could have been a 5, but again, with the food and the sickness resulting from that, we rate this experience a 2.  
<Date>Jul 10, 2008

<Author>Goodtimingman
<Content>Great Resort will be back My partner and I went to the Punta Cana Princess for 7 night at the suggestion of our travel agent. It was more then expected. Great people, good food and plenty to drink. We met guest from all around the world and every body got along like all good friends. You will need to pack Pepto-Bismol, amodiem and dont forget to take a large insulated mug for cocktails. The bar tenders do not mind filling them up. Your room gets cleaned between 2  4:00 PM. But that wont matter because you are at the beach, pool or a bar. Ride the trolly between the other three resorts and see the shows and disco. The food is a little better at the Caribe Resort. The jeep tour and the booze cruise tours were great also. I highly recomend these. Take plenty of $ 1.00 bills, no one will give you change back in american money. Credit cards only used in the resort at the tour booking or the front deck. You will not really know the exact exchange until you bill comes in. Go - Enjoy - and just lay back and relax.  
<Date>Jul 10, 2008

<Author>SweetPJakefromDolo
<Content>Great Beaches!! We heard so many wonderful things about this resort but after staying there, we want to add a few items of interest for future travelers. We booked our trip through bookit.com. We had the Platinum Package which includes bottle of rum, fruit basket, unlimited room service and robes/slippers. For those who want to stay at a nice resort, for relaxation, quiet nights and beautiful beach views, all inclusive with plenty of variety of food, this is for you.. We stayed in the 4th bldg, on 3rd floor, near everything, our balcony view was beautiful, we could see the ocean and the pool along with the gardens. Food at Fish restaurant was fantastic!! Service there was awesome! Other restaurants were very good as well, however, the a/c didn't work in most and it wasn't much better at the buffet, always hot, not enough fans. Even the lobby area, with the main bar, was very hot at night, no breeze, not enough fans or ventiliation. Poolside bar was the highlight!! We made many friends there. Pool was immaculate. There were even ducks swimming in it every morning. Spa - a disappointment, asked for deep tissue, got a relaxation message instead. Therapist kept checking her cell phone for calls during the massage, ugh!! Don't go into town unless you want to be mobbed and insulted by vendors who want to take you for every penny. Distance from airport is about 30 minutes, rough cab ride will cost you $33.00 one way, no matter how many people need it. Service was excellent, front desk, concierge, maid, restaurants and bars. We especially liked, Jose, Elvis, Hector, Nelson, Altagracia, Ingrid, Anderson, Emilio. The beach was beautiful, white thin sand, you can walk for miles... awww!! Animation Team - RATING: poor. They should all be fired. They were more interested in their own activities and didn't do their best to interact with the guests. Volleyball games were fun, however one day we were given a damaged volleyball instead of another and we were told to use it, no one offered to get a new one. It was almost like the animation team worked for a 2-star resort... thanks to Fernando, we were able to get a volleyball and start our games again. Best Restaurant - Fish, Worst Restaurant - TEXMEX. Resort stores were WAY overpriced! There was really little to do on this property at night, we went to adjacent resort for shows, disco, etc. We want to say hi to Dave, Tiffany (thanks for the Tiffany Special), Todd, Adrienne, Bob and Terry. Lets keep in touch! Pura 'n Victor  
<Date>Jul 10, 2008
<Rating>4	4	5	5	5	4	4	5

<Author>ShaNewYorkCity
<Content>great hotel! just don't eat the food The hotel is beautiful!The staff fantastic!The grounds immaculate!JUST DONT EAT THE FOOD!I just returned home after a seven day stay at the Punta Cana Princess (July 1 to 8 2008) My travel mate got severly sick from the food, along with several other guests from the hotel, and this review should not to be confused with any other travelers reviews who might also have experienced the same fate!The food is not kept at room temperature, thus inviting a potential for a real food born outbreak, which indeed happened. I was fortunate enough not to get sick, but I ate several yogarts a day, and stayed with rice and beans as the quality of the food was poor to low grade.I hate to write a review like this, but I feel managment should be made aware that guests are getting sick, with mild to severe stomache problems and the food issue should be immediately addressed for the safety of all concerned.Otherwise, this hotel is truly great and has the potential to be outstanding except for the food issues.  
<Date>Jul 8, 2008

<Author>mikenchris
<Content>Beautiful Place Averaage Food Just returned from a 8 day vacation at the Princess...Having done my homework on ths resort , I really can't complain...I have to agree with most of the reviews...Beach is gorgeous..Rooms are very nice..Fridge is always stocked with water , coke and beer...Air Conditioning in room worked well and bed was comfortable...The food at best was mediocre ...I enjoyed the fondue retaurant the most....The buffet style breakfast and lunches got tiresome after a couple of days...My biggest complaint was that the MIlk was not really kept cold and I found the fruit not so special...The pool is great , especially the bar that sits in the pool...The beaches are gorgeous, the staff is friendly...I agree that the only thing stopping this from being a 5 star resort is the food...It is reallya beautiful resort so I wouldn't stop anyone from going there...Bring immodium and pepto bismol...Also bring sunscreen from home..bring more than you think you will need as the prices at the hotel store are high..So try to plan in advance any medicines or lotions that you need to bring with you so you don't overpay...Although I enjoyed the resort I probably would like to return to Punta Cana but I would spend a little more $$ and try to find a place with better food...  
<Date>Jul 8, 2008

<Author>jimich626
<Content>a wonderful vacation My Husband and I stayed at the Princess from 6/26 to 7/3 for our 15th wedding anniv. We had a great time! The resort was beautiful, our room was great (building 5, close to the beach and pool). We received a very nice welcome when we arrived, loved the fruit punch! We were able to get into our room early and we felt the room was perfect! The beach is fabulous and the beach beds......so comfortable! The pool was clean and refreshing. It would have been nice if the pool was open at night though..it's still hot and a night swim would be nice. We met some wonderful people....hi, San Antonio, Georgia, Virginia and Liverpool, England!! The staff was wonderful, we have no complaints....the girls/guys at the breakfast buffet, bartenders, animation team (Pablo, Luis, Celina...) were great!Our room was cleaned well, I liked that they knocked on our door around 6:00 pm each day to ask if we needed anything. We didn't get turn down service each night, but that's okay. The only (small) complaint I have is not enough bath towels. But if you could find a maid in the hall you could get more. The food was okay, not the best, not the worst. The best dinner we had was at the Shangay in the resort next door. It was definately my husband's favorite! The fondue restaurant was good, it's different......it's a long time in there. Fortunately, we did not get sick. We heard a lot of people talking about stomach problems. I actually gave Imodium out to people. Since we've been home our stomachs are a little off but nothing major. We did one excursion to Sanoa. Pedro from VIP travel couldn't have been nicer. He was very helpful, had a lot of information and booked our trip for us. Unfortunately it rained almost the whole trip! It was cold, wet and lots of mosquitos on Sanoa. If you go, bring your bug spray!! Miguel was our guide (from VIP travel) and he was very nice. He spoke very good English which was helpful when we had a sightseeing tour on the bus ride. We loved our vacation and we would definately go back to Punta Cana Princess!  
<Date>Jul 8, 2008

<Author>wylie1
<Content>Still sick!!! After reading many reviews on the Princess we decided to give it another chance. We were there 4 years ago and I got sick then. Not as sick as this time but my gut was not right for a month after returning home. The reviews seemed that there had been some improvement with the food but my experience was again, not good.  Yes, the beach,the rooms,weather are very good. Thats why we went back. The setting is beautiful,if only they could get their act together with the food it could be a 5 star resort. I was there one day and a half and I got diarrea. I was very careful and also had no drinks but bottled water and 2 beers. By thursday I had to go to the clinic. A very nice Dr. in the clinic on the grounds prescribed me anti- biotic, pills for my bowels, pepto bismol and intravenous drugs for 2 days, to the tune of $430. Nice vacation, I spent most of my time in the washrooms. I have never had anything like that in my life. I am back to work this week and still I'm on gatoraide for my electrolights because I'm feeling so weak.  It's not hard to figure out why people get sick. The buffet food is NEVER hot. It sits there room temp for hours. Sure there is plenty of food but all of it has no taste and is sitting there growing bacteria. I even tried a hard boiled egg,thinking that was safe. It was so over cooked,black yoke that just disentegrated it was so dry.My husband ordered a caesar salad at the Tex Mex and it came like soup with so much dressing on a hot plate.Don't bother trying to make a caesar if all you have is iceberg lettuce. The food is a joke. Will I go back? Never. I can spend my money in many other places with a nice beach and not get so sick ,it ruins my holiday. I went knowing it was not gourmet, I did not expect that. The only word I can use to describe the food is slop. By the way a wedding party had 5 sick people and another young couple from England were sick.My husband spoke to another lady that was ill also.  The animation team are so irritating. This is supposed to be a adult resort. I can make my own fun. I don't need someone pulling me out of my chair to teach me dance lessons or play volley ball. The music they blasted at the pool everyday was for their pleasure only. The same 4 songs every day. I did not see anyone else looking like they enjoyed it. as a matter of fact some people got very mad at them in the pool, they were so pushy and overbearing. People tried to ignore them but its pretty hard when the music is blasting and you can't get away from them, they just take over for 3-4 hours every afternoon. Go somewhere else!!!!  
<Date>Jul 4, 2008

<Author>TiffnDave
<Content>Lovely beach and resort grounds but that's it! We stayed at the PCP from June 18th throught the 25th and had the VIP package for what that is worth. We have been to many all-inclusives and consider ourselves not very picky or hard to please. Let me start out with the positives: Yes the gardens are well kept and we even tipped the gardeners for their hard work. The beach was nice, the water clear, the sand white and smooth. Expect to walk out about 15 feet and then it does drop off. The most beautiful beach we encountered was on our tour with the Dune Buggies. That beach was called Macao Beach. If you take this tour you will get extremely muddy and the mud doesn't come out of your clothes, so bring clothes that you don't care about. Do bring candy or treats for all the children that come out of their houses to bring you pictures and flowers. I gave a few of them a dollar, but wished we would have known to give them something else. Check in was smooth and you do get their punch and a cool washcloth which you will need after your very bumpy ride to the resort. Every resort I have been to has done the same thing though. It took about 45 minutes as you have to drop everyone else off and this is one of the last resorts. My advice would be is to get your own taxi to and from so you don't have to wait. Friends that we met paid 33 USD at night from the airport which is higher than their daytime fees. The conceirge service in the lobby was helpful, polite, took us to our room right away with our luggage. We did get the fruit basket, 1 small bottle of rum, 1 small box of 3 cigars, and the towel decorated with flowers. Yes the room stays moist as it is humid. Remember to bring a candle and it will keep your room smelling fresh all week long.The rooms need major updating. The bathrooms are very outdated. They were rusty. Our drain was always stopped up when taking our daily showers, wash cloths were only present on the first day, but we knew this and had brought our own. Maid service came in the early afternoon and late at night for turn down service which was a nice touch.We stayed in the 5000 building on the bottom floor which was nice since it was 20 feet from the pool. We are not early risers and we were never disturbed by any pool noise. Some friends had the third floor and said the high ceilings made your room feel larger and they could see the ocean. There were many channels to watch about 1/4 in English.The food: After reading the reviews I expected way more than what was spoken about. The Tex-Mex filet mignon I received was tough but my husband's was cooked just right but not anything to brag about. The plates always come out hot and so will your caesar salad. This is really the only salad to speak of here at the resort. Everytime you get a drink, make sure you ask for your glass to be filled with ice or you will be drinking hot whatever you drink. This is throughout the resort. Il Bacio, the italian restaurant was way below average. I ended up getting sick after eating the smallest portion of lasagna I have ever been served. They did serve my husband a second piece to compensate for him being able to eat it in 4 bites. Our friends said they had enjoyed it there and got big helping of the raviolis and fettucini. We never ate at the Fondue but heard it was good. Our friends said it took 3 hours and there was no ac in there and it became very hot in there once they served the different fondues to everyone.They also said the seafood restaurant was good, but we don't care for seafood so we didn't eat there. All the buffets were way below average. There is no taste to any of the food and it is very bland. Luckily I survived off of rice and bread all week. Everyone we met got sick at the resort including us and we could never pinpoint what we ate or if it was what we drank. The bar tenders were average and not very animated compared to other places we have been to. The drinks were just ok. And I finally had to make up my own drink for the week as they could never get it right. There is no cranberry juice here, nor coconut rum or real orange juice. The margaritas are nasty and they don't even carry any named brand tequila. The animation team is just plain annoying. The same stupid dancing and yelling of applauso throughout the day at the pool made you not want to be there. We had our everyday players for volleyball in the pool which was fun except we had to fight the animation team to get a decent ball everyday to play. Then once we were out there, they harrassed us to do their activity which we didn't want to do, so they would come over into our game and try to take over. The gift shop was way over priced compared to anything else. If you want to get deals you must go down to the beach about 1 mile to the left. You must heavily barter to get a cheapy cheapy price. They will give you the calculator and tell you what do you want to pay. We always ended up paying half of what they were asking. Don't pay more than 5 dollars for any shirt or hat. Coffee should be around $6 and windchimes $20.Paintings $20-30 medium sized. Make sure you bring pants and dress shoes for the guys as you can't get into any of the restaurants except the buffets without them. We thought this was ridiculous as the girls could come in with just shorts,flip flops and a tank top. Go figure! We went to to Caribe Princess for the shows. One day we had walked over there to find out no shows were going on even though it was advertised. Would we go back to the PCP or the Dominican Republic again? No. Just a note Our best waiter for the week was Serapio at the Beach Breakfast Buffet. He was so attentive and really went out of his way. If you go in to the Bavaro Shopping Center, expect to be called names and be insulted over trying to barter. They don't want to go down even a 1/4 and I guess they don't need the money even though it was one of the most poorest countries with trash everywhere, with dead animals on the side of the road waiting to be slaughtered. The roads were the worst I have seen and wehave been to many places. If you have any questions please feel free to contact me for an honest review. Hi to Victor, Pura, Adrienne, Todd, Terry and Bob. Shoot us an email we would love to hear from you.  
<Date>Jun 26, 2008

<Author>SK
<Content>Punta Cana Princess is Just Perfect! A group of 6 of us (mid-20/early-30) stayed at the Punta Cana Princess from June 16-21, 2008. We were all in Bldg. 4 on the 3rd floor ?great views of the pool and ocean! The resort seemed only  full while we were there ?plenty of chairs on the beach and at the pool! Overall, we loved this resort ?the size, friendliness of the staff, food, atmosphere, etc. The resort is smaller (less than 300 rooms), but still has the same amenities as larger resorts. We liked the fact that it is adults-only ?not having to vie for seats at the pool bar with kids drinking virgin drinks! J This overall made for a quieter, calmer resort as well. Rooms ?Beautiful, did not feel they needed pdating?as some have mentioned. We liked the island-y feel and vaulted wood ceilings. We were platinum guests ?thus had the rum, cigars, fruit basket, robes/slippers, stocked mini-bar, etc. I not sure, but this may be the standard. There was a note that we could upgrade to IP?for $15/day with a 4 day minimum. I personally didn feel it was worth it, unless you really want the massage and special meal. Beach beds (actual beds, not the chairs under palapas) seem to be open to all ?and they are HEAVENLY!!! (this may have been because the resort was not crowded and all and  of the beach beds were not being used every day).Beach ?Clean and beautiful. Beach beds and chairs/palapas are both nice. Water was warm/refreshing. Great breeze off the water. We did have a server on the beach, Francisco, who also manned the beach bar. He great! Excursions ?While exiting the water our first day we were approached by Fernando, who was selling boat/snorkeling trips. We ooked?a trip with him (he with Cayena we think ?he had a yellow shirt on). This trip was AWESOME and only $25/person for over 2 hours ?just the 6 of us were on a smaller boat. They took us to the big roped off snorkeling area in the water, passed by the sharks/rays/dolphins area, went to the natural pool (all 3 of these are parts of the ig?snorkeling trips that are $70-$90), and then took us around the shipwreck (which we requested). 2 of us girls also got to sit up on the padded area at the very front of the boat for the ride and sun ourselves! It was a fun trip and I totally recommend it! The other commercial snorkeling trips take longer to get the 50 or so people on/off the boat, once in the water everyone is crowded and kicking each other trying to snorkel (we left soon after the big boat arrived), and the only thing extra you get is some rum punch and mamajuana! I definitely advise ?GO FIND FERNANDO (he walks along the water in front of and to the left of the PCP).Food/Drinks ?We enjoyed the food. Breakfast and lunch buffets were good. Breakfast ?yummy omelets made to order, fresh chocolate croissants, lots of fruit, etc. Lunch at the main buffet was good too ?they had a fresh pasta station, grill (chicken skewers were amazing!), and my favorite, the freshly tossed Caesar salad area. I really like all the made-to-order stations. Lunch at the beach buffet was OK ?good for a quick pressed sandwich with the freshly grilled chicken! The fries (with the nacho cheese sauce!) and pizza at the beach bar were excellent. NOTE: All a la carte restaurants are not open every night ?check with the front desk to find out which nights each restaurant is open. Dinner ?we ate at 4 a la cartes: Swiss/La Petite Fondue (the Chinois sliced beef was delicious, shrimp app. fondue and swiss cheese fondue were both great, brought us a bunch of cold apps. too, chocolate dessert was yummy!), Italian/Il Bacio (florentine chicken was good, great bruschetta app., good service), Tex Mex/Ro Grande (great food and service, filet was better than the other cut of steak offered, cheese sticks app. were the best wee ever had, interesting argaritas?, and Asian/Shangay at Caribe Club Princess (the beef dish and chicken/broccoli dish were great, fried rice was good, fried ice cream ?AMAZING!!!). The boys ate at Brazilian/Rodizzio at Tropical Princess when the girls ate at Shangay and they said it was OK. One word of advice ?if you go to the Dominican Beach Party on Tuesday night, go early or plan to eat somewhere else and then go to the party later. We went at 9pm and the roasted pig was pretty much gone and the old?salads had been sitting out for hours (I ended up getting a stomachache that night). One thing I tried right before we left that I wish we went to more was the Creperie at the Caribe Club/Tropical Princess. As for drinks ?theye all great. If you want top-shelf liquor, just ask for it. I had many blended Absolut vodka/lemonades. The Caribe Club/Tropical Princess lobby bar had tons of top-shelf liquor ?again, just ask. The usual blended fruity drinks are always good (but melt so fast!). Presidente with a lime is always a solid choice too! Nelson at the pool bar was great!Atmosphere ?Our group loved the Anamacion team, especially Jose and Louis!!! They had fun activities/pool games during the day and Friday night was karaoke. They have so much energy ?passing out sangria, organizing games, etc. Nightlife was pretty calm (except for karaoke night). We went to the Caribe Club/Tropical Princess (really 1 big resort) several nights for the Arieto disco and show (Lion King ?surprisingly pretty good!). The lobby bar at Caribe Club/Tropical Princess was also pretty happening. We also went to the Tower Casino one night ?fun atmosphere there! The staff overall at the PCP was EXCELLENT ?so friendly! We never felt that tips were expected, but gave them because of such great service. So, we loved the Punta Cana Princess. The resort itself (grounds, rooms, etc.), atmosphere, staff, food/drinks, etc. ?we could not have asked for more!

<Author>NYgirl68Ny
<Content>LOVED IT! Don't listen to the bad reviews! I'm a NY girl, I know my stuff! I stayed at this resort from June 14-20th. Let me tell you, this resort was great. Don't listen to the bad reviews of people complaining about the animation team, or the food. These people don't know what their talking about. The animation team is SUPPOST to be loud and get people into a vacation feel. What do you expect? I'm from NY so I'm a picky eater. The food wasn't the best I've ever had, but it wasn't horrible. There was always something I could eat.The grounds are beautiful, and the beach, breath-taking. The people who work there really go out of their way for you. Can we please keep in mind that this is a 3rd world country, so if your not happy with something, chances are it's because your so use to living easy in your home-town. My boyfriend and I visited Manati Park. If your thinking of swimming with Dolphins, that's the place to go. I've been wanting to for so long, however when we went we didn't have enough money on us. (I guess we just have to go back then!)The Fondue place, and Tex-Mex were the best resturants on the resort. The food was great, and the atmosphere was nice. Overall, please don't listen to the bad reviews, these are people who are probably high-strung, and are living in mansions LoL.

<Author>cel1962
<Content>This place is AWESOME! Don't believe the bad reviews this place is awesome. We just returned from our honeymoon May 30- Jun 6, 2008. I wanted to write a review as soon as I got back.  We arrived on a Friday, when we got to the hotel check-in was a breeze. We booked a Platinum package(definately the way to go). The hotels website didn't have any platinum packages available, but we were able to book one on Bookit.com.  I am in the food business, so good food is important to me! The food here was good. It's not great and it's not San Francisco or New Orleans, but the food is good. Even finicky eaters will find something they like here. The ala carte restaurants were better than the buffet, generally, but the buffet was good as well. We also got married at the resort. It was a wonderful experience. The staff could not do enough for us! Even when it was raining the day we got married they moved us from the beach to the lobby and made everything great. I can't say enough about the staff at the Punta Cana Princess. One thing we did was take alot of 1's and 5's in US currency and tipped everybody. We were treated like kings. What most Americans don't understand is if you treat people with the respect they deserve in THEIR COUNTRY, they in turn will treat you with courtesy and respect. I have traveled all over the world and the Dominican people are some of the best we've ever encountered. If you want to have a great no stress vacation book the Punta Cana Princess!!!!!!!!!

<Author>NewJerseyCzarina
<Content>Do not go. They are running a bait and switch. We booked for adults only, small resort and paid for Platinum VIP service. When we arrived, we were there were no rooms available and they were transferring us to a sister resort. They tried to make it sound like they were upgrading us but we had paid for the upgrade already and did not want to go to a large resort. We personally met 4 other couples that had the same thing happen to them and were also very unhappy. We could not believe it - and that's just the few people we met. Imagine how many others it happened to. When you complain the staff just look at you and say there is nothing they can do. You needed to use a trolley to get around the resort. which is very inconvenient. The housekeeping was not good - once our room still was not cleaned by 5:30 and once by 7:00 pm - both times we had to call for housekeeping. We called for towels 3 times another time, and never got them. Food was OK but certainly not up to the rating. There was supposed to be butler service on the beach, but we never saw anyone the week we were there. Definitely not worth the extra money. We were very unhappy with this resort and would never go back or recommend it to anyone. We have been to 3 other facilities in Punta Cana, and would recommend any of them.We wrote Bookit (who we reserved through) to complain and never got a response. Once they have your money they do not care.

<Author>pharmgirl2008
<Content>Great choice for adults-only Resort:The resort was very beautiful and well-maintained. It was laid out very nicely and not a far walk from anywhere. We stayed in Building 5 which is closet to the beach and looks out to the pool. If you like to nap in the room it can get a little noisy around the pool at 3 when the activities group plays games, but we were mostly at the beach so it didnt matter. We went the 1st week of May and the weather was absolutely perfect-it rained for 15 minutes total the first 2 days and that was it.Rooms:We had a platinum suite which i don't think is much different from the other rooms except you have a bottle of rum and cigars in your room upon arrival. Rooms were tidy and maids were great, especially when you tip them. You could tell a little updating was needed, The bathroom showed it the most and we had a mysterious leak by patio doors but it was only during the last couple days. Activity:I loved the fact this resort was adults-only. Having no kids running around the pool or crying at dinner was great. It was very peaceful. If you're coming to do a lot of activities this is more of a laidback setting. The 2 sister resorts had restaurants and a casino if you wanted to go there. Excursions are offered-my boyfriends parents went horseback riding and rode thru the towns to get to the ranch, which was a little scary.Food;We enjoyed the food and didn't get sick at all. We didn't drink the water they pour at dinner, just stuck to beer, soda or juices. The 2 restaurants at the Princess were good-loved the tex-mex one!People: The people who worked there were very nice. Communication was ok if you knew a few spanish words for the maids to understand what you needed (washcloth, soap).Overall it was an enjoyable and relaxing vacation. The first time we went out of the country to vacation-beach is more beatiful than I could describe. The tipping could get to be a little much but that is probably more my fault beause I can be a sucker. I might go back but most likely will try to visit other places

<Author>emerald_kay
<Content>Punta Cana Princess Paradise!!!! My husband and I went with another couple to Punta Cana Princess. We stayed from May 21-May 28. This was our first time to an all-inclusive resort  our first time in the Dominican Republic  we absolutely loved it! I did extensive research before we booked this  our vacation was worth every penny we spent!AIRPORT:No problem getting through customs. I read that there was a $10 tourist entry fee at the airport, so we were prepared. A guide led us to our VIP Travel services rep  we got on an air-conditioned van. Then we were on our way to the resort.CHECK-IN:This went a whole lot smoother than I expected. As soon as we arrived, we were greeted with a cold cloth (which was a break from the heat) and a welcome drink. I requested rooms in building 5 (closest to the beach  pool) and our travel agent hooked us up with rooms in building 5, and our friends were in the room next door. ROOMS:Honestly, the rooms could use a decorative update, but we were only in the rooms to sleep  change clothes, so it wasn't a big deal. Our king sized bed was very comfortable! I have back problems, and it's hard for me to sleep comfortably in hotel beds, but I never had any back pains the whole time we were there! My husband enjoyed our free cigars and rum in our Platinum room. I liked the stocked mini-fridge (coke, sprite, beer,  plenty of water). The maids cleaned our room twice a day  we tipped them generously. Never saw a bug in our room.BEACH:This was my favorite part! They brag about the world's best beaches  I would have to agree. White sand  clear warm waters were wonderful. I really loved the canopy beach beds because you can control how much sun you get.FOOD:We didn't have any problems with the food at all. We ate at all the a la carte restaurants at our resort. We liked the Fondue (get the shrimp appetizer  meat variety enree)  the Tex Mex (highly recommend the steak, fajitas,  ribs) resaurants the best. We ate at the buffet (La Casabe) for breakfast  lunch most days. The buffet had more selection for lunch than the beach buffet. We ate at the buffet in the Caribe resort for breakfast once, but it wasn't much different than our resort. We did try the Brazilian restaurant at the Caribe resort, but we weren't impressed. We had all been to Brazil before, and the food in Brazil was much better, plus 3 out of the 4 of us had bad stomach issues the next day.SERVICE:This was one of the main reasons why we chose this resort over others. I read reviews here for months on this resort  everyone kept complimenting the service here. We prefer good service over luxury. All the workers greeted you with Hola  had a big smile on their faces. They were always busily working to serve the guests (which we rewarded generously with tips). Whatever you wanted, they'd go over and beyond to make sure you got it.BARS:The drinks kept coming. Ask for premium liquor because they have it. The lobby bar was the best out of all of them, but the swim-up bar was cool. We hit the swim-up bar around 4-5PM most days.The Presidente beer with a lime is good. Highly recommend the Coco Loco, Mamajuana (they call it Dominican viagra),  Blue Lagoon. OTHER INFO  ADVICE:*Bring around $50 in small bills to tip because most workers there work 12hr. days for little money.*Go to the tanning bed (or have somewhat of a tan) before you go. Three of us did  we never got burned. Of course, we applied sunscreen every so often too.*Bring SPF 30 and above sunscreen. We did and we didn't get burned, plus we got even better tans.*Bring Febreeze or another air freshener because it can be a little musty in the room sometimes. Keeping the A/C going helps.*Try learning some Spanish before you go. The workers will love to teach you  they like it when you speak Spanish to them. They appreciate your effort. It might help to bring a Spanish dictionary.*Drink more water than alcohol. I know that's a given, but especially because it is soooo hot there. Their water is filtered, so it's okay to drink (except the tap in the bathrooms).*Only the Fondue, Tex Mex,  Italian restaurants have air-conditioning. The buffet, seafood restaurant,  lobby do not have A/C, so keep that in mind.*The resort is adults only. We liked not having kids around. However, some people did go topless, but it wasn't a big deal.If you're thinking about coming to the Punta Cana Princess, I'd highly recommend it! We looked at other resorts  talked to others staying at other resorts  the Princess sounded the best to us all. For the price  service, it was worth it!  
<Date>May 30, 2008

<Author>LJR
<Content>Great time at the Princess Our party of 8 stayed at the PCP from May 18th to the 25th. We were all in agreement that the week was a success.Check in was effortless. We were in our rooms and changed within an hour. The suites are good size and adequate for a weeks stay. Glad to have the mini-fridge and coffee maker. Off to a good start!The first sight of the beach and ocean was breathtaking! The sand was so soft. We got a drink at the bar and just took in the clean air and the peace and quiet.Our days were mostly spent at the beach in the a.m. (beach beds way cool) and poolside in the afternoon. We did venture into Bavaro plaza for shopping and found Steves Corner Bar. A must! Some of us did swimming with the dolphins at Manati Park, others did horseback riding, and the Carribean festival. All were enjoyed. Everyone was pleasantly surprised with the food. Alot of choices, as one guest doesn't eat red meat or chicken. Ate breakfast and lunch at Casabe and dinners at different restaurants. (La Cave, Shanghay, Mare Norstrum, Tues. night beach party, Tex Mex.) The only one we wouldn't have gone to again would be the Fondue. It just took way to long.We contacted guest services and had a private table and dinner on the beach for my friends 40th Birthday. It was spectacular. One that she will never forget. The wait staff, maids, guest services, etc. were proffesional and friendly. We had one problem with a dinner reservation, but guest services fixed it in no time. Do bring bug spray. Those buggers loved my sweet blood! I was the only one out of the 8. But I dealt with it and enjoyed the rest of my stay, bites and all!All in all, if we were to return to the DR, the consensus of the 8 of us would be to go back to the PCP!  
<Date>May 28, 2008

<Author>sms08
<Content>A little piece of Heaven Early May 2008, I was given the wonderful gift of a week long vacation to your Punta Cana Princess Resort. As a first time traveller, I knew nothing of what to expect. I was accompanied by a very good friend  my daughter.It was the experience of a lifetime! Beautiful country with beautiful people. Amazing sunshine, beach, ocean, beds on the beach (a must have!)  pool. Truly wonderful Resort with exceptional staff, in every area. Loved the food offered at both the buffets  the restaurants. Great waiters/waitresses, bartenders  housekeeping staff/grounds keepers (so clean!) Staff was always smiling! Enjoyed the Disco  Casino. Animation team were fantastic on the beach, around the pool  in the lobby. Never a dull moment!The portion of the vacation that I least enjoyed was returning to Canada,  leaving your wonderful country, people  Resort behind. We will be returning to Punta Cana  hope to be bringing new faces along with us. Hope to see you next spring at the Punta Cana Princess Resort! FABULOUS!

<Author>HomerandJazz
<Content>WOW we loved it Punta Cana PrincessWe just got back on Sat May -23rd,and loved every minute of it,the reviews we read before the trip could not have been more accurate.First of all the sheer beauty of this place is unbelievable,the grounds are immaculate,and the beach was incredible,more than we had anticipated. We spent alot of time on the beach,always reserved a palapa by getting up early.The food on the resort was excellent,although some people are different than other's,every one has a bad day i guess you could say. Cold beer and pizza and nacho's for lunch,or go to the buffet.Excellent buffet breakfast in the morning,we never missed,the juices are a little sweet. Mare Nostrum was our favourite restaurant,lobster,wine ,beef ,mashed potatoes etc.There are so many things to list,and you problably have read all the other reviews,just go and check it out.Oh and one more thing..there were no bugs in our room,a few people had mosquitoe bites,but nothing to complain about,4000-5000 wings have the best ocean and pool views.DONT BE CHEAP! these people are very polite and helpful and extremely hardworking,tip them.Lobby at night for a good time.Lots of toplessness on the beach,its adult only and it is a mixed bag so dont get upset just go with it.We are going back next year hope we see the same people we met this time.KevBrenOntario
