<Author>aknsa
<Content>Punta Cana Princess, 5/18, 2008 The hotel itself is impressive in decor and spotless. Beautiful grounds, big pool, gorgeous beach with canopy beds waterside.Our room was nice, and a bottle of rum, cigars and basket of fresh fruit were there upon arrival.Maids were very efficient. Small fridge was stocked with Sprite, Coke, beer, and two large water bottles.Beach towels were included, so you did not to bring any.On to the restaurants- You need to make reservations, and can make as many as 3 ahead of time. Tried the Fondue place. Atmosphere was nice an intimate. The food was fair, and it took 2-21/2 hours to finish, due to the long waits for the fondue.Regular drinks are included. We decided to pay for two bottles of wine. While the meal is all included, we left a 20- (US) tip on a 90-tab for the wine. This was met with a rather displeased look by the manager, as if it wasn't enough. That turned me off to the restaurant for the rest of our stay. a 20% tip is generous, especially when tipping is not necessary in an all-inclusive.The Italian restaurant was excellent! The carpaccio, bruschetta, and Tartalle pasta were all delicious. Dessert was delightful, and the cappucino was wonderful.The buffet changes nightly and provides salads, breads, and themed nights for food. A lot of the food was of the greasy type.Pastas can be made to order. The breakfast buffet was quite good with fresh juices, fruits, yogurts, crepes, waffles, ham, bacon, and omelets and eggs made to order.The Mare Nostrum is open 24/7, and the bar next to it as well. The food is ok and standard: appetizers, salads, burgers, fries, pizza, and you can make a panini.BEWARE! You DO need BUG SPRAY! The mosquitos at night can be awful!For great meals, at an additional price, book La Cava and El Pescador at the sister hotel. They are 25- and 32- per person, but well worth it. THE ONLY PROBLEM is getting a shuttle from one hotel to the next. We waited for 45 minutes! This happened frequently, and was quite annoying, as we kept being told 15 minutes.The Disco Arrieta was a lot of fun. Opens at 11 p.m., and you drink free until midnight. Tower Casino was okay, ask for coupons before you go, to double your bet, or play 10- free.The shops downtown are sketchy. The shops in our hotel are OK. The Caribe had nicer shops.The sting ray and swim with sharks was worth every penny. BUT make sure you eat a good meal and bring snacks. They push the 151 rum, and Mamajawna. You can get drunk real easy. I would also bring your own snorkeling, as they do not clean it well.It was a nice trip, great with a bunch of friends.  
<Date>May 25, 2008

<Author>bigdaveNewJersey
<Content>Can't get much better. My wife and I are in our 50's and have been to the Islands several times. We just returned from the Punta Cana Princess and rate it as one of the best we have stayed at. We stayed at Sandals in Antigua a few years ago and we weren't as impressed as we were with the Princess. We read some bad reviews about the resort, but after staying there we just don't agree.The staff is what makes the difference. They are hard working, friendly and go out of their way to please the guests. The food was plentiful and good. The grounds are the best we have ever seen. The beach is cleaned twice a day.Don't get me wrong, there were monor problems but nothing to spoil a great vacation. I found we have more complaints regarding some of the guests. We witnessed some of the guests treated the staff like dogs, yelling at them and complaining they didn't speak english, (dah your in their country.) We saw another guest fill a dirty water bottle with juice at the buffet and another walking around the buffet with their fork picking at the food as she went along.In other reviews people complained about the mosquitoes. We found this to be false. If you want to fight a war with mosquitoes come to Ocean county in New Jersey and hang out at dusk on a humid July night.We would highly recommend the Punta Cana Princess to anyone who want to have a great vacation.

<Author>AlisAngel
<Content>Didn't Exceed Expectations My husband and I went to the Dominican Republic as part of a larger vacation (we stayed in Florida for a few days prior and a day after our Dominican trip). We chose the Dominican because it was reasonably priced and was easy to travel to from the Florida area. We chose the Princess Punta Cana resort because it was an Adult Only All-Inclusive resort and had favorable reviews on the site.Accommodations: We stayed in a top floor suite and the room was beautiful. The high ceilings and large daybed were nice surprises. Housekeeping was not exceptional; everything seem to be done in stages and began early in the morning so after the first day we did not get new towels and were left without washcloths for the remainder of our stay (the towel person came knocking before we got of bed in the morning so we always had to turn her away). The in-room mini-bar was limited - two bottles of pop, two beers and two bottles of water all restocked daily and one bottle of local whiskey.Amenities: Pool was very nice, kept at a comfortable temperature and the swim up bar is always great. However, there were a limited number of chairs, daybeds, and tiki huts which all filled up by early morning. There was a rule about not saving spaces but who wants to get into a fight with someone over a chair when you are confined to the resort space with them for the next few days? The beachside huts and daybeds, when available, were fantastic. Huts were especially nice when it rained all day ?allowed us to be outside but kept us dry. And surprisingly all of the nightlife activities were next door at the family resort so this resort was very quiet after dinner.Service: I have to admit that the service was below my expectations. I have previously stayed at all-inclusive resorts (Sandals begin the most recent) and resort staff is generally exceptional. One thing I was not happy with was tipping for everything was expected and didn seem appreciated. Also, while US $ was the standard in the resort, the resort staff was very limited in their English language skills. I have generally had a feeling of pampering when I stay at all-inclusive resorts and here I felt like I was intruding most of the time.Food  Beverage: Definitely edible, I certainly didn starve during my stay. The fondue restaurant was fun and it was nice to have options outside of buffets. I was disappointed in the remium?shelf liquor. As a VIP guest we were suppose to have access to the premium liquors however it was difficult to find any. I think they keep any name-brand liquors hidden in cabinets at the bars and you have to ask specifically for them when ordering drinks.Overall, the trip was very nice; the island was gorgeous, the resort was satisfactory and beaches were great.  
<Date>May 7, 2008

<Author>RyleyNS
<Content>Great trip but not perfect My husband and I along with two other couples traveled to the Punta Cana Princess the beginning of April 2008. Overall I have to say we really enjoyed this resort, however we did have some problems. This may be a bit long but bare with me, hopefully it will give a good honest review.Flight - We travelled down with the Regency Club through Air Transat. Flight was fine. It was very early in the morning and a bit cramped but I guess that is to be expected on these kinds of airlines. Bus to the resort was actually a lot of fun. Check in - Check in on the other hand did not go so well. If you go here and have someone by the name of Solomon serve you at the front desk wait for someone else. He was rude and just overall a jerk. We had requested to be in the same building as our friends and we had also requested king beds. They had us in separate buildings in two double beds. Also we had been told that Regency Club guests were in either building 4 or 5. This is not the case. You only get in building 5 if you specifically book an oceanview room, which was not offered to us at the time of booking. However if you kick up enough of a stink and maybe throw in a few tears they are pretty quick to try to accomodate you. They were not able to do anything for us the first night but asked us to come down the next morning and they would move us which they did. We also waited a long time for our luggage to arrive at our room got fed up and finally went and got our own. So once we were all situated in our final rooms for the week everything went much better.Rooms - We ended up in a king room in building 1. I was a little concerned about this but actually the room we were in was really nice. We were in 1009. It was very spacious and very clean. The bed was surprisingly comfortable and the shower had good pressure. May seem trivial to some but I like a shower with pressure. The rooms do however have a smell to them. Not a bad smell but I was wishing I had brought a scented candle or some room spray. I did brew some coffee and that helped. It is almost an over air conditioned smell or something but not so bad that it bothered you.Resort - The resort itself was beautiful. The grounds were so well kept and everything was clean. The pool was really nice with a swim up bar. We really didn't have much trouble finding a lounge chair but if you want a bed you had better plan to be out early, like 6-6:30 am. We really didn't care and really didn't want to get up that early so we just took what we could find. Although you are not suppose to, everyone does reserve with towels and books.A la Carte Restaurants - We ate at all of the a la cartes with the exception of Mare Nostrum in the evening. We really enjoyed La Petite Fondue. The Tex Mex Steakhouse was good as well. The Italian was OK for the main dishes but the starters they bring are delicious. We also tried two restauarants over at the other resort. We ate at the Mexican which again was good and the Chinese which I think was my favourite. The starters there were excellent as well and I really enjoyed my curry chicken dish. However we had two who had the pork and did not enjoy it and one who had the beef and said it wasn't very good either.Buffet - We ate primarily at the main buffet up by the lobby for breakfast and we alternated between there and the Mare Nostrum for lunch. The selection is better at the main buffet but I did enjoy the nachos and pizza down by the beach. The Mare Nostrum also had one of our favourite waiters, Sarapio. Another great person was Santa. We ate at the buffet one night and it was fine. You really don't go to an all inclusive for the food.I guess that is about it. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the Punta Cana Princess. It was relaxing and quiet. The fact that it was adults only was a real bonus as we were there for a relaxing take it easy kind of time. Now I will warn that this is not a party resort. There isn't much in the way of night life. There were activities in the lobby at night that we went to but at the end of the day we were so exhausted we really weren't all that interested in night life. There is however a disco on the other resort you can go to if you want a party. So if you are looking to just kick back and relax in a quiet surrounding definitely consider this resort.  
<Date>Apr 30, 2008

<Author>Willy899
<Content>2 Weeks at the Punta Cana Princess We stayed at the Punta Cana Princess From April 7 to April 21 and our stay at the resort was for the most part enjoyable.This is a lovely well kept resort . The grounds are perfect and the pool and beach are spectacular. This resort seems to be maintained better than its two sister resorts next door.We found the food to be better than most resorts we have visited ( 4th time to the DR) and there were always lots of choice at the buffett each night. We ate at 4 of the restaurants are they were all good - Steak house, mexican, fondue and italian. The restaurants on the resort don't take reservations so you need to show up early (before 7PM) or you could be in for a long wait. The restaurants of the sister resorts next door need to be reserved and I like this better as you know there will be a table available for you.This is a very quiet resort with little night life - after 10PM everybody is gone to bed, Perfect if this is what you want but don't expect it to be party central. You can go next door to see a show or go to the disco (only has free drinks from 11-12) if you want a bit more nightlife.I had a few issues with trying to get a place to lie down at the beach or pool. People are up as early as 5:30 reserving their chairs and by 8;00 there is nothing left. Hotel policy says this is not allowed but everyone including the staff ignores this. They really could use more loungers on both the pool and beach areas.Service at the buffett is good but there were times that it seems the staff were overworked and it was difficult to get a second glass of wine or water.The biggest issue I had was with fly bites. The first week we were there it was windy day and night and we had a few bites despite wearing repellant every day. On our second week the wind died down and we were literally eaten alive. I was getting 3 or 4 new bites each day and the old bites would not heal. It came to the point I did not want to go out after dark as I could not handle getting any new bites. There were not Mosquitoes but very small flies that had a huge bite and did not seem to know that DEET was not the main course for their dinner..This resort and its two sisters resorts are surrounded by a huge swamp that is the perfect breeding ground for these pesky bugs. Their were alot of people complaining about this on our trip home. For this reason I would not return to this resort as the bites were very painful - enough that I could not sleep at night. The bites on my arms became infected and I am now taking antibiotics 4 a day for 10 days to clear this up.They really need to deal with this issue if they want people to return.  
<Date>Apr 24, 2008

<Author>TwoBlondSisters
<Content>Great Resort, So Much Fun!! My sister and I went to this resort for our annual Mommies Vacation from March 28th to April 4th, 2008. We have been away every year for the last ten years to many different tropical resorts. This resort was definitely our favourite to date. The front desk staff were very friendly and accomodating. Our first room was on the main floor and we really did not want to be on the ground floor. When we went to speak with the front desk -Julio - a very handsome man - happily changed our room to a third floor room. The room was incredible. We had wonderful views of both the pool and the ocean. The room service is fantastic. I don't see many people mentioning it but it is available 24 hours a day and they deliver your order very promptly. (I really liked the salads on the room service menu - I acutally found them to be better than the salad at the buffet. ) The staff at the resort are by far the nicest I have ever encountered at a resort. All of them SMILE constantly and are very pleasant and try very hard to speak English with you. The bartenders are very nice - but I did find that they do not serve the international brands of liquor and beer unless you ask for it and it gets kind of tiring to always have to ask when you go to order a drink. The bars all close at midnight except for the beach bar and they do not budge on this. A group of us were in the lobby one night and they would not serve anyone a drink after 12:00. This is not a complaint - they still have one bar open 24 hours - but when you are enjoying yourselves in the lobby - it is a pain to walk all the way to the beach bar to get drinks. The animation staff are really this nicest I have ever met. Jesus, Jose and the rest of the animation team are very pleasant and try really hard. It was the perfect balance for me because I don't really care to get all involved when I am away - there is just enough to do and they are not in your face all day trying to get you to do things you don't want to do. (My sister, on the other hand, loves to participate and managed to keep herself busy all week joining in most of the organized activities!) I could go on and on about this fabulous resort. We met so many incredible people who will remember and think of often. Thanks again to everyone at the PCP and all the great people we met who made this a trip to remember!  
<Date>Apr 23, 2008

<Author>drea68
<Content>Fantastic vacation at a fantastic resort My husband and I just returned April 11/08 from a glorious week at the Punta Cana Princess. This resort is amazing, we have absolutely nothing negative to say about it. I won't go into detail as the other reviews have pretty much covered everything. The resort is beautiful, well maintained, impeccable grounds. The beach is awesome, white sand, turqoise water. Everything is very clean, the pool deck is scrubbed every morning. Our room was always cleaned well everyday. The food was great in all the restaurants. The staff at all restaurants and bars were great, especially at the Mare Nostrum, which serves breakfast and lunch and then turns into the seafood restaurant at night. Would highly recommend this restaurant for a nice seafood dinner. We can't say enough about it. We religiously checked the reviews before we booked our vacation and even afterwards, and all that was said in the positive reviews is 110% true. It's a great resort to go to if you want to relax and unwind. There is not a lot of partying going on, you can get that at the Caribe and Tropical Princess next door to this resort. We found that people liked to get up really early, 6:00a.m., and reserve the palapas around the pool and the beach so.....if you're an early bird, we would highly recommend doing this, if not, chances are you will still find chairs or a bed. Bring mosquito repellant as there are quite a few in the lobby which is where the nightly entertainment takes place and people congregate at night to chat and have a few drinks. Ask for Emilio at the lobby bar, he will treat you well. Check it out for yourselves, you won't be disappointed. We would definetly go back to this resort.  
<Date>Apr 13, 2008

<Author>xinfinity
<Content>Better than expected A couple friends and I stayed at Princess for a week in February 2008. I've been to a few all inclusive resorts in the last few years and this was my first time in DR. Punta Cana is a very developed tourist area and there were many resorts to choose from. I found it difficult to narrow down my choices, but ultimately it was the recommendations from TripAdvisor and the cost that helped me decide on Princess.The reviews I read all had good things to say about the resort and I don't recall anything bad standing out in my mind.With that being said, I was somewhat worried about whether everything would run smoothly. Because there were three of us staying in one room I was worried about whether we would get a room with the right number of beds, towels, etc. I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived to find that, yes indeed, there were enough towels in our room. Sometimes it's the little details like that that make the difference between relaxation and stress.I wanted to write this review to point out that I feel Princess is well run. There always seemed to be help available, seating at restaurants, chairs around the pool, etc. The grounds were well maintained, the staff were friendly, and many staff made an effort to get to know us. I had a less than ideal experience with food in Cuba, but I found the food at Princess surprisingly good, especially the lobster tail one night.A final note about the resort. My friends and I range from 26-33 and while we found the resort to be an older crowd (adults only), we enjoyed the quiet, relaxing aspect of the resort. There were fun activities available, but what was great was that we had access to the two neighbouring resorts where the guests were noticeably younger and more interested in partying.  
<Date>Apr 8, 2008

<Author>aquapoolco
<Content>Great Resort My husband and I spent our 10th anniversary at this resort. We booked the Platinum Package through Vacations To Go which I recommend. We go somewhere twice a year, always all inclusive Caribbean and Mexico, so we are familiar with what to expect. Other that one minor thing this was a great resort. I would rate this a solid 4, maybe 4 1/2 out of 5.First the bad:When we got to the resort we were told it was our lucky day we were being upgraded to a Honeymoon Suite. When we booked I requested a regular room in Bldg. 5 by the beach. We were given a room in Bldg. 3. It is the building farthest from the beach and the room was on the top floor at the far end. I wasn't happy about the location but the view was AWFUL! We were overlooking the resort dump. Broken palapas, etc. The room was done in all white with a balcony and whirlpool bath. Being all white, it showed every scuff. It could have used a paint job. The next morning we switched to a room in Bldg 1. This was a regular room but was MUCH nicer. The front desk was nice about the switch.The good:Everything else. The grounds are very pretty. The pool is really nice, although a little cool for my taste. Wonderful pool beds and beach beds and palapas. Great beach. Lots of chairs.The food was about what you expect at an AI. The buffet was pretty good. The Italian restaurant had good food but the service was slower than most. The steak house was ok too. We really liked the fondue place. The seafood restaurant by the beach was very good. Excellent ceviche! We also booked a beach dinner on our anniversary. I was overwhelmed! I expected a table on the sand and maybe a tiki torch or something. We had a table in the pergola outside the seafood restaurant. The beach was lined with palm fronds, fig leaves,  flowers forming a pathway to the pergola. They took our arms and escorted us to our table while humming the wedding march. We were served 2 different wines plus a bottle of champagne. Had a 5 course meal with dessert. They really went out of their way to make our evening special. We were given printed menus to take with us, they took pictures for us, 3 waiters served us. All this for $50 US !!! Worth 3x that.The people in DR are fantastic. They are the friendliest, happiest, most helpful people we have encountered. They genuinely love tourists. Please understand that these people live off of their tips, not their salary. Even though tipping is included in the package we always take $100 -$150 in $1's and $5's. Let's face it. 1. The service is always better when you tip 2. They really need it and work their backsides off for it and 3. If you can afford the trip, you can afford the tips.For anyone contemplating DR or Punta Cana Princess, you won't go wrong with either.One tip: Watch out for the Mamajuana! It tastes pretty good, and a shot or two is fine. Just don't drink too much of it because it will give you the WORST heartburn you've ever had the next day. (Normally we never have it.)Also if you want to take it home make sure that it is in a bottle. Don't buy the stuff in the plastic bags - they confiscate it at the airport! We found out the hard way.  
<Date>Mar 31, 2008

<Author>Onemarmot
<Content>Do Not Stay Here! They Steal!!! It saddens me to write this report, as our vacation was great. HOWEVER, while my luggage was in the Punta Cana Princess' secured luggage lock-up for the day, my video ipod was stolen. Not my passport or money, but my ipod. The hotel is refusing to take responsibility for the theft and will not file a stolen property report in order for me to get compensation. Please be wary in trusting this hotel with anything.

<Author>Canadian_Sue33
<Content>A little slice of heaven! Paradise My boyfriend and I stayed at the Punta Cana Princess from March 6-13, 2008. The hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible service before. The front desk staff were very helpful and the housekeepers kept our room amazingly clean, never a bug in sight. The beds were comfortable and the room was always nice and cool. The grounds of the hotel were always kept in beautiful condition.We had full access to the sister resorts next door and you could either walk or take a golf cart. Those resorts were beaituful too and we also had access to the casino which was quite fun too.The beach is breathtaking, absolutely spectacular. The ocean is so warm, we found it warmer than the pool. The weather was fantastic. I had checked the weather before we left Canada and was worried because it said partly couldy and showers everyday that we were supposed to be there. Well...partly cloudy meant the odd cloud here and there and rain showers lasted about 2 minutes and then the sun was out again. It was HOT HOT HOT. It was only about 31 celcius but felt like 40 when you were away from the beach and didn't get the lovely breeze off the ocean.The service on the beach is great too, especially if you tip the server a dollar or two! He kept our drinks topped up all day :)The food was ok, the buffet was good and the steakhouse was great. The seafood restaurant was alright, but was a little disappointed with the lobster.The animation staff was great, always trying to get you involved in their activities but didn't pressure you. If you said no, they moved on to the next guest.No children...ahhhh! Bliss! This is one of the best features of the resort!!!The excursions were fantastic. We went on the ATV tour and snorkeling tour. Both half day excursions and they were well worth the money. Especially the ATV tour.I highly recommend this resort for honeymoon or couples looking for a romantic getaway.  
<Date>Mar 25, 2008

<Author>rtgaway
<Content>Perfectly Pleased! My husband and I stayed at the PCP for the first two weeks in March and all I can say is that we'd go back again next month if we could! We've travelled extensively all over the Caribbean and have never experienced an all-inclusive and were somewhat apprehensive as to what we'd encounter even though most of the reviews we'd read were positive.First of all, let me say that the hotel staff is the most hospitable, helpful, friendly and accomodating group of people we've ever met. From the moment we arrived (two hours ahead of check-in) until the minute we left it was very obvious that EVERY maid, bartender, waiter, waitress, groundskeeper, maintenance man, guest service representative, etc. had one goal in mind and that was to make sure their guests were satisfied; they did an outstanding job (even when often times faced with a language barrier!)!The food was surprisingly good. Granted, it's not gourmet cuisine but the buffet strived to offer a large variety and the a la carte restaurants were a nice option. The salads and fruits were as fresh as could be and the desserts were amazing. We visited La Cava and Momma Mia's next door and would highly recommend both. Overall, out of the l4 days we were there we were only disappointed in maybe three of our meals (including breakfast and lunch). We never were hungry, we never got sick to our stomach and we never had to ask for a refill for whatever we were drinking; we enjoyed the service immensely!The grounds at the PCP are beautiful and maintained to perfection. The beach is gorgeous, with just enough breeze to make you feel comfortable. The sun beds are awesome and a welcome relief from the chaises; we never had a problem with having to be the first one to the beach to get either - there were plenty for everyone (be careful with those chaises, though; a couple were broken and are probably still there!). If you enjoy walking, I would encourage you to go out on the beach to your left; when you get to the flea market the view is breathtaking and that stretch of beach is magnificent.The rooms at the PCP are spotless, spacious and extremely comfortable. I especially liked the double sinks in the bathroom, as well as the outstanding water pressure. The towels were not the most plush but they were clean and plentiful. Our king-sized bed was super; my husband didn't snore for two weeks! We were also impressed that out mini fridge was replenished daily,along with our coffee; again, the service was superb!The entertainment, better known as the Animacion Team, was certainly not Broadway or even cruise quality. They provided a tremendous amount of fun, however, and encouraged everybody to participate, day or night. If you're looking for a lot of night life, I'd suggest checking out another resort or possibly going to the outside theater next door, the Casino or the Disco.Make sure to experience a massage or two in the Spa or on the beach; you'll want to pack your masseuse in your suitcase! We couldn't believe it was possible to be that relaxed!!Our vacation at PCP was truly one of the most enjoyable ones we've ever had; we met some really neat people from Canada, we had l4 days of perfect weather and the hotel was l00% to our satisfaction - who could ask for more?! !!  
<Date>Mar 25, 2008

<Author>Fredericton81
<Content>Awesome!!!!! Hello All,All right, better late than never!!!! I have been meaning to post this for a month and I am finally getting around to it. It has been on my conscience because I read every word of every review every posted on this resort and feel I could bring something to others looking for some info. Im going to do this a little different than prev reviews cause it does get somewhat repetitive. Here we go. Food awesome. Service awesome. Room awesome. Resort awesome. Get the idea? It really is great all around. Now that that is out of the way here are a few less published facts and tips.You do not need a power adaptor. We bought one and didn need it. All of our stuff (hair dryer, camera, laptop etc. all worked off the electrical plugs in the room.Laptop does fit in the safe. I have a Gateway 2 yrs old and not small by any means. If you have a normal size laptop it should fit fine. No concerns with bringing it. Resort felt very safe. Safe if free also.Learn a little Spanish or get a pocket Spanish-English dictionary. The girls were all about this before we left and I though it was a waste of time. But at 3pm when you are all drunk trying to explain something to your new best friend the bartender, It is almost impossible. We ended up drawing pictures and using hand gestures to figure out that Andy lives in Santa Domingo, and is going home in a couple days to see his son and wife.Tipping is something you always hear about. Everyone asking to please tip cause they are soooo poor. Here is my take. The same people get all the tip money. The same bartenders, all the maids, and serving staff. We tipped very well to everyone, but in retrospect I wish we had of given a larger percentage to the people that don see allot of tip. (the gardener, busboy and the less traffic bars.) I really believe that the maids and popular bar tenders do a great job and deserve a good tip, but these people are really coining it. I bet you that they make up to 10 times there salary in tips. The guy that keeps the grounds in such beautiful shape may see a tip a week. Do as you please that is just my take.Premium drinks are hiding. If you get in with the bartenders, you will drink like a king all week. A good tip early, and some conversation with the bar tender go a long way. World famous Nelson at the pool bar is really great. Everyday, all day, I was at the pool bar and we had a great relationship. When I would walk by the bar on the way to the beach or somewhere and I would hear a whistle from 200 yrds away. Look over and there is Nelson arms in the air as if to say here do you think you are going, get over here and have a drink with me.?As soon as my toes hit the pool Nelson had a big smile a wave and my drink was started while 3 others were waiting to order a drink. If the bartender likes you, you don have to ask for the good stuff. You just get it!!! Lots and Lots of BOOBS!!!!! Like it or not, I don care, but there is no way around it. I think it has something to do with adults only resort. The good, the Bad and the Ugly!!! From 18yrs old to 70 yrs old. Some really beautiful girls too!!! Sorry honey. A la Carte no reservation and unlimited visits. This is a real bonus. You could literally eat at all 4 every night. Grab a group of new friends and visit the Fondu restaurant. It was great.Drink water not just booze!!! One of our group got dehydrated and passed out. Off to the medical center on the resort (which is as good as any clinic in Canada!!!!) Into an ambulance (which is not a donkey and wagon) and off to the hospital, I.V. in arm. They said the hospital and service was world class. $1600 later she will drink more water next time. Luckily she had insurance through work.This is starting to drag on. Il end this now. Hope this helps. Hello to all our new friendou know who you are. Hope to see you all at the weddings next yr. JB  
<Date>Mar 24, 2008

<Author>PCPfirsttime
<Content>It was great... This was our first visit to Punta Cana and hopefully not the last..we read all the reviews on the PCP and would say that they were very accurate. The hotel is quiet, small resort so very easy to get around, minimal walking distance to all services. The beaches were beautiful, lots of opportunities for long walks. Pool was great, swim up bar staffed with friendly courteous staff, very helpful. Rooms were clean and housekepping staff always had the room cleaned in a timely manner. Turn down service at night was a nice added touch. Hotel is appearing a little older, but still in very nice condition. Checkin and checkout were uneventful. Front desk staff were helpful and friendly. The restaurants were accesible but men did have to wear long pants. No reservations were required so that was also nice, as you could decide to go at the last minute and were accomodated. Buffett was good, lots of variety, different theme each night although some food was available every night..so you could stick to a specific preference if you liked. Desserts could have used a bit of variety..these seemed to be the same always..lots to choose from though so something for everyone. The beach grill was great for breakfast, fresh omeletts and great toast...less congested and right by the ocean so was nice to have breakfast there..very casual as well. Santa was a great waitress...Entertainment was ok, the Animation team tried very hard to get folks involved although there was not a lot of variety, there were disco's and other stage entertainment at the adjoing hotel so you could find a bit more action if you wanted. This is a great place to go if you want to relax, and stay fairly low key..a great vacation. We visited the casino and it was a lot of fun..they have a disco there as well that starts at about 11 at night...looked like a lot of fun. The shuttle was great to go back and forth on..took about 10 minutes and the wait was not too long. The Catermeran half day trip to snorkel and swim with the sharks and sting rays was great..the staff on the boat were full of energy and made it a lot of fun. It was certainly a good time, lots of rum and dancing...If you snorkel make sure to go to the Advanced side as the Beginners side does not have a lot to see. Advanced side was great..and it does not matter if you are new at the game...Try not to forget any essentials at home because they are very expensive on the resort and that is really the only place to purchase items..sunscreen, advil, cough medicine etc. Markets on the beach were ok and they do barter, but it was things like cigars, clothes, paintings, carvings..rum. vanilla, coffee...Cigars in the hotel store were just as reasonable. We did go to Nicoles jewellery store in town and it was small but had something in most price ranges...we were told by the travel rep it was a safe place to buy authentic jewellery and not get ripped off...we did buy some..This is a beautiful place to visit, the resort was very clean and the staff super friendly...made our first visit very enjoyable..  
<Date>Mar 20, 2008

<Author>curamala
<Content>Amazing Vacation overall I just returned last night from a glorious week at the Bavaro Princess in Punta Cana, Dominican. There was four of us, me, my husband, my son (11) and his friend (12). I don't know what people are talking about when they bash this resort. We had a wonderful vacation. The resort is absolutely beautiful, the grounds are very neat and well kept, the rooms are spacious, clean and cozy , the food is good (there is always something to eat).and the people that work there are very friendly. We went to cuba last year and my son's stomach did not do very well. At the Bavaro Princess he had absolutely no stomach problems!!!!!!!The two boys had a blast playing soccer, basketball, pingpong, shuffleboard, swimming, pool, and fooseball. We didn't see them at all during the day. At night they have a kids show at 8 and an adult one at 10:00p.m. in the main lobby.Our favourite restaurant was the Japanese Restaurant. It was an amazing experience and the food was amazing!!!! The one we didn't care for was Bella Pasta. The food was okay. Other than that all the other ones were great.We will definitely come back again!!!!

<Author>CaribeandCanada
<Content>Great beach, great staff and food, Quiet (that's OK though) Phil and JackieOntario, CanadaJust got back from 14 days at the Punta Cana Princess. It was great, maybe a 4 or 4 1/2 star... would not give it 5 only because it doesn't have an exotic pool and fantastic entertainment. We've been to Cuba(2), CostaRica, Cancun, Panama(2), Aruba, Barbados, St.Martin, Florida (5) and we're in our mid 50s. We're fussy about safe food, not musty rooms and gotta have shade without fighting over it.Bottom line:CLEAN, SAFE FOOD and GOOD FOOD, QUIET, lots of shade, Great Staff.-great beach that's cleaned every morning and has lots of palapas (don't have to get up at sunrise to reserve one)- very clean and orderly (just the way baby boomers like it)- halls, pool area and rooms cleaned AND RINSED every day... wow.... your feet don't get black like other places we've been-staff is great... about the best we've come across.... no complaints at all... only saw 1 waiter look a bit disgruntled one time.... not bad for 2 weeks-quiet place where everyone pretty well respected your privacy... if you are bunch of rowdy 20 yr olds looking to party-on all night, try some other place.... this place is a bit classier than that.. there were lots of young people but also lots of us more senior (50s) and older.... a good mix -FOOD - ranged from good to VERY GOOD and maybe even excellent at times. Most of the time I would say very good and VERY SAFE... that's a big deal !! We were pleasantly surprised since our daughter had gone to some other place 1 mile south a few weeks earlier and 28 of the group of 30 got really sick. So we came down expecting to only eat bananas and drink bottled beer. After about 4 days we were eating everything and no problems at all. Everything is fresh, spotless, as tasty as you want.. Ate almost all meals at the ala cartes without 1 lineup. Had to wait 2 minutes 1 night for them to set a table at the fondue place... Good variety... the odd meal was only just good but believe me, it was SAFE. Drank the water at the restaurants after seeing that my wife drank it for days and was OK ( I use her as my food tester then I wait for 2 days.... just kiddin). Sure, if you see lunch meat that may have been out for a while, I would stay away from it. That goes for anywhere. Really it's good food... some interesting items on the menus and you can go back as often as you want (I think.... well, we did). After 14 days we still had not exhausted the menus......close though. So I would recommend the Princess.... it's small, quiet and perfect for couples and small groups... lots of interesting European clients to give the place a nice flair. One word of caution (oh yes, there has to be one) is that ground floor rooms tend to be musty, but that's the case everywhere in the Caribbean and Central America... you can't get away from it on the ground floor. Get the 2nd or 3rd floor. We changed from ground to 2nd floor (no problem) and it was fine. The best buildings are 5, then 4 , then 3. Building 1 or 2 we did not care for too much. See other reviews for excursions, parasailing, details of restuarants, photos, etc ... I think I've given you the bottom line on this very nice place..... ENJOY.  
<Date>Mar 17, 2008

<Author>reh012
<Content>Can sum it up in one word...Paradise We stayed at PC Princess from 2-27 thru 3-5 2008 and adored the resort. The Amimacion Staff was wonderful...Danny, Andre, Selena and Katrina made each day and evening fun filled with activities. We got involved in almost every activity they put together throughout the day and in the evenings. I would advise anyone to join in when they ask for volunteers and if you don't join in...get front row seats and be prepared to laugh.The restaurants were great. We really enjoyed the food at Tex-Mex. The Margaritas are also very good there. Le Petite Fondue was excellent and I advise not waiting till the last night to go there because you'll wish you had gone at the beginning so you could have gone back for more! The beach area and the pool area were clean and tidy. We never had a problem finding somewhere to lay out in the sun or rest in the shade. We did do an excursion to Saona Island and it was a great trip. Bring lots of sunscreen because you don't feel yourself burning. Although the bus ride to get there was long, it was worth it once you got on the catamaran and headed out to the Caribbean Sea. Our only bad experience was our deep sea fishing excursion. We booked through the resort and the company was Gone Fishing. The fumes from our boat caused severe illness/carbon monoxide poisoning. It was a terrible adventure and I would not recommend that trip to anyone. We had 8 foot swells and in the 4 hour trip only 1 fish caught the line. It was an expensive trip and not at all worth the $100 per person. We heard the Safari Trip would have been much more worth the money we spent. Overall I would say our trip was excellent. I would return in a second if I could.  
<Date>Mar 7, 2008

<Author>Davidsonjt
<Content>Nice Adults Only resort My husband and I stayed at the Punta Cana Princess - Regency Package - January 7-14. We have been to a number of all-inclusive resorts throughout the Caribbean, including two Sandals resorts. This was my second time to Punta Cana, but my husband's first trip.When we first arrived we were surprised at how small a group we were - because the hotel has only 270 rooms (or so, I think), when we got off the plane there only was us and two other people destined for the hotel! We are used to be part of a huge group that is herded onto a large bus...then when they drop you off, it takes forever to check in! It was nice that we were only two groups - check in was a breeze, and then we were off to enjoy the day.Our room was great - decorated with flowers, and included beer/water/coke/sprite as well as bottles of rum/vodka/rye. This was probably the largest room we have ever stayed in, and thought it was great - lots of hot water, drawer space, electronic safe included. We tipped our maid with a few dollars and little shampoo/perfume samples every couple days, and she was great.The beach and pool were highlights. We never had a problem getting a pool or beach chair, or a beach bed (included in the Regency package). Towels were normally in our room courtesy of the maid (Regency package), so we never had to go get them. The one time that the maid forgot, though, the towel service were out of clean towels, so we had to wait a while. No big deal. The beach is beautiful and the water is warm. The pool bar is great - try the Mamajuana - it is the local drink - made with rum/wine and and herbs marinated altogether. The locals say that if a man and woman have two shots each, each night they will have a long and happy marriage (no doubt!)The grounds are beautifully kept, and everything is quite clean.The food was not the greatest though - the buffet is okay - we could find something to eat, but I wouldn't say it was delicious. The Steak House Rio Grande was the best meal of the week. My husband said he wished we could eat there every day (but it is closed weekends, and normally full). The Mexican was good, and the Italian places, Chinese, and Swiss Fondue were fine too, but nothing to write home about. Overall, the a la cartes were much better than the buffet. We aren't seafood eaters, so did not try those a la cartes, nor did we try the Brazilian. La Cava costs an extra $25 per person, and I was not willing to fork out additional money. Neither of us were sick, and we gained a few pounds (as one should when on vacation and at an all-inclusive), so all-in-all, not too bad.At lunch we ate at the buffet mostly - the restaurant on the beach would have a smaller version of what was in the buffet, but if you waited until 4pm, they serve really good sandwiches...only works if you book a late dinner though!!We did go over to the partner resorts - Caribe and Tropical, and they were a little bigger, but filled with kids. They do seem to have a better selection of fruit at the buffet, though. A negative point was our Air Transat rep Sonia. When we arrived we were told to meet our rep in the lobby the following morning for the standard briefing on the hotel/tours/etc. We showed up early, and the rep was no where to be found. There was also another couple waiting to hear the presentation. We asked the front desk if they could call, which they did....the Air Transat office indicated that the front desk should try Sonia directly, as she was supposed to be there. The front desk did so, and there was no answer....we waited around a little bit, and then left. The following morning we ventured to the lobby again, and the rep, Sonia was there. We made a comment regarding the previous morning and how we were waiting for the presentation - she quipped it was my day off. Oh - we didn't know - we were told to meet you....we asked if we could hear the presentation - I just finished it. No offer of apology for the inconvenience, no effort to tell us when the next pr! esentation was or if she could help us in any way. My husband ended up booking a tee time through her, but we didn't book anything else as she was terrible to deal with. The other couple we had met talked with her a few times about a possible outing - something they always have done while on vacation, and really wanted to this trip, but was so turned off by Sonia's negative attitude and lack of help, that they didn't. Hopefully you don't have an experience like this.We tried the casino - not the greatest - they have black jack, craps, roulette, caribbean poker. They also have a texas hold'em table - buy in minimum $200 up to $1000. Wouldn't waste your money there.Another disappointing thing is that there is only one hot tub, and it closes at 5pm. 5pm is when I would actually start wanting to go in the hot tub! As a result, we never tried it out.At the end my husband said that he would never pay Sandals prices again, as this resort was more than adequate, but I would - the food for me was fine - but if you pay the Sandals prices you get GREAT food, not just okay food. Besides that, everything was perfect.  
<Date>Mar 5, 2008

<Author>Bughater
<Content>Mosquitoes!!! Punta Cana had the most beautiful beach I have ever seen and miles of it! The weather was amazing and the beds at this resort were extremely unique and fun to suntan and read on. The beds were both on the beach and around the pool which was very nice if it was too windy near the beach you had the option to move near the pool.The food at the a la carte restaruants was great....if you can eat at them every night do so... it isnt necessary to make a reservation so you can go whenever you choose. The buffet food was pretty good and we really enjoyed the breakfasts. They really don't know how to make north american desserts so don't be dissapointed if you are a sweet lover like I am.The biggest dissapointment of the trip for me was the mosquito bites that I got in the gym at our resort....the workout room was swarming with them. I guess that they really enjoyed the air conditioning and I didnt even realize they were biting me as they are smaller than our mosquitoes here and you dont feel them bite. I had 110 bites on my lower legs and was very uncomfortable the entire trip. I became very aware of where and when they were around and found that in the lobby in the evening they were plentiful also. BEWARE!!!! I ended up having to take antihistamines the whole time and was very happy to get home and out of the mosquitoe zone! I also was happy that we had decided to take our antimalarial medication as some vacationers had not done so. Apparently malaria is quite prevalent and becoming even more common among the caribbean islands.This resort was well worth the money if you want to just chill out and are happy just hanging out at the beach or in the pool. There isnt much else to do in Punta Cana, I had been to Puerto Plata previously and found more activities/excursions offered there. The drinks were also TOP NOTCH and our room was the best. We stayed in building #5 on the top floor and had a view of the ocean. We read about it on someone elses tripadviser note so requested it and they were wonderful accommodating us.My girlfriend and most of the others did not get bothered by the bites like I did, so don't worry that this happens to everyone, there were only about 2 or 3 others that got bitten as bad as I did and not all the ppl got the bites in the gym. I just happen to be a person that mosquitoes love....both here and in the DM! Stacy Edomonton AB  
<Date>Mar 3, 2008

<Author>martra
<Content>"Amazing Hotel/Staff" Just returned on Saturday Night from a one week vacation at the Punta Cana Princess. You can not go wrong with this resort. Staff are amazing, truly happy people always working with a smile on their face. If you get slow service it is because they are very busy not because they are not working hard.We did not suffer from any stomach problems during our stay the food was good to great. Highly recommend the Tex Mex, ate at this restaurant three times...........very good!I could go on  on regarding how much fun and how great this resort is however it would be repeating the other positive reviews. Should you have any question please feel free to email.What i would really recommened and was very surprised the lack of people who did not use it is Deep Woods Off. We all seem to know of the Malaria issuses in this area, the mosquitos are comparable to what we experience at dusk and dawn during the summer months. We sprayed before dinner every night and did not get one bite. The lobby bar, gym and computer area seemed to be the hot spots for the mosquitos however if you wearing the deep woods off you will not be bugged.We had no issues with bugs/ants in our room or around the resort.If you are into a quite relaxing and truly amazing vacation you will be very pleased with this resort, we would go back in a heart beat.

<Author>napcatLouisville
<Content>Disappointed! My husband and I and another couple (their first time at an all-inclusive  out of the US) stayed at the Punta Cana Princess for 5 nights. Check in was fine. We did have to go back to the front desk several times during our stay because either my card worked in the door or his - they finally got them fixed although neither of them ever worked in the safe - we had to share our friends safe.The beach  ocean was everything you could every dream of BUT the food was very disappointing. Dinner at the beachside restaurant the first night was good but went back another night and it wasn't. The buffet during the day by the beach was rather unfulfilling - I would have killed for some pretzels  chips or nacho chips to munch on. The service at the restaurants and the room cleaning was good but language barrier did come into play at times.My husband and his friend were playing golf at White Sands Golf Club on Monday  Wednesday. Monday's pick up went fine because we had a tour guy call on Sunday  arrange for the pick up. My husband arranged for a pick up after playing on Monday for Wednesday morning and that didn't go so well - after waiting an hour after the designated pick up time - my husband asked the girl at the front desk for help in contacting the golf course and after much frustration finally got someone to help. I will say the Golf was not part of the package but felt they could have tried to be more helpful. Remember just put your watch away because you are on Dominican time which is whenever THEY decide it's time.

<Author>babeandbelle
<Content>Good Value Just returned from the Punta Cana Princess and had a great vacation. I will try to touch on what I felt others may have missed. First off, we spent weeks analyzing other reviews on Trip Adivsor and had a really hard time trying to decide on where to stay. I think we finally chose the PCP for the adults only, beach, and the fact that the reviews were about 90% positive, which is Very high if you read a lot of reviews.  We were not disappointed as we got exactly what we were looking for , beautiful soft sandy beach, gorgeous turquoise water, and a nice clean resort. I will now touch on things to be aware of : - Arrival off the plane: we got to our bus quickly, then sat on it for about an hour before it left. It stopped at about 5 other properties before getting to the PCP, which is always the last stop on any excursion. Our flight from Toronto left at 5:20 and we got to the resort at about 1:30 am. If I go again , I will take a taxi ride straight there, it costs around $35.Check in was quick, I had requested a room in the 5000 suites and a King bed but we didnt get it, the next morning after much coaxing, I managed to get a room in the 5000's on the main floor, better than nothing with a King bed.. After checking in we went to the 24 hr grill and ordered hamburgers, as I had read some reviews that raved about them. They were undercooked, however, we were so hungry we ate them anyway. We tried them once more the next day , again undercooked , this time with a hair in them. No more burgers for us. I cant quite figure out how people could have raived about them? Breakfast Buffet was boring and tiring, I couldnt imagine staying here for 2 weeks and having breakfast here all week. The egg station was good and that was it. Limited variety of cereals, good selection of breads, fruit was average and I found it odd that they did not offer any berries, or nuts , which I love to put on my cereal.There was no fish offered for breakfast, until the last day , I did notice some smoked salmon . Lunch was buffet as well and you could forget about getting a nice fresh sandwich, it was all precooked foods that sat in the troughs for the entire period it was open. To be fair , they did have a section that had processed slices of ham and turkey and salami , along with a decent assorment of cheeses, they just didnt look apetizing at all . They offered some types of fish, inlcuding sea bass, however, it was alway undercooked, a shame for a nice type of fish. al a cartes were decent, never outstanding with a couple of exceptions. The fried mozzarela sticks were excellent at the tex mex , as were their nachos and dips and the stake was good, again undercooked ( you can probably get around this by orering well done for medium). Best drinks we had were the frozen margueritas at the Tex Mex. They seemed to have them figured out there, which is strange as I think all the drinks come from the same place? The evening buffets have different themes everynight, which means 85% stays the same and they mix up some of the meats for the theme of the evening. The first one we went to was the seafoood Buffet , I was quite excited about it , as I love seafood, only to find the lobster to be about the size of a very large prawn and it was mushy, I decided to go the mare nostrum ( the seafood restaurant) instead of eating at the buffet and ordered the lobster there, this was very good, however again not very large, All in all I would give the food a 3 out of 5, probably the least favourite thing at the resort. You could probably order room service to get around the boredom of these restaurants. Cleaning of the rooms was decent , however , my girlfriend had a pair of her pants stolen by the maid service and forget about trying to report it, it was useless, this was the only problem we had with the room services, everything else was decent. You do get a good variety of tv channels, which are usefull , as the place is dead at night after dinner, they have some lame shows in the lobby and if you want to watch them , spray yourself for mosquitoes, particularly if you are female, they seemed to bite all of the women there but trust me tv is more exciting. The staff are very friendly and easily confused if you ask for anything out of the ordinary in English, ie. I wanted cream in my coffee instead of milk , they could not figure it out, so I order Baileys with my coffee and that solved my cream problem. I will not go over beach topics as they have all been covered, with one exception, you do not see the sun set so make sure you get up early to see the sunrise, it is absolutely gorgeous and it rises fast, this also ensures you can reserve a beach bed or lounge chair on the beach.  The wind always blows strong on the beach , so if you dont like wind , consider the pacific coast of Mexico, I quite enjoyed it , as it gave you relief from the heat of the Sun. We booked through Transat Vacations, which gave us the Regency Club ,which meant absolutely nothing, everyone had the same thing there. Oh yeah you got three bottles of cheap booze ( which we left, only one of them was sealed), and three cheap cigars. Please dont get me wrong , we had a wonderful time , I just wonder if we would have had the same good time at a less expensive resort, as the beach and Sun ( the two major reasons we loved it so much) are the same at every resort in Punta Cana. We would go back to this resort in a flash, IF the price were right , I would say at around $1000 this would be good value.  
<Date>Feb 22, 2008

<Author>paulettec
<Content>Punta Cana Princess - Excellent vacation I will not make this review too long because enough great things have been said about the Punta Cana Princess. Excellent resort. Very quiet, adults only and that is great if you want total relaxation. We tried 3 of the restaurants and all were quite good. Buffet was repetitive but food was good. Staff is very friendly and cheerful. Most could speak English quite good and some even spoke French to us.What can I say about the beach, fantastic. We walked that beach every day for about 2 hours and it is superb.We were lucky to get a room in building 5 on the third floor as I had requested in an e-mail. Other people that I met had also requested building 5 but did not get what they had requested. But frankly, the resort is small enough that all rooms are quite close to the beach. I saw the sunrise every morning from my balcony while having my coffee......exquisite. We went 3 times to the casino (we took the free shuttle) that was fun for a few hours.If you want total relaxation go to this resort. I truly recommend it.Thanks to all of you that have answered my questions since last October. Your reviews and/or comments on this resort were really helpful once I got there.And yes Nelson at the pool bar is the best.  
<Date>Feb 20, 2008

<Author>fitzright2001
<Content>Perfect Vacation, Perfect Resort We stayed at the Punta Cana Princess from February 8-16,2008. This was our forth trip to Punta Cana and our first stay at this resort. This resort is the smallest we have ever stayed at. We loved the size of this resort and the adults only policy.We upgraded to VIP-Platinum when we booked our trip. The upgrade is worth every penny to stay in building 5000. This is the best building on the resort. You are maybe 50 feet from the beach and you have a good view of the ocean from your balcony or terrace. We stayed in room 5013 which was on the ground floor on the end by the beach. The room was great, we had one problem when we first got there, the lock on the sliding glass door was broken, we notified guest services and it was fixed promptly. The beach is beautiful, warm blue water with small waves to play in or body surf and powder white sand. The waiter service on the beach is hit or miss, he serviced the beach bed area more frequently than any other area. Tipping him did not change the service, but the bar is so close it was no big deal to get your own cocktail. There were plenty of beach loungers and huts available everyday, we never had to worry about finding a spot on the beach. We did not go to the pool during the day but from what we saw there were plenty of loungers and huts available there also. Because the resort is small its not over crowded and being adults only you dont have kids and teenagers running all over the place. It is quiet and peaceful. This is the perfect place to unwind and have a relaxing vacation. In my opinion if you are looking for a place that has a lot going on during the day and looking for nightlife this resort would not be for you. But like other reviews said, the 2 sister resorts are a short walk away and they have shows at night, there is a lot of activity and were very crowded I was very glad we were not staying at either of the sister resorts. You can also take the shuttle to the casino, it was maybe a 10 min ride to casino from the Punta Cana Princess. The food we thought was good for an all inclusive, its not gourmet but its plentiful and you can always find something to satisfy you. The specialty restaurants were good, they have a no reservations required policy. We never had a problem getting seated. We ate at all the specialty restaurants and were happy with the food and the service except for the fondue restaurant it was OK, we liked the shrimp appetizer but we were not too happy when they brought out the main course and they had raw chicken,beef and sausage all on one plate. But like I said the food was good and prepared well in the restaurants and buffets. There is always fresh fruit and plenty of choices.The resort is kept spotless, and the grounds are beautiful.We went on 2 excursions, deep sea fishing and the bavaro splash where you drive a small speed boat and go snorkeling. The fishing was OK, the bavaro splash was a blast, very much worth going on.I would return to this resort without hesitation and I would recommend it to anyone. The only thing I would like to see them change would be make the minimum age to stay there be changed from 18 to 21. If you have any questions feel free to e mail.  
<Date>Feb 20, 2008

<Author>letrbuck
<Content>Better Than Cancun First of all, Air Transat sucks!!!!!!!!!!. We departed from Edmonton, Ab, Can on Jan 31/08.We decided to take our golf clubs on this trip .Upon checking in that morning, Air Transat tryed to charge us extra for our clubs because they said that the allowable weight was 15kg.Their website clearly states 20 kg.I'd expect this kind of treatment in Cancun, but not in Canada.I also think that it is very rude for flight attendants to be speaking in French to each other on a charter that leaves from Western Canada.On the flight down, not one hot meal .They serves a cold bagel breakfast and an hour before landing , they gave us a cold fist sized burrito.Unfortunately if you want to stay at the Punta Cana Princess, you have to fly Ait Transat.The peolple at this resort try very hard to please you.The maid service is good, not always excellant but good.If you need extra water, beer, or towels, they don't take all day like in cancun.Usually within 15 minutes.The resort is exactly what it looks like in the pictures.If you want to go lay on the beach for two weeks, this is a good place to go.The food is what I expected it to be.Average at best.Afterall, you are in a 3rd world country, don't have high expectations.The service in the al'la'cart's was terrible, we spent most of our time at the 2 buffets offered.The food and service at the sister resorts was horrendous.I wouldn't recommend them at all.Unlike the mexicans, these people are always smiling and happy to have you around.The flea market on the beach was fun to shop in just to haggle down prices.Don't go into town to shop, it's all the same stuff and the merchants are very aggressive in getting you into their store.Overall, with exception to Airtransat, the trip was 100% better that Cancun last year.The flight is long, 6.5 hrs going and 7.5 hrs coming home.If your planning on golfing, don't take your clubs and don't use the online golf registration service offered via the internet.They tryed to screw us out of a golf reservation at La Cana.They didn't pick us up at the resort and we had to call them to straighten it all out.If you want to golf, book it when you get there and rent clubs.La cana is a very nice coures , Cocotal, is an average course at best.This was the only time in my golfing life that a marshall made us skip a hole.They started a group on the back nine when we were golfing our 11th hole.He claimed we were going to slow and made us skip the 12th hole.Also, there are no washrooms on the front nine, and we seldom saw the refreshment cart.At La Cana, we saw the refreshment cart on the 2nd hole and not again until the 13th hole.Not a big deal, but when your golfing in 30 celuis weather it's nice to have a cold drink now and then.Punta Cana Princess: could us an upgrade to the rooms, beds and such.No frills, just better service than mexico and nicer people.

<Author>Jimbo08
<Content>Punta Cana Princess , A great adult resort! Punta Cana Vacation Review Nancy  Jim - OntarioWhen: Feb. 4th ?11th ?2008Where: Punta Cana Princess ?Regency Suites-Transat Holidays packageFlight from Hamilton, ON- flight from Punta Cana was late so our flight was delayed 1.5hrs. (6pm). Pilot made up about 30min. of this.- flew Skyservice for the first time and they are very good.Arrival/ customs- got through customs/luggage and sitting on the transport bus in 30-40 min (Transat rep. Ready  waiting)Check in- as we were the only people checking in at 1am, everything was taken care of in 5min.- given a room in block 5 ( rm # 5008 main floor ). Had previously requested an upper level room in blocks 3,4 or 5. but none available that night. Works out we were satisfied with this room  remained there for the week. Bags arrived quickly to our room- I was hungry so we went to the 24hr. beach bar/grill and had a freshly made grilled chicken on a bun/fries/salad/Presidente and it was very good and Andy on the bar was a riot. What a great view as we sat on the outside deck of this beach front restaurant listening and viewing the wavesRoom: - King bed in a very large room that has separate bathroom with two sinks, bathtub with shower.- electronic safe in closet.- Step down into a large sitting area that had a sofa with large cushions  trundle bed under it. coffee table, TV  fridge stocked daily with water, pop  beer. Patio doors open up from here to a nice patio with two chairs  a table.- Rooms were cleaned daily usually before noon. Nightly turn down was a nice touch and generally room was made up with fresh flowers.- Usually received daily clean beach towels to our room, bath towels, ?hand towel. Face cloth hit  miss. (but no problem as we have learned to bring our own face cloths)Food- this resort has good to great food at all the A la carte , buffets and beach grill. The seafood restaurant was very good as was the Italian. Punta Cana Princess recently dropped the reservation requirement at the A la carte's and we think that this works very well. The buffet always had plenty of selection to suit our tastes. We did not go to any restaurants off the resort at the sister resorts but I was told that they were very good. You will need to call  reserve at those restaurants.Beach- Punta Cana Princess has a large beach for a resort of this size. They offer plenty of beach cots both under the beach huts and in the open. If you want one of the beach huts in the prime locations you better get there by 8:am. They also have about 30 beach beds in a roped off area and they usually go early. We didn try them because they don allow for you to sit up. The beach is cleaned  raked early in the morning. - (I find it amazing by how much trash [ empty cups straws etc ] is left behind on the beach each day by some guests. Shame on them!!- They have drink service at the beach although spotty at times.Pool- the pool is about 4?deep all over. It really is a good size for a resort this small. It has plenty of cots and a few beach beds. As with the beach the earlier you get there the better your location. The towel on the cot game is in play here even though signs are posted to refrain from this practice. (Early bird gets the worm.)- The pool has a swim up bar  waiter/waitress service at poolside.- Lots of organized activities by the animation team at the pool site in the afternoonEntertainment The lobby offers some form of entertainment most evenings. Lobby is large and always a good place to sit and people watch. They also have evening events at the beach weather permitting. You can go to the sister resorts for nightly entertainment.Animation- all very nice and work hard to get people involved in variety of activities.Staff- we found all staff very friendly and appreciative of our efforts to speak Spanish. They were always very polite and often replied in english.ConclusionWe have stayed at two other resorts in Punta Cana, one of them a family resort the other an adult resort and they were both very nice 41/2 ?5 star ratings.We prefer Punta Cana Princess for its size and the general layout of the resort. It is really easy to find you way around.The food was great and staff very friendly.We will return here as soon we can  would recommend this resort to anyone looking to kick back and take it easy.  
<Date>Feb 17, 2008

<Author>marcman
<Content>I have never been to a place where i felt so welcome and invited I have never been to a place where i felt so welcome and invited, the staff treated us with respect and kindness.This was my first trip ever. When we arrived to the resort, my mouth droped it was beautyful. The bus ride getting the was short and comfterable. I had dectied on this place after readind review after review. And i shure made the right decision. Ill start with the food. NO and i mean NO reservations needed for the a la cart resturants this is a total plus.I foun the food to be a little greasey at times but for the most part good 4 a la carts 2 buffates, no need to rush to get something to eat there is always a table somewear. there were 5 bars and the wait to get a drink well there was no wait. The thing that impressed me the most is the fact that the entire resort except the wasrooms and showers HAS PUIRAFIED WATER, so dont be afred to get that extre ice cube or glass of water with your dinner I was'nt.I think we had one of the LARGEST SAND BEACH OF ALL THE HOTELS, and this was somthing out of a post card. night life a little quiet thins seamed to shut down after midnight, but if you wanted to keep going all you had to do was step on to a shuttle and go to the casino or disco and thies were open till 5 am. The disco was loud but I liked the music it had a bit of dance mixed with cariben sound.The rooms looked just liked the broshure bee nice to your maid we got 6 pellows and extre water and pop. when you get to your room you will get 4 bottles of booze i mean a 40 0z 2 26 0z and a mickey plus 3 stogies.pretty cool. I am 30 rys old and I had the best time I think I could have I did not party much ,but took in a lot of RR. You still have 24 hr drinks yes rum and beer as well as fried chicken, hotdogs and hamburgers so if you want somthing to eat at 5 am go ahed. daly actives were good tenis, archery, vollyball, darts,pool volyball. lots to do. This was not the cheapest for me but It was one of the best moment of my life I WILL GO BACK WITH OUT A DOUT.I hope this gives you a little more in fo and thank for reading

<Author>RosieNJ
<Content>Heaven on earth! We were at another resort in Punta Cana last year. It was big and impersonal. We decided to try a smaller resort this year and booked at the Punta Cana Princess for 10 days. It was heaven on earth.Check in was smooth and pleasant. A cold drink of something pink and sweet from the bar, and a cool damp towel to wipe off the travel grime. A quick trip on a golf cart to a room with a fabulous balcony view of both the pool and the ocean. A chilled fruit basket and cold sodas, beer and water in the fridge. Since we booked as VIP's, there was also a bottle of rum, whiskey and vodka awaitng (full size bottles), as well as 3 local cigars. A quick change into shorts and then we walked around the complex.The grounds are beautifully maintained, with music piped in along the walkways. We found the food at all the restaurants to be wonderful, especially at the a la carte restaurants. And I can't say enough good things about the wonderful dominican coffee. The beach is beyond compare....white sand, turquoise water and friendly people everywhere. We were able to use the beach beds (you can't even imagine how wonderful this is unless you have been there), and the waiter service on the beach was great. We met lots of great people, includng the staff. When you spend 10 days in a small resort, you get to know everyone. We met folks from far away, and are actually planning to meet them there next year. I would have booked my next vacation with them before we even left if I could have!If you go, please tell Julio, Louisa, Serapio, Emilio, Celine, Jarol, Alberto, Felix, Santa, and Danny that Rosa says hello and will see them proximo ano!  
<Date>Feb 4, 2008

<Author>AlbertaTrudy
<Content>We Found Paradise!!!!!!!!!! Hola!! The Punta Cana Princess is the best resort we have been at so far in our travels. We loved it so much we tried to stay an extra week but they were totally booked up and we couldn't stay- we even offered to sleep on the beach if we could stay! This is the only resort we have ever been at where we weren't ready to go home! The food was excellent with a fresh pasta bar at lunch, omlette and pancake bars at breakfast and usually fresh fish bar at the evening buffet. For breakfast they also have yogurt, toast, cereal and all the usuals you would find at home. The 24 hour snack bar makes the BEST hamburgers- even better than I would find at any restaurant in Alberta, Canada. The fruit was always fresh and plentiful and was always my favorite food! The baked tomatoes are very, very good, too!The a la cartes are now reservation-free so you can enjoy them on any night and as many times as you want during your stay. This was fabulous cause when we met new people and wanted to go for dinner with them we could go to the a la cartes for a special meal on a moments notice.The beach party on Monday night is a whole lotta fun even though ours was moved inside due to windy, rainy weather.The nightly shows in the lobby are fun and we went to almost every one. We got to know the Amination team very well so we had fun with them during the day and at the shows at night. We ended up in the show one night, much to my husband's dismay!Kelvin, Danny, Jarol and Celina are a very energetic group of people!!! This show ended about 11:00 and then you could go over to the disco if you still craved more excitement or you could go for a quite stroll on the beach. If you chose to retire then, it was nice and quiet and you could get a good sleep.The staff at the Mare Nostrum Snack bar are amazing! Give a big hug to Serapio if you go there- he bends over backwards to make sure you are taken care of. Daniela is an excellent bartender and will make whatever you ask for, even if she's never heard of it!!We were part of the VIP group and had access to the beach beds. They are fabulous!!!!! Talk about a fanatasy- falling asleep on a bed on the beach listening to the ocean and dreaming of paradise.....and waking up actually IN paradise! There is also butler service on the beach for the VIP's- another amazing perk of being a VIP. There is also a fruit basket in your room, a 26 ounce bottle each of rum, whiskey and vodka and a stocked mini-bar. We also had a little box with 3 cigars in it. There were bath robes and slippers also for us to use. The maids were fabulous and we had nightly turn down. We also had free internet access.The beaches here are out of this world and unlike any we have encountered. It's like walking in icing sugar and the sand never gets hot! Amazing! As you can see, we are very taken with this resort. We have already made plans to go back next January but it will be for 2 weeks this time! Hola!!  
<Date>Jan 30, 2008

<Author>Davluv
<Content>quiet paradise my wife and i as well as my brother in law and his wife just got back from the princess and thought i would write this while it was fresh o in my mind In one word terrificwe arrived late in the day half hour by bus ,check in was fast and efficientgot our luggage to our rooms in quick time and went looking for food .it was noted that beach bar was the place to go but for whatever reason was closed that night .But the staff told us to go to the main buffet .it had the beach bar menu and was very good and the beer was cold.tired,we went to our rooms and were greeted with a large suite with king bed, fruit basket ,free rum and three cigars.I normally have trouble sleeping in a strange bed but had no trouble here at all,slept like ababy.We were in building 5 on the ground floor and we overlooked the pool,with the bar straight ahead.unlike other people we had no trouble getting the same 4 chairs every day by the pool , usually by 8.30am.the beach was very clean and the sand was soft and pleasant.allways chairs available, and the beds were a nice touch.Though you needed v.i.p. for these it was well worth it.Food the buffet was always with a different assortment, and at night had a new item on the carvery. my only complaint would have a better variety of desserts.of all of the a lacarts we only went to 2 but enjoyed them so much we went twice to both. The tex mex did a great steak, just dont order med rare it came out mooing ,but the corrected it and the chef even came out to check, again great service.mare nostrum is great we had lobster and it was very good.Also the when you are finished you are offered afterdinner liquers the pool bar is terrific during the day ,and i found nelson and fransico very friendly and well versed in mixolagythe lobby bar is nice at night with the animation team getting people involved . a great server there was dayanra? she was always friendly and fast. dont forget these folks live for tips so dont shy.all in all if you wish a vacation that is quiet and laid back, then this spot is for you .
