<Author>Bookbox
<Content>A Wonderful Holiday This is one of the smallest hotels in Punta Cana and because of that there is a wonderfully intimate feel. The absence of children means that it's a very calm, peaceful environment. The hotel, the grounds and the beach are kept immaculately clean. You very quickly get to know your way around and the staff become like old friends.There are less facilities and activities on offer than at other hotels but you can always visit the other Princess hotels if you're feeling bored. Similarly the choices at the buffet restaurant were more limited than we're used to but the quality was excellent throughout. When I mentioned to the restaurant manager that I was vegetarian I was overwhelmed by the response. The Head Chef came and spoke to me every day to ask whether I would like something special in addition to what was available in the buffet.We visited two of the a la carte restaurants and both were very good. We also heard good reports from everybody who visited the other two. There were a further six a la carte restaurants available at the Caribe Princess hotel as well as a larger buffet restaurant but we were more than happy with the food at the Punta Cana Princess. There are three bars and the choice and quality of drinks was very high.The animation staff do their best although the entertainment , particularly in the evening, is very low key. Again you can visit the Caribe Princess next door for a wider choice of activities and evening entertainment.The beach is stunning and there were always plenty of sunbeds available.I can't praise the staff highly enough. There were too many special people to name individuals but everybody that we came into contact with was friendly and helpful.The rooms were large, clean and very comfortable with all the facilities you would expect and need in a holiday hotel.Overall, a wonderful holiday in a fantastic hotel!  
<Date>Jan 20, 2008

<Author>sdipasquale
<Content>Awesome!! We stayed at the Punta Cana Princess from Jan 7-12, 2008. I'll I can say is we can't wait to go back. I travelled with my husband, my son and his girlfriend. We all had a great time and can't wait to go back. From the staff to the accomodations, everything was perfect. I liked that this resort is adults only, no kids jumping in the pool, etc. Very relaxing, the staff cannot do enough for you, from helping you decide on which excursion to do (we asked the staff for alot of advise on what to do, they were extremely helpful) to climbing up a tree to get you a fresh coconut! The food at the buffet was pretty good. We never went hungry, but we definately enjoyed the al a carte restaurants more. The Tex Mex Steakhouse and La Cava were incredible. Bring a sweater for the restaurants, they are air conditioned. The swim-up bar with Nelson was great. He makes the best Coco Locos, as well as BananaMamas. Once he was off shift, I stopped ordering Coco Locos, no one else can make them like him! Also, don't forget to visit Emelio at the Lobby Bar. He puts on an awesome show, as well as pouring some really good drinks.We did a sport fishing excursion, using Mikes Marina as our contact. We booked a half day, and though the fishing was pretty slow at first, we ended up catching 3 Dorado (Mahi Mahi). My husband is still smiling thinking about the experience!Our kids did a sunset horseback ride on the beach and said that it was great! Overall, no complaints. We meet alot of wonderful people from Canada, which we hope to keep in contact with. Americans were certainly in the minority here, but that was not a problem for us.If you are on the fence about this resort, don't hesitate. The only thing keeping me from booking again right now is we have told so many people about it, and they all want to come down with us, we are juggling too many schedules at this point. We may just have to book it and say to the rest come if you can!  
<Date>Jan 19, 2008

<Author>fullmonte
<Content>Third Stay Loved P.C.P. Even More This was our third stay at the pcp 2003,2004,2007 I think this time was the best due to the fact the resort is adults only now.We requested the same room as the other 2 stays and we received it 5107.The food was great never a problem finding something tastey.The room was always clean,always hot water,fridge restocked. If you want extra water just leave a short note asking dos agua por favor and leave a dollar if you want they deserve it.We keep returning here because we also love the location on Bavaro beach, we love to walk 1-1.5 hrs per day,1 day turn right next day turn left.Always feel safe as there are resorts all along the beach.Can't wait until April we're going back to pcp with 2 other couples.Please please please DO NOT be afraid to be generous with your 1 dollar bills the staff try very hard to make our vacation enjoyable a small tip does make a big difference.

<Content>Couldn't have been better We stayed at the PCPrincess All Suites from Dec 8-15 - even with the tropical storm Olga passing through we had an awesome time. We have no complaints - great front desk service from Julio and lobby bartender Emelio and the most happy guy at the pool bar Nelson - all very friendly and can't do enough for you. We ate at all the a la cartes except the fondue - as well as a few at the Tropical and Caribe- all excellent. The buffet was really great for breakfast and lunch - huge selection. We had the Regency Suite package and the rooms are gorgeiou, huge with a king bed and double sinks - lots of storage space and a lovely balcony. The beach beds are great and there are also lots of palapas and a huge beach. We would consider going back - great to have adults only.

<Author>JRCan
<Content>Descent Resort, update needed. We booked through Sunwing Vacations.Price was good but they almost hide the fact, that you fly into Santo Domingo, which is a 3 1/2 -4 hour bus ride from the Airport to Punta Cana.Trust me, make sure you fly right into Punta Cana. Hotel Good points-great beach, good restaurants, good food, great drinks and descent service. The variety of restaurants are good and the service was quite good. The grounds were perfectly manicured and spotless, thanks to the mostly Haitian workers.( who deserve a tip for sure) Negative points, check in was slow. Smoking seemed to be everywhere, even though there are designated smoking locations.(mostly because of the Europeans)Rooms could use an update, they need new beds and new plumbling fixtures. Overall it was a good trip with good food and good weather.I would recommend the resort, but make sure you fly into Punta Cana.

<Author>mikegemma31
<Content>Nice Hotel but The Food is below average Me and My new wife stayed here for our Honeymoon.Overall view of the hotel - very clean and great pool and beach but the food is not the best - dont expect great food here you wont get it.Check in - Very good - cold towels and drink are nice touches. When we checked in they asked for the copy of our marriage certificate and took it away and photocopied it. We expect a upgrade or something else but when we got to the room it was just the same as all the others - excepet they brought a basket of fruit and a bottle of rum to the room later on.Pool and beach - Brilliant, If you like lying aroung the pool all day then this is the place for you. The swim up bar is great and Nelson will put a smile on your face straight away - hes always smiling. Try the coco loco's they are superb. You wont go thirsty with Neslon serving you as soon as you coming to the end of your drink another one is placed in front of you- Great. The beach is very clean and I loved the sea - great waves.The staff are very friendly , not one member of staff whilst passing failed to say ola. We didnt tip much , just the maid for the room which she kept spotless and the lobby bar waitress who kept sure our table was never wanting for anything.Food - The biggest disappointment at this Hotel. The buffet is OK but not great and the Restaraunt are only slightly better. We Eat at the Italian and were very Disapointed and the Chinese was OK. We did have fun at the Fondue cooking our food at the table but again the food is just passable. We did eat at La Cava and that was very nice - the best meal we had all two weeks we stayed there.The entertainment is very poor for a Adult only resort and a 5 star hotel. They all try their best but I expected better.Me and my wife were ill with bad stomachs and spent most of the first week on the Toilet but we were much better the second week - Not blaming the Hotel for that just Bad luck I suppose.But overall very nice hotel and resort but dont expect great food or you will be very disapointment  
<Date>Nov 17, 2007

<Author>Pinghead
<Content>Great Property, Great Staff, OK Food Returned from a week at the Punta Cana Princess on 08 November 07. Best vacation value for the dollar that I have experienced. Loved the 'Adults Only' policy. The property was beautiful - large and lush with a great pool and an excellent location on the beach. Staff were very friendly and always responded to any requests for information, assistance, etc.We traveled with another couple. E-mailed ahead and asked for adjoining rooms in building #5. Received a quick response and our request was granted. We were right beside the pool and very close to the beach. Lots of loungers and beach beds, both at the pool and on the beach. Not crowded at all - not sure if this is a slow season or if this is typical year round. Anyway, it was great.Only down side to this resort is the food. If you looking for cruise ship cuisine you will be sadly disappointed. Food is plentiful and more than adequate, if you are not a picky eater. Food here was better than at AI's I have stayed at in Mexico and Cuba. However, food is not the 'strength' of this resort (and I suspect of any Caribbean AI resort).While the food wasn't great, it met my expectations of an AI resort. However, in all other areas (rooms, pool, beach, grounds, staff, etc.), the Punta Cana Princess exceeded all my expectations. I would not hesitate to recommend this property to anyone looking for an economical 'laid back' vacation on a beautiful tropical beach!  
<Date>Nov 11, 2007
<Rating>4	5	4	4	4	4	4	3

<Author>didig
<Content>Don't waste your time or money let me start by saying I'm from manhattan and have traveled EXTENSIVELY...all over the world. This was my first all inclusive. I've stayed in hotels in Indonesia for $4 per night to suites in Paris for $5,000 per night so I have a very broad traveling history. I went to the princess with my boyfriend.I wasn't impressed AT ALL!!! Rooms:We had to change rooms 3 times...I know that I shouldn't expect strong water pressure in a third world country but I also didn't expect a trickle of 3 drops of water at a time. I couldn't wash my hair for 3 days. The rooms were clean. The decor was okay. Buildings 4 and 5 are the best ones, they are very close to the beach and pool. Forget about buildings 1 and 2. Terrible location. The last night we stayed we got a free upgrade to the honeymoon suite. It was very nice. Duplex, jacuzzi and daybed upstairs-very romantic.Staff:The best part of the trip. Everyone was very friendly. I suggest tipping well. Food: Disgusting. I ate toast and cheese everyday. None of their food was edible. Very difficult for vegetarians. We had to book 3 days in advance for an a la carte restaurant, which wasn't worth it. Did I mention DISGUSTING? I would have rather eaten toast and cheese. Chinese restaurant was awful. Italian restaurant was awful.Mexican restaurant-after the meal I went to the room and threw up.Guests: Not many Americans. A lot of South Americans, French, etc. I met a Siberian couple who had traveled 21 hours on a plane to get there. My only question was...WHY???? None of the guests were very friendly.Beach and pool: The water was a bit rough for me. I prefer the placid water in Martinique or St. Martin. But if you like waves then you'll enjoy it. The beds on the beach were great, was worth upgrading to the VIP, though many non VIP guests were using the beds. Plenty of seaweed all over the beach. Not very clean.Shopping: Nothing. The flea market was nice. About a 10 minute walk down the beach. We bought a lot of beautiful painitings there. Plaza Bavara was ncie too. Bought some great wooden carvings and more paintings. Only go there if you know how to bargain. they harass you. They will start at $400 but will eventually go down to $60 if you know what you're doing. My boyfriend couldn't handle the haggling and pressure the people put on you to 'come look'. I didn't mind(used to it) but after a few days it became very draining. The hotel has one lousy gift shop. Major rip off. On my last day I bought a painting for $80 which I could have easily gotten at the flea market for $30.Nightlife: Be careful. That's all I have to say. I went to Mangu discotheque one night(off hotel groinds). Nothing special. I wasn't impressed. I didn't go to any shows at the hotel. I was so bored by evening I just wanted to go to sleep. A few times we played connect four in the hotel lobby.If you have the extra money(maybe $50 a night more) I suggest staying at the paradisus next door. It was GORGEOUS!!! Upscale, gorgeous tropical grounds. we missed out. I have no idea how this hotel(the princess) was rated #10 in Punta Cana. Probably one of the most boring unoriginal places I've ever stayed at.Good luck.  
<Date>Nov 4, 2007

<Author>fall_vacationer_7
<Content>relaxing vacation We stayed at the princess Oct 26 through Nov 2 and had a lovely time. We were there through the tropical storm, which limited our sun time. The resort grounds were very well kept. We were in the 4000 building and had a good view of the pool and ocean. The beach was beautiful and the sand felt like powder. The food was not bad, our best dinner I believe was at la cava. The only problem we had the whole trip was that we did not speak any spanish and it was hard sometimes getting answers, but I can say that they tried very hard to understand and get you what you needed. We booked the VIP and upgraded the massage to 70 minutes which my husband and I enjoy very much. The only thing I did not like was the 1 hour boat ride, the driver was traveling to fast and the ocean was ruf, I did not think we would make it back so when visitors at the tropical princess got off the boat we got off also and walked back to the princess. One young girl was crying. Overall it was a relaxing vacation.

<Author>lmm623
<Content>Great Honeymoon We went to the Princess for our honeymoon and had a wonderful time. The rooms were clean and well kept. The A/C was ok but we would have liked cooler. When you came in from outside you could feel the difference but it was not a big difference and when we both showered it made the entire room hot. That is our only complaint about the rooms.The beach is WONDERFUL, The sand is never hot and the beach is very well maintained. It is breath taking the first time you see it. The pool was our favorite spot and Nelson the pool bartender was GREAT. We liked the pool because it was not salty, for some reason the salt was really bothering my skin so we stuck with the pool. Being able to swim right up to the bar was great and we loved the pool side and beach side beds. It makes such a difference when you can layout all day and be comfortable.The food was good most of the time. Breakfast was a little tough, we had a hard time finding food that was hot, specifically the pancakes, waffles etc. The eggs and that type of food were warm but not hot. Lunch was great we went to Mare Nostrum for the buffet everyday and the grilled chicken was very yummy! Dinner was also great we ate at the buffet as well as the specialty restaurants. Our favorite was the Steak House, but we also tried the Italian and Lacava and all were very good. We would suggest making a reservation for a specialty on Monday nights as I highly do not suggest the Dominican Night buffet. We heard from alot of people that they got sick from the food (we were there for 2 Mondays and that was the case each time).Overall the resort is wonderful, well kept and the landscaping is beautiful. We plan to go back and would suggest it to anyone. My only suggestions would be to improve the breakfast food and have better A/C.  
<Date>Oct 31, 2007

<Author>Happybeanies
<Content>Loved the Punta Cana Princess Suites  We stayed at this resort from Oct. 19-26th 2007. We absolutely loved this resort. We were in block 5000 and had a great view of the ocean as well as the pool. We had a king size bed with a step down to a small sitting room which in turn walked out on to the balcony. Our room was always clean and the fridge was well stocked. We did the VIP package and would recommend it. Not only did it get you the premium drinks we also got the 20 min massage, small snacks at night that were delivered to our room and a free meal at the Le Cava or the Seafood restaurant as well as some other bonuses. The filet mignon in the Tex Mex was to die for as well as the lobster dinner at the Le Cava. We had heard negative things about the Fondue Restaurant but 6 of us went and it was great.Nelson at the pool bar always makes sure you are looked after as well as Kenya up in the Lobby. The Catamaran/Speedboat excursion was a great trip. I ran into a problem with my camera but the Manager was great about and even sent a huge fruit basket to our room. We did a lot of tipping but that was because the workers that got the tips were the one who made you want to come back. We also met great people from other cities from Ontario as well as Texas and they also made it a memorable holiday. We will definately put this hotel on our return list.  
<Date>Oct 27, 2007

<Author>travellerkittie333
<Content>Had a great time My boyfriend and I stayed here for 7 nights last week (15 Oct 07 - 23 Oct 07). We read loads of reviews before going and found a great cheap deal with DirectHolidays.co.uk. We were unsure on what weather to expect but we had glorious weather all week with only one day of clouds. It was hot all week (day and night) but the rooms had air con so it was lovely. It probably rained every day but didn't cause a problem and was only ever a quick shower.I have mixed opinions on what we found compared to some of the other reviews I've read. We weren't mad keen on the 'animacion' team. The americans and spanish seemed to like them but they took over the pool at the same time of day everyday playing games that I never ever understood.....I tried to work out what was going on but it was mostly in spanish so had trouble. People seemed to like them though! The americans and spanish also seemed to enjoy the cheesy music (eg abba, ymca, grease).....sorry bit of an over-generalisation there....just our observations! At night the animation team took over the lobby bar a couple of times with another weird show which we didn't get....they do it so with rather loud speakers so did take over quite a lot.Which brings me on to the nightlife......or lack of to be honest. The resort does lack a little after dinner time. There are a choice of 2 bars (lobby or Mare Nostrum on the beach) which are both nice but quiet (if the animation team aren't there). We struggled a little to entertain ourselves in the dark.....we did go next door to the Caribe a few times and they had a beach party one night but other than that seemed quiet too. We're not party animals so didn't want a rave or anything but it was lacking a little something on this front.....On the food topic......a mixed bag. We tried all restaurants on the resort. El Rio (tex mex and steak house) - food was ok, quite nice, nothing to write home about. Fondue (good fun although service a little slow both times we went there....best place to eat on the resort in our opinion). Mare Nostrum......gave me a bad stomach for just over a day.....I blame the seafood crepe - can't be sure though I suppose. The seafood was dissapointing to be honest and we didn't go there again. El Bacio (italian)....not great food and didn't go there again. El Sombero in next doors resort was good and the food was nice there - a close second favourite.During the day the buffets were good. Breakfast was in the Caribe every day and was good. Lots of fresh fruit and fruit juices (including a favourite to all the women....banana milkshake.....they couldn't refill the jug quick enough!). There's a guy on the egg counter cooking omeletes and eggs - really great too. There was a pancake counter with waffles and stuff for the americans no doubt ;). Too sweet for us brits in the morning I think. There was all sorts to eat - I'm sure everyone would be happy with something.The all-inclusive part was great. Free stuff - woohoo! it was a great feeling. Beer anytime you like and refills you don't even have to ask for....great. I'm sure some people took advantage but we didn't ask for more than we really wanted. One tip - learn some cocktail names as we didn't know any and expected the barmen to make you something exciting if you asked! If you ask for a cocktail with rum in it.....you'll most likely get a shot (albeit a large one) of rum and ice. All drinks come in a plastic cup which was fine by us. Presidente beer was great too. Cocktails that we learnt about: Meringue (has a banana liquiore and orange juice and rum I think - one for the girls :) ), coco loco (a white milky one with chocolate sauce).Our room was in 4000 and faced the pool. It was ok but did smell progressively worse as the week went on. It was generally damp and musty which we put down to the fact that the room is in a humid island on the carribean! All the same, I found it more and more unpleasant (but my boyfriend was less bothered). They did clean the room everyday and the aircon worked well. No other complaints really. The second day we left a note in an attempt at spanish for more water and Presidente beer (rather than the standard stuff which isn't as nice). We got it but just the standard beer and water from then on. We left a nice tip when we left as they did a great job.On leaving our flight was delayed by 16 hours (MyTravel......). The hotel were wonderful and let us keep our room without question. The even brought us a plate of food on our last night. We didn't pay an extra penny and had all-inclusive all day. Can't thank them enough for that.I found the resort to be really nice all in all. Very clean always, the staff were so polite and friendly and cheerful always - lovely!! There could have been more to do in the evenings and the food wasn't great to be honest but the pool and beach were great. We didn't go on any of the excursions and we didn't find the water sports place until the last day so didn't do that either - maybe we should have.I'd recommend this hotel to anyone with the caveat that I have returned home feeling as though I've been on a butlins holiday camp and that I really didn't see the true domincan republic at all......perhaps our fault for not doing the excursions but a lot of them were a long way away and we didn't fancy spending our time sat on a coach. I recommend the people and weather to everyone though!!!  
<Date>Oct 24, 2007

<Author>BostonEllie
<Content>wonderful just returned from a long weekend at the punta cana princess.what can i say but it was wonderful. The resort was beautiful. The people who work there from the front desk employees to the gardeners, and everyone in between were some of the nicest people i have met. The hotel itself is not a brand new resort. It does show a little wear and tare. It is kept very very clean. Hotel staff are always out and about cleaning and making you feel so very welcome. The beach is beautiful, white powder sand and no sea weed or trash. The water is that carribean blue that just takes your breath away. The pool was great. It was clean, warm and had a swim up bar. The food at the buffet was good not great. Had plenty of choices for everyone. Never felt any stomach upset. We ate at the Italian, chinese and La Cave specialty restaurants. All were delicious. WE did the vip package, so we got the massage, cigars and rum. Was it worth the extra charge. Yes.. the view from our room (4000 block) was to die for. What can i say.. reasonably priced, wonderful people (who speak English) and no children, what could be better?  
<Date>Oct 21, 2007

<Author>Nelson90
<Content>Fab Time I have decided to write this review as I have religiously checked trip advisor for the past 6 months and have found all the reviews for the punta cana princess very helpful, so on my return I thought I would try and help some fellow potential travellers. One word of advice-if you are thinking about going to the PCP... do it! My boyfriend and I travelled to the PCP at the end of September for 2 weeks, we went to relax and enjoy the sunshine-this holiday met and exceeded all our expectations. I have travelled to the DR 3 times previously, I have visited Sousa, Cabarette and most recentley Playa Dorado-out of all these places I would definatly rate punta cana as being my favourite destination-it is just as you imagine the Caribbean to be- white sand and clear blue sea. The PCP is fab-it has beautiful grounds that are kept immaculate and throughout it has speakers which play quiet chill out music (not quite the ear deafening sounds some other reports have suggeseted!?!). The pool is large and kept very clean, there was always plenty of chairs and shade around the pool-the swim up bar is great and has a very friendly bar man (Nelson). The beach is gorgeous. it is kept very clean-there was plenty of chairs here too. Whilst on the beach or by the pool we were never really bothered by sellers or staff-the first few days we got approached a few times but once we made it clear we weren't interested in the activities we were left pretty much alone. It seemed to us the staff were very good at spotting who was up for their games and who was more interested in chilling!We were allocated a room in the 4000 building overlooking the pool-the room was lovely, nice and large with 2 large beds and a sofa a nice big TV and clean bathroom. The room was kept very clean by housekkeping and the mini fridge stocked every day, we did leave the maid a tip every other day but I do not think this made a differnce-on the whole the hotel was of a good clean standard. There was some previous comments about the water temp. and pressure, we had no issues with either, but I do think some people should remember they are in the DR in a reasonably priced resort so somethings you kind of have to expect not be the same standard as a 5 star resort in the States. There was also a safe in the room to use (free of charge).The lobby area was lovely and had the best bar man (Emilo) who made some lovely cocktails. The best thing about this resort for me was the food. I have not got a strong stomach, I usually avoid meat on holiday and normally have atleast a day or two of being unwell. However I was absolutely fine at the PCP! We ate in the buffett for breakfast (and yes there WAS cereal every day-see below?!?) there was tons of fresh amazing tasting fruit and lots of hot selections inc, pancakes, waffles, eggs cooked to order etc. For lunch we usually ate at the beach buffett, again no complaints here, yes it was similar food everyday but to be honest its usually too hot to eat too much anyhow in the middle of the day, we did go up to the main buffett a few times and this was nicer (but further to walk from the beach :-) ). Dinner time we varied between the buffett and a'la carte restaurants. the buffett was a hit every time, always loads of different stuff and always hot food. We ate at the Tex Mex which we had no complaints about, Mare Nostrudam (seafood) which again was lovely and the fondue-which was by far our favourite, mainly for the novelty factor-you have to try it for the chocolate fondue alone! We did not upgrade to VIP and I still struggle to see the real benefits, we already had a lovely room, once you have one rum who knows if its premium or local brand and who wants to spend their holiday surfing the net!! But it is a personal choice so I guess its good to have the option but you def, dont have too. One last note about the PCP-the staff. They were some of the nicest, most helpfull and happy people I have met. Yes it helps if you make an effort and try and speak a little Spanish (even if its just Ola!) and yes it helps if you smile back (you'd be amazed at the amount of miserable people we saw on holiday!!!) but I can not fault them, they all (especiially Emilo) helped make our holiday. A couple of other things-do the Jeep Safari (it will open your eyes to the real DR), try the swimming with sharks trip (not as scary as it sounds they are nurse sharks so no teeth), try out the spa ( we had massages and they were lovely) and go to the disco next door if you want to get a bit lively for a night, we went on a Friday and it was packed and really buzzing.So to sum it all up, go to the PCP if you want to chill out enjoy the sunshine (although we did have some rain!), let your hair down and drink rum!  
<Date>Oct 16, 2007

<Author>buddy127
<Content>Our 20th Wedding Anniversary Trip Toms River, New Jersey We arrived at the Punta Cana Princess All Suites Resort  Spa the day of our 20th Wedding Anniversary and it was beautiful from the moment we stepped foot in the lobby. We were greeted with a tropical drink and our check-in went very smoothly. Then we went to our room and were greeted with a beautiful room with lots of fresh flowers in it. We opted for the buffet restaurant the first night and was kind of disappointed. This was the only complaint we have with our entire stay at the hotelThe next night we went to the Caribe Princess and ate at Mama Mia's and it was delicious with very good food and drinks along with dessert.The third night we ate at the Rio Grande Tex Mex Restaurant and the ambiance was nice along with the food and everything to go along with it. The last night we ate at Mare Nostrum and had lobster. It was fantastic and the view was beautiful. This restaurant is right on the beach with a view of the ocean.For breakfast and lunch we also ate at Mare Nostrum for the buffets and they were great. No complaints at all.The beach was so clean and the water very warm and clean. The beach was cleaned daily.We enjoyed the nightly entertainment. They put on a different show every night and was very entertaining.The week we spent at the Punta Cana Princess is one to remember always and will visit again sometime in the future. Thanks for making it so special.

<Author>EileenLancashire
<Content>Absolutely fantastic My husband and I stayed at the Punta Cana Princess from the 18th Sept - 2nd Oct. From the moment we arrived we were made very welcome. Our room was spacious and clean with lovely furnishings. My husband is very fussy about his food and I can honestly say he had no complaints, there was so much choice - even the fussiest person could not fail to find something they liked. Presentation of the food was excellent. Choice of buffet restaurants and a la carte was very good. The pool and was very clean and plenty of sunbeds around it. The beach was kept clean - each day the staff cleared the seaweed!!!All the staff were extremely helpful, courteous and very caring, genuinely concerend that you were enjoying your stay. Always smiling and it was a pleasure to be around them. The entertainment team were great and worked hard, if you didnt want to participate then they did not pressure you. With the limited resources available (small stage on beach) the team put on enjoyable and entertaining shows in the evening. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our holiday and will be back.

<Author>ACP63
<Content>Disappointing We stayed at the Punta Cana Princess (PCP) from the 17th - 24th September.Good points: 1) Check in was smooth and speedy and the staff friendly and polite (the welcome cocktail and cold towel were nice touches)2) Rooms are a good size (we had twin queen beds) and the bathrooms, while small, are well appointed (the double sinks are great when you're sharing with a friend)3) The resort is nicely laid out with everything within easy walking distance and low-rise buildings. All rooms are within 50 yards of the beach, pool and lobby.4) The location is gorgeous - the beach really is that white and the sea really is that blue :)Not so good points:1) The noise! Firstly, the resort has a sound system wired up throughout the grounds and gardens. From 7am till 11pm, music is piped EVERYWHERE at quite a considerable volume. It's like being trapped in a lift with muzak playing ALL day. This non-stop background noise is supplemented by music playing at the pool bar, in the lobby and in all the restaurants. By the way - every location plays a different CD...Secondly, the entertainment staff offers activities during the day (aqua-aerobics for example) on the beach or by the pool. When these activities are running, they set-up a sound system which would make the Rolling Stones envious - the volume is quite something! Unfortunately, the other sound systems playing around the resort are not switched off during these activities - so it all becomes quite a cacophony. Then, just to put the cherry on the cake, every night at 10pm the entertainments staff put on an hour-long show, either in the lobby, by the pool or on the beach. Out come the Rolling Stones speakers again...2) The entertainment. The PCP positions itself as a 5* property. This seems to me to be at odds with their entertainment policy, which is more like Butlins. I don't want to be harassed at the pool by people wearing blue and yellow uniforms trying to get me to participate in water polo, pilates or anything else. If I'd wanted an activity based holiday, I'd have booked one :) Equally, when enjoying a drink at the bar after dinner, I don't want those same people interrupting my conversation and shrieking at me show time - by the pool - 5 minutes!!Overall I'd class the PCP, at best, as a 4* property and wouldn't return.  
<Date>Sep 30, 2007

<Author>cocohead
<Content>Wonderful...AGAIN.. We stayed at the punta cana for 2 weeks again this year. Still a wonderful place. After contacting the hotel direct, i asked if we could have the same room as last year, we got next door !! thats not bad is it. we stayed in block 5000. this year it was a little on the noisy side, there was a beach party going on from around 10pm till midnight over at the mare nostrum restaurant that wasnt active last year, its not to noisy, but they have also built another hotel next to the punta that has discos till around 1am. so if your a light sleeper, try to get rooms in blocks 2000 or 3000. again the staff were fab, nothing was to little or to much for them. i firmly believe in the chuck a buck approach. if they do something out of their way for you, a dollar tip will make your stay special. Food was again excellent, ricardos coco locos are out of this world, and a big hand for the pool guy who works is socks of to keep the place tidy. Also a special thanks go,es to the lady doctor on site who looked after my g/f when she got an ear infection. Would i go there again ?? prehaps not for a 3rd time. maybe we would move down to the bavaro princess if we went back, just for that extra bit of luxury. But if its your first time on that coast,and like things not TOO quite, you,ll love it.steve and sarahwales

<Author>Waterbaby57
<Content>Loved it! Reading some of the other reviews I'm not sure they are talking about the correct Princess resort. This one is an adults-only so there was no issue with children. The pool was clean, uncrowded and refreshing. I am a swim lover and used the pool everyday at all hours (also swam in the ocean everyday!) One of the ladies we met did have red spots on her legs. She figured it was from sand fleas or something - her husband didn't have any. No one suggested bed bugs. Found the staff very friendly - we made it a point to say hello, get to know their names and got a big hello whenever we entered the dining area. Tried to use a little Spanish even if it was only Si! Grounds and beach were spectacular. Room was always clean. Sometimes had to be careful about food choices in a la carte restaurants. Beef is not going to be like what we have in Canada. Buffet had good selection. Very relaxing week - had many activities if you wanted to participate. But didn't make you feel you had to do things. We are considering going back in 2008!

<Author>andb2000
<Content>Wonderful Vacation My wife and I went to the Punta Cana Princess Resort about a month ago for our 2 year anniversary. After we departed the airport we were both pretty shocked about how bad the country looked and felt. This is obvoiusly a third world country, but there is a ton of construction showing that the country is getting better.The hotel itself was very nice. The one problem we had is when we got to our room we noticed the patio door wouldn't lock all the way. We had to wait about 2 hours for someone to come fix it, but they did fix the door. The room and bathroom was bigger than we expected and everything was very clean. We stayed in the 5000 block of the hotel. The room did smell when we first got there, but my wife sprayed some body spray and within a few hours it didn't smell anymore. The grounds were kept up very nicely from the lobby to the beach. We stayed during hurricane Dean and after the hurricane everything was pretty dirty, but within 24hours they had just about everything looking very clean again. The food was ok. My wife really liked the mama mia italian place and I really liked the mexican restaurant at the sister resort. Everyone highly recommended the fondue place, but we were unable to get reservasions for this, which we were dissapointed with. The buffet was pretty good. We made sure to take pepto tablets after every dinner and this helped settle our stomach from the different kinds of food we weren't used to. Both of our stomachs were pretty upset the last two days, but I'm not sure if this was from the alcohol or the food. The drinks were very good. We tipped the bartenders a dollar every other drink. We were one of the few people tipping, which I found very suprising. Because we were tipping though, we were always the first to get refills and we normally didn't even have to ask! I would highly recommend tipping a few dollars ever now again for much better service. We also tipped the maid the first morning we were there and asked for extra beer and she left a 6 pack in the mini fridge :)Don't forget to try the mamajuana! It is just a shot of rum that has been soaked in some kind of bark for a few a days. Be sure to ask the bartenders what it is to enjoy a great resonse.We stayed for 6 nights, but because hurricane Dean ruined one day we felt that it was to short. I would highly recommend this hotel. I hope that we can someday go back, but next time we will be won't be going during hurricane season and hopefully staying longer.  
<Date>Sep 18, 2007

<Author>Kris827
<Content>50/50 rating for Punta Cana I spent 4 days in Punta Cana and the resort is really a pretty place, but overall I would rate it 50/50. The people there are nice, but don't speak great english at all. The games that were played, were played in Spanish which unless they were doing little stunts that didn't require any speaking, then you didn't understand what was going on. I really thought the food would be better than it was. The best place that I ate at was the Italian resturant and I had chicken and mashed potatoes. Other than that place, the food was disappointing and I am not a picky eater at all. The beach was beautiful, the bar and pool were really nice. The massage/spa was great. I had a great time b/c of the people I was with. I am undecided if I would go back there again.

<Author>bev9443
<Content>This resort is overrated! Having been to Punta Cana numerous times, we've never been so offended and disappointed after leaving a resort. The problems were numerous and in retrospect, we should have taken heed to the reviews posted by previous guests. To name a few issues: 1. Upon arrival, the key to the room did not work.and no one seemed to care. After waiting for approximately 2 hours, we walked back to the reception desk and found that our problem was never addressed.2. We requested a honeymoon package, which we never received. Our initial king-sized bed was two single beds joined together. The room was filthy, bathroom contained mold/mildew, towels were ragged/dingy, walls were dirty and furniture old and unkept. 3. The advertised mini bar contained beer, soda and water...there was no hard liquor as advertised. 4. The staff was dismissive/impolite/unattentive. 5. The larger of the two pools was filthy with leaves, straws, and had an odor of feces. It was gross! The bartender at the swim up bar seemed bothered when a guests requested service, to which they were entitled. Alcohol was extremely limited and totally off-brand (cheap liquor). It was NOT top-shelf as advertised! 6. We did not have A/C for three days and it was extremely hot and unbearable.7. The bathroom faucet was broken, but in fairness, fixed the very next day.8. On our last day, a water main broke and we were essentially told to either wait or do without. Luckily, we improvised and showered with bottled water, in order for us to catch our flight on time.9. We observed one staff member scamming a European tourist by selling him a bottle of wine, which he was entitled to as part of his inclusive package. My husband understands Spanish and became aware of the scam.10. Did we mention that the waitresses lacked manners?11. THE BEACH WAS BEAUTIFUL AND THE LANDSCAPING WAS FABULOUS! We figured they cannot mess up the natural beach. 12. The staff selling VIP membership to Princess hotels was aware that the resort was crappy and used that as his selling pitch. For example, we were approached by one staff who stated, I know this resort has alot of problems, but if you purchase the VIP membership, those problems will be addressed effectively. Is this a set-up for failure? The APPLE representative even expressed that this resort was by no means a 5-Star resort, but that was the rating for it...Ghee, Thanks...13. The animals around the resort compensated for the resort's shortcomings and they (animals) seemed friendlier than the staff. Go figure!14. The scenery is beautiful, especially the landscape (superb)...our pictures were very lovely, but the negative experience is not worth the photos.Not to dwell on the worse vacation we've experienced, but I would not take my pet to that resort. Really, it is not child/family/people friendly! On one day, the poolside entertain required that a participant/tourist touch an entertainer's gential, as if turning off a faucet. It was funny to us, but if our kids were there, it was have been totally unacceptable and inappropriate. Some of other entertainment were great, but that was a bit too lewd.There are so many beautiful resorts in the Dominican Republic...this is not one of them, especially as a family vacation.  
<Date>Aug 19, 2007

<Author>zoola
<Content>Hit and Miss Well unfortunately there was a lot more misses then hits, but anyway here it goes.Hit- Awesome landscaping and cleanliness of resort overallMiss- We were put in a room that had joining doors with the one beside it, you could hear every single thing in the other room, even a drawer closing sounded like it was right in your room. Not to mention the sound of a couple of hyper ladies. You can blame them though, they were on vacation just having fun but the resort should not put people in these rooms unless people traveling together request them.Hit- We could seen the ocean from our balcony, literally steps to the beach and pool, this type of room placement would set you back a lot of money at other resorts.Miss- VIP seemed like a big hassle to the workers, you were made to feel as though you were putting them out by asking for bottled beer or premium liquor. Room service was a joke, first time we used it, and it actually never even came! Were pretty easy to please and don complain much so we just went to bed and let it be. Tried it again a couple days later and it took about an hour and a half and they only brought the calazone and forgot the two cokes and the pizza, he was very apologetic but it took another thirty minutes to get the rest. We tipped every one from the bartenders to the maid to the gardeners, about $150 in total and another $100 in gifts for the maid like kids baseball gloves and makeup and such. some were seemed grateful others not so much, but I tip to get something extra or because I recieved good service not to feel like a hero for tossing around a few ones.Hit- Massages with the VIP were great, paid extra to get the 45 minutes, very happy with themMiss- Hard to get the maid to even leave a couple of Presidentes in the mini fridge, she did a couple of times but man we had to work for it., towel were ratty, shampoo bottles and such looked like they had been used several times over.Hit- Spacious rooms, beautiful beach not to hard to find a chair or bed at the beach or the pool, nice and peaceful resort, never felt crowded at all..Miss- Sometimes we had to wait 10-15 minutes just to get some one to come over and ask us if we would like a drink, while other times you would have someone greet you almost immediately and then come back three or four time to see if everything was okay, it was like every day you were in a different place with two totally different levels of service.Hit-Emilio, Lobby Bar this guy would make a killing in tips if he bartended in North America.Miss- This is the big one here. The food is dangerous to eat. That right dangerous, lots of it was tasty like La Cava and some of the other a la cartes, and even the buffet had some very good food like the omelet station and the pasta station. Now some of the food was crap as well and I am by no means picky ( I could live on pizza and burgers and such for a week and be quite happy) but you should never have obvious leftover hotdogs covered with a yellow sauce (hollandaise maybe) on your breakfast buffet.. Anyhow back to the dangerous part. I was sick for about one and a half days and then was better ,but not a hundred percent for a day and then I got sick again for another two days. When I say sick I mean nasty stomach pains, nausea, and lay in bed this really sucks sick. Luckily I brought all medical marvels like Imodium , pepto etc though I not sure if they even worked but you never know maybe it would have been twice as bad if I didn take them. I know not everyone will get sick but when it happens to you its brutal. I work in a restaurant so I know how to be careful but It didn seem to help me at all. But in between my sick days I saw what I was up against when I had a burger from the beach grill and took a bite into it and it was raw inside, I went back up to get another and asked him to cook it longer and he did but then just after grabbing a bunch of raw chicken to put on the grill with his tongs and spatula he grabbed my burger for me to put on my plate and the raw chicken juice was dripping all over my burger and plate if this is what goes on right in front of you, trust me what going on in the back is ten times worse. Also at the Tropical next door I saw the bartender at the lobby bar grab a dirty glass rinse it under the tap for two seconds and serve up a new drink in it, not the end of the world but still who wants to drink from that and like I said if their doing this pretty much out in the open you know its not any better in the back. Just a note I am by no means a picky person but when you get sick you start to think of all the negative things that happened and you don't tend to overlook them as much as you would had you not been sick. But really its 2007 and if you can build a rsort that is as nice as this why can't you have food that won't make people sick.So in conclusion it doesn matter if its one of the most beautiful places on earth ( and the Punta Cana Princess is) if you can enjoy any of it because if your sick it just not worth it. Remember as well that once you get sick like that even when you get better you can help but to be very scarred of eating anymore of the food that made you sick so you end up eating bread and french fries for the rest of your trip because you don want to miss out on what little time there is left on your vacation. If you like to gamble with your vacation go here, chances are you won get sick (my wife didn) but if you do youl be laying in bed pissed off that you spent your only week of vacation and a few thousand dollars to feel like crap and watch VH-1.  
<Date>Aug 17, 2007

<Author>DebbieMc3
<Content>Very relaxing and beautiful We've recently returned from a 7 night stay at The Punta Cana Princess (PCP). There were 3 couples ages from late 30's to late 50's in my group. Five out of six of us had stayed at other all inclusives so we had something to compare the PCP to. We all had the VIP package so after a quick check in, we went right to the VIP desk to pick up our information. I highly recommend the VIP package. It was well worth it.We went to our rooms and had our luggage about 5 minutes later. The rooms were a nice size and perfectly clean.  The grounds were amazing. They were well taken care of and spotless. The pool was the perfect size for a small resort and also spotless. The pool bar was a fun and friendly atmosphere. The beach was beautiful. The waves were big enough to have fun in yet small enough to just float around. The water was a pretty blue. Having the VIP package allowed us to use the beach beds and gave us bar service on the beach. That in itself was worth getting the VIP package. We also did the 1 hour boat ride that was included in the VIP. It was a lot of fun. The mini spa was perfect for our complimentary 20 minute massage (vip package). Having a massage while hearing the waves break behind you was so relaxing. The entertainment staff kept people having a good time with volleyball, aerobics, softball... but I was just there to relax so I chose not to participate in the daily activities. The nightly entertainment was silly but again, I wasn't there to be entertained. We enjoyed the music and the cocktails. We met a lot of nice people and had lots of fun with the bartenders and cocktail staff. By 12:00 am things got pretty quiet but you could always hang at the beautiful beach bar 24 hours per day. The food... Here's where my review will get more negative. As a self proclaimed foodie, I thought the buffet food was mediocre at best. There was always something that I liked but it was just ok. The a la carte restaurants were better (except the Asian place, it was awful).La Cava (also included with VIP) was amazing. The atmosphere was great and the food was even better. The Italian and the fondue restaurants were also good. The Dominican beach party was very nice. Don't forget, men must wear long pants to the al a carte restaurants. We saw a lot of people get turned away in shorts. If you are going on vacation for gourmet food, this may not be the place for you. I would highly recommend The Punta Cana Princess for anyone that wants a quiet and relaxing vacation. We had a great time and can't wait to go back again.Debbie from NJ  
<Date>Aug 15, 2007

<Author>DeniseO
<Content>Princess at Heart!!!       Hotel grounds

<Rating>5	5	5	5	5	5	5	-1

<Author>zatchmo
<Content>A pleasant surprise I just got back from a week at the Punta Cana Princess, and I had a great time. We booked through Bookit.com, which had the cheapest price we could find, even though there was a airfare increase in the last step of booking. I concur with some other reviews, Americans were definitely the minority here, and English the 2nd language, spoken by the staff when needed. We were VIP, which is worth it if you can get it for a good price. It would not be worth it for the $25 a day the resort charges. We paid $50 for the whole week when we booked. You get top shelf liquor and beer (through sometimes a hassle) 2 free hrs of internet, 20 minutes massage each, mini bar in the room, turn down service, a bottle of rum, 3 cigars, 1 hr each of watersports, and other things.The breakdown:Arrival:When you arrive to the Punta Cana airport, you immediately get your picture taken with some local women. Then you stand in lines to buy your $10 Tourist Card, which seems like a huge rip off. Immediately after customs, you hand in your card.After you claim your luggage, there will be a lot of guys yelling out the names of various travel companies in an effort to carry your bags. DO NOT LET THEM. They will only carry your back out a door to the booth you are looking for, only about 20ft. And then of course, you have to tip them. Luckily we had this experience before, so we didn't fall for it this time.The resort is only about 20-25 mins from the airport, so not so bad.Check-In/Room:Yes, it takes longer than it should. I don't know why...we were the only ones checking but it still took about 15 minutes. But no big deal, a fresh cool towel and a drink helped. When we got to our room, we saw that we had 2 double beds. We called back to the front desk and asked for a king bed. Julio was very nice and told us that they are booked up for that day, but tomorrow they will give us a new room with a king bed and a better view. Ok, great. My girlfriend was happy because she thought our room smelled. Both rooms did have a musty smell, but you have to remember that you are at the beach with high humidity.The next day we were moved to our new room around 2:30. It was in the 5000 building, which is the closest to the beach and the pool, great location. If you think you might complain about the noise from the pool, then don't stay in the 5000 building. They often do dance lessons and aerobics at the pool, so the music might wake you up if you like to sleep past 10am.If you are VIP, you get a mini bar with 2 bottles of water, coke, sprite, and Soberana beer. USe it up, as they will refill it each day. The Soberana beer might be one of the worst beers I've ever tasted, but what can you do? Well, I heard all you have to do is call the front desk and request Presidente instead, but we never did.The grounds:Very well kept and pleasing to the eye. I really like the color scheme and layout. It's a bit of a walk from the beach to the lobby though.Pool:Very nice and big, with a swim up pool bar. Very often the chairs and beds at the pool are taken all day. You can usually get a spot if you hang out for a bit and keep your eye open, but there were times when everything was taken. If you see a chair with a towel that has been un attended for a while, just take it.Beach:Well kept and very nice. There was a lot of washed up ocean plants because we just missed a Tropical Wave off shore, but they cleaned it up a few days later. There is a VIP section of beds on the beach, which is real nice. There was always a bed available, if not 5 or 6. And someone will walk around and take drink orders. ***NOTE ON THE BEDS*** The beds have a retractable cloth roof to help keep you out of the sun, but THEY DO NOT BLOCK THE SUN COMPLETELY!! I made the mistake of laying on the bed for 2 hours mid-day, and got very burnt. Always wear your sunscreen!Food:I didn't have any problems, and I eat and drank everything in front of me. But I am always like that. There were people that said they had some stomach problems, but I've come to realize that they were people that don't have a very adventuress appetite. If you don't normally eat different foods, don't try now. Over all, the buffet was good, and there is something for everyone. If you can't find anything, you can always (at lunch and dinner) get pasta prepared with several choices of toppings and sauces.We only ate at one of the restaurants, the Dominican restaurant called Pilon. This was a really great meal and I am glad I went. The problem is you are expected to wear pants at all the restaurants except the buffets. I was so uncomfortable and hot the whole night that we canceled our reservations for the rest of the week. Also, I just didn't want to have to follow a schedule on my vacation. Also, the sister resorts are crazy! They are very nice looking, but there is way to many people (and kids) at the other resorts.Bars:Yes, there always seems to be a problem with the VIP and getting top shelf liquor, but I wasn't so worried about it. Most of the good liquor is at the lobby bar, where you would hang out at night. They do have it, you just have to request it, and usually add a tip. There is always somewhere to get a drink 24hrs. Usually the beach bar is open all night, and you can get food there too.Staff:For the most part they were very friendly. You will almost never be spoken to in English unless they know you don't speak Spanish. Some staff, including bar tenders don't speak much English at all, but here is your Spanish lesson: Dos Coco Locos mas por favor mmmmm.....coco locos...I wish I had one right now! The first night I did have a run in with one of the chefs that knew I didn't speak much Spanish, and I think he was taking a few shot at me to his buddy who was laughing. Oh well, I've seen many Americans do that to foreigners in our country too.Over all, a great time, and I would definitely go back. If you need pampered and every need catered to, this report is not for you. If you think Americans are better than everyone else, stay home. If you want excellent food, this resort is not for you. If you are an easy going person looking for an inexpensive, relaxing break from the norm, I would definitely recommend the Punta Cana Princess.Oh, and you are not allowed to take Mamajuana (the drink) out of the country, as it had leaves and branches. So, either pack it in your suitcase and lie to the USDA, or don't buy any.  
<Date>Aug 11, 2007

49	0(staff):3	2(night):1	8(day):1	11(bed):1	12(friendly):1	27(bar):1	29(minute):1	31(front):2	32(check):1	36(desk):2	37(review):1	59(definitely):1	67(call):2	71(include):1	72(resort):1	75(week):1	96(worth):1	114(hot):1	127(speak):2	132(hear):1	136(charge):1	148(request):2	152(english):2	156(reservation):1	194(tip):1	243(king):1	288(rest):1	351(add):1	353(instead):1	369(spanish):1	384(wish):1	399(usually):1	698(language):1	856(uncomfortable):1	1065(cancel):1	1172(americans):1	1326(2nd):1	1343(lesson):1	1521(favor):1	2063(presidente):1	2208(cocoa):2	2623(tender):1	3095(loco):2	3862(minority):1	5192(por):1	5721(mas):1	5876(concur):1	7149(dos):1	11300(mmmmm):1	
69	2(night):2	4(nice):1	9(service):1	10(restaurant):3	16(food):3	21(excellent):1	22(pool):2	27(bar):6	29(minute):1	30(beach):1	31(front):1	38(lot):1	46(free):1	47(eat):2	55(lobby):1	57(water):1	62(expect):1	63(drink):4	67(call):1	68(travel):1	72(resort):1	77(buffet):2	92(help):1	97(internet):1	118(top):2	125(towel):1	140(deal):1	197(fresh):1	238(bottle):2	249(luggage):1	250(yes):1	261(swim):1	278(cool):1	290(bag):1	295(name):1	337(except):1	359(allow):1	368(guy):1	399(usually):1	434(wear):1	443(beer):2	448(mini):2	478(hang):1	514(dominican):1	530(country):1	560(sometimes):1	730(massage):1	760(company):1	823(various):1	824(carry):1	885(worried):1	1017(effort):1	1077(claim):1	1084(rum):1	1193(hassle):1	1390(liquor):3	1464(hr):2	1484(shelf):2	1555(vip):2	1593(leaf):1	1672(coke):1	1834(cigar):1	1939(yell):1	2103(pant):1	3244(watersports):1	3950(mamajuana):1	4170(24hrs):1	4248(sprite):1	5316(branch):1

<Author>Yackswife
<Content>Beautiful but somewhat disappointing I booked our reservations through AAvacations for me, my husband, my sister-in-law and brother-in-law for July 8-14, 2007. We chose the PCP because it was all adults and a smaller resort and from all the positive reviews I read on TripAdvisor. The plane from JFK in NY left on time and was a pleasant flight. We arrived at the Punta Cana, were greeted by lovely ladies and island music and had a bit of a wait on line for Prieto Tours for our transportation to the PCP. The other lines for tour companies were much shorter. When we were finally assigned a bus, there was no room for the four of us, so we were taken off and put on another bus, hoping that our luggage was also being moved, and it was. We had to wait until this bus was full before it finally left. The bus ride was close to an hour and made numerous stops at other resorts to drop off people. The PCP was the last stop. The ride was a bumpy one, but it's good to see that they're working hard to improve the roads. The transfers were part of our package, but if you have a choice I would suggest taking a cab. Going directly to the resort would have been a lot quicker. Checking in was quick. We were given a warm fruit drink, no cool towel as some have written. We booked the VIP, but other than the great dinner at La Cava, it probably wasn't worth it. We requested rooms in the 5000 building, but were told there were none available. We were given room 4114 and my sister-in-law 4l08 on the second floor. I requested a king size bed and that too was refused. We were given a map of the resort and other information and told to go to our rooms and our luggage would be brought by shortly, which it was. The room was very spacious, had a sitting area and a balcony overlooking the pool and the air conditioner worked fine. The bathroom was a nice size with double sink and vanity. The towels, as many have written, were worn, thin and have lost their whiteness. We had beach towels in the closet which also were in bad shape. These were never replaced, which I thought was part of the VIP package and we always had to go to the hut to replace them with dry ones. The refrigerator had water, soda and beer, there was the small bottle of rum, which was part of the VIP and three complimentary cigars. There were also robes in the closet for us to use while there.As the days went on, we did have to go to the front desk to report some problems. The frame around our mirror in the bathroom came off and we were afraid the very large mirror would be next. The toilet kept running at one time and wouldn't stop and there was some water accumulated on the floor and we couldn't figure out where that came from.I would say that our main problem was trying to communicate. I know it would be hard to learn the many languages of the guests that stay there, but I don't know if they try. They gave us one very small bar of soap. When I saw the maid in the hall I asked her for some more and she didn't know what I was talking about. After a lot of had gestures and finally another maid who figured it out, our maid finally got it, although there was no soap on her cart and she had to go upstairs somewhere to get some. Same thing when we needed another box of tissues. A couple of days later, our used towels were taken away, but not replaced. This time we called the desk. We did generously tip the maid after she brought us the soap, but I wouldn't say it made much of a difference. One other disturbing thing that occurred was that we never got phone messages. One of our daughters and a friend were staying at another resort that week. When we tried to contact her to make sure they arrived safely we were told that she wasn't registered. Since our cell phones didn't work there, it took calls to NY to our other daughter to track her down and we learned that she was registered at that resort and she had called and left a message at the PCP for us. We never got that message or another that my daughter in NY left for us. When we checked with the desk they said there were no messages. This bothered us because if there was an emergency we would not have known. Also phone cards that we brought with us were useless there and we had to charge our calls to NY on a credit card - beware the average 5 minute call cost about $42 and then you were charged $2 by the resort.I must say the resort is beautiful and the gorunds are well maintained. The pool was great, never crowded, there were lounge chairs all over but covered with towels from early in the morning. It appears that people put the towels down to reserve them and then go off to the beach or on an excursion. Some were never occupied by people. Since we spent most of our time at the pool we wanted to make sure we had a spot so my brother-in-law did what everyone else did. Made sure he got down there early and put towels on 4 lounges. The swim-up bar is always fun, although they usually had only one bartender who cared for the people in the pool and on the upper level for those who just walked up to it. We went down to the beach a couple of times and the beach is beautiful. The sand is white and soft and they do their best to keep the seaweed away. As for the food, it is pretty average. There is a variety at the buffet so you will find something. We ate breakfast and lunch there and two of our dinners. The other nights we went to El Sombrero (Mexican), Shanghay (Chinese), Mare Nostrum (Seafood) and La Cava, also seafood, which was included in our VIP package. La Cava was our favorite, but I must say it's very dark and very chilly. They have to keep it that way because the room has bottles of wine everywhere. The grilled lobster I had was outstanding. My in-laws ordered steak at the El Sombrero and had to send it back. It was so tough they couldn't cut it. We weren't too impressed with the Chinese restaurant either but being from New York it's very hard to find Chinese food anywhere else that compares. As for nightly entertainment, there is very little at the PCP. The animation team does try, but the space in the lobby where they perform is limited, with very little seating. Isabel the waitress is very sweet and we had fun speaking with her. I do believe that We never went to the other resorts for entertainment because it didn't start until 9:45 p.m. After having dinner and walking around in the heat and humidity, by that time all you wanted to do was go somewhere cool. We did go to the casino a few times which was fun but small. We went to Manatee Park where we met up with my daughter and she and her friend and my husband swam with the dolphins. Well, it's not acutally swimming. You get into a pool with other people, the dolphins come up to you and at one point a worker directs you to hold onto the dolphin's fins and it pulls you to the side of the pool. Sorry this is so long, but when I was looking for a resort and spent many hours reading reviews (mostly positive), I decided that I should share my thoughts and our experiences at the PCP. I hope my review was helpful. It's not my intent to scare anyone away from staying there. It is a beautiful resort and the fact that it's small and adults only is definitely a plus. It's a quiet place to get away from crowds and kids, if that's what you want. Wherever you go and wherever you stay, I hope you have a safe vacation and a great time.  
<Date>Aug 11, 2007

4	144(short):1	181(tour):1	188(line):1	760(company):1	

<Author>phillygirl105
<Content>Enjoyed Our Stay at the Punta Cana Princess! We stayed at the Punta Cana Princess from July 18-25. My husband (30)and I (27) went with another couple, who are also in their late twenties/early thirties. My husband and I have been to an all inclusive adults only resort before. All four of us really had a great time, but there were two things that we found to be disappointing. 1)Desserts- every dessert that we tried at either the buffet or ala carte restaurants were not good at all. 2)Drinks- of all the reviews I read on this site, I had heard some people say the drinks were not consistently cold and I would have to agree. Sometimes we would order a nice tropical drink like a Pina Colada for example, and it would be nice and cold and slushy like, but sometimes we would get one and it would be like drinking Pina Colada juice, it was all liquid and not very cold/icy. When I think of a Pina Colada or Daiquiri, I think of a nice icy cool refreshing drink and I did not get that very often. Although we were not happy with these two things we would actually still return to the Punta Cana Princess. And now onto all of the positives about the resort: Check In- We had no problem with check in. It was nice to be greeted with a cool towel and a glass of yummy tropical punch. We were then off to find our rooms and when we got there our luggage was there. Room- Our room was great, we stayed in 5107. It was the perfect location, we were on the second floor and loved that our building was so close to the pool. The room itself was very big, we had two queen beds and then there was a little sitting area where the tv and fridge were. The bathroom was also a nice size, I loved the double sinks, it was great cause my husband and I each had our own space to get ready. Also the AC worked really, really well, it actually got pretty cold in our room the first day and the rest of the time there we stayed plenty cool by turning off the AC and just having the ceiling fan on. Food- I thought the food was really good. We at at the Caribe buffet twice. Our first night, Wednesday, it was an Asian buffet and we definitely found enough to eat that we liked there. We also ate there on the Domnican buffet night, Monday, which was really good too. They had music playing while we ate too and it was just nice to get a little taste of Dominican culture. The rest of the nights we ate at the ala carte restaurants. We tried Il Pilon, Domincan food, Il Bacio, Italian food, La Cava, the fancy retaurant and Tex Mex restaurant, I forget the name of it though, anyway we enjoyed the food at all of them. La Cava was very nice, I had the lobster. It came with two lobster tails, my first one was really good but the second was overcooked. At the Tex Mex restaurant, when we got there it was super hot in the restaurant and they sat us right near the kitchen. My husband went to talk to someone at Guest Services and right away the manager came in and was over at the thermostat checking on the AC. We were pretty happy that they took care of it so quickly. Our meal was really good and I loved the margaritas they gave out there as well as the guacamole and chips. Staff- We found the staff to be incredibly friendly. From the Anamacion staff to the hostess at the buffet to the bartenders, everyone we met greeted us with an Ola! and was happy to help us. I have noticed that some people that have reviewed this resort has said the staff was unfriendly. I am wondering if it is just the language barrier. I was not really able to speak Spanish much, I really tried though, and I did feel that I wasn't as connected to the staff as those guests who could speak fluent Spanish. I don't think it has anything to do with being not friendly I just think it is harder to connect with people if you do not share the same language. I feel like I tried as much as I could to talk with the staff and they tried as much as they could to talk to me. And that is all you can ask for. Beach- was beautiful although actually we did not spend too much time here. We did do a few activities on the beach like ping pong and pilates, but beyond that we really just liked being by the pool. Pool- We loved the pool! It was huge, had a nice pool bar and each day we found a nice palapa to sit under in the same spot near the pool. There were also lots of activities at the pool, we did aerobicos a few times which was a little silly but fun and also played pool volleyball. Cleanliness- The resort was very well maintained, I would daily see people at work clean up the debris on the beach as well as working on maintaining the gardens around the resort. Overall: We all really enjoyed our stay at the Punta Cana Princess. Although we were not too happy with the consistency of cold drinks and the below average desserts, everything else was wonderful our nice, spacious room, good food, friendly staff, beautiful beach and pool. We would go back again!  
<Date>Aug 6, 2007
<Rating>4	4	4	5	4	3	4	3

<Author>RDF30
<Content>The food is TERRIBLE! I stayed at the Punta Cana Princess for 5 nights too long. The hotel was beautiful, overall, the service was good. However, the beds and pillows were very hard. It almost seemed that the pillows were made out of rubber. Finally, for a 5 star hotel, the food was by far the worst I have every had. There were 6 of us in our party and we were all sick with an upset stomach every night. Good luck if you're planning on staying there. By the way, the food at the other hotels in the Princess chain are just as bad, especially the Dominican Restaurant, El Pilon, at the Caribe Club Princess. Oh, and be prepared for a long wait at the restaurants!

<Author>Rbnorway
<Content>Princess resort We arrived at the resort and got checked in pretty easy. There were 16 of us and we all stayed in the VIP. The rooms were great. The bottle of rum was small but that made it easier to pack. The pool is really nice but it closes at 8pm. We played volleyball and it would have been nice to do more at night. There is not alot to do at night. The casino was smaller then I thought it would be and we were treated very rude. We didn't leave our place anymore. The food was good for the most part but there were times we were not sure what we were really eating. Advice for anyone going is to book your night meals the first day you are there. We were there for 4 nights and only got in restraunts 2 of those nights. The seafood places had great food. There weren't alot of people there but they said they were booked. Maybe we had problems getting reservations since there were 16 of us but we always saw empty tables. I wish there were more things to do at night. This is a adult resort so it really sirprised us that there wasn't more going on. Room service was good but it takes 45-60 min. We didn't have a menu in our room but the lady I talked to helped me on the phone pick out some food. Most of the staff was nice but there were a few that didn't seem like they liked americans. We really tried to to speak some spanish but it had been several years since I took it in school. Take a book with you and it will help you. One of the things that we were disappointed in was the one hour free motorized water sport. things were booked up and the only things available you could only get 15 min because they said that was equal to one hour on the boat that was booked. The banana boat only had half of the straps that worked and that made it hard with 8 people on it. The driver kept whipping us off and after about 5 min riding we were done. The spa was good and we had no problems getting in. The VIP was nice but I guess we thought it was going to be more. There were some miss leading things that we thought we were going to get and didn't . The only beer was presidente and budwiser. Over all it was a nice trip but this is not a place I would return to for a vacation

<Author>PortugalLost
<Content>What can i say?? My wife and I (ages 33 and 31from Portugal) stayed at the PCP July 15-21,2007, but NO VIP guests. This was not our first all inclusive. After reading ALL the reviews, our only concern for our much anticipated stay was the weather. Allow us to thank all of our fellow trip advisor members for taking the time to share their thoughts. Here's ours, we will try to be as brief and thorough as possible.CHECK IN: smooth although I was denied room requested in building 5000 or 4000, because I was not VIP guest, I found that hard to believe, because I read that other guests with no VIP were in building 5000 or 4000, so we went to 3000. I quickly realized that begging and pleading was getting me nowhere.  We were instructed to find our building and room without assistance. (our luggage would follow). Not that we would have had difficultly, but we expected to be escourted with our luggage and shown to our room properly. We are not uppity people, but we have been to enough resorts to know and appreciate quality and class. We settled into our room 3124, slightly disappointed, but happy to get our vacation underway. THE ROOM, was very accomodating, although, the AC worked quietly only on low fan speed. The fridge was warm.THE BATHROOM was spacious with double sinks, one drained very,very slowly. Hot water, good pressure at all times. The bath towels are a disgrace, 2 stars at best. They were small, some frayed, rough and tinted gray.. We regret to inform you that the FOOD IS BORDERING ON AWFUL in the buffet!!!!. Just as a recent reviewer stated, the ala carte restaurants are a pity. We came to realize that there is something not quite right , we went to l Bacio?the Italian (Lasanha was good), amma Mia?other Italian in Tropical (porc with hot sauce was good), Tex Mex (the best filet mignon ever!!), El Sombrero the Mexican in Tropical (with nice porc and beef) and the Chinese that I dont remember the name as also good?Despite these shortcomings, we are actually looking forward to returning because the beautiful beach, R  R, no kids and hopefully better weather is what it's all about for us. When you stay at the PCP, please keep in mind that you get what you pay for. The major disappointment, all things considered, would be the food. The weather is always a gamble.  In conclusion, the beautiful grounds, white sand beach, gorgeous turquoise waters, pleasant service people (front desk not included), spotless  spacious rooms were the highlights that couldn't be ruined by the afore mentioned drawbacks.We would recommend this resort for those who can temporarily put aside their culinary discretion to enjoy the otherwise positive benefits. As for us, we will re visit the Trip Advisor web site in search of true Luxury Resorts, because overall, many little disappointments add up to one large disappointment .Last Note: The resort is Emilio (from Lobby Bar) and Emilio is the resort?if you don understand please ask for Emilio and you will see!!
