<Author>joanienewjersey
<Content>Had a Great Time We stayed at the PC Princess from July 7th to July 14. We were 2 couples - Tommy  Joanie and Bobby  Denise. We were in building 5 #5106  #5004. We requested to be near each other but on arrival there was a problem. Bobby  Denise stayed in building 4. The next day we again complained  they moved them into bulding 5 to be near us. Of course we tipped the front desk. The rooms were clean  the refrig always stocked with plenty of beer. Even Budweiser that my husband requested along with Presidente  Soberana. We overlooked the pool  ocean view. We had the VIP plan which allows you to make reservations ahead of time for the restaurants which is a great idea. That was worth it. We did upgrade our 20 minute massage to 55 minutes  it was well worth it. The beds on the beach were great and the huts are too. Never had a problem getting a spot - plenty of space. The beach is gorgeous as is the ocean. Sometimes you did get sea weed but it never bothered us  the cleaning crew was always cleaning up. We did try to book the free motorized sport which was a boat ride but they told us it was booked for the week  we did this our 1st day there. So we weren't that happy about that. Our husbands went deep sea fishing  caught a marlin which made their trip great.We have been to the DR 5 times and love the people and the hotels. This resort was great because it wasn't too big like some of the others. You have the option to use all the facilities at the other 2 sister hotels which we did. We met people from all over the country (Atlanta,Georgia (Andrew , Nicky  friends)  Saratoga, NY. Also our friends from Canada - Sav  Leanne  Lena  Tom. Wonderful people. They made our week wonderful. The casino is nice. We had some fun there too. As for tipping - I noticed at this resort they were looking for tips all the time. We are all tippers but it seemed to be at times too much. Hands out a lot more than usual. But we tipped anway  made the best of it. The Pool was beautiful  again met great people there every late afternoon after the beach. The tram ride to the other hotels was a lot of laughs. Sometimes the driver went to fast  other times nice  slow. The food was average at this resort. Plently of food and a lot of choices. The lobster everyone said was great - me not liking seafood ate steak which was okay. You had plenty to eat and enjoy. I didn't care for the mixed drinks so drank plenty of water  once in a while a rum with diet coke. We agree we would return to this hotel in a few years because we did have soo much fun  liked mostly everythig about it. If anyone has questions, please fell free to e-mail me at trip advisor. Joanie from Bergenfield, NJ

<Author>steveandbarb
<Content>Beautiful, quiet resort, left much to be desired My husband and I (ages 51 and 53) stayed at the PCP July 14-20,2007. VIP guests. This was not our first all inclusive. After reading ALL the reviews, our only concern for our much anticipated stay was the weather. We were so sure we would find our personal paradise here, that we booked another week for 4/2008, sight unseen. After reflecting on the week we just had, we MIGHT NOT have considered going back to the PCP. BUT, for the price for a week in April, ($2000.00 USD) we could not resist. Next time, being forwarned, we will have lower expectations. We need to say that the AFFORDABILITY of the PCP is one of the FEW ATTRIBUTES this resort has to offer.  Allow us to thank all of our fellow trip advisor members for taking the time to share their thoughts. Here's ours, we will try to be as brief and thorough as possible. CHECK IN, smooth although I was denied room requested 5215 or any third floor in building 5000 or 4000, Monica said with a frozen smile, they had none. I found that hard to believe, it being July. I quickly realized that begging and pleading was getting me nowhere. When it comes to room location, I am known for trying all theatrics to get my way. Didn't work at the PCP. Upon arrival, we were given a cool towel and a 1/4 full glass of warm juice. We were instructed to find our building and room without assistance. (our luggage would follow). Not that we would have had difficultly, but we expected to be escourted with our luggage and shown to our room properly. We are not uppity people, but we have been to enough resorts to know and appreciate quality and class. We settled into our room 5106, slightly disappointed, but happy to get our vacation underway. THE ROOM, was very accomodating, although, the AC worked quietly only on low fan speed. The fridge was warm, it needed to be defrosted. After 2 calls to the front desk, to no avail, our housekeeper took care of it the next AM, because she spoke to someone and they understood her language. We were instructed to leave the fridge door open when we left the room for the day. THE BATHROOM was spacious with double sinks, one drained very,very slowly. Hot water, good pressure at all times. The bath towels are a disgrace, 2 stars at best. They were small, some frayed, rough and tinted gray. (Meant to be white.) For those of you who are in need, they did supply face cloths.  We regret to inform you that the FOOD IS BORDERING ON AWFUL. Just as a recent reviewer stated, the ala carte restaurants are a pity. Even La Cava, which hides behind an intimate atmosphere and pretentious service. (Ladies beware, it is freezing in there, we asked to have the AC turned down, they did so begrudgingly). We came to realize that there is something not quite right with the beef at the resort (or perhaps in this Country). We found this mystery meat to be dangerous to our digestive tracts. We never cared for buffet style dining, but that was the only time we felt safe. The weather did not help our overall sense of disappointment. We were there for 5 full days (not counting 2 travel days). The first day was partly cloudy, second day, cloudy, no rain,the next day, pouring rain until 2PM, the next day... total washout. The last day of our vacation was picture perfect weather.  Despite these shortcomings, we are actually looking forward to returning because the beautiful beach, R  R, no kids and hopefully better weather is what it's all about for us.  When you stay at the PCP, please keep in mind that you get what you pay for. The major disappointment, all things considered, would be the food. The weather is always a gamble. Oh yeah, speaking of gambling, The CASINO, we found it to have a sleazy feel to it and I did not feel safe on the tram going on the public road. The SPA on the other hand was one of the nicest I have ever visited.  During our vacation, I celebrated my birthday. The staff delivered a fruit plate to our room, nice thought, except the delivery person helped themself to our complimentary cigars!!! I reported the theft to guest services. I was more concerned that in the future, more items would be missing. Nothing was done about the incident for 3 days. I reported it again and the guest relations manager said she had not heard of the incident. Our cigars were replaced x2 but the management never apologized for the dishonesty of their staff (which concerned us much more the the cigars.)  In conclusion, the beautiful grounds, white sand beach, gorgeous turquoise waters, pleasant service people (front desk not included), spotless  spacious rooms were the highlights that couldn't be ruined by the afore mentioned drawbacks. We would recommend this resort for those who can temporarily put aside their culinary discretion to enjoy the otherwise positive benefits. We hope that the management responds to the complaints and resolves some of these problems.  As for us, we will re visit the Trip Advisor web site in search of true Luxury Resorts, because overall, many little disappointments add up to one large disappointment .  
<Date>Jul 21, 2007

Upon arrival booked all al la carte restaurents no problems.Baggages brought to room within 10 minutes bell services, excellent Room: spacious and large, cleanResort :clean clean cleanBeach: AwesomePool: Nice size great pool barRestaurants. On this resort the are all good. If they have the ingredients they will make it for you Our favorite was the italian and seafood with a spl mention for the tex mex. Breakfast buffet awesome. Anamacion Team: They were nice they tried very hard. This is an all adult resort its hard to get vacationers off of there asses such as me for different activities. Thanks to Carlos and Danny and all of the team for there smiles and good humours. I did play water polo and participated in the ping pong tournament. was greatOver all this is a beautiful resort with great employees who work very hard to please everyone. From the gardeners to the service staff . Thanks to all of you who made my sejour so great.Felix a grounds keeper who cleaned the beach bed area every morning. Alejandro from the morning buffet ,Poo Poo Inside jokeSerapio from the beach grill at lunch time thanks for the sprites and sevices Fast worker he had the sprites and cokes and beers on the table before you were sitting down. They will assist you in any way they can. they care about this resort and they are looking to improve the resort every day.

<Author>Sandraq
<Content>A little disappointed My husband and I stayed at the PCP from July 1-8th. We were not able to reserve VIP before arrival and we chose not to upgrade for $44.00per day after arrival. We did not see any premium liquor at either the swim up bar or Mare Nostrum which are the areas we were in most of the time. The resort is kept clean and our room(4108) was fine after being moved from one with water leaking from the bathroom ceiling(4016). We tried a variety of restaurants and they were all okexcept Shanghay. We arrived 5 minutes early with about 15 other people and we were all told to wait. They then rushed around to take off the food orders without even offering a beverage. They brought usan eggroll/wonton appetizer which was cold. The main course was better but the service was terrible. Service was great in all the other restaurants, we left this one before they could bring dessert.The resort was fairly quiet which was great. The beach was nice and easy to walk on. There was quite a bit of sea grass though. We have been to many all inclusive resorts and non A/I in the past. I would probably not return to the PCP unless it was quite a bit less than wepaid. I called guest services to make a manicure appointment. I asked to be transferred to the spa and was charged $2.00 to do so. I was not told in advance this would be the case. Upon checkout they said I owed $6.00-$7.00 for using a calling card from the room. I do not own a calling card and we spent about 20 minutes waiting while the manager (in the back) decided we did not have to pay for that. I

<Author>JOSEYB
<Content>how about english as a 2nd language Where do I begin......Well besides being bumped off our flight from JFK and losing our luggage for three days, after day 3 it was ok for my first all inclusive trip.Suggestion................................My suggestion would be to have the hotel assign a person to help guests (BILINGUAL WOULD BE A PLUS) for special situations like arriving at the hotel with no luggage. I do understand that it is not the fault of the resort, but alittle compasion goes along way. Possible have a LOST LUGGAGE WELCOME BAG which could possible include toothbrush/toothpaste, deordorant, razors and maybe a couple of tee shirts (with Punta Cana Princess advertising of course). After travelling ALL DAY and checking in with no bags, we ended up going into the Gift Shop and purchasing 2 toothbrushes, a small tube of paste, 2 razors and a small thing of deordorant and it cost us $26.00. Since the front desk could not help with our baggage situation, I had to contact AA bagage claim in Punta Cana. This venture involved purchasing telephone cards and paying $2.00 for a outside line every time I made a local call. Fifteen calls later (@ $2.00 a call = $30. + the two telephone cards at $10) , I finally was able to locate my luggage and it was delivered Tuesday morning. Other than that, beaches were beautiful, service was good, food, well that's a whole nuther story. They should also hire an entertainment director. We shuttled over to the sister hotel for that cuz ours wasn't too great.The room was beautiful. Never saw the gym or jacuzzi (probably someone at the front desk could have mentioned it at check in).ALSO....never new there was a refrigerator in the room until day 4. (oops....something else for that front desk to do).All in all, a good trip. Probably would go back to Punta Cana but would try another resort.

<Author>lisachill2
<Content>MOST amazing honeymoon EVER My new hubby  I went to the Punta Cana Princess Resort from July 3 to July 9th and we had the BEST time!!! We took the VIP package (since so many ppl raved about it) and it was absolutely, completely, one hundred percent worth it. Just the 24-hr free room service made it all worth it!!! One night, around 2 am we ordered 3 desserts, 2 sandwiches  salad (we were famished from doing honeymoon activities ;) and the guy brought it to us with a smile!!! Even though the tip is included  they don't expect tips, we would always tip ones to the maid, room service guys, the customer service men  women, and the bartenders. Everywhere we went staff smiled at us, shook my hubbys hand, patted him on the back - it was fabulous! One thing we were amazed about was that there were no bugs! We couldn't figure it out! They must spray for them all the time (altough we never smelled anything chemical) but when we got back home to Texas, we found more mosquitos in our back porch than on our whole 7-day stay!! Another perk is that it is adults-only and a lot smaller than the two sister resorts (although it was fun to go there for the shows, the a la carte restaurants, and walk through their park with random peacocks roaming the landscape! ). At night it's much quieter  most of the time, in the evening, you have like the entire beach to yourselves to take romantic walks, with our toes in the wet sand  hear nothing but the roar of the ocean waves... it was amazing. Also, the VIP beach beds ROCKED. It didn't matter what time we woke up (8 am or 11 am) there was always one available! All the food was AWESOME, especially all the fresh fruit  I loooooved the grilled chicken! My bubby loved the burgers  DEFINITELY loved the size of the steak at La Cava. The only problem we had with the food was that we always ate too much! Also, my hubby (from Brasil) thought that Rodizzio (the Brasilian a la carte) was good food, but not Brasilian by any means. The drinks were amazing too. I should note though, that neither of us drink alcohol so it took some convincing of the staff that we really, truly wanted our drinks sin alcohol, virgin . At first, many thought we were kidding. and I had to throw away a few drinks (I just can't stand the actual taste of alcohol, I know, it's weird) but they'd always make me another one without alcohol, laughing in disbelif ;) We did the parasailing (not included) and it was totally worth it for my hubby  I thought it was really neat too, but I got kind of motion sick towards the end  I felt gross on the boat ride back. We also went to Manati Park (not included) and swam with the dolphins! That was AWESOME! We also loved the other shows! It was all GREAT fun! We really had a great time  it was always easy to book the a la cartes for dinner by phone in the mornings. But truthfully, I really liked the all day Casabe buffet the best!!! There was just so much variety  you didn't have to choose just one thing! That probably relates more to my personality preferences than the actual food itself! They were both about equal in quality (for my middle class taste anyways! ;) but I enjoyed the variety and flexibility more of the buffet. We only have one warning for fellow Americans who don't travel all the time (like ourselves) , the Europeans are very flexible with their bodies  exposure! Even the old men (...in string thongs!) it was funny, but awkward to see at first... lol - we got used to it by the end of our trip though. Overall, we want to send every honeymooning couple there - it was AMAZING.  
<Date>Jul 16, 2007

<Author>ryandrach
<Content>Ok, but wouldn't return My wife and I recently spent our honeymoon at this hotel, after reading all the positive reviews we couldn't wait to go. Unfortunately our stay was a bit of an anti-climax.Check in was fine, the receptionist was really friendly etc. As honeymooners we asked about a possible upgrade and were told yes this was ok as long as we were willing to pay an additional $100 per night.........we didn't take her up on her kind offer!!! (the brochure states honeymooners get a free upgrade when available)The room was lovely, very spacious, air con VERY good and the fridge had beer!! We did notice several damp patches in the ceiling though, so did the maid when she was cleaning one day when we were in there! Apart from that we have no complaints, apart from channel 96 only showing adult films on one day!! :-)The beach is lovely, probably the best we've ever seen, spotless soft white sand and clear blue sea. It is picture postcard stuff and it really took our breath away when we first saw it.The grounds are immaculate, the friendly gardeners will offer to climb up and get you a coconut too which is a nice touch.We found a few problems though which put us off ever going back to this hotel, maybe not the DR but definitely this hotel:THE STAFF:Whilst most were very courteous and friendly there were the odd few who gave you the impression this was too much like hardwork! The pool bar gentleman is one, also the gentleman who works the lobby bar was only interested in serving you if you were lining his pocket with dollars. There is a certain favouritism to Spanish guests too, whilst I have no problem with the Spaniards I object to waiting at the bar and then a Spaniard appearing from nowhere and being served immediately. It's not as if we didn't tip on a regular basis, much more generous than most but it didn't seem to matter. THE FOOD:The buffet is probably your safest bet, I found the food pretty good in there although my wife didn't and subsequently lost half a stone on our trip. There is a different theme every evening and I found the food to be of a pretty good standard. I never eat veg at home but the veg here was amazing, so was the rice and all the meat dishes. (if you're a very fussy eater then perhaps this hotel isn't for you) The a la carte restaurants aren't worth going to, the Chinese is pretty bad, Tex Mex steak didn't taste like steak to me, the Mexican in the other hotel is average but the Italian is probably the worst meal I've EVER had.My biggest problem of all was certain cliental, for a so called 5 star hotel I find it disgusting that people smoke in the pool and flick their ash in the water. I also don't understand why people took the time to walk to the lunch buffet at the Mare Nostrum (beach restaurant) and then walk back and eat their burgers, pasta, sausages etc IN THE POOL?????!!!!In my eyes the hotel consisted of 80% Spanish, perhaps 10% American and the remaining 10% a mixed bag of other nationalities. The staff seem to favour certain nationalities, one in particular and I find this pathetic in this day and age.To sum it up, nice beach, beautiful weather, the sea and pool water are like a bath, the buffet very good, and the rooms are very spacious but a little TLC would make them immaculate.My review is honest and to the point I feel, please feel free to get in touch.  
<Date>Jul 11, 2007

<Author>MrsKris
<Content>Fit for a Princess!!! We arrived at the Punta Cana Princess at 6.30 pm and check-in was quick and easy. We were given room 5004, attached a label to our luggage and then walked to find the room ourselves. The bags were delivered within a very few minutes of our being in the room. We did not upgrade to the VIP package but had a ground floor room near the beach overlooking the pool. We had bath robes provided and also beach towels were in the room even though we had been given towel cards. The room was very pleasant with two double beds and separate seating area. There was a coffee maker and a digital clock, ample storage space and hangers, and also a TV with a good number of channels in English. We were also pleased to have a room safe provided free of charge which was programmable with your own numerical code. There was also a fridge containing soft drinks and beer. We never touched the soft drinks and only had a couple of the beers so I am not sure how often the fridge was replenished. There was a 2L bottle of water which we used in the bathroom for teeth cleaning and also to make coffee. We left a note on the first morning requesting extra water and always got it after that. The room was kept spotlessly clean each day and fresh towels provided. We tipped a small amount each day and had flowers and towel sculptures left by the maid. As other reviewers have said, the beach is fabulous. There were a great many people playing the owel game?and although we are early risers and were actually sitting on the beach by 8 am all the palapas near to the ocean were already reserved. No big deal, we found a place we liked and sat there every day. The towels provided for the beach are collected from the aquatic centre which was only open from 9 am ?5 pm which I did not think was quite long enough. Also the actual towels were often in really poor condition ?thin and even holey! Let the hotel down in my opinion. The pool is really nice and because the hotel is for adults only, never felt crowded. We always moved our amp?up to the pool mid-afternoon and never had any trouble finding beds and shade. The reason we moved from the beach was that we received a number of insect bites in the late afternoon on the beach. I was badly bitten around my face and eyes and even ended up having to see the hotel doctor. One eye was so badly swollen, it was almost closed. I looked ghastly! The doctor is located 24 hours at the Caribe Club. I spoke to him by phone and then the bellboy took me over to see him on a golf buggy. The doctor spoke excellent English and was thorough in his treatment. This incident was the only thing to mar a really excellent vacation. We had breakfast everyday in the main buffet restaurant. We liked the fact that a young lady meets and greets and shows you to a table. However, we did find that service in the buffet was erratic. There was no shortage of staff or willingness but the waiters and waitresses seemed to rush around a lot and not achieve all that much. They were not very good at topping up water or wine at dinner but this was just a minor irritation. We found the food to be hot when it should be or cold when required. The variety was not huge but there was always something acceptable. We preferred to eat dinner at the a la carte restaurants when possible. Lunch was taken at the beach bar. The setting is superb and they did a really good job of keeping the sand out. The food was always the same but varied and enjoyable. The waiters went to the bar for drinks for you. Some days they did a barbeque on the beach and provided a delicious sangria. On Monday night, they move all the chairs out of the buffet and on to the beach. The Mare Nostrum becomes the buffet for the night. Now this is just my personal opinion but WHY???? We absolutely hated it. You had to walk on sand in your good sandals, it was too dark to see, could not find a table and it was impossible to get a drink. The food was not very nice either. They also allow traders to set up stalls on the path to the beach and they were unpleasantly persistent.. We resolved not to go to the beach night on our second Monday and were able to book the Tex Mex that night. We had no problems booking a la carte restaurants. We went to the lobby in the evening to Guest Services and never waited more than a couple of minutes. We could book 3 nights at once. We went to all the a la cartes at the Princess twice and once to the Dominican at the Caribe. The Dominican was by far our least favourite. The staff were surly and the food tepid. My friend had an upset stomach after we had dined there. That was the only tummy troubles we had. We enjoyed all the restaurants at the Punta Cana Princess. Le Petite Fondue was fun and the melted chocolate dessert was to die for. The Italian was good but portions huge. I had a pizza and could only manage a couple of slices. They were very worried that there was something wrong with it and wanted to get me something else. I was just stuffed. The Tex Mex was excellent and I can recommend the Fillet Mignon. I am not a big meat eater but I enjoyed this. We only went on one trip which we booked via the aquatic centre. It was the catamaran trip. The cost was $84 each for the whole day. We walked along to the left of the hotel to get to the boat but were brought back by Jeep on a 20 minute drive which was fine. The catamaran was much smaller than the ones we had traveled on around Puerta Plata but this was nice. The day was varied with a trip around the wreck located by the Iberostar, snorkeling time, a big beach slide, a visit to a shark/ray sanctuary and then to a natural swimming pool. The bar was included and a light lunch. A lovely day. In the evening, the animation team put on some kind of a show in the lobby. We did not like this. It was very unsophisticated and not in keeping with a 5 Star Adults Only resort. It would have been much more preferable to have say a pianist playing there each night. There was not a great deal of seating in the lobby and this could be much improved. The only other alternative is the beach bar. This is a beautiful location but all the drinks are served in paper cups which is not great at night. In conclusion, we rated the Punta Cana Princess very highly and would return. The fact that there are no kids is a huge bonus. We walked around the two sister hotels and found the atmosphere manic. We were glad to return to the calm of our own hotel. We have been to quite a number of hotels in the Dominican Republic over the last ten years and nowhere is perfect but without doubt the negatives at this hotel were far outweighed by the positives. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

<Author>linbad2
<Content>You will love it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! You will love this resort! The resort is really beautiful and gorgeous. The grounds are impeccable and really pretty. It is so clean and pristeen. The staff really goes above and beyond to make your stay wonderful. They always say hi and are so friendly even if they do not speak your language. A smile even goes a long way. We had VIP and we felt it was worth it as you get the extra perks. We stayed in room 5213 and it was great. Our room had a cathedral ceiling and we overlooked the pool and the beach. Our mini bar was stocked at all times. We walked down the beach and the PCP was truely the nicest resort around. The beach is just beautiful and there are plenty of chairs to go around and if you are VIP you get the really comfortable beds as well to use. We usually went to the sister hotel for dinners and entertainment and it was fun. Going there was a snap as it is a short walk if you want or the trams comes every 10 minutes or so that drives you there. The other resort is for families so it is more crowded and has kids everwhere. The PCP is so quiet and serene and you really feel like you have the whole resort to yourselves. We have never been to an all adult place before and it was really nice, you don't miss the kids at all and it is really nice. We would definitely recommend this place and would love to go back again someday. We took the all day excursion on the big truck and went to a sugarcane platation, a private house on the mountain and saw a typical family and we went to a private ranch on the beach and rode horseback on the beach, swam in the ocean, and in the private pools and then they served us all lunch. It was a very nice way to see the real Punta Cana and surrounding areas and it will really give you an appreciation as to what we have in our own homes. The only things that were not mentioned anywhere before we chose this resort was that there are no elevators as in most of the hotels there are only 3 floors. The main large buffets are open sided and not air conditioned so it is hot. We just booked a different specialty restaurant each nite and they are air conditioned and have really good food as well. It gets really hot and humid all the time and I am a sun lover and love to sunbathe and I will tell you to bring alot of sunblock (the higher the better) as you will be looking for the shade as the sun is extremely hot. Also bring aloevera for sunburn as you will need that too as you do get burned even with 50 sunblock on you. Other than that we have nothing bad at all to say about the resort. You will enjoy it! If anybody wants to ask me specific question I will be happy to answer you. My email is linbad2@msn.com. I am sad to be home and back to the grind but I have lovely memories of it.  
<Date>Jul 4, 2007

<Author>edewaele
<Content>If you want food posioning and horrible service, this is the place!! First off, the AC did not work in the room. It was like pulling teeth to get a room change. You would think with the number of American tourists that vacation this place, that the locals would learn some English. But no. Huge Language barrier. Numerous times would I have to ask 3 or 4 times for something as simple as a refil of my coke. The humidity was herendous, not to mention you are eating dinner outside almost all the time. No air in the lobby either. You also have to ask for the chefs to recook the food, because almost always is the food either undercooked of sometimes raw. A number of people had food poisoning. The entertainment was sub par. The beach needs to be cleaned badly, with cigaratte buds and trash everywhere. On several ocasions at this all inclusive resort (tipping is optional) we tipped the waiter or bell hop, only to get a snide ungratful remark, thats it!! I would never go to the DR or recommend this place/'country to anyone.

<Author>sabineFallRiverMass_
<Content>best all inclusive resort ever first do yourself a favor and don't even bother reading the review by LITTLE BUNNY 06 ,MONTREAL .my husband and i stood at the PUNTA CANA PRINCESS june11 to june21 and totally loved it . Last year we went to St.Lucia and stood at the Sandals resoert, well let me tell you we loved that resort alot , but the Princess topped the Sandals resort .We thought that the Princess was all the five stars that it claims it is. The place is so clean and beautiful . everyday and all day long you would see workers and staff keeping up with the place, and a great job they did. As of speaking the language well we don't ,granted my husband is portuguese there may be a handful of words similar , but as for me i'm german born american citizen . so we would ask some phrases mostly used and learned them before we got there. but i did not thing there was a problem if we didn't know something in their language and spoke english .they would also do their best to understand what we were saying.what travelers have to remember they are poor people thry were born there work their butts off, they should not be expected to speak our language nor anybody elses.oh and by the way the food is great , there are so many selections at every seating wether it was breakfast, lunch, or dinner.all those critics that say not much of a selection or not too much food or even the vegetarians who complain about no selections,all i have too say is were the hell do they go to eat to get satisfiy their hunger.you mention it and i pretty much think they had it. i will leave you future travelers with a heart warming thought .you need to remember your going to the caribbean, this means be on vacation enjoy the view the people and learn to relax , you will get your drink and your will get your food and your room will be cleanned and made up by a maid. just smile and relax greet the people in whatever language and they will smile and greet you back in their language and they are there to please you however thay can.LOVE SABINE , GO TO THE PUNTA CANA PRINESS!

<Author>GeorgiaMamaof6
<Content>Better than Hawaii!!! What a wonderful trip and hotel!! We just got back June 18-22, Friday and can't imagine how anyone could ever say anything negative about the Punta Cana Princess. The staff was WONDERFUL, friendly, generous, thoughtful and all of this with no additional tipping!!! The food was all wonderful, there was always something great to eat! Breakfast is spectacular and a most enjoyable meal. Lunch out by the beach was terrific with sandwich items, hot items, fruits, desserts, salads, salad bar, barbeque grilled hamburgers, chicken, pork and steak. There was a delicious rice dish with lots of fresh seafood at lunch also. At night, all of the a-la-carte restaurants were great but the grilled lobster at the Mare Noistrum was fantastic, anything we raved over, they bought us another one. If you walk over to the sister resorts, you really appreciate the quiet atmosphere when you return. Romantic music was always pumped thru the speakers in the gardens in the evenings and very pleasant island music in the daytime. No kids! We left 6 at home so it was a nice change for some romantic , stressfree time away. I honestly can't say enough good about this resort. Beach was beautiful! Everything was very clean and immaculate ALL OF THE TIME our room, the grounds, buffets, restrooms, beach, everything, much cleaner than the US. Couldn't believe that we got all that for such a terrific price! If more people knew about this, Hawaii would go out of business! Enjoyed it so much more and can't wait to go back again next summer!!!!!  
<Date>Jun 24, 2007

<Author>LITTLE_BUNNY06
<Content>God! What a disappointement! After reading so many good reviews...I was sure this would be a great hotel!Boy, was I mistaking...I'll get to the point:The good:-the beach-the weather-the rooms ( good size, very clean, working A.C) The BAD!!!:- service: terrible !! We had never been treated this way anywhere...If you didn't speak spanish ( andI do, but my husband doesn't ),nobody would give you the time of day when tryingto ask for an information...they just turned their backs and pretended not tohear you...It was as if our being there was an inconvenience for them, they weretoo busy laughing and joking with each other...As for getting something to drink during any of the meals...well, good luck!Tipping didn't help either...Total disrespect !- food: horrible!!! disgusting...lack of choice...and whatever they had wasgross...the only time you could actually eat something was at breakfast (eggs bacon)Yes, you could go to the sister resort and eat( they had a larger buffet )...butit was really crowded all the time !!! We tried the Mexican restaurant and waited for about an hour to get served aFajita (was ok ) Chimichangas (gross)...At our hotel we tried El Mare Nostrum ( everything was either burned or coveredin some weird sauce...) We love trying new food, but this was just NOT GOOD!We also ate at the Italian restaurant Il Bacio which was ok...We didn't get a chance to try the Tex-Mex...you can only make reservationsbetween certain hours and it was all booked by the time we got there...This was our fourth all inclusive resort...we had been to Cuba 3 times and wewould NEVER EVER return to this resort...We loved Cuba each time and were superdisappointed with this trip...We still enjoyed the beach  sun but the staff disgusting food made us never want to hear about this resort again.There are plenty of great hotels in Punta Cana...please don't chose this one!!

<Author>oldgazza
<Content>Nice time at the punta cana princess My wife and i, both 49, stayed at the Punta Cana princess for 14 nights from 4th June 07. Overall we had a super holiday which we booked last minute 4 days before departure. At 1150 for two of us we thought we had excellent value for money. Clientele mainly Canadian, American, German odd French and a few English.I have tried to be honest and critical where i thought fit in this review, but must emphasize, we had a great time!!!!Accomodation; Generally good, although our first room 4018 was rather damp and musty smelling, we requested a change of room on day 2 and were given an odourless room without argument, but on the ground floor again. Fellow guests were also complaining of damp smelling rooms on the ground floor. Guests with British tour operators who we spoke to all seemed to be allocated ground floor rooms.Pool area; Nice pool and swim up bar, good water temperature and seemed pretty clean, although we always avoid late afternoon swimming in the pool as we feel pollution is at its highest then. A small army of cleaners washing everything down, loungers, patio area at 7.00 a.m every day. Poolside loungers were a disgrace though, nearly all of them being broken underneath and virtually collapsing, very uncomfortable. Replacements were made on some days but these were also used and also broken.I cannot understand the management mentality which allows something like this to mar what is generally a great pool area. Blimey, youv'e gotta lay on em most of the day after all, we don't all wanna come home with sciatica do we!Beach; Great beach area, as good as anywhere i've been.Gardens; Wow, manicured and tended to perfection to make this resort a natural paradise, one of the high spots. These gardeners deserve a medal, spare em a buck or two there worth it.Food; Good all round. Casabe buffet good always, found something good to eat, whether it be from the carvery, griddle or selections from the hot plates. Could be a but repetetive but hey where isn't on a 2 week holiday. Quality control regularly probe testing meat temperature etc which has to be a good sign.Steak House. Good, nice tender steak, Petit Fondue. Good again.Mama Mia at Tropical Princess Very good. La Cava a la carte at Tropical Princess, excellent . I found the beach restaurant to be the least appetizing so only ate there twice. I would rate the food at this resort highly overall and say it was a high spot of the holiday.Service; Generally very good, happy faces from most staff and a willingness to give good service whether tipping or not.Drinks; Presidente beer o.k. cocktails pretty good, local spirits leave a lot to be desired but are drinkable. We upgraded to v.i.p package for last four days of our stay, this made a lot of difference. At 22 u.s $ about 11 a day per person this was well worthwhile as it entitled you to premium brand drinks, a dinner at la cava ( very good) which would cost $25 per head, A massage $35 per head, internet access, an hour motorized watersportsand use of vip double beach beds and other little extras. I would reccomend doing this even if for only part of your stay.We did have a problem with one of the lobby bar staff trying to give us local drinks after upgrading to vip but we soon put him straight and had no further problems, just be aware.Entertainment; The animacion team were fine during daytime doing usual stuff, volleyball, aerobics etc, and were a nice bunch.But the evenings were a big disappointment, childish games, shouting down overloud microphones, this was the pits. the worst evening entertainment i have experienced in 5 trips to the caribbean and countless holidays in europe. Totally out of context for a laid back over 18 resort, the only big disappointment of this holiday. You could go to the Tropical Princess and watch the shows there if you wanted to though.We booked 2 trips during our stay, one to Saino island, through airtours via coach catamaran and speedboat, a long trip 11 hour round trip but i thought worthwhile and enjoyable, a beautiful island.The other a deep sea fishing trip, from the marlin fishing co, booked through airtours. We were ripped off, 9 on a small rundown boat for half day, stayed close to shore caught 1 fish, gave us a glass of coke though,well it was only $95 each and managed to cram 13 of us into a vehicle with 10 seats for the trip there and back.Obviously no one could belt up. Are these trips meant to be vetted by the tour operators ??????? Avoid this company MARLIN, I would research a company online before i went next time and book independentlyTo conclude, we had very little in the way of stomach / rear end problems, myself suffering one morning which i put down to an excess of mamajuana rum the night before. This is a very clean and well kept resort and i heard nobody complaing of any stomach problems.Did we enjoy our holiday? Too right we did. Would we go back to the Punta Cana Princess again? Too right we would. Would we recommend it to you ? Yes we would . Enjoy !!!!!!!!  
<Date>Jun 20, 2007

<Author>JoyLim88
<Content>Best Vaca Ever! First off The PCP was GREAT!My girlfriend and I stayed at the PCP from June 10 to June 17. One week is not enough. The flight there from Toronto was not bad about 4hrs, left T.O at 10:20am and arrived at 2:10pm. We were a little late checking in so we did not get to sit right beside each other on the plane. They did give us seats together but we were separated by the aisle, no big deal. When we arrived in Dominican customs was fast, there were those guys in white you hear about ready to take our bags, but we only had 1 piece of luggage each so we did not need their help, but they were not aggressive at all, as some people stated. Bus ride to the resort was a little longer than I would have liked but they had to drop other people to their resorts first, so nothing much to complain about. When we got there check-in was a breeze, the only thing we had a little problem with was, when my g/f booked the hotel we wanted a king size bed but when we got there they gave us a room with 2 doubles. The concierge told us the king size bed room was on the ground floor without a good view, but the 2 double bed room was on the 3rd floor and it had a pool/ocean view. So we checked it out and stayed with the double room. We were in room 4221, great view of the whole pool area and a pretty good view of the beach. After we got settled in we went to the service desk to get our tickets for our massage, 1 hour motorized sport, and internet access. While there we also decided to book what restaurants we wanted to eat at. It was a bit confusing as to when we have to book the restaurants, because there are certain times you can do so, but in the end it was ok. We tried to book for the same night but we couldn but luckily the guy there had a cancellation so on our first night we ate at Shangay, at the Caribe. The food there was pretty good, we both had lobster. It was dry but free so we really didn care about it too much. The other restaurants we tried were La Petite fondue (Very good), Rio Grande (O.K, but they messed up my order), and the other Seafood place at the Caribe (Very good but couldn finish because it was too much food), but I forgot the name. We also made reservations for Sombrero, and La Cava, but we ended up not going, and just eating at the Buffet. The Buffet had almost the same stuff all the time, with a couple of different dishes. It was good though nothing really to complain about.We went with the VIP package, and having access to the Beach beds are fabulous. Our first night there we stayed up really late, and on Monday morning we woke up really early had breakfast and just slept on the beach beds for a couple of hours getting tanned. Throughout the whole week we never had to wait or look hard for a beach bed. There was always one available. And even if you leave like your towel or a book on the bed and go away for awhile no one will take your spot no matter how long youe gone. The beach at PCP was so nice and clean. If you were to walk over to the neighboring beaches they had seaweed all over the shore. But at the PCP they always kept it clean. We walked to the market on the beach but that was probably my least favorite thing to do there. The vendors there are so aggressive and they all have the same stuff. And when you do go into there stores they try and give you a deal but they end up asking for a price that is ridiculous. But you should never agree on the price they ask for. ALWAYS bargain, if they ask for 90US you give them the most 15US-20US, nothing more.  My g/f and I did a couple of excursions; we did the 1 hour boat ride to the ship wreck and along the shore line. That was fun, but they said the boat comes and picks us up at 2pm; they came at like 3pm. We also went parasailing, we did the tandem one so both of us were in the air at the same time that was OK, but we had to wait on the boat for 3 other couples to go first so we got a little sea sick, so that made the parasailing not as fun because we felt sick. And then on Friday we went to the Marinarium. That was an experience everyone should try. Forget swimming with Dolphins. Go swim with Sting Rays and Sharks. We went at the sunset trip that is when they feed the Rays and there aren as many people who go on that trip, so it is not that crowded as if you were to go during the daytime. When we went at sunset there was about 10 people, plus the crew. When you go during the afternoon there could be up to 30 people plus crew, so going at sunset is way better.Every night at the Caribe Resort they would put on a show at 9:45pm. We went to all the show except one. The performances were OK. Some performers were really good they can really dance and stuff but some looked like they did not know what was going on. If you go and check out the show try and see othic? he MTV show? efore? and there is one more but I forgot the name.This trip was our first all inclusive trip and going to PCP made it a great experience. I hoped this helped anyone who is thinking of going to this resort, because honestly now that I am home I want to plan another trip there ASAP.  
<Date>Jun 20, 2007

<Author>kaylarosie88
<Content>Best Vacation Ever! I know this review is kind of late, seeing as how my mom, brother, my best friend and myself went almost two years ago. But when I saw this hotel on the review page I knew I had to comment.This was my first tropical vacation, and I became hooked. The only bad part of this trip was the flight and bus ride, and that is ONLY because I get motion sickness quite easily and I am really not good on planes.Aside from being beautiful in just apperance, I would have to say that I met beautiful people as well. My brother became frends with Micheal he was an amazing guy who kept him entertained, my brother who was 15 at the time had lots of fun teaching his basketball tricks etc. It was good for him to have someone to talk to especially since I had brought my best friend with me.Rooms:The rooms were absolutely beautiful, they were MUCH bigger then i had expected, we had a standard room and it was lovely. The beds were a bit hard but that is to be expected anywhere you go, this happend to be a good thing for me because it helped my back quite a bit. The fridge was always stocked every day, we always had towels, and when we came back to our room our maid always left us a flower on our bed as well as two in the bathrooms, one by each sink. Although we didn't really have money so we couldn't tip, we always left a thank you note and when we left we left some perfumes and stuff behind for her. Food:The food was really good, we ate at the buffet as well as all the specialty restorants that they had. I loved the chicken fettucini alfredo i had it almost everyday. The deserts were always good, and the staff always made sure we had fresh drinks and were doing well. Beach: The beach was amazing you could walk forever it seemed in both directions. when you go onto the beach if you turn left and walk for about 5-10 minutes there are local vendors who are willing to bargin to give you a good price... we got lots of stuff and spent only a little. The beach was clean and there were always chairs available. Warning. It is a topless beach, be prepared for that, it suprised my 15 year old brother quite a bit, and he always blushed and looked away when a topless women would walk by. So if you have small children prepare for sunless tanning not only on the beach but by the pool as well.Day Trip:My mom took us all on a day trip as well. This included a bus ride through the town. it is beautiful and colourful, but it saddend me... I tend to take things to heart to much, and when I saw the size of the houses and the surroundings it made me feel bad for being at a big luxurious hotel. After the bus ride we ended up at another hotel where we went down the beach and boarded a speed boat, which took us to a huge Catamaran. Once boarded there were drinks and dancing, it was so much fun. We ended up going to a private protected beach where we had lunch and spent 3 hours swimming in the warm crystal clear water. We bought some necklaces from the local vendors and had a great time. After that we boarded a speed boat and went out into the middle of the water, way off the shore where the water ended up being only waste high, we saw starfish as well as other fish and it was amazing. It was really worth the extra money spent, I would recommend this to anybody! After that we boarded the catamaran again and went back to our hotel. Overall:This was a fantastic vacation and I would recomment anybody go to this hotel, I would love to go back, the staff was amazing, the rooms were spotless, and I had the time of my life! This hotel definetly got me hooked on vacationing, and I hope to someday go back! This really turned out to be a lot longer then i thought it would be.. but its such an amazing vacation that I just had to comment!  
<Date>Jun 19, 2007

<Author>Beachbunny33
<Content>Garden of Eden This resort is the very best we have ever stayed in. My husband and I stayed here from 9 June - 15 June. We are in our mid 40's. The staff is friendly and helpful and the resort is kept as clean as a hospital. Checking in was only a 10 minute stop and checking out was even easier. Eat at the Ala Carte restaurants and you can make up to 3 reservations at a time. Men must wear long pants to these restaurants. Buffet areas are open to swimsuits, shorts, skirts, tank tops and wraps. Buffet food is pretty good with a different variety at the Casabe and pretty much the same everyday at the Mare. Mondays is when they do the beach buffett but it rained and it was cancelled. I really suggest upgrading to the VIP status. The rooms and beachside beds are worth it alone. VIP's also get a 20 minute massage and 1 hour of motorsport use (although this only consists of the banana boat ride or a boat ride to the sunken ship (which is just a rusty ole boat). Only problem is that the 1 hour ticket can only be used once and the banana boat ride only lasted 15 minutes. You do not get a credit of 45 minutes. The same with the internet use. You get an hour pp but must use it all at one time. Our one off resort dinner (free for VIP's) was at the La Cava. This meal was absolutely fabulous. My husband had the NY steak and I ate the grilled lobster tail. A lot of food. The beach had about 30% topless women but most are European so no biggie. Only the American men seemed excited about it. Same at the pool. Swim up bar was a nice addition. I recommend this resort to anyone looking for a laid back place to enjoy one another. We can't wait to go back.  
<Date>Jun 16, 2007

<Author>barb111
<Content>Absolutely Fabulous!!!! My hubby and I stayed at the PCP from 6/2-6/9 and we had a wonderful time. I am going to try to organized in this review, but I tend to ramble. Firstly, the trip from PVD was fine to Charlotte, but then we waited 40 minutes on the tarmac due to traffic congestion and then 25 for someone to come and opoen the door to the plane. No biggie, our flight to PC was delayed 90 min. Still on vacation, no worries. We arrived in P at 4:30, got our bags and went through customs in about 15 minutes. We were asked if we had food, and then waived through. Hubby agreed to let someone carry the bags 20 feet, because he's a nice guy!! Told Prieto tours were taking a taxi and 25 min. later we were at PCP with a glass of cold punch in our hand. We were given room 5209 with a cathedral ceiling and a larger balcony than the others. Plenty of drawer and closet space. Bathroom was large and I found lighted well, as others have not. The bed was a King with lots of pillows and very soft. The fridge had plenty of beer and soda. The maids cleaned morning and night and restocked everything. We tipped her $2 am and pm. VIP get towels in their room daily. You can go up to the dive shop for more during the day, By the end of the week we had 3 each!!We had a great ocean view!!! Our VIP envelope was waiting for us as was the items in the room. At check in, we made a reservation for that night. One was made before arrival, but we decided against italian and went for Mare Nostrum. After settling in, we went to the beach. Absolutely beautiful. We took a quick nap and then went back and made the rest of our restaurant reservations for the week. No problem.Mare Nostrum - good seafod, right on the beach,Brazilian - our least favorite. It is really buffet with them bringing different meats to your table.Dominican - good, and a fun place. I'll note that in the Brazilian and Dominican, people had on shorts, T's and even bathing suits!!La Cave, nice place, good food, slow. But, again..who cares!!!El Pescador, we paid to go (32pp) and it was probably our favorite. Less formal than Le Cave and really good seafood. Right on the beach and fun staffThe beach party is Monday nights and they have vendors come in. The buffet is in Mare Nostrum and they have tables and entertainment right on the beach.We ate breakfast at the buffet every morning and lunch either there or at the smaller buffet at Mare Nostrum. We did try the Creperie one day. Bad mistake. I know people have raved, but.... The chicken and cheese was orange cheeze wiz and some very dark meat chicken with lots of gristle.. Coouldn't eat it.Drinks were plentiful and we used our bubba keg, but saw NO ONE else with them. The bartenders kinda joked about them. We did tip with each drink order and left $2 at Breakfast and Lunch for our drink server. $ dollars at dinner and $10 at El Pescador, because they were so nice, In all honestly, we saw tipping VERY rarely.We did our excursions with the hotel. $20 for snorkeling. Unfortunately, the water was very choppy and not great. The free one hour boat trip was fun. We had booked the sunset cruise, but 3 days in a row it was cancelled. The boat driver was tired!!! Hubby did parasailing.We spent most night in the lobby or at the beach bar. We did see the Italian's show over at Caribe, but never ventured to any of their other shows.We only got top shelf liquor once in the lobby at PCP, everywhere else they don't have it. At Caribe, they lied and said they gave it to us, but we saw what they poured. Received and saw no one with bottled Presidente. None of this was a big deal to us.We used our free 20 minute massage and purchased additional 55 min. and it was well worth it. The spa is lovely and would recommend it over the mini one at PCP. Caribe and the spa is only a 2-3 minute walk away. It took longer to wait for and take the trams.I did have to see the doctor while there. My eyes were a bit swollen from too much sun. She gave me some shots and meds and checked me for the next 2 mornings before breakfast for additional meds. overall, it was $350 which my private and trip insurance will cover. Well worth it.We did not bother stopping at the beach markets, because they were just too aggressive and the items looked too much like stuff I didn't want. I found nice T-shirts at the resort for a reasonable price and we bought jewelry, a painting and rum from the vendors the night of the beaqch partyl.Overall, our stay was great!!!! The beach was wonderful..loved my floatie. The pool was never crowded. It was hard to find a palapa after 6am, but we managed. The food was good, not excellent, but not why we came.Unfortunatelly, the trip home was not good. The flight out of PC was 4 hours delayed, so we missed our connection in Charlotte. Found a hotel at 1am, got up at 4 to go back to the airport to come home the next day. Luggage was lost, and when it arrived, the rum had broken and the bags were ripped. Kudos for trip insurance, once again.Please feel free to contact me with any questions!!!!  
<Date>Jun 16, 2007

<Author>Crazy8NC
<Content>Great Resort! My husband and I just returned from the Punta Cana Princess on Sunday, June 3rd. We traveled with 6 of our friends. Our experience was great! I feel I can say that for our entire group. We traveled from America. I must say, that we were some of the few Americans at this resort. That was interesting to say the least. We met several people from different countries. The diversity was great! We had not problems with immigration going into and leaving the Dominican. Once we arrived at the resort, the staff was very helpful. All of our rooms were spacious, very clean and stocked with a great mini bar. We took the advice from other reviews and tipped the maids each day. They always left us extra bottled water and drinks in our rooms. The food at the buffet was okay. Our group tends to like more spice and we found in this country, more sweet spices are used or none at all. But, we always found enough to eat! We ate at the Caribe twice. Our group upgraded to VIP. I strongly recommend this. You get the perks of the beds at the beach and the pool. I usually took our towels down to the beach around 7:00 am to save 2 to 3 beds and 8 lounge chairs. We never had a problem with enough space. The beach is large and very beautiful. Unlike another all-inclusive resort that my husband and I visited, at the Princess you could walk for miles up and down the shoreline. The sand was white and baby soft. The weather was great. Only one hard rain storm and a couple of afternoon showers. We took advantgage of our VIP motor sport package by taking a speed boat up the coast toward Dolphin Island. The driver stopped beside a Rum-Runner boat which was cruising the coast. Two words: BUBBA-KEG! Those in the know, will know what I mean! Overall, our experience was great. The one thing that was hard to adjust to was the topless beach. As Americans, we are not used to that. However, after the first day, it was not a big deal. I know the guys enjoyed it! We are all ready to go back. Definitely a world class resort. As many reviews here have said, your vacation is what you make of it. We certaintly made ours FUN! Oh, please say HI to Carlos if you visit the resort. He made the week alot of fun! THE LEGEND LIVES!  
<Date>Jun 9, 2007

<Author>cher818
<Content>loved the princess we just returned from the pcp on june 5th, we had a great time, the hotel is nice and kept very clean. rooms are large and stocked with soda and dominican beer. the pool is large and never crowded. there never was a problem getting a lounge chair as some reviews stated, we did not need to go down and save a chair at 6am..same at the beach there is plenty. the food is average at the buffets, ala cartes are very good, we ate at all of them at the princess and 1 at the caribe...never disapointed.as far as the vip goes, if you want it for the upgrade on the drinks only, dont bother they use the i dont understand you when it comes to asking for something premium, my husband got maybe 3 budweisers while there and they always had to go find it. but everything else was well worth the vip. the room alone was worth the extra cash/ we had room 5211 beautiful pool and ocean view and all the extras beach towels, cigars rum....all in all it was a great vaca spot . the beach is beautiful to say the least and the staff are excellent, very very nice...friendly...this is a very nice resort not a 5 star but a close 4 star in my opinion.

<Author>flytrumpet
<Content>Awesome honeymoon !!!! We went to the PCP for our honeymoon from may 13-20.What a fantastic place.Everything is immaculate,lobby,grounds,rooms,pool,restaurant,beach...just great.Employees are great and the service is top notch.Don't forget to bring $1 bills as they will be really appreciated at the bars.Don't forget the maids either,they work extremely hard.A far as food goes,no complaints here,buffet was huge and it was basically impossible to not find at least a couple of things to like.A la carte restaurants were also good(we did La petite fondue,(which is excellent),tex mex,which is also very good,and the italian at the sister resort.What more is there to say,just go and enjoy,you won't be disapointed.If you ask for a room in the 5000 building,you will be minutes from the pool and beach.But the resort is small so everything is a very short walk.

<Author>PrincessNyc
<Content>Wonderful Vacation Experience Two friends and I stayed at the Punta Cana Princess from May 17-May 22, 2007, what a beautiful resort! The front desk staff was exceptionally friendly when we arrived and we were given an excellent room in the 5000 building (best location)...we were steps from the pool and beach as well. The grounds are kept immaculately clean and the staff is always friendly and eager to make your stay enjoyable. VIP is definelty the way to go and worth the few extra dollars. The beds on the beach are extremely comfortable and always kept clean. Some of the staff that deserve a notable mention are Nelson (bartender from the beach bar)...he was extremley friendly and made the best drinks! The whole animation staff was great but Super Carlos was definelty super with us, he always invited us to participate in all of the activities and made us laugh the whole trip! Alejandro from the buffet was very friendly and always made sure we were satisfied at the buffet. The buffet offered an excellent variety of food...breakfast was excellent....if you plan on tipping during your vacation don't forget the omelete guy and the juice guy...they will be extremely grateful, as was everyone else who we tipped during our vacation...they make very little money at the resort and they work 11 days straight before getting 4 days off...and most of them live over 4 hours away!!!!!If you plan on going dancing; Areito was okay but not a great mix of music...oh yes and if you are planning on paying with American $$$ take plenty of singles....BEWARE OF ADA the bartender at Areito....she caught amnesia when I paid with a $20 bill...she implied that I never ordered a drink from her, then she claimed I paid with a $10 bill.....at the end of it she made of with $14 for herself....not to ruin my vacation I let it go.The beach is absoluelty beautiful, if you plan on taking an excurssion the half day snorkeling trip held by Carribean Festival is the best....great time on the boat and swimming with the sharks and stingray.Overall the resort is excellent and the staff make the trip all the better....I would definetely recommend this resort !!!!

<Author>happyseniors
<Content>A Wonderful Holiday My husband and I are seniors (in fact he is a senior senior) and although we seldom go on all inclusives this one was truly wonderful. As he has some difficulty with stairs we asked for and got a ground floor room in Bldg 5 the closest to the beach and the pool. The room was large and clean BUT very musty smelling. We turned the AC off and opened the patio door ( and main door when we were there) and got a lovey breeze which after a couple of days cleared the air. We believe it is the air conditioner that causes the smell . We found the beach to be lovely ( very much like the beaches in Antigua where we go frequenlty. ) However being as it is the Atlantic and not the Caribbean, the sea is farily rough..you can certainly swim, and we did every day but it can be quite a challenge!!! I am not sure if it is ever calm. But great for sailing !We thought the food was really quite good. The buffet was great with a lot of variety. Breakfasts were wonderful!!!The a la carte restaurants were good too . As other reviewers have mentioned, if you want to book one of the exclusive restaurants at the other hotels that come with the VIP package, do it immediately upon arrival or the best one (La Cava by all accounts) will be taken.We went to El Pescador instead which was ok but not great. Staff are so friendly. My husband speaks Spanish and I can stumble along in it and they realy liked that!!! They were always chatting and smiling and nothing was too mcuh trouble for themWe did find the DJ at the pool very loud around noon each day as he gets people to do aquacises in the pool. and the music (and his voice) is deafening and pretty irritating actualy. . He does it again aroudn 4:00. But it only lasts half an hour or so. We just closed the door!!!At no time did we have any mosquitoes and we had our door open all day long including the evening...No did we have any stomach or other upsets..I strongly believe those are caused mainly by over eating, over drinking and too much heat!!!This is a small (270 rooms) hotel with nothing more that a three or four mintue walk away. This is good for us older folk!!!I would recommend it highly to anyone. I think if you want a really lively nightlife you woudl need to go elsewhere.  
<Date>May 24, 2007

<Author>TennesseeBelle
<Content>Great Staff, Great Beach, Great R This has been a wonderful vacation. We did the Adult Onlyall inclusive at Punta Cana Princess...We also enjoyedthe other properties...There is nothing missing.You do need to book you dinner reservations, beforecoming....they were all booked prior to our arrival....So when you book your trip...book your dinners.Make sure you ask if they are included in the all inclusive...some are and some are not.The Service was Exceptional...very professional...The Beach is soooo beautiful...Topless bathingis premitted and 30% did it...young and old alike!Make sure you weigh you luggage...cannot be over45 pds at the island and 50 pds in the states.Carry an extra $100 for unexpected expenses, likethe tourist tax...extra weight...The Presidente Beer was Great...free flowing 24/7,as well as the liquors....BahamaMaMa with DarkRum was Wonderful....You will not be disappointed!!! The Best timeto go (free of bugs) is April and Early May.

<Author>sunseeker64
<Content>Wow... you won't be dissapointed at the Punta Cana Princess !!! That is a promise.... So.... I was obsessive about reading the reviews and checking out the forums for the PCP for weeks before my trip and all I can say is this resort is fantastic. If you go with the attitude that you are on vacation and leave your expectations at home, you will have the time of your life. That being said, there are some areas that will exceed your expectations.Rooms: Very nice, clean, clean, clean. a/c worked exceedingly well and the maids were fantastic. Don't forget to tip... They work from sun up until very, very late at night and make next to nothing. Pool : Beautiful, well kept, lots of shade and the swim up bar was great. No kids, no loud music and if I had to offer only one morsel, it was that there was no pool side drink service. You had to either swim up or walk up to get served.Staff: These people are the hardest workers I have ever seen. They work and work and work to make this resort clean and comfortable. They are quick with a hello and the hugs are a plenty. Tip, tip, tip and you will not be sorry. A buck goes a very long way. Beach: Not much to say here but lovely. One of the most beautiful I have ever seen... Food : Well ........This is the only negative experience that I can speak of. Although there are many choices, don't go with an expectation that you will be having a fine dining experience. The fodd was tolerable and I always found somehting to eat, but honestly it just isn't very good. From everything that I have heard and read this is not just at the PCP, but at most of the resorts too. The cuts of meat are different and they try very hard to have something for everyone. To me (and I am a foodie from SF) this is not a deal breaker. Drinks: Unless you like really sweet drinks, you might want to consider bringing your own mixers.. I know that sounds crazy but even the mixer were a little odd. The soda was odd, the tonic was odd and the OJ tasted like tang. There really is no good wine choice and if you are a wine drinker, bring your own. The beer is okay when cold (don't forget the bubba keg) and there is always a very happy and gracious bartender to get you whatever you want. I love my morning mimosa(s) !!!! Bottom line - this is a terrific place. I would not hesitate to return or to recommend the PCP to anyone. Go with a good attitude, plenty of ones and fives (100.00 of both), a couple of good books, ton's of sunscreen, bug spray and a bubba keg and a good time is assured !!!  
<Date>May 21, 2007

<Author>Fox43
<Content>Love the Princess We were at the Punta Cana Princess May 11-18. I wish we could have stayed longer. The staff went out of their way to make our time there absolutely perfect.We did the VIP upgrade, and it was worth it. The room had everything we needed and more. It was very nice to have the option of room service, however the restaurant choices were more than ample. Even the buffet provided such a nice variety, it was hard to decide where to eat. Believe me, we didn't go hungry!The drinks were all good. The bartenders would make anything you wanted - and made it well. I'm sure some people may have thought the drinks were weak, but all you have to do is say something. All the staff wanted the guests happy and they would do anything you asked.The grounds were kept immaculate. The beach area, and pool area were constantly maintained. I never saw trash laying around and the bathrooms were constantly being cleaned.We loved that this was Adults Only, and it's a small resort which makes it feel more intimate. Everything was a short walk away. We visited the sister resorts Carbe-Princess and Tropical Princess, and they were nice too, but we were so glad that we booked at the Punta Cana Princess.I have nothing bad to say about this resort. It was PERFECT.

<Author>pkes
<Content>Loved the Princess! We traveled to the Punta Cana Princess from Apr 29-May 3. We had a fantastic time at the resort. We booked it through [--] and although we had to wait about 20 min for our driver, we made it to the resort with relative ease. Our room was not ready, but we were able to enjoy a nice buffet lunch at the restaurant. The food at the buffet was pretty good. There was always something you good find to eat. We also ventured mainly to the pool buffet for lunches since you could eat while still wearing your bathing suit. We really enjoyed the a la carte restaurants for our dinners, particularly the Mare Norstrom and the Fondue restaurant. We also enjoyed the Creperie at that neighboring resort for lunches and snacks. We found a range of quality at the bars. We found the pool and lobby bars to be the best. As for the resort, the grounds were beautiful. Our room was spacious and we were able to easily switch from two double beds to a king-size bed. The only issue in the room were the mosquitoes that were sometimes let in from the housekeeping staff. I would recommend bringing some bug spray. The pool and beach were beautiful as well and we didn have any trouble finding huts to sit under. We had thought about the VIP package, but ended up not getting it and were just as content. The Princess is the 3rd and newest (built 2003) resort in the complex of Princess resorts. They have trams that take you to the other 2 resorts and the casino. You sometimes have to wait a bit for the trams but the walk is not that bad (about 10 minutes to the Caribe). You cannot walk to the casino, but it is really not worth the trip there despite how much they promote it. (but we aren gamblers)They have shows every night that occur in the theater by the Caribe. If you have an 8:30 dinner reservation it is hard to make the start of the show at 9:45, but we caught the end of a few shows (magic, carnival, etc)During the day the staff runs activities such as archery, darts, ping pong, volleyball, etc. The staff is very nice and will teach you how to do anything. It was, however sometimes hard to find where the activity was meeting when it was supposed to be occurring. The staff at the resort was super friendly and extremely hardworking. Overall, a great resort, very reasonably priced for this quality!

<Author>Kathryn75
<Content>Paradise! I have just returned from a two week stay at the Punta Cana Princess. If you are planning on travelling to Punta Cana I would most definately recommend this resort. I travelled to Punta Cana with my finace and two of our friends. For the first two hours of our arrival we were all simply awestruck by the beauty and perfection of the resort. Within minutes of our arrival we were greeted with drinks while we waited to check in. Our room was by far the nicest hotel room that we have ever stayed in. Not only was it huge, it was immaculate and air conditioned to perfection. The mini fridge was stocked every single day with sprite, coke, beer and water. One day we asked the maid if she could supply us with two bottles of each and she did so without any hesitation. We did tip the maids $3 a day which we found extremely fair. They work so hard all day long, it doesn't really matter when you leave the sign out to have your room cleaned, wether it is 8 a.m or 3 p.m. it is guarenteed to be finished within an hour. Every single member of staff that we encountered were extremely friendly. From the maids, maintenence people, bellboys, and security, to the guest service representatives, enteratiners, bartenders, waiters, waitresses and cooks, all the way to the manager and medical team we were greeted with a smile. The staff are willing to help at the drop of a hat and will go out of their way to satisfy you. We were shocked at how much variety and how good the food was. There was definately no shortage of food and it was always kept warm. Obviously, if you go for breakfast at 9:45 a.m the food is in worse condition than it was at 7a.m. However, we did eat breakfast at this time on many mornings and the food was still excellent and plenty of it. As for the lunch and dinner buffets it really didn't matter when you went, the food was always great. The resuraunts that you have to reserve were excellent. Once again the food was great and the staff were outstanding. Remember though that you do have to reserve for the specialty resturaunts and reservations go fast. The sister resorts next door (Caribe Club/Tropical Princess) also have extremely good food. In fact, not to take away from the food at the Punta Cana Princess because it was also outstanding, but the sister resorts had even more variety. We ate at most of the resturaunts and have no complaints about any one of them. All of the bars are great. The bartenders are so comical and a small tip goes a long way! The Beach and Pool areas are kept in excellent condition, the maintenence people work so hard to keep the seaweed out of the water and off of the shore, and the sand is groomed nightly. As for the pool the area is also in spectacular condition. Heads up though, there are a ton of shaded areas on the beach but we found that since were are younger (early 20's) we woke up much later than the other people, and were hard pushed to find shade on the beach when we rolled out of bed at 11 a.m. This was totally our own fault though, if we had got up earlier I'm sure we would have had no problem. Even with that being said, we always found somewhere to sit. Tips for travelling to Punta Cana/ staying at Punta Cana Princess:1) Bring bug spray (oh my goodness, we got eaten alive. This could possibly be due to the time of year but it sucked. We had to by bug repellant from the resort store which cost us a whopping $14 for the smallest bottle). 2) Stay hydrated! Unfortunately my finance did not do this so well. This was a combination of being over excited for free beer and beautiful sunshine. He learned his lesson after a two day stay at the hospital. Thank god we had travel insurance. 3) Tip the staff. They work so hard to please everyone, $2-$3 goes a long way. It might not mean a lot to you but it really does to them. Plus, it gets you fast service. 4)Bring medicine like pepto bismal, immodium, advil, gravol etc. Travellers stomach bugs and diarahea is really common there. 5) At the airport as soon as you arrive they charge you a $10 airport tax. We were unaware of this and were scrounging for our money.6) Don't buy from the store on the resort. It is a huge rip off. Walk down the beach a little and there is a market. They will try to way over charge you. Usually you can talk them down to less then half of their original offer.  
<Date>May 18, 2007

<Author>jim48d
<Content>great resort We stayed at the Princess May 6 thru the 12. The resort is fantastic,rooms clean, staff friendly and drinks are great. The only thing that I would even say was a little bad was the food selection, you need a wide pallet to find something to enjoy, what they had was always fresh just a little different. The pool is beautiful and the swim up bar great. I have never seen such lovely beaches, the sand is so soft you just can't belive it. The only problem we had was with our airline, DELTA. Take my advise and avoid them like the plague. They delayed us leaving Nashville and we missed our flight out of Atlanta and when we got to Atlanta we got more stories than Mother Goose wrote as to why the delay. No help from respresentives just a gate person who listened to us but could not do anything. On the way back same problem this airline does not seem to know what it is doing. Punta Cana is still trying to develop itself for tourist but be prepared the tours are nice but not quite organized as I would like to see them. As far as going back I would to the resort but will give the country a few years to catch up with development.
