<Author>PooandSat
<Content>Best Place Ever! Poo and Sat- London EnglandWe stayed here from 30th April-7th May 2007 and loved it!This place is FANTASTIC!! The 9 hour journey from London was worth it. The Punta Cana airport is a sight in itself with its thatched roof, musicians and traditionally dressed woman to greet you on your arrival. To make you aware- when these ladies grab your arm, they arenot crowd control- a photograph is being taken. This will be made available to purchase on your departure for 10$. Nice little touch. The beach is the best we have ever seen- and we have seen a fair few. It was long, wide and clean. You could walk miles and miles. Gorgeous!The resort is self contained with everything easily accessible. We loved riding the shuttle bus through the beautiful grounds.The nearby Casino and Palma Real (the shopping centre) arrange their own shuttles to and from the resort. We did kind of get addicted to Blackjack thanks to the gentleman from the Casino who kindly taught us how to play in the lobby. Bavaro Plaza was great for shopping. Find the right shop and you can get everything you want at a good price. Always offer much less than the original price quoted and pick up some bargains. Disappointingly, the rum was not as inexpensive as we thought it would be.Nightlife wise- there is a club- Arieto- within the resort and this has free entry and drinks until 12am. We did go a couple of times and whilst we enjoyed it- they could do with more non spanish music. The staff were friendly and helpful. Language was a bit of a barrier but everyone managed to communicate somehow. The food was excellent and cannot be faulted. We easily managed to overeat at every meal every day. We mainly ate at the buffet restaurant but there are a number of al a carte restaurants available so we tried out the mexican and italian and found them to be very good. Drinks wise- as the other reviewer mentioned- the mixers were very sweet and so there are only a certain number of cocktails you can stomach. So, stick to good old rum and coke. We checked the weather forecast prior to travelling and expected rain however were pleasantly surprised as we had sunshine every day and it was HOT HOT HOT!There was a good mix of other nationalities particulary Canadians and Americans. We made some good friends from Newfoundland and Quebec City (you know who you are ;-)) who we will keep in touch with and hopefully return to PCP with. The resort manager took care of the guests and the resort. Always very friendly and eager to please and even personally secured us a reservation to an already full al a carte restuarant.There are many excursions available but we did not book any. We did parasail though and that was an enjoyable experience. Can't wait to return to this place and can't see us wanting to holiday anywhere else ever again!  
<Date>May 16, 2007

<Author>RIRested
<Content>Beautiful Place to Vacation We stayed at the Punta Cana Princess Resort May 5-12 with friends from IL and CO. Traveling to and from the Dominican Republic was fine. Our check in to Princess was easy and the room was very nice. We were all on the 2nd floor of the 4th building (it overlooks the pool and you can see the ocean from there). The beach was probably the nicest sand that I have been on and the resort does a good job of removing the seaweed compared to the other resorts. The resort facilities and landscape are nicer than the sister resorts, Tropical and Caribe. The food was kind of hit or miss. We found that the buffet style restaurants varied between the two resorts. Ours (Casabe) was better for breakfast and the one at Caribe (El Higuero) was better for lunch and dinner. I think most of that had to do with the Caribe being a much larger resort with more variety in food. We did run into more difficulty with vegetarian options than we did in the Mayan Rivera. The a la carte restaurants do not list all of their ingredients on the menu and often times a dish would arrive to the table with meat on it. The staff was accommodating once we explained vegetarians don't eat meat. We ate at La Cava for our speciality dinner and it was the best meal we had. The desserts were a bit bland and wish I would have brought some chocolate with me. The staff is amazing, very hard workers, and always smiling.  They have basketball, tennis, ping-pong, shuffleboard, bocce, archery, volleyball (beach and pool), fitness center, and mini golf available.I would definitely recommend Princess Punta Cana. The adults only was a nice change from screaming kids. I would also recommend the VIP package. The VIP area on the beach was great and you did not have to arrive early in the morning to get a spot. VIP package included 20 min massage, premium drinks, 1 hour of motorized watersports, 1 SCUBA dive for certified divers, a complimentary dinner at a speciality restaurant (others are charged a fee to eat there), 1 bottle of rum and 3 cigars in your room, 2 beach towels in your room per day, nightly turndown service, 1 hour free internet service, room service, bathrobe use and access to VIP area at the beach and poolside. The VIP 1 hour of motorized water sports (as it is stated on a ticket that the VIP desk hands you) is only valid for 15 minutes for some reason and only includes the banana boat, tubing, water-skiing or a boat ride (this one lasts 45-60min). It does not include the other activities they advertise at the booth. We did do the free SCUBA dive that was included in the VIP for certified divers and we were glad it was free. Unfortunately, the Pelicano dive operation is poorly run and the health of the reefs are poor. If you SCUBA dive I would not hassle with bringing your own gear down with you like we did. We planned on diving several times, but after the huge dissapointment with the first dive, I wouldn't waste my time.We all tried to speak Spanish as much as possible to locals. I would highly recommend it to anyone traveling there as it was much appreciated by all the staff. We also brought little gifts (books, crayons, nail polish, toys, etc) for the staff and their family which was also very much appreciated.  
<Date>May 15, 2007

<Author>Paaj
<Content>Relaxing Resort filled with Friendly People This is the most comprehensive review. It's long, but it's worth it. These are my views and hints for traveling to this resort. I traveled with my boyfriend to this resort from May 4-8th. When booking this trip we were very worried about whether we would find a good place. When we looked at the reviews on tripadvisor we were amazed at the great reviews. We were still a little skeptical and thought that there must be something wrong with the place since we got such a great deal. Boy were we wrong. We had an absolutely wonderful time at the resort. The lady at the reception desk was a little rude when we checked in, but the receptionists after her were very friendly. We quickly noticed that there was a language barrier between ourselves and the staff. Everyone spoke Spanish, but very few people spoke or understood English. We didn't expect this before we arrived so we didn't prepare ourselves by bringing any type of translation dictionary. I think this would have been handy at times when we wanted to ask something, but had no idea what to say. As we walked through the resort we were constantly greeted by the employees with a cheerful Hola!. Everyone was so friendly. our room did smell a little musty, but that's expected for a sealed room in a tropical resort. I would suggest bringing your own pillow or an additional pillowcase since some of the pillows also had a musty smell. The room was very clean and spacious. If you're a late sleeper (ie. past 9am) I would suggest putting the Do Not Disturb sign on your door before you go to bed. We were often awoken by the staff. It did take until mid afternoon to have our rooms cleaned, but I think that was because we kept returning to the room and changing the sign. When we wanted our room clean we contacted the front desk and it was done within the hour. We also received a call from the management asking us whether our room was cleaned to our satisfaction.The food at the resort could be considered hit or miss. The restaurant food was amazing. You have to make a reservation at least the night before for the restaurants on your resort and 2 days in advance for the restaurants at the neighbouring resorts. This was a disappointment since our stay was only for 4 days and we were not able to eat at the restaurants our first night. Also, some of the restaurants are not always open so make sure you check with the receptionist to see which days they are closed. The lunch buffets were usually the same and were not very good, but the dinners more then made up for it. The breakfast buffets were enormous and usually your stomach got full before you could try everything you wanted.We wanted to take advantage of the activities that were offered and found that we got the best deal from the beachside business. Snorkeling was very cheap and only $20 a person for 1 hour of snorkeling. Parasailing was a little expensive at $45 a person for only 15min, but it was well worth the money. The helper on the boat even took tons of pictures for us since by the time it was our turn most of the people were taken off the boat.The beach was absolutely beautiful. The sand was powdery white and felt so soft on your feet. The lounge chairs under the huts tended to be taken up very quickly in the mornings and usually covered with towels, but no people. The neighbouring resort had a no reservation policy and I would have preferred that since it seemed as though no one returned to 'their' chairs past noon. Beach towels were available for free everyday and you could exchange them as many times as you liked, but don't lose them otherwise you'll pay for it.One big this to note. Do NOT use the international calling from your room. We were charged 50 pesos for just using the phone and then my boyfriend was charged $30US for a 1-2 minute call to the US. I would instead bring a calling card and use the payphone in the lobby. You might get a better deal that way.US currency was widely accepted along with credit cards. All items for sale in the little stores were in Dominican Pesos, but when it came to the purchase they would convert the amount to US dollars and put it on your credit card. I don't know if this was the best rate, but there were no additional charges on my card. There is an ATM onside, but the rate along with the fees your bank charges is worse then what you would get at the front desk. My suggestion is to either bring Pesos with your or exchange them at the front desk.One suggestion to the resort would be to have better maps available for each guest. We often had no idea where we were going or where anything was. All 3 resorts are within walking distance of each other, but I would take the free trolley the first time so that you get a feel for where everything is.Well, I hope you've enjoyed my thorough review. I hope you enjoy your vacation as much as we did!!  
<Date>May 14, 2007

<Author>jackattackbrighton
<Content>rock out at the princess! My boyfriend and I stayed 10 days at the PCP 5/4/2007-5/13/2007 and we loved every single day. The resort itself was very well polished and much, much prettier than in the photos!Next door to the resort is it sister property, where children are allowed. And you are welcome to make reservations for dinner at their restaurants, and use their facilities as well. I never saw a child at our resort; they are very good about being strict on that policy.Behind the resort there is a huge stretch of marshland where you can see practically every type of bird the Caribbean has to offer!We did tip our bartenders and maids, which I think accounted for our drinks being just about as strong as you can make them! But it seemed that everyone was getting great service all around. Neither my boyfriend or I speak Spanish, but most people at the resort did perfectly, some more than others. Aside from a few awkward moments, we had virtually no language barriers.For the downsides to the resort, well there were very few. It is important to make reservations at the specialty restaurants for dinner. They are very quirky about this policy. You can make 3 reservations at a time, but you can go to each one as many times as you like. If you, hypothetically, get way too drunk at the swim up bar and miss your reservation, it ok, because the large buffet always has something great cooking. HUGE plates of pasta where you can add in your own mix-ins, a grill cooking up different fish, and meats, and chicken, sometimes they had a Caesar salad station, and that was phenomenal!. During the day they have a huge buffet as well, but also a beach buffet where you are allowed to enter in your bathing suit. They make the best fried chicken of all time!The breakfast buffet is open from 7-10 and they have a huge juice bar with 10 different types of fresh juices and juice blends that they make right there in a blender. So good!The beach was great, like a caribean post card! You could swim out or snorkel a little ways, but you couldn go too deep because there is a lot of boat traffic right off shore. People doing motorized sports, and taking speedboats out to snorkel and such like that.They have snorkeling everyday at the beach at 11am and 3pm, its 20$ and they take you on a 15min speed boat ride, out to a section of coral, and let you swim around for about an hour and then they zip you right back to the hotel. It was really nice and we saw a lot of fish.We never made it out to the disco, but we could hear the one next door at the LTI and it sounded like an extreme amount of fun.So all in all our room was always clean, our drinks always strong, and the beach always an endless, soft, white strip of inviting fun. We recommend the PCP to anyone!  
<Date>May 14, 2007

<Author>lorijeannj
<Content>Muy Bien! My husband and I just returned from Punta Cana Princess All Suites with VIP package for 6 nights, May 2 - May 8. We had the most relaxing vacation of all vacations.Having travelled extensively elsewhere in the Caribbean and Europe, this was our first visit to Punta Cana. Our experience with Punta Cana was fantastic. We had no problems nor issues thanks to all members of TripAdvisor for their shared experiences of which helped us in our travel plans and what and what not to expect in Punta Cana.We booked our airfare directly with Spirit Airlines and did hotel separetly because Spirit did not offer Punta Cana Princess in their vacation packages. This trip was our first for booking with an online travel agency and we used bookit.com and I have to say we were very pleased. Three days before we were to leave, I sent an email to bookit asking for a reconfirmation and Nicole responded that everything was okay on their end. Experience with bookit.com was very pleasing. Checkin at Punta Cana Princess confirmed this, uneventful and quick. We had our voucher and they had our wrist bands and room key ready.We arrived at 2:00 p.m. and were in our room by 2:20 p.m. Luggage wasbrought up by the bellmen minutes later. It was now time for a cerveza.Our room was wonderful. Our welcoming gifts (part of VIP) greeted us as we entered our room, cigars and a bottle of rum. Flower pedals were adorned in the bathroom. Fridge had cold soda, water and beer. We had a nice step down sitting area that led to a nice sized balconywhich overlooked the pool and the beautiful ocean. There is a safe we used. A shower with hot and high pressured water. The room was very comfy for the week. Our 6 nights were wonderful, very, very relaxing. We never really left the resort except for a night to the disco, casino and our gourmet dinner at La Cava at the Caribe Princess.The beach is awesome. We hung out there most of the time except for the time we walked to the beach bar for mas cervezas, which was quite often :)Never ever had a problem finding a VIP bed by the beach. The cabanas seem to all have been taken daily, but we really didn't notice because we were happy with our beach bed. The pool, what pool? We were there for the beach. But have to admit a dip in the pool before noon and a Bloody Mary at the swim up pool bar did the trick.The beach is awesome. No shells, no rocks, no nothing. Just sand and aqua clear waters. Sunbathing topless for woman seems to be acceptable and did not deter wifie from doing, it is quite relaxing.Make sure you have plenty of sunscreen for the areas that don't see the light of day much and leave some for the rest of your body. The sun is strong! We aren't buffet eaters so our dinners were at the al a carte restaurants. Tex Mex was the worse. La Cava (gourmet, Caribe Princess) was great except we had to wait over an hour just for our appetizer, but it appeared everyone in the restaurant that night did as well. Not sure what that was about and didn't ask.We had breakfast two mornings in the main buffet area (we are not early risers). Not bad. Loved those fried bananas.Lunch, we always found something at the beach bar, all day. As a matter of fact, the beach bar is open 24 hrs, so if you are thirsty for a cerveza or hungry at 3 a.m. and want some chicken, they will cook it for you.Not once did we get an upset stomach or even have a feeling of getting an upset stomach. We weren't afraid to try anything and ate different foods such as burger, fried chicken (yum yum!), fish fritter, shrimp, lobster, fruit, different salads, caesar salad, ice cream, crepes, sandwiches and pizza.We have read so many different reviews of people getting upset stomachs in Punta Cana (not necessarily the Punta Cana Princess) and from what others have stated, we believe it is from overdrinking and too much sun. When the sun is cooking and you are drinking alcohol, dehydration comes into play. Remember to drink water.Went to the Arieto disco one night. It was okay. Five dollars for a cerveza. Locals come here after work as well as tourists. All we can say is be careful and watch your back. Not saying we had a problem, just saying be careful. This disco is not managed by any Princess resort and you are on your own..Another night we went to the casino. If anyone should decide to go here, please email us and we will give you our address so you can just send us the money instead of dumping it there.Two nights we went to the Caribe Princess, just for dinner. La Cava and the Brazilian restaurant. Other than that did not spend any time at the Caribe.There is a tram that takes you to all three places above, the casino, disco and Caribe. This was nice. Even nicer was walking back from the Caribe on the beach. Banana boat ride is a must (included with VIP). We did a snorkel trip as well for one hour, twenty dollars per person. Well worth it.For both they pick you up on beach. Reservations can be made at beach activities area.For transportation to and from the airport we prepaid with Rafael Silvia for private transportation (no sharing). On arrival to Punta Cana Airport (PUJ) there was no representative for T.S.Silvia there as stated per our voucher. There were other drivers holding signs similar to this name, but someone approached us and we told him we had a voucher and he called for us and someone was there in fifteen minutes, no biggie, our flight was early anyway. When getting off the airplane, a souvenir picture for purchase on departure is taken then you step forward and pay ten dollars per person (US$) for a tourist card of which you hand in steps away. Departure was just as easy. Our driver was prompt at picking us up at Punta Cana Princess and we picked up no one else on the way to PUJ.No problems or issues at airport. Of course we did purchase the souvenir picture!Our experience overall with Punta Cana Princess was wonderful. Hector at the beach bar and Amarillo our room maid made our trip very comfortable and relaxing. The employees here go out of their way for you and for this service we tipped appropriately. We rated our experience as a five star, because everything went perfect. If you go, remember to take a minute and notice all the beautiful flora that grows there; beautiful colors and the greenest foliage. Whatever we missed to relate of our experience we are sure someone else has experienced and shared.Ed and LoriP.S. - We brushed our teeth everyday and night with the tap water. No problema.  
<Date>May 13, 2007

6	160(relax):1	566(woman):1	1214(acceptable):1	1570(topless):1	2892(sunbathe):1	4539(deter):1	

<Author>Sarabring
<Content>Wonderfully relaxing A group of 42, 55+ just returned from a week stay (May1-8). We had a great time. Relaxed, tanned, and no one went hungry. Some had VIP, some not. We did and would have had a great time without. The beach towels in the rooms were nice but it was no hassle to get fresh ones at the beach. As everyone has said, the resort is very clean. We stayed in the 5000 bldg and would recommend an upper floor. We visited a few ground flours and they were musty smelling. Everyone was very friendly and made us feel welcomed and took care of every need. I do have some issues with the VIP liquor. I like Absolute and couldn't get it at the pool bar. At the lobby they had to send to the beach bar for it. They did, but I felt like they only had one bottle for all the bars. Also, it seemed like they only had sweet mixers. I couldn't get cranberry juice. As you can see, no big problems. We found food to eat. We ate at the El Baccio and the La Cava and The Fondue place. We enjoyed them all. The sea food at La Cava was very generous and good. Don't expect to eat and run at the ala cart places. Dinner is usually 2 hours. We enjoyed the Animacion team. Fun and friendly. We went to the shows at the Caribe. Sometimes long, but not bad. We went to the Casino. Not large but fun entertainment. Watch the water. I took Pepto Bismal every day and had two days when I didn't feel like drinking, but didn't stop eating! Overall we really enjoyed it.  
<Date>May 12, 2007

<Author>RooseveltL
<Content>Good All-Inclusive - not luxurious but nice I required a 2 nt stay to attend a wedding held in Punta Cana area. I choose this resort because it didn't have a minimum stay requirement and also was adults-only no rugrats running around.The check-in and room process was simple. The room had some small ants in the bathroom but I was in the Carribbean so didn't complain or think of it as a problem. Room was furnished with bed, sofa/bed, tv, ceiling fan, balcony, fridge (stocked with beer, coke, sprite  bottled water), and iron board. Beach was great, adequate number of bars (none were full or long wait) and VIP section was nice. I didn't venture to the other properties available via the same wristband.The buffet area for food was okay - nothing to write home about as I would've like more Dominican flavor meals (plantains, mangos, etc.) but I guess they must cater to a wide range of palettes.I found the staff nice but most didn't speak English beyond their basic functions. A good place just for relaxation and a few beverages.There is no major nightlife at this resort and things are very quiet after 10pm.I attended a wedding a Majestic Colonial which was much larger and nicer accommodations (each room had a shower  huge jaccuzzi tub) but they had a 3 nt minimum, but if I were to return to this part of DR I would choose this facility. I would probably not stay at this resort again but not because of anything negative just think there are better places available.  
<Date>May 9, 2007

<Author>Babas
<Content>Wish I was still at the Punta Cana Princess April 21-28We enjoyed a glorious week at the Punta Cana Princess. Our experience went way beyond our expectations as we'd read a lot of negative postings. We are actually considering returning. Arrival Sunquest states in their brochure that the hotel is a 20-minute drive from the airport. What they fail to tell you is that we had to stop at 3 other hotels on the way which makes the drive last just over an hour. Our arrival at Punta Cana airport was very quick and very well-organized. We arrived at the resort around 10:30 p.m. and check-in was quick. We bought the VIP package and the front desk clerk gave us our VIP bracelets and asked me if I minded coming back between 9:00-12:00 the next day to pick up my package which was locked at guest services and she didn't have a key. I really didn't mind because I wanted to make all our a-la-carte reservations the next day after breakfast anyway. They tagged our luggage with our room number and it followed about 5 minutes after we'd let ourselves in our room. Overall Cleanliness  Layout One word - spotless! From the rooms, to the lobby, to the grounds - there's always someone cleaning. Also, the proximity of every service at the resort is pretty close. In our opinion, this was definitely one of the advantages to a smaller resort. Rooms We had room 5205. Third floor, king size bed, full bath. We'd requested Bldg 5/3rd floor and got it. Our view was beach and pool bar. It was cleaned every day in the morning and towels and beverages were replaced/replenished around 6:00 p.m. every night. Each room has a big golf umbrella and bathrobes that you can use during your stay. The safe requires you to program it with your own 4-digit code. We had no theft problems while we were there. Guest Services Arrived at Guest Services shortly after 9:00 a.m. on Sunday morning. There was one couple in front of me waiting to make reservations while another couple was finishing up. My total wait time was about 15 minutes so no biggie there. I was able to make 4 reservations at once including La Cava which was part of the VIP package. She told me that I could reserve another if I'd like but only later on in the week and at least 24-hours prior. She also informed me that the opening of -la-carte restaurants varied from day to day. I found this out while making our reservations. For example, I would ask for Brazilian for 8:30 on Monday and she would reply they're closed on Monday but I can give you Brazilian on Wednesday and Tex Mex on Monday. FYI - all the -la-carte menus are on a rack next to Guest Services and you can look at them any time which makes it much easier to make your choices. She then gave me my VIP envelope which included two cards for massages, two for one-hour Internet service, two for motorized water sports and two for La Cava. Restaurants Just one word of advice: if you like wine with your meal and plan on drinking from the wine list, the prices are very high. We knew this before leaving so bought 3 bottles at Duty-Free and didn't regret it. For example, a bottle of Yellow Tail Shiraz was $15 US and we only paid $10 CDN at Duty-Free. House red and white are available. The red isn't too bad if it's a little chilled.Dress code: the Buffet insists that you wear a t-shirt or some sort of cover up (males  females) at breakfast and lunch as you will be refused entrance if you're just wearing a bikini top and pareo, if you're wet or in your bare feet. Dress code for all the -la-cartes stipulate that men have to wear a collared shirt and long pants. No restrictions on footwear for men. Hubby wore leather sandals. Men were allowed dress shorts at the buffet for dinner. Breakfast was always at the buffet and was always good. Yes, it can happen that all the silverware isn't on your table but we never experienced a staffer not setting the table for us or not coming back when we requested a missing piece. We can't understand why others had such a problem with this. I can understand vegetarian posters who've complained of lack of choice, but I'm also under the impression that it doesn't matter where you go in the islands, you're pretty much out of luck if you're not a meat or fish eater. On the other hand, if you're not vegetarian and can't find anything to eat, then you should rethink travelling anywhere. Hubby actually heard someone complain that he couldn't find anything to eat because he was a meat n' potatoes kind of guy, yet there were meat and potatoes on almost every menu and at buffet. Yeesh!!!!! Makes you wonder what they eat at home. We, on the other hand, love to try new things. On Sunday, we had a reservation for the Mediterranean restaurant. It's on the beach next to the 24-hour beach bar, therefore an open-air space. Then the torrential downpour came at about 5:30 that evening. We retired to our balcony to wait out the storm which never let up for the rest of the evening. Guest Services called to advise us that the Mediterranean restaurant would be closed, however they were moving us to the Tex Mex and still offering us the Mediterranean menu. Great service indeed! Hubby had steak and I had lobster tails. Yum! We brought our own wine and there was no problem whatsoever. Monday night we ate at the Tex Mex. We both had the filet mignon. After reading a lot of reviews on this site about overcooked beef, we decided to order medium-rare (we both like medium) and it was cooked perfectly (medium). Again, no problem having our own wine served. Tuesday night we had buffet* which was terrific. There's a lot to choose from and like breakfast, everything is replenished accordingly. The food is fresh. What's supposed to be cold is cold and what's supposed to be hot is hot. We lucked out that night as they had whole suckling pig at the roasting station. Desserts were very good too. Wednesday night we had Brazilian. This restaurant is on the beach at the Tropical Princess, a 4-minute walk. If you're a meat lover, you'll love this place. There is a small side buffet open for sides like salads, veggies, etc. Then a waiter comes out 5 different times (courses) with meat on skewers which he carves on to your plate. The order being, chorizo sausages, chicken, fish, pork ribs, turkey and finally beef. Needless to say, we were stuffed when we left. Thursday night we buffet again and it was just as good as on Tuesday. Friday we went to La Cava at the Tropical Princess and it was really good. Hubby had beef carpaccio and I had shrimp and lobster cocktail. We both had lobster tails which were huge. Dessert was good too. Again, no problem bringing our own wine. Wine was very expensive here but they had an impressive wine list. Be warned that service may be a bit slow for some of you. The whole meal took about 2 1/2 hours, but we're used to it so it didn't bother us. Just wish we'd brought two bottles of wine. Also, on the night of your reservation, Guest Services will ask you to present yourself at their desk 1/2 hour before your reservation. They then print out an invitation to which they staple your card to and you bring this to the restaurant. They will also arrange for transportation but we opted to walk over. It's only about a 4-minute walk. *Note: We went to dinner around 8:30 p.m. every night and there was never a shortage of food at the buffet. Lobby Bar This was one of the highlights of our trip. Deyonera (?) and Emilio were the best. Always friendly and fun to be with. Try a Coco Loco. They're amazing. Deyonera makes the best shaken Margaritas I've ever had. There was animation every night at the lobby bar which generally started at 10:00 p.m. A lot of it was funny and it was loud as other travellers have posted, but it lasts until about 10:45-11:00. Then it gets quiet again. If you want quiet, go to the beach bar which is open 24 hours, weather permitting (open air). It seemed to only close on our 2nd and 3rd night due to rain. The disco and casino were at the Tropical but we never went. Pool We didn't use the pool at all. Since our room overlooked the swim-up bar, we took the opportunity to observe, more than once, guests who sat there for a very long periods time and drinking heavily. Draw your own conclusions. Thanks, but no thanks. I'm sure the ocean water is much cleaner. The pool is attractive and there never seemed to be a problem finding a lounger. Workers hose down the sidewalks every day that surround the pool. Beach The beach at the PC Princess is one of the less congested we saw on all our walks. It didn't matter what time one would get to the beach as there were always palapas and loungers available. We stopped setting our alarm after the first day. The water was warm and we had quite a few waves during our week which was fun. We tried the VIP beds once but ended up under palapas all week. We only saw butler service twice during our week but to be honest, we weren't really paying attention as we read and walked the beach a lot. Animation I disagree with some posters who've said that they cater to the 18-30 crowd. Not so. If you want to participate, you can. For example, after animators invited us to play volleyball twice and turning them down, they did not ask us again. Can you blame them? I looked at this as being courteous and not disturbing us. As far as guests entertaining guests, I disagree with that too. They tried hard to get people to participate in the lobby bar, but they also respected people who weren't interested. Guests who did participate were having a great time. If animation and shows are important, walk over to the Tropical for the show that starts at 10:00 p.m. every night and go to their disco and/or casino. There's plenty to do if you really want to. Spa There are two spas - one at the PC Princess on the beach and a more formal one shared by the Princess and the Tropical. I was given the choice for our massages and I picked the formal one because it was so quiet. The massages were wonderful. They're usually hit or miss in the islands but these were really nice. We'd booked 8:30 a.m. and it was a great way to start the day. Tips We tipped the maid $1 US/day. We also tipped at restaurants and the lobby bar staff, who, I will add, never looked at the amount - very professional. So it didn't matter if you were tipping them $1, $5, or $10; everyone got the same friendly service. Skyservice We were scheduled to depart PC at 8:45 p.m. this past Saturday (Apr. 28) and land in Montreal around 1:00. Unfortunately for us and about 200 other passengers, this did not happen. First of all, our flight was one hour late taking off which should have landed us at Trudeau International Airport at 2:00 a.m. The pilot announced the usual we're sorry for the delay followed by the reason for the delay. Allegedly the plane originated in Cancun. Which to us meant it flew from Cancun to Montreal, then Motnreal to Punta Cana. Well, almost at the end of the flight, the pilot announced that due to strict noise regulations, they could not get clearance to land in Montreal or in Toronto so we were being re-routed to the Hamilton, Ontario airport. What a treat! Not! We spoke to one of the flight attendants and he told us he'd attended this same flight over the past 4 Saturdays and in the previous 3, not only were they late every time, they were able to negotiate clearance into Montreal. So we were the exception. He was under the impression that Transport Canada got fed up with them being late all the time. Upon getting off the plane, a flight attendant told us that we would get our customs over with and would probably leave for Montreal around 5:30 a.m.Now, you would think that a Skyservice representative would have kept us informed as to when our plane would leave Hamilton. No such luck. And to top it all off, nothing was open at the airport. All they ended up offering us was a free Tim Horton's coffee around 6:00 a.m. before we finally got to check in.IOHO, Skyservice offered no service whatsoever as far as keeping us informed. We feel that Transport Canada is very much to blame in the sense that they should not offer landing schedules so close to a curfew and should re-think re-opening Mirabel International Airport (no noise restrictions). We will definitely be writing both agencies to express our disgust as well as try to get someone to pay for our extra day's parking at the Trudeau Airport. . Vacation OverallOverall, we can't wait to go back but not with Skyservice. If you have any questions, please fee free to address me in the Forum.  
<Date>May 8, 2007

17	9(service):1	48(wonderful):1	57(water):1	58(quiet):1	71(include):1	97(internet):1	107(choice):1	225(la):1	266(pick):1	292(card):1	730(massage):3	919(sport):1	1555(vip):1	2341(cava):1	2669(formal):1	4162(motorize):1	5172(envelope):1	

<Author>Fionna2003
<Content>The Best Holiday Yet! We stayed at the Punta Cana Princess Resort April 23rd to May 2nd - 8 nights which was just so right. Not too little as you wish you had more time there, and not too long as to make you feel your homesick. We travelled with My Travel there and Thomas Cook on return. We paid extra for the Premair service. In fact any flight over 3 hours long I would recommend paying the extra for the better service. And Yes, it is better service. We had a slight problem on our outbound journey. Apparently, My Travel double booked seats at Gatwick prior to arriving at Manchester and therefore before we boarded, we had our seats changed. Not too happy a start but hey , we were going on holiday !. Quite a bit of leg room and comfy seats on the flight, plenty of food and drink and attended to really well. we arrived at PCP at 8pm ish, we then took a bus ride to the hotel which is one to be experienced. Definately not like the roads over here, no no, I must admit they do take the ' joy riders' very seriously as there were a whole lot of sleeping policemen ( road humps ) a couple of miles nearer the hotel. Part of the journey we all heard the loud bang, we think the driver had a blow out - but he carried on going. Arrived at the hotel at 9.15 pm rushed to get some supper before the buffet closed. Weather for the first couple of days was rainy then sunshine, and when the sun shone - it really shone ! So hot there you forgot it was raining 30 minutes previously. The hotel rooms were so clean and spacious. the best hotel room we have been in and we havent stayed anywhere less than 4*. We were in Block 4 room 4004. The most central accomodation to everything.( just be carefu when walking on the tiles corridors - can become rather slippy ) The maids came in each day to change the towels and make the bed ( and dressed the bed with flowers and petals - wonderful ) In fact there were 2 king size beds and a bed settee in the lounge area of the room which turned also into a bed. So much storage space too. The shower is fantastic - really forceful and you can change the style of head too. The Hairdryer is brilliant. I tool mine but never used it at all. I also took straighteners and they heated up fine. You have a coffee machine in your rrom with coffee and tea and creamer and suger which is replace each time you used it. There is a fridge inside the cupboard which the TV sits on. That is always stocked with lemonade, coke, and water. The TV channels arent too bad - Dont turn on channel 96, you will now wont you ? ha ha.  Now to the Food halls. We used the Caribe buffet each morning and evening. The omeletts are so lovely, and plenty to choose from . Smoothies, Juices, Cereals, toast, Oatmeal, Fried food, doughnuts, croissants, fruit, yoghurt, - Im starviing now. At lunch time we went over to the snack bar by the beach, again, salad, fries ( not very hot tho ) chicken, lamb chops, pork chops, burgers, and then each evening they had a different theme night on. Failing you like the theme night choice you could always back up with fries - potatoes, soup, salad, and they usually had a roast on in the corner. The Turkey is to die for ! Fantastic. The restaurants on site I believe are very good, we only went to the Tex Mex - Mexican - That was fine, the margarita they gave us was awful tho. Entertainment on in the Lobby in the evenings began at about 9.30 till 11.30, the animation team are full of energy and the games and re-enactments they try and get you to take part in are so funny - quite adult watching in some cases. Good job theres no Kids allowed. If you want to learn Merengue dancing - go there in the evening, and the boys and girls will get you up and give you a chance to try it out. ( theres music piped through the gardens and round the pool all day - can be a bit noisy by the pool) If you need internet access there are 2 computers for your use. $10 for 60 minutes which is quite good. Bit of recommendation tho - Get a hotmail address and you can MSN Messenger to you friends - so much cheaper than Mobile calls. Each day they have a photographer coming onto the beach and then onto the area by the pool. Each day they bring a different attraction to take the photo with, I have a Snake Phobia, so I was always on my guard when on the beach watching for what they were bringing with them. i have since found out, they bring the snake on a Sunday. they have a tiny monkey, and a chameleon too. Now onto the beach area. Well what can i say, the beach is extremely soft white sand - so clean, the sea or as I have been told to call it - the OCEAN is like stepping into a bath of turquiose radox bubble bath, so soft and creamy and luxurious. Yes that describes it well. I dont normally like going into the sea, but it was wonderful. Sometimes the waves were a little rough but you need to enter the water till it reaches you chest and then you move with the waves and they dont push you back to the beach. Make sure you have lip block on all the time - sore lips are not to be laughed at - in fact you cant laugh - it hurts too much. We walked both ways from our hotel along the beach if you are looking out to sea and turn left - you walk about 10 - 15 mins and you will come up on the beach huts where there are plenty of lucky lucky men behind their stalls trying to vye for your attention. Walk through the middle of the huts and you wont be bothered too much by them and at least then you get a chance to see what each of the stalls have to sell, then on your way back you make up your mind. Beautiful jewellry, I bought 2 necklaces, 1 pair earings and he asked for $75 I bought them for $40 so always say you only have ' X ' amount of $'s and they will take that instead of losing the sale. We had a beach party on Monday night and they had some stalls on site then too, same products being sold, but as least if you have dollars to use before leaving PCP you can spend them then. There werent many British visitors to PCP plenty of canadians where we met 2 lovely couples there, but the other canadians were also so friendly. I know now where people from spain and germany go on holiday to. Dom Rep. I took some spanish phrases off the internet before I left for the holiday and hopefully intended to try them out - only found the phrases as i was packing to come home. So if poss - get some phrases ready to use - the staff love to hear you ask how they are in their native launguage.  If poss leave one of your card keys in the electricity recepticle which is on the right hand side as you open you room door. This then ensures your air con is on when your out of the room and keeps it lovely and cool for your return from the beach ahhhh. I had been receiving updates off Tripadvisor a few weeks before we travelled on this hotel and looking at the photos, when i got there I felt like i knew the place very well. I promise you wont be disappointed holidaying here - We are definately returning - we have been to the Gran Ventanna in Playa Dorado - north coast - this is far superior to that holiday - And you know what I thought the best part of it was - NO KIDS ! - until you experience a holiday with no kids running round - splashing in the pool - crying and being under feet - you dont realise what youve been missing. I could go on forever , but I bet your fed up now and just itching to get on that flight ! I do hope you found this review helpful, I thoroughly enjoyed typing it and reminiscing. Have a lovely holiday,. Fionna  Dave  
<Date>May 8, 2007

<Author>superjudi
<Content>PCP The Place to be--Judi fron NJ Returned home May 5 from the Punta Cana Princess-- What can i say, It was a very nice, relaxing and fun vacation. The resort is very nice, totally clean at all times and very, very friendly. I am from New Jersey and very hard to please--but I have really NO complaints. Arrived on sat 4/29 at 1pm and was able to check in right away. Went with the VIP plan--which was worth the extra $$. The 20 minute free massage alone covered the extra cost. The beach is absolutely gorgeous-and extremly clean. There are sun beds for VIP only and let me say that made my vacation-they are clean and comfortable and enough for all. The pool area is well equipped with chairs and shade huts. Many other reviews that I read complained about the food-Myself and friends thought that the food was good-of course there were a few things that we did not enjoy, but there was always something else to eat. Dinners at the restaurants were very good, my favorite was the italian restaurant at the PCP. Chicken Parm excellent!!The staff could not be more accomadating, always friendly and and sweet!! The best bar is in the lobby with Emilio, he works the 3pm to 11pm shift, great personality and lots of fun.The only thing i would have liked to see was alittle more music in english-mostly spanish playing all the time-but you do get used to it. The animation crew really tries to bring entertainment to you all day and night, but to no avail-not there fault-most people want to just relax.I would reccomened this hotel to anyone-LOVED IT -will return!!p.s. if you can try and fit a noodle or a blow up float in your suitcase(deflated of course)do so, good to have for both the pool and ocean.  
<Date>May 6, 2007

<Author>jdinbow
<Content>Wonderful - Loved Everything We stayed at PCP from 4/22-4/29. After a very rough start - we were to leave Boston at 9:30 am - didn't get off the ground until 7:30 pm - Apple Vacations - that's a whole other review - poor service.We arrived at PCP at 1:00 am - even at that time everyone was scrambling to accommodate us - they were very sympathetic to our situation. We ended up going into the main buffet at that time for something to eat and drink - Merengue's for all - great drink!Our rooms were really nice, comfortable bed/couch, clean and spacious, maid service was terrific. The sun was great, rained every day pretty hard at times and the wind was blowing pretty hard, so we opted for the pool most of the time which was wonderful! Loved the swim up bar. Only problem we had was being VIP (worth the up-grade) we had access to the day bed's (worth the up-grade very comfortable) were that regular guests would occupy them it is not posted at that pool that the beds are for VIP only - the beach area is. The resort was filling up as the week went on, so we did find ourselves reserving a day bed. Food was very good, good assortment in the main buffet (Marina night was not so great), Mar Nostrum was our favorite restaurant during the evening (beef with stuffed lobster in wine sauce A++++ can't say enough about that). The Fondue restaurant was a lot of fun - it was our daughter's birthday and they went all out for her. We went over to the Caribe Club for their buffett one night - similar in food - but it is very, very hectic and much larger. We couldn't wait to get back to the PCP! The night entertainment was a lot of fun - tequilia funnels! OMG! Emilio at the bar was so funny - ask him for a bikini! Bernardo  Jose at the pool bar - were just great - lots of dancing, singing and fun. This resort was great in that it is small and intimate, but that is what we like - we met the best people from all over the world during our week; something you don't encounter at a large resort as easily. My daughter and her boyfriend got engaged while we were here and they will go back for their honeymoon. Overall, my husband and I would definitely go back to the PCP we had a great time. Would definitely do the upgrade to VIP again as well, it comes with some really nice extras.  
<Date>May 2, 2007

<Author>Chooch77
<Content>Awesome for a 1st trip Wow, where should a start.... it was our 1st trip ever for me and my boyfriend and we would go back in a heart beat.The staff is awesome, i have never seen people enjoy their job so much. They are always smiling and at your service.The buffet at the beach kind a sucks, its always the same thing every single day. But its really practical because you are right on the beach and you dont need to be dressep up, you can just go in your bathing suit. So thats pretty cool.The a la carte restaurant were pretty good we thought, we tried the Tex Mex, Mexican, The sea food place, and the very best one is La Cava'' the one we had included on our VIP package. We had the lobster and it was absolutely devine. And also its pretty much the only place that you can buy decent wine instead of the crapy house wine that they serve you and all the other restaurants.The resort is so well kept, they are always busy cleaning. Our room was on the top floor, which was nice cause we had the cathedral seiling. The fact that its an ''adult only'' resort is awesome, not that i dont like kids cause we have a daughter but its really nice to get away and be only with other adults.Anyway i am probably forgetting some stuff, but the main line is.....its awesome. If you have questions you can ask me.Ciao

<Author>babigirlgee
<Content>Very Nice Resort.... only one thing.... Just returned from my stay @ the Punta Cana Princess from 4/22-4/29--- The resort is very nice, always kept clean with tons of workers, working on the landscaping, cleaning the pool, etc. The room was definitely amazing, we had a direct view of the pool, and the beach.. room 5211. I would definitely say to not stay on the ground floor because at night the amount of bugs is crazy, and I would not want the milipedes crawling into my room. The pool was kept in tip-top shape, and cleaned a few times throughout the day. The bars, I would honestly say the nicest people are at the lobby bar.... and at the ebach bar at night.... other than that, some of the people working there looked like robots, even after you tipped them-- I am not expecting a song and dance, but when i order one or two drinks and give 2 dollars everytime I at least expect a thank you. Not all of the workers were like that, there were definitely some who were very gracious to recieve the tips. The Food. #1 I am a New Yorker, who has access to the best restuarants in the world, and I will say that it is nothing like food in the United States. I would say it is decent. #2 I am a vegetarian and there was honestly not much for me to eat... I know people will say oh you could have had pasta.... but when you come from New York, and an Italian family... you cannot eat Tomato Sauce that was made in the Dominican Republic... it tastes like Ragu. There were some things I could eat, which kept me going... They had a very small salad bar, and once during the week they had vegetable soup.... In the A la carte restaurants, I had asked if there was anything they could make that did not have meat in it, and they said NO... so I was a little upset about that because I had stayed at RIU, Iberostar, and Breezes before, and all of them helped me out with my food issues. My fiance said that he enjoyed the chicken that they made daily. Out of all the a la cartes, he said that RIO GRANDE tex mex steakhouse, was the worst because the meat was very tough(he ordered filet mignon.. that is not supposed to be tough), He loved the Chinese! He liked the italian because he had gotten pork filet which he said was very tender. The mexican was very good -- I order chicken fajitas, and just ate the peppers and onions out of it .. they had a very nice taste. You are definitely better off booking all a la cartes. The buffet at the Caribe is huge, but extremely crowded with kids who are sneezing on everything, which is always lovely. overall, I would say is was an average place to stay, 3 stars.... definitely not 4 or 5also, the bavaro shopping mall..... unless you want to be hassled and being begged to come in and check out their stores ... stay away.  
<Date>Apr 30, 2007

<Author>honeymoon15
<Content>Quite and Relaxing I have been home 24 hours now from our trip to the Princess. I have travelled for several years and never have I stayed at such a relaxing resort. I have 3 children and love them dearly but Adults Only is the way to go. The restaurants, pool and beach were NEVER full. I was amazed that no matter what time you went to any of these spots you would get a chair. As for being clean the grounds are immaculate. The rooms are clean and bright. Very comfortable beds and all rooms face the pool and everything around it. Small amount of odour of must but a scented candle works great.The food was good. Your not at home so remember these people can not please everyone. Book the restaurants as soon as you can they go fast.We shopped in town for our gifts. The Bavero Plaza is 10 minutes from the resort and has everything you would need. My husband bought his cigars there and was amazed at the price.No night life but it was nice spending time with the man I love.I don't know if I would go back but I would say this was the most relaxing trip I have done.Always remember your not at home your in paradise and only you can make it beautiful. Have a great trip. Honeymoon

<Author>djMaine
<Content>great vacation We stayed from 4-15 to 4-22.Arrival was easy and smooth. Breezed through the airport. Ride in wasn't bad about 1 hour as we were the last drop off. Check in was fast was given keys and the bell boy took us to our rooms.Room: Beautiful room. Prob the best we have stayed in. We had a king bed sunk in living room spacious bathroom. We went vip had the perks in the room cigars rum bathrobes. The room is spotless and kepted that way all week always had clean towels. We tipped $3 a day with a candy bar and a present for the day maid and $2 and a candy bar for the night. We always got extra for our fridge. We were in building 5 had a view of the pool and could see the ocean. Resort: It was well groomed and beautiful small enough so you would walk to the lobby or resturants and bars nice if you want to make a quick trip for something. Staff is the best the bartenders are very good and fun. We met a couple the first day who were a blast and made our vacation. My husband and hers got up at 5 in the morning and they went down and got the beach huts and spent everymoring at the beach bar gearing up for the day. the beach bar is open 24 hours and the bartenders there are great. The food I thought was fair. All others in our group thought it was horrible. Out of all the resorts I have stayed in, it was the worst. But the pasta station was good ala carts were good. La Cava was really good. Drinks were really good. We had access to Cribe/tropical but really didn't go there. We took a short walk in there but basically stayed at our resort.We did one tour Saona Island it was alot of fun and worth the trip even with the long ride I am really glad we did it. It is not a snorkle trip though. The island is absoultly beautiful meal was really good and was fun.We had a prob the last day we were waiting for the bus at 11:30 and after a 1/2 hour I asked the bell boy if he know when the bus was due. He said sometimes they are late and to give it some time. We waited for another hour then I had the front desk call the apple rep and there was a mechinical prob with the plane which didnt leave boston and would be a 14 hour delay. No problem so we threw our bags in our friends room went to the beach it was cloudy all day no sun but was still nice. We were picked up at the lobby at 9 pm never flew out till 3 am. There were a lot of angry people at the airport but there is nothing you can do about it and I would rather be delayed on the departure then the arrival and we made the best of it.Beach: Best yet. Have to get up early to get a hut. we didnt use the vip beds but they are really comfortable. There are vendors a short walk as you look at the ocean go left. Good buys. We walked the beach each day and it really is beautiful.Weather: Had a nice week but had about 3 days where it rained for 3 hours or so mostly in the later afternoon which was ok as the sun is really hot and we came back with super tans.All in all we had a great vacation with the exception of the food. We went to Pureto Plata in 05 and prob will not come back to this island. If any one has any question pm me and I will be happy to answer.  
<Date>Apr 24, 2007

<Author>Anitahd
<Content>Wonderful trip! What a wonderful trip! We just got back on April 20th after a 6 day stay. I can't say enough good things about this resort. The grounds were so beautiful, the staff was so good to us and treated us like family. The Animacion Team was fun and entertaining. The beach was absolutely gorgeous! Crystal clear warm waters. The waves were fun. The sand is so soft under your feet and there is a nice breeze most of the time. It rained one day while we were there but not until in the afternoon. The food was good at every restaurant we ate at. I liked the Pescador the best and had lobster there. The best drink, I think was the Coco Loco, yummy! We had the VIP package, and was well worth it. We stayed in the 5000 block. Very nice room, good air conditioning and the bed was so comfortable. Fridge was stocked well and drinks were cold. My husband liked the beer. I drank the diet coke. If you like strong coffee you will like their brand. I kept watering mine down. You get used to it after a couple of days though. We didn't do any excursions, our choice, but had plenty to do and mostly we just wanted to relax on the beach. Be forewarned though that even if you like seashells and want to buy them from the locals, it is illegal and you may get arrested. I almost bought one before I read in the Punta Cana brochure that it is illegal. Glad I didn't. You won't see any shells on the beach but they have them for sale everywhere. I could go on and on about all the wonderful things at the Punta Cana Princess. If you have any questions please write and I will be happy to help.  
<Date>Apr 23, 2007

<Author>nottmorr
<Content>Better than Expected!! My husband and I (both 50ish) stayed at the Punta Cana Princess for 1 week March 30-April 6, 2007 and have absolutely nothing negative to say.Transporation to and from Airport was quick and pretty well organized however don't expect to be at hotel in less than 45 minutes once the bus gets underway. Roads aren't good so can't go very fast, sit back and take in the locat way of life. Check-in: Quick  friendly (didn't get the welcome cocktail but checked in at about 945pm  bar was still open so were able to get our own)Lobby: Large, clean, a great gathering place after dinner with a bar and lots of seating.Rooms: we were in building 4, ground floor, location central to everything. Rooms were spacious, clean and nicely decorated. Air conditioning worked fine and was needed to keep out dampness (unavoidable given the climate and humidity). Mini bar always stocked with soft drinks (my husband thought he'd died and gone to heaven when he saw the coke was in glass botlles! ) Did say the beer in the fridge was disgusting however we met a few who didn't mind it. Grounds: Beautiful, well maintained and constantly manicured. Pool: Large, clean, refreshing with plenty of chaises available in or out of the sun and a swim up bar with plenty of cold Presidente` beer and Banana Mamas. Beach: Beautiful, we are walkers and we never ran out of beach in either direction, able to buy souveniers at either end and also available at the hotel. Always lots of chaises availability at the beach. Both the pools and the beach area were far more crowded and noisy at the sister hotels where kds were allowed. Much more relaxcing and quiet at this 18+ hotel. Food: Very good,. The al a cartes were very nice, presentation great, decor very nice and food very good. We ate at Mare Nostrum (seafood), Tex Mex (steak) Shanghai (chinese) and both Italian restaurants, one at this hotel and one at next hotel over. Buffet was also very good always a couple of good meat choices (much larger and more variety at the hotel next door, worth the 3 minute walk! ) Entertainment: Day time activities around pool and on beach were good and well organized, however night time activities in our lobby were a bit silly. There were shows at both the sister hotels and both the ones we saw were quite good entertainment. They didnt start until 945-1000 and most nights, after long days in the sun we were just as happy to stretch out on the bed and watch a little TV at that time. We did hit the casino one night, very small, most slot games unfamiliar, lasted about 20 minutes. Didn't do any excursions so can't comment on those. Tips: Bring lots of suntan lotion, bring a face cloth if you use one, bring insulated mugs, bring lots of ones for tipping. (We started tipping restaurant  bar staff but toward the end of the trip we started tipping the guy who cuts the grass, the man who cleaned the pool, the omelette maker etc these are the hard jobs and unlike the others probably rarely get tips. Tips are not shared so whoever picks it up keeps it for thmselves. I did get several bites during the week, never did figure out what was biting me, could have been no-see-ums however strangley enough my husband didn't get any and half the people we met got any bites, mostly the women, guess we're sweeter. They were very itchy so pack some after bite or equivalent.  
<Date>Apr 12, 2007

<Author>mainesunseeker
<Content>Punta Cana Princess - "Why not, baby?" My boyfriend and I (35 and 33) visited the Punta Cana Princess from March 13-19, 2007. We booked air, hotel and transfers through a TA and paid $130 extra for the 2 of us to upgrade to the VIP package. Here is our (very long) review of our trip:FLIGHTS AND TRANSFERS:We flew US Air from Boston, connected in Charlotte, no problems with out flights. Transfers were prearranged through VIP Travel (no relation to hotel) and we quickly found our shuttle. There were no other passengers to drop off so we arrived at the resort in about 25 minutes even after a small traffic tie up due to a truck broken down.CHECK IN AND WELCOME:Our bags were unloaded and set aside. There was no one else waiting to check in so we walked right up. A bartender from the lobby bar showed up within moments with a delicious fruit punch served in Champagne glasses. After quick check in we put ID stickers on our bags and visited the VIP concierge who explained the perks of our package and gave us the rundown on booking dinners, etc. We moved quickly to the lobby bar for another fruit punch, this time with rum.After about an hour at the bar we moved on, with our luggage, to our room.THE ROOM:Our room was on the top floor of building 4. To us this would be the 3rd floor, to them it is the 2nd (ground, 1st, 2nd). The room was spotless with a cathedral ceiling of wood and a ceiling fan. We never turned on the AC our whole visit but did use the AC fan and the ceiling fan. We had 2 queen beds; there was a large dresser/vanity and the closet had plenty of space for hanging clothes as well as shelf space. There was an umbrella in the closet along with an iron and ironing board. The safe was in the closet and measures about 12x6x12. We did not pay additional for the safe which was controlled by entering a code you pick rather than by using a key. There are two steps going down to a living area with couch, trundle bed underneath and bureau. I fell down the stairs the first night we were there and would recommend placing something in front of them overnight as we did going forward. The room is dark at night with the curtains drawn, leaving a light on is advisable. The bureau has a couple drawers and houses the fridge, water glasses, ice bucket, etc. The fridge was stocked daily with 2 liters of water, coke, sprite and beer. As part of the VIP package we also arrived to a bottle of rum and box of 3 cigars in the room.The bathroom was clean with a double sink, full tub and shower. We always had hot water and plenty of water pressure. There was a hairdryer and makeup mirror in the bathroom as well as a bottle opener attached to the wall (handy!). There is little room for your stuff though; just counter space and the lip around the tub; there are no shelves and only one hook on the wall. For us, this was sufficient though.The patio is off the living area and the view from our room 4219 was out over the pool (pool bar area) with the ocean beyond. The noise from the pool was never an issue for us and at night the pool lights with the ocean sounds beyond were very nice. If I were requesting a room I would ask for an upper floor room in buildings 4 or 5 as they would have the best view.THE RESORT:This is a fairly small and compact resort. The lobby is furthest from the sea with the buffet and 2 ala carte restaurants in front of it.. Shops are to the right of the lobby coming out towards the pool.Rooms run down either side towards the water with the pool in the middle of the area. There are walkways with lots of green space and palm trees between. Throughout the property are large sculptures of birds, animals and tribal figures making for interesting strolls around the grounds.The pool area has plenty of palapas and beds surrounding it and a pool bar/swim up bar that played latin music though never too loudly. The pool was large enough that the volleyball net could be left up constantly with plenty of space for a quiet dip elsewhere.The beach is lovely - wide and white and the water warm. Most of the time we were there it was quite windy and the waves were fun to play in. The breeze made our time in the sun much more pleasant than it would have been. There is a separate area roped off with beach beds for those who have upgraded to the VIP package. The beds had retractable awnings over them, approximately 30 in all. We never had a problem getting one, even when arriving to the beach quite late in the morning. Outside the VIP area are lounge chairs and palapas. The chairs were comfortable and the palapas plenty. On the beach was the watersports center, also where you exchange towels, and animation area. We cannot comment on the watersports but they were friendly when we exchanged towels. The animation staff led aerobics, dance, volleyball and more on the beach. The beach bar has several tables in both sun and shade. Butler service on the beach was convenient. We brought two Bubba Kegs, one we kept filled with ice water, the other Santo Libre. Yum. The restaurant next to the beach bar had food available from late morning until dinnertime, then late night snacks. Mid-afternoon was ea time?at the beach bar ?sandwiches, salads, fruit, etc. One afternoon we were there we were treated to a BBQ lunch at the beach which was one of the best meals we had there.THE STAFF:These nice folks work HARD to make your visit enjoyable. We can figure out how they remember everyone names but they do. Everyone greets you with a happy ola?as you walk by and there is always someone there with what you want when you want it. The maids and the groundskeepers spoke little English but were always happy and would attempt to engage you. The waitstaff, bartenders, etc. were providingfirst class service and the language barrier was easy to work around. Learn even a little bit of Spanish and it will go a long way. We found the bilingual staff to be extremely helpful and eager to teach you more Spanish if you just asked. If you speak only English you will be fine with the staff you need to interact with most. Overall, the friendly staff made our visit. pecial for you?is heard often but still seems sincere.THE FOOD:We ate breakfast at the buffet daily. The omelet bar was good and you can never go wrong with bacon. There was a variety of pancakes, French toast, fresh fruit and some other, less appetizing, sausages. The coffee is delicious and the mimosas just the way we like them ?lots of champagne and a little o.j.Our appetites were generally small while we were there, probably because of the heat, so we usually skipped lunch and grabbed late afternoon snacks at the beach bar.We ate once or twice at the buffet for dinner. Very average. We ate at 3 of the ala carte restaurants: Italian, Tex Mex and Fondue. The fondue was a good meal and a ton of fun. We had the shrimp app., meat (in oil) main course and the chocolate fondue dessert. All were excellent with dipping sauces on the side and fun fun fun! We both had Filet Mignon at the Tex Mex which was good, but not as tender and tasty as we get in the states. The Italian was disappointing but we heard others who had ordered different dishes praising it. We both had pasta dishes ?my boyfriend the ravioli with Bolognese and me the spaghetti with pesto. His could have been Chef Boyardee from a can. Seriously. Mine okay but not nearly pesto-ey enough. We were going to go for our complimentary gourmet dinner at El Pescadore the last night of our stay, but it burned down. No, actually, we decided to operate on island time our last night and just missed our dinner, but it did burn down, so good thing we spared ourselves the disappointment and had decided to skip it anyway.OTHER STUFF:We went to a show at the Caribe/Tropicale which was a Broadway review. We had fun. Short ride in the golf cart train with friendly folks we tried our best to communicate with. With our VIP package we got complimentary 20 minute massages. They will try to get you to pay for an upgrade to a full hour. I'm sure for the extra $30 or so it would be worth it but we stuck with our freebie and enjoyed it very much.We tipped about $200 in the 6 days we were there. We felt it was appreciated and might have got us a little extra attention but we saw superior service provided to those who didn tip at all. Those who don get tipped so frequently, like the groundskeepers and beach cleaners, were appreciative as well.As mentioned above, I fell in our room. I actually hit my head harder than I ever have before. We called resort medical staff and there was a doctor (or nurse?) in our room within 10 minutes. I ended up agreeing to go by ambulance to the local clinic. Care was fine all around, the clinic clean and well staffed though maybe not so well equipped. I had x-rays taken there and the option of a CAT scan which I declined. Be aware that if you need medical care you will have to pay for it out of pocket. The ambulance wouldn roll out of the resort until I paid them ($155 US) and the clinic wouldn call me a taxi until I squared up with them ($420 for exam and 2 xrays). Both took credit cards and I will get full reimbursement from my stateside health insurance. Care was fine overall though.SUMMARY:This is a beautiful, quiet, adults-only resort. I would give it a 5 star rating if it were not for the food. But I would not hesitate to go back.  
<Date>Mar 24, 2007

5	29(minute):1	345(complimentary):1	527(package):1	730(massage):1	1555(vip):1	

<Author>MarkChicago
<Content>Loved It!! We stayed at the Punta Cana Princess hotel from March 8th-12th. When we left Chicago it was 20 degrees and we had winter coats on. When we got to the Dominican it was in the 80's the whole time. We had a great time there. Everything is so clean, and everyone is so friendly. Check-In was a breeze. Saloman helped us, and he was very nice. Most of the staff speaks English so we didn't have any problems. We stayed in building #4 and left the maid a few dollars everyday. We still got the turn-down service and we were not apart of the VIP package. We did request more towels one day, and they sent them up in no time. The beach and the ocean was beautiful. There are some little shops on the resort, but everything is way over priced. They also will not bargin. If you walk down the beach about 5 min, there is a little market that you can get things really cheap. Stick to your guns about how much you are willing to pay. They eventually will give in! A friend of mine got two necklaces and a braclet for $10, and the guy kept insisting $20. We got it for $10! We did swim with the dolphins at Manati Park for $75. It was fun, but not worth the money. They said we would be able to do it for 20min, I think we were in the pool less than 10. There is another place that you can do it, that is $95 and you can swim with them longer. I would have rather paid the extra money for the better one. We booked through VacationExpress.com and had the option of paying $15 per person for hotel/airport transfers. That was worth it, you didn't have to worry about getting a taxi. This resort is also connected to two other princess resorts and you can take a tram to the other resorts and make reservations at their restaurants. We ate at the Brazillian and the Italian Restaurants which were very good. Get the chicken dish at the Italian. We heard the steak house was really good, but they are not open on the weekends. If you want to check it out, make reservations during the week. Wish we would have known that. The adult only resort was the way to go. No annoying screaming kids around. No splashing in the pool. A very relaxing and restful trip!! I would definitly book here again!  
<Date>Mar 20, 2007
<Rating>5	5	5	5	5	5	5	5

<Author>TequilaQueen44
<Content>A little bit of perfection We stayed at the PC Princess March 3-10th...not a drop of rain for 7 days...it was so hot we sought shelter under the majestic palm trees for a little relief. We stayed at this resort 5 years ago and loved it so much we returned to the adult only side. The buildings and their warm bold colours stand out amongst the regal green palms and beautifully and immaculately groomed gardens. Everyone is busy working each day to clean walkways and the gardens...it's really breathtaking. We had a second floor room in block 4 ~ 2 double beds, sunken living room with day bed, lots of storage for clothes... computer in your room if you want internet access ($40 U.S. for the week) ~ Fridge filled with beer and water etc, large bathroom...it's all so clean and comfortable, but how much time do you really spend in your room anyway? The beach is like a photograph...warm turquoise waters...little seaweed...waves that encourage even the most timid to rent a boogyboard and try bodysurfing...it's so much fun. What can you say about the drinks...their pleniful, tasty and quickly catch up with you...before you know it the sun is going down, you've spent the entire day enjoying the hot caribbean sun and it's time for siesta. We tipped the bar tender each day a couple of U.S. dollars ~ this goes a long way to encourage quick service!! We used the buffet on the Caribe side...it's much bigger, better selection of food and a 5 minute walk....Al a carte were good...we tried Italian, Tex Mex and Chinese....everything is beautifully presented and taste excellent...not a wine drinker but I heard it was not very good...stick to the bahama mamas. Lots of activites around the resorts...tennis, volleyball, archery etc...staff is amazing...always friendly and smiling ~ the Dominican people are so welcoming. This was our 11th time to Punta Cana...no wonder we keep coming back. I would highly recommend this resort.  
<Date>Mar 20, 2007

<Author>chaverskev
<Content>Loved the Punta Cana Princess!!!! We just returned from the Punta Cana Princess. It was amazing! The resort was so clean and beautiful!!!!! There are gorgeous palm trees everywhere. The pool is beautiful and so clean. The service is amazing!! Everyone is so friendly. The beach is absolutely gorgeous. The sand is so white, there are no rocks or shells and they clean the seaweed off every morning. The water is pretty warm and a beautiful color of blue-green. The weather was perfect. The food is ok. The buffet is ok, there is always something you can eat (bread or fruit). The restaurants are pretty good. We ate at the Bacio and the chicken was good there. We also ate at the Brazailian one and it was really good. We were told the Rio Grande is good also. The rooms are very clean and pretty. The maids are wonderful. They clean it every day beautifully. It's no problem to get extra towels for the room or for the beach. The massages are great, we used the spa outside. There isn't a whole lot to do so if you're looking for an exciting vacation, this might not be for you. But if you're looking for a relaxing vacation, this is the perfect place. It's not too busy, you almost feel like it's just you. It's nice that it's an adult only resort, it makes it even quieter. The staff is so accomadating and friendly. We had a great time and would definitely go again. We did one excursion, swimming with the dolphins at Manitee Park. It was fun, the swimming was less than 20 mins and there wasn't much to the rest of the park. I don't really think it was worth the money. But the resort was definitely worth it!!!  
<Date>Mar 18, 2007

<Author>Magoo07
<Content>Fantastic Resort - Jim  Just returned on March 11th from a two week stay at the Punta Cana Princess.You could not ask for a better resort to stay at in the Caribbean.We have been to numerous islands and resorts over the years and this is the first one that we have decided to certainly re-visit.The resort is relatively small which makes it easy to access any part of the facility and the fact that it is an adults only resort means that it is quiet and relaxing. The resort is maintained super clean and you could not experience a more firendly and helpful staff. Eveyone goes out of their way to make you feel comfortable and to assist you in any way that they can, from the administration staff to the servers, maintenance crew and the cleaning staff.We took the VIP package and would certainly reccommend it to anyone. The main perk of the package is the use of the private beach area that has tanning beds that are worth the cost of the upgrade in themselves.The food in the alacarte and buffet restaurants is not gourmet style however it is more than exceptable. The specialty restaurants on the other hand are excellent. The VIP package provides you with a complimentary meal at one of the specialty restaurants and we found the experience at La Cave so great that we returned for another meal at our expense. The meal we had would blow your socks off!One piece of advice........lunch is served at the beach-side buffet and for the most part is repetitious from day to day but is acceptable. Make the effort and go to the main buffet for lunch and you will have a much better selection and quality of food.We left a couple of dollars ever other day for the room staff and that proved to be very beneficial as a simple request would give you anything that you wanted.Can't wait until we have an opportunity to return to this bit of heaven.
