<Author>2495
<Content>Great Place- Mar 4th to the 8th Just got home and had a great five day stay. The resort is spotless and very clean. The food is good. The TEX-MAX is the best and the Italian is good. However, the buffet always had things everyone can like. We had a choice of either the Pescador or La Cava. Unfortunately we picked the Pescador which is a very limited menu. If you do not like shell fish. This is not the place for you. We had a very enjoyable meal at the Sombero, Mexican Restaurant, at the Caribe. Remember you can go to any other Princess Hotel to eat and they can't come to the Punta Cana Princess. The real joy is the adults only. Just go to the other hotels and you will run back to this one. We had a problem with check in. Apparently they overbooked and told us that we were cancelled. No one told us about this. However, once we showed them our paid vouchers they got us a room in a hour or so. While this was in building 2 at least it was on the second floor. Everyone says that building 3, 4  5. are the best. Unfortunately unlike airlines when you are overbooked you get upgraded this did not happen to us. However, the rooms are all the same and the cleanliness makes up for alot of things. They are constantly cleanning. Now for some tips. Definitely, get the VIP. The price is worth it. You get the beds on the beach in your own area. It is the envy of everyone. You get premimum liquors and a choice of specality restaurant. Plus many more things like internet, turn down bed services etc. Thanks for the reviewer who let us know about wash clothes. They do not have any. The natives don't use them. Glad we brought our own. The beach is beautiful and the resort is the envy of all other resorts at Punta Cana. The house wine was a disappointment. They wanted 6 times the market to purchase for named wines. They really need someone to teach them about wines. Watch your luggage on the way home. The bell captain put ours on the wrong bus and we had to have him get it back for us. We were lucky that they returned with it. Bring alot of singels and use them. They are very appreciative of a dollar or two tip. We brought a hundred of them and didn't bring many home. I know that it will be harder to make reservations here again with all the good reviews but they deserve it. We had great weather and only rained one evening. The entertainment was to loud and appeared to cater to a younger crowd.  
<Date>Mar 9, 2007

<Author>ajm/rjm
<Content>Well worth every cent!! This was our third trip to the Dominican Republic but our first stay at the Punta Cana Princess. We took the VIP package and it was well worth it. It included top shelf liquors, a 20 minute massage, motorized water sports, one hour internet for each of us, use of canopied beds on the beach, etc. We truely were treated like Very Important People. All employees were incredibly cheerful and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable.... and they succeeded. The grounds were beautiful. The food was just okay but it didn't seem to matter since they have so much else in their favor. I will go back and I will recommend this little piece of Heaven to all my friends.

<Author>PuntaCanada
<Content>Best Resort we've stayed at in Punta Cana We just returned from the Punta Cana Princess after a wonderful 2 weeks of r and r. Ditto all the positives as reported in the previous reports - the front desk staff was exceptional to us!! The Dominican people have a contageous joy - we constantly asked them what made them so happy - They loved their job - they loved their family and country, and were CONTENT with their lives. Plus, they had the merengue!!! :) Thank you Emilio and Kinya for the last minute merengue dances as we waited for our shuttle to the airport. The resort was CLEAN, rooms were spacious and beautiful, food was excellent - We've done a lot of travelling, and know what's out there - this was the perfect place for us. Adults only was a bonus. The most beautiful beach in the world - lots of hot water, everything worked - If it needed fixing, they fixed it right away. Thank you Karen, Julio, Jesus Super Carlos and all the staff for making our stay a memorable one. We hope to come back again next year.The McConnells from PUNTA CANADA :)

<Author>SixtiesLady
<Content>Wonderful vacation We just returned from our first 'get away from it all holiday', in 23 years and cannot rave enough about the Punta Cana Princess. We are both in our sixtys, and just didn't realize what an all inclusive, adult only vacation could be. Although my husband ended up with the flu, the size of the Punta Cana Princess was just what we needed. The Princess is a smaller resort and was so easy to get to the pool or the beach without a long walk. Just what the Dr. ordered. There is lots to do if you are wanting adventure from swimming with the dolphins, snorkeling, tubing. We could lay around the pool and tan or sleep in the shade, we could always find a spot at the beach and watch the people or swim. The service was beyond expectations. It didn't matter if it was water, or a drink, the friendly staff was always there to assist. The ala carte restaurants were an adventure in fine dining. Although the language was a small barrier, it was not hard to explain with gestures and a small dictionary that we had a bad stomache and they adjusted my husbands meals accordingly. We had alot of fun at the Domincan Restaurant at the Caribe. The staff was fun to be around and they certainly enjoyed their work. The Steak at the Tex Mex at the Punta Cana Priness would give our good Alberta beef a run for the money. The amount of ala cartes allowed was terrific but we found that we enjoyed eating at the buffet as the food there was also great. The work and effort put on by the resort was greatly appreciated. The whole buffet area was moved to the beach for a beach party one evening and the meal was to die for. The cleanliness of this resort is at least 10 **********. It didn't matter if you used their public washrooms or your own suite, they were spotless. The grounds were gorgeous and the grounds keepers just fade into the landscaping keeping it in beautiful shape. Although my husband was ill for the first 2 days I felt right at home wondering around the resort on my own even going for meals in the evening and never once was worried about my safety.  We took the trip to Manaiti Park and were treated with the same hospitality as the Hotel. And so handy being picked up at the door and returned in fine style.If we had a negative comment to make it would be the helpfulness of the lobby staff being able to communicate on arrival. As this was our first holiday in along while, being tired from a long late flight, very hungry from lack of eating due to a poor airline, and in a new country, better explanations of what is going on would have been a great help. The staff knew what they were doing we just didn't. And don't remove the card in the wall when you get to your room. It does not work in the safe, and you will be in the dark in about 15 minutes and trying to locate the phone. But after calling the front desk and trying to understand their explanation of what we had done the situation was righted promptly. I would also reccommend taking a face cloth as they aren't supplied.All in all we had a wonderul holiday filled with many good memories and lots of wonderful pictures. We will be recommending this resort to all our friends and family if they want a wonderful vacation. If it wasn't for the terrible plane ride, we would be thinking of going back real soon.  
<Date>Feb 26, 2007

<Author>MaidO'Mud
<Content>Loved it! We stayed February 5-12. The hotel is adult only which is a huge plus for us. We had access to the 2 other resorts, but the screaming kids drove us back to our quiet home. We went to get-away and totally relax - and did just that. Finding a beach chair is no problem in either sun or shade. Drink service right at the beach, and food available from 10:30 a.m. on at the beach made relaxation easy.We highly recommed this hotel. The staff work HARD to make you feel welcome and comfortable. If you try to speak a little spanish, they'll turn somersaults to serve you. Small tips (2-3 dollars) cause huge smiles and are certainly appreciated - not expected.There is little to do as this resort which is why we went there. Sometimes you just have to sit on a chair for a week and not move :-)For those that crave activity, there are activities run by enthusiastic staff. You can play, or watch.

<Author>acg2111
<Content>beautiful resort,very quiet just got back from puntacanta princess, hotel was beautiful,grounds were so clean pool was clean and plenty of room to swim and relax. if you want a good spot on the beach or pool its best to put a towel over your chair to save it and try to do it before 9:00.our room was the best we were near the beach and pool so we had a great view and close to everything. they said no tipping for drinks but to get good service best to tip $2each time you get a couple of drinks to get better service we also tipped the maid each day she always supplied us with plenty of drinks and clean towels. the food was the biggest let down the 1st 2 nights we made reservations at the mediterraneanmare nostrum we had surfturf not like at home my lobster was smaller than a golf ball and my husband did not even get any and the steak was like rubber. the next night we ate at the rio grande everyone said this was the best ,appetizer was chicken very good steak was horrible after that we ate at the buffet which was okay we never tried the caribe food because it all looked the same. all in all i would return to this resort if they keep it all adults it was so peaceful that you have to overlook the food. if you wanted to see shows you had to go to the caribe, we did a jeep safari ,ride definetly,would recommend you get to see beyond the resort area and its very safe you travel with about 10 other jeeps. so if you want a nice relaxing vacation and you are noy a picky eater then i would suggest this hotel.

<Author>mexico62
<Content>enjoying our vacation We are still here at the Punta Cana princess and very much enjoying ourselves, we have another week to go.The VIP upgrade is worth it and we enjpyed our complimentary massages . Also being able to book the a la carte restaurents by phone instead of waiting in line is a bonus. Also we have a private area on the beach and use of the beach beds and drink service. We have yet to try the scuba and watersports included. The rooms are very nice, they have a step down couch and tv area. Coffe makers, bathrobes and beach towels in the room and 24 hr. room service with the VIP.One recommendation prior to coming is you should be taking an anti malarial drug as this area, bavaro beach is on the travel advisory for malaria, which is transmitted by a dusk to dawn mosquito. To check this out refer to the CDC website. The medication needs to be started 2 weeks prior to travel and is taken once weekly.The PCP is smaller but we are able to enjoy privileges at the Caribe and Tropical princess next door. There are a variety of restaurents between the resorts, we haven't tried them all yet. Mamma Mias italian was quite good, but the steak place wasn't quite as expected. The buffet next door also offers a wider variety of food. A couple of our friends were down for a couple of days with stomach ailments, but that can happen anywhere. All in all, very nice. The entertainment next door was good. The lobby bars close at midnight but the beach bar is open quite late as is the disco. They do charge for drinks at the disco after midnight though. Pool is ok, needs some upgrades, but swim up bar is great, sometimes a little slow if busy. They do seem short of staff here, but they are all vey friendly and helpful. Glad we booked here, probably would try another resort next time, but worth the money.  
<Date>Jan 30, 2007

<Author>rhodgreen
<Content>Luxurious Peace Booked this hotel as a last minute holiday, hence had very little time to research our options before we booked. The hotel was a class above many of the other hotels in the area (we went exploring and had a little nosey around some other pool/reception areas). The hotel's ground are split with its older sister hotels - this makes for a nice walk in the evening when visitng some of the speciality restaurants.This hotel mainly catered for the Spanish. Most of the evening entertainments was for them, but was in fact quite small comapred to the main events that occured in the sister hotel.The rooms were very nice (split level), we had a slight musty smell when we arrived so the hotel installed a dehumidifier in our room which stayed with us for the week.The room was cleaned daily although initially this did not happen until very late in the afteroon when we were returning from the pool area. A quick word with guest relations resulted in earlier service.The food in the restaurants were very good. The all-inc choice was limited compared to some other hotels we've been to, but the quality was far superior. The speciality restaurants were slightly dissapointing, especially the ones in the other hotel. Superb fish restaurant, don't waste time with the itallian and chinese.Staff very courteus, getting served at the bars was easy and the drinks were of a high quality (fizz also available on request).Pools were clean (and constantly cleaned).Beach was the same as the rest of the area - very nice, and nice to stroll allong - shame there's no sunset visible from this side of the island.If you go with Airtours / MyTravel from the UK you will get a ground floor room - its what's been agreed/contracted for with the hotel.My final thoughts on this hotel compared to the Riu's/Iberostars (which we have prevsiously experienced) is that it is smaller, more relaxed, more luxurious, quieter, better buffets - but am not sure which I prefer. It doesn't get 5/5 as it was lacking something - hard to say what - possible character / identidy - something that was strong in the Riu's for instance.

<Author>LAL192
<Content>Nicest People We just got back from a week at the Princess and I was very impressed with the resort. If you love the beach then this is the place for you. Get VIP and then you can lay on these great beach beds, the lounge chairs and fine too. The pool is very clean and there are little huts for those of you who cannot handle the hot sun all day. The resort as a whole is immaculately clean and the rooms ave very comfortable. I was most impressed with the staff, they make you feel like you are royalty. We tipped a bit and made a point of getting to know some staff and I was sad to say goodbye to them. This is a quiet resort with no kids and no disco but down the street is the sister resort which you have access to and a shuttle goes to and from regularly. My only complaint was the buffet was sometimes not the greatest, there was nothing wrong with it but if you are used to gourmet than you would probably be dissapointed. The A La Carte's were good though. I would recommend this resort to anyone looking for a very clean, beautiful, and relaxing place to vacation. Again, the beach is unreal. White sand and aqua water as far as the eye can see.

<Author>Randola
<Content>Poor Food We just returned to Canada after 1 week at the Punta Cana Princess resort and are glad to be home. It was listed as a 4 star but the only thing about it that made it this way was the rooms which were the most comfortable we have had in 3 stays in the DR. The beach was great and the pool was nice but the food was horrible. The buffet was the worst I have had in 5 Caribbean trips and made me violently ill one evening which has never happened to me before. The a la carte's were ok but did not make up for the limited poorly prepared buffet. The staff were polite but were understaffed. We did like the entertainment crew but not enough to return to this resort. We will pay the extra money and go to the Gran Bahia Principe or the Grand Paladium Bavaro again, both of these resorts are 2 or more stars better than the Princess.

<Author>coryj1978
<Content>I really liked it! I went for the week starting the 30 of december until the th of January 2007. I had a really great time. The food was great, I must have gained pounds. The buffet was varried and the items were fresh and tasty. The lunch time BBQs at the beachside restaurant was fun.... especially yummy was the luncheon Paella party! The a la Carte restaurants were easy to get reservations to and the quality was good. I was actually pleasantly surprised with the Fondue restaurant--yummy. Oh my god the drinks were out of this world. You so have to try the Banana Mamas and the Coco Locos; now I know what heaven tastes like. The pool was great, and the swim up bar was like wow! The only thing is there are some people who stay in the in pool bar all afternoon and don't get out, but where are they peeing!!! lol Another great thing is the fact that there are no kids there, 18+ all the way. the common areas, the pools, the bars are all nice and calm. The bach is super, it is clean and no sea weed, they have people raking it and upkeeping the sand. The animation team is small but they are so full of energy, and they are reall nice people. The best bar is the lobby bar, the bartender to get is Dyanara(? I think thats how you spell it) she is super friendly and nice, she will make you laugh and she puts on a great mini show of her own. The housekeeping staff is oK THEY DO WHAT IS REQUIRED AND NOT MORE, the room is clean but little extras like swan folded towels (like i have grown accustomed to in Cuba are not luxury here). The front desk is ok, not the best customer service but not the worst either. Do not use your credit cards, we had a situation and we used it they were unable to reimburse us, big deal!!! Bring cash good old American dollars or else they try to swindle you ith exchange rates that fluctuate depending on what you are buying and who you are buying from. I loved it and had a great time but then again with the friend that i was with how could i not have the time of my life ;)

<Author>sydjord
<Content>relaxing My husband,daughters ages 12 and 16 and I stayed the week of December 5th,2006. We have been to many islands throughout the carribean, and this was by far the most relaxing. The resort is so vast, that you can easily find your own solitude. There was not really a night life, but then again we are not nightlife people. Tours are available if you want. We did snorkel and parasail and that was fun. The food is what you would expect in a poor country. Remember you are not in the states. Breakfast was great every morning on the beach. It consisted of eggs anyway you want , omelets, and great variety of breads and fruit. The coffee was strong and the milk is Goats milk, but you get used to it.Lunch we had again at the beach every day. Frenchfries hotdogs hamburgers and a great variety of hot dishes. My husband loved the salads, but there was no dressings only oil and balsamic vinegar. So remember to bring your own, he wished he did. For dinner we tried most of the restaurants. Chopin was an Excellent buffet, Italian was good, and The Steak house was excellent. The Seafood was so so. Remember you can always go to the buffet and eat if you are still hungry. The dinner buffet in the lobby has just about everthing you could want. Great hot entrees (some were strange like rabbit and bob white but hey you are on vacation BE DARING), a pasta station, salads, fruits and great deserts. The rooms were clean staff was great and super friendly. The language is mostly spanish, hardly any english, so brush up on your common phrases. My 16 year old loved the bartenders because they kept giving her alcohol in her drinks, so watch that with the kids. The beaches were beautiful and spotless. Get a hut at at least 8 am or they are gone. Also most of the guests were European, so remember is is not uncommon to be topless.Some extra tips1. Don't expect to get an American paper, there is none.2. When you turn your beach towels in get new ones for the next day. The Towel cabana doesn't open till 9am.3.Bring perscription Lomotil for diarrhea. Goats milk can be rough.4 . Be prepared to barter when shopping. They are very pushy and never give them what they say start at half or less.5 HAVE FUN AND RELAX!!!!!  
<Date>Jan 3, 2007

<Author>thebunner
<Content>Great Value Just got back from 2 weeks at the Punta Cana Princess ( Dec. 5 to 19) and thought I would share my findings with anyone looking for reviews. We had a great holiday. Along with the fact the resort is a little smaller (at 270+ rooms) than some and is adult only (according to staff this may change back in Feb.) it is a very quiet and relaxing setting. On the other hand, if you want more action  activity, you have the option to go next door to 2 large sister resorts and use the amenities and restaurants there. The rooms, resort, pool and beach are kept very clean.The food is fairly typical what you find in most D.R. resorts but plentiful and lots of variety. One would be hard pressed to not find something they like. The D.R. often gets a bad rap for people getting sick on the food or whatever but my own observation is that it is generally over consumption of sun, alcohol,  food, in that order. As is the case with traveling to any strange country, you might get thrown off a bit (and yes, I do) but this can be minimized if you ase into it?slowly and don go at it too hard at the start.The staff is great. While predominantly Spanish, they always seem to be able to communicate or will get someone that can. One has to empathize that they are dealing with English, French, German, and a host of other languages. Most important, they are a friendly (if you are) courteous, congenial people who seem happy to do for you what ever they can. I tip the occasional dollar out of appreciation (and also because they don receive gratuities as most operators suggest in their brochures) but it is not necessary in order to receive good service. A smile and simple racias?will go along way.The beach is rated by some travel magazines in the top 10 beaches in the world for a good reason. It is white, wide and long.To summarize, the 5 star rating by some operators might be a bit of a stretch but it is definitely 4+. Good bang for the buck. Go and enjoy your holiday.  
<Date>Dec 20, 2006

<Author>kdiddy
<Content>Absolutely fab!! The Punta Cana Princess is a fine example of a really good all inclusive package. We arrived as a large group, check in was as swift as it could possibly be, bell boys take your suitcase, I thoughtthe hotel was well signposted so you could find your room easily. We were in block 1000, close to bars and pools slightley further to the beach.Granted, not all the restaurants are as we would expect at home, but we aren't at home,we are in the Carribean, and a very poor area of it, so taking that into consideration the food was excellent. My favourite restaurant was Mama Mia at the Caribe and the Rio Grande at the PCP. Avoid the fondue restaurant, the food is not good and you end up raiding the buffet afterwards!!The pool area was extensive and kept spotlessley clean. All of the bars were kept well stocked (except they kept running out of tonic water!!) and drinks were kept flowing. Soon as you put one down another replaced it!!The beach is breathtakingly beautiful, and is cleaned daily. There are very few beach sellers that come an pester you, you have to really invite them as security guards keep a low presence.As we were only there for a week we only did one trip, which we booked through the watersports center, it was a day on a catamaran, swimming off the reef with tropical fish (fantastic) onto a large inflatable slide (way down the beach from the pcp)(my husband loved it!) and then swimming with sharks and rays (again fab) Then lunch was salads and burgers (simple but good) and onto a lagoon, we were provided with a floating bar and as much rum and coke as we could drink. Altogether a wonderful day.Our only problem was on the 6th night there was an almighty tropical storm and our bathroom ceiling caved in !! We were moved to an identical room oppsite and other than the inconvience of having to repack, all was dealt with quickley and satisfactorily.The entertainment staff are a credit to the hotel, having so many nationalities in one place it could have been difficult but it was done with such enthusism you couldnt help but get caught up in it all. The barman in the lobby bar was a mad as a box of frogs and kept us entertained well into the early hours.All in all, a great holiday, highly reccomended to all travellers.  
<Date>Nov 23, 2006

<Author>unu
<Content>ideal for a relaxing holdiay RACHEL  JAY GREEN LIVERPOOL ENGLANDwhat can i say! This was the best holiday i have ever been on.Me and my Husband (age 24, 23) arrived here on 30 Aug 2006 For 2 weeks and loved it. Our hotel room was lovely and i could not believe the size of the bed it was massive!!! This hotel is so clean it is unbelievable i have never been to one like it before. The pool is also cleaned twice daily and was really nice, not to hot or cold just right. here is a little list on what we thought of this holidayFOOD-some people would have a moan about the food and i honestly dont know why. Breakfast was so good, you had so much to choose from it was my favorite time of the day.Lunchtime was the worst, the buffet selection for lunch was not good, me and mu Husband used to go to the beach bar for lunch which is part of the hotel and right on the beach. It serves burgers, pizza, chips stuff like that. Whilst on our stay we went to three of the restaurants which i must say werent great. Tex Mex was quite nice,the best out of the three. Chinese was apalling and Italian was worse.The buffett at night was quite good and that was were we eat most nights. The Spaghetti dishes in the Buffett put the Italian to shame.Night Life-this was virtually none existent at the PCP you had to go to the hotel next door for the show and the disco, this was no problem what so ever as the little bus(golf cart) comes every 15 mins and it takes 3 mins to get to the hotel. The shows were not our cup of tea as when the people on stage would talk to the audience it was in so many different languages you got really confused. When thay did speak English you could not understand a word that was said.the night club was ok, we went there 2 times and had a good little boogy. The beach bar in the PCP was our little local and it was really nice sitting there of a night time, the breeze was lovely and it was nice to just chill and have a few weeks.Overall-even tough some of the restaurants were not very nice it did not put us of our holiday, this is a lovely hotel and the staff are lovely too. Anyone one going to PCP will enjoy it and it is for all age groups, Me and my husband would deffinetly go back to Punta cana, and i would certainley recommend this hotel.

<Author>Alwayshoneymooning
<Content>It was good for relaxing but the food wasn't My Husband and I (We are newlyweds) went to DR and stayed at the PCP July 26th - August 3rd, 2006.The rooms were nice - we got block 5000 - it's a must if your staying there - it's by the pool and beach and has ocean view.The people are friendly as can be - Dominican Time translation 10 minutes can mean an hour - things are slow paced there. The grounds and the rooms were always kept clean. Weather great! Beach Great! We did the snorkeling tour and it was nice.The downside - THE FOOD IS NOT GOOD! You can eat it but it's not good -breakfasts were better than the rest of the day's meals for sure. Room Service Menu is very limited and the food on it stinks. The pool is big, beautiful and clean - wasn't crazy about the way the staff takes monkeys on leash's for the people to take pictures with - the monkeys are treated badly.Rio Grand - we ate there twice the food was better there. You have to make reservations MUCH MUCH in advance or forget it! Do all your reservations the first day you get there! Italian Restaurant was horrible (Mama Mia or something like that)Seafood wasn't that good either. Buffet or Rio Grand - whenever we went to another place to eat we would end up going to the buffet anyway cause we were starved! It wasn't a bad vacation but we wouldn't go again.

<Author>Airlinerep
<Content>PCP Very Good Experience My daughter and I just returned from a trip to Punta Cana.We loved thePCP. I was a little aprehensive reading past reviews,but our experience was wonderful.The room was large and clean. We stayed in the 5000 block,so we had a lovely view of the beach and ocean. The resortis very well kept, the pool was large and not crowded. Thebuffet had a great variety of different foods, so even if youate there regularly, you had many options. We only triedthe italian restaurant ( did not like it), and Rio Grande ( tex-mex)which was very good.We were very careful about the water, and we had no problemsat all. The weather was hot but very breezy. The ocean waterwas a little rough and murky ( due to the seaweed), but wasstill very enjoyable. The beach and pool have a large quantityof palapas and chairs. I never had a problem getting a good spot.Staff is very friendly ( single girls sometimes receive too muchunwanted attention from the male staff).Overall a very good experience, excellent place to relax.

<Author>Dancer14
<Content>Clean, friendly  July 8,2006 2 weeks in beautiful Punta Cana. The resort is kept immaculate. Of course all the workers are friendly  helpful, expecially Carlos one of the animators, he always came over to say hello and to ask about our daughter who he included in all the games and shows. (She is 17). The best thing was eating at the specialty restaurants. You need to make a reservation in the morning, but it never costs you extra and you can go to the other resorts as well. Book early (8:00am) We always ate at 6:30 and were usually the only ones in the restaurant until 8:00pm. TEX MEX Grill ...Awesome! Mama Mia.....great pizza  lasagna  soups. Tipping is always enjoyable for us so we bring $150.00 in $1 US bills and tip everyone from the conceirge, maid, porter, bar tender, lady who comes around with coffee at breakfast etc. We also bring old clothes, toys, candy, toiletries, medical supplies and make-up to give to the people who work at the hotel. They truly appreciate it and always give us special attention. Everything about the hotel was great. We never had to put towels on a chair to reserve a spot, there are plenty at the beach and the pool. It is great to have the trolley to take you around the 3 properties even if you just go for a ride after dinner.Beautiful spot for a Wedding if your looking they have it right on the beach in a Gazebo with palm covered arches leading the way with flowers and covered chairs with bows. The bride is brought in on a horse drawn large white carriage. No Complaints.  
<Date>Aug 2, 2006

<Author>barbbutterfly
<Content>Heaven here on earth!!!!! My daughter and I booked this trip a few days before going. We couldn't have made a better choice. The people that worked at the PCP were very friendly and efficient. We were waited on hand and foot with such beautiful smiles. They really went out of their way to make sure we had a great holiday!!!!We took lots of US one dollar bills for tips and they were very much appreciated. Many people did not tip and the staff still gave everyone excellent service. We especially loved the fillet mignon at the Tex Mex Restaurant. The theme nights at the buffet were excellent. We couldn't believe how much variety there was at the buffet during the week. On our last night there we enjoyed the Beach party or Dominicana night. It was heavenly to sit on the beach with the cool ocean breeze, sip Banana Mamas and eat such delicious food. We enjoyed the excursion to Dolphin Island. Although the one macaw tried to eat my daughter and she got quite a pinch on her shoulder. Swimming with the dolphins was a lot of fun. We also went on the sunset horseback riding excursion which was amazing. We got to explore some natural areas along the beach that hadn't been invaded by resorts. After an hour they stopped to give the horses a break and one of the guys climbed a tree and brought down coconuts for everyone. It was nice to have the opportunity to taste the milk. The resort couldn't have been cleaner. In the mornings the staff actually scrub the walkways. The beach is absolutely gorgeous and they had a ton of lounge chairs under grass umbrellas.  
<Date>Jul 27, 2006

<Author>ditravels
<Content>Punta Cana, Yes! Bravara Princess Never Again! This was my 4th time in Punta Cana  I find it a beautiful island country with friendly people  I hope someday they will be able to afford to live in comfort. However, this time the resort was way below every other one I've been to. The Apple catalog advertises it as a 5 apple. I was talked into going to it because the travel agent said it was on sale. I had another resort in mind. On the way there, the apple rep told us it was not a 5, maybe a 4. In any case, it was so large you're always on a shuttle to get somewhere. We had been in Punta Cana at the same time 4 yrs earlier at another resort (our weding was there)  my husband picked gorgeous flowers for my bouquet. This resort was neat, but no flowers! The food was disappointing, even though I didn't gain as much weight as I had feared, when I'm on vacation, I want good food! Even the ala carte restaurants were lacking. The drinks were VERY weak! When tips are included, you shouldn't have to flash $ to get a decent drink. I'm on vacation  not driving for gosh sakes! When you think you're getting a suite really you are getting more sitting room, which is not necessary when you're on a beach vacation! We had more amenities at the airport hotel in Cleveland. The beach was beautiful  you make the best of it--after all, it's vacation! But I would NEVER recommend this resort!  
<Date>Jul 26, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved It! My husband and our kids stayed at the PCP, from June 27 to July 11th and it was AMAZING! There was always something to do, like getting a massage, going touring, snorkeling, lying and lazying around on the beach, swimming in the HUGE pool, pigging out at the restaurants, visiting and having and wild night at the casino, walking down the beach and buying some souvenirs, at night time walk down the beach and look at the beautiful view and plenty more. The hotel was always clean! Beds made, Bathrooms fixed, ect.. Whenever we left our room, when we came back it was clean. The room service was quick and great too. The food was pretty good. There were some time's that the food wasn't the right temperature. For example what should be hot was warm or cold, and what should be cold was hot or warm. But that happened rarely, not to often. On the other hand, most of the restaurants were clean and had great food! Definantley recommend the italin cuisine and the Tex Mex. Chinese food buffet had a lot of variety, something different for everyone's taste. The snack bar had a lot of variety too. The swim up bar had great service, recommend you visit it more than once.  The beach and pool left me speechless! In the morning the beach would be cleaned and at night. The pool was clean and not to crowded. Before I went to the resort I thought that there was no way I could go to the pool because it would be packed with people and if you swan you would bunp into someone constantly. But I was wrong. There was always room everywhere, on the beach and pool. Probably because most of the people there are trying the activities most of the time. Definantley recommend scuba diving with sharks. It was so fun! The sharks were pretty friendly, although I didn't go near to many of them.  The massage was so soothing. I live in the busy world of sitting on a computer all day and being stressed all the time. While being massaged I forgot about everything. The masseuse I had was really good!  The hotel has a club for kids and teens. My 16 year old daughter had a great time going to the teen clubs. I felt comfortable knowing it was supervised. My son who is 8 went to the kids club and had a blast! He still talks about it! While our kids were at these clubs that left me and my husband alone. Alone for a romantic night. We would go to a restaurant, and walk on the quiet moonlite beach. Then go to the hotel and have some a lone time. Something we've both been to busy to have. Then our kids come bac and tell us about their night. The staff was kind, accomodating, and more than willing to cater to your every need. A few words of advice and some reccommendations...:- Don't go to the casino often, maybe once on your whole trip.- Go scuba diving! A lot of fun!!- Make sure you don't miss out on the Tex Mex, Chinese and Italian restaurant! Highly recommend it.- Don't waste a moment there because you won't want to leave, and when you do you feel you should have used that moment better!- Take walks, clears your mind of stress... trust me!!- Tips are not needed to be left, I did, but some of my money was returned... This is a resort I would recommend to families of 4 or 5 the most, and hneymooners. Very romantic and fun.  
<Date>Jul 12, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Will not return Stayed at the Princess resort for 6 days in May and although the resort was beatiful and well maintained they have some serious flaws. 1-Hardly anything is done or spoken in English. How can you understand songs or entertainment when everything is in spanish, even the poolside entertainment.2-None of the restrarants are air-conditioned, they try but when you walk out with sweat dripping everywhere, it makes for a bad dining experience.3-Beware at the buffets, especially the main one. While wating for it open for lunch one day I watched as these birds walked along the salad bar helping themselves. Do not eat anything unless it's cooked!!! and Yes we both got sick. You have to bring your own ketsup and salad dressing.4-Don't know why you can never get reservations in the restruants since they are never more than 1/2 full.5-Found out after 3-4 days that you have to ask for liquor in your frozen drinks. This was only after waving a tip in the air.6-upgrade to platium service. It is well worth the small amount they charge.7-You are warned not to go outside the front gate. it is definetley a third world country.had somebody tell me he wanted my camera at the little Plaza outside the front entrance. Lucky for me a policeman was walking by because we quickly left and ran across the street to safety.8-The casino, a joke spent every bit of 5 minutes in there and luckly only lost 5 dollars.9-Don't even ask for a ocean view room. There are not any. Did hear the honey mooners had a decent view.Well I could go on forever but I'm sure you get my point. They do not like Americans and our next vacation will be back at Cancun where they appreciate everything you do for them.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>2yrs in a row and still love it!! Above all I have to say the service was awesome!!!! Anything you want or need the staff was more than willing to show you where to get it or even get it for you!! The staff was very attentive to every need! We did the Vip package and it was worth it. With the Vip pk. you get a free massage, free room service, and domestic beers (budweiser), plus more! The resort is on the smaller side compared to some of the others. However, it was very well manicured and relaxing. No nightclubs on this resort makes for less night traffic in and out. The other princesss resorts next door have nightclubs that you can take a trolley over to. The pool bar service was great! It does get crowded at times but the bartender does a good job getting to everyone!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Wonderful Resort for Relaxing Vacation Just got home from a vacation at Punta Cana All-Suites Resort and spa. Stayed from June 26 to July 3rd. Went with my husband and 2 children (3  12 y.o.) . Went to Punta Cana last year. We stayed then at Breezes. We enjoyed both locations, but PCPrincess is a muched more relaxed location. There are only about 250 rooms compared to Breezes with over 700. There were fewer activities for the kids, but they could do the kids club. Additionally, if you book the VIP service you have access to the other two resorts next door owned by Princess. They have many more activities. However you will notice the difference when you visit there. It is quite busy and loud. It is was too noisy compared to PCPrincess. We only went over there to go to La Cava italian restaurant (excellent).The beach at this location were absolutely beautiful. We were able to walk in either direction to the local vendors. This was fun, but they are very aggressive. I am not the type that enjoys a tough negotiation (I felt they got annoyed when you didn't buy). Only go if you are up for the challenge of trying to negotiate a bargan. Most of the time I felt I was being ripped off. Still they had some nice jewelry, and beach cover-ups we wore the entire stay. The beach offers all types of water sports, banana boat, snorkeling, parasailing, etc. We chose to relax at the beach. You can buy sand toys at the PCPrincess Minimarket, $9 US. The kids liked the pool the best. We could barely get them out. We were there from 9am to 5pm most days. They loved it. Rooms were clean and of good size. Checkin was smooth.Food was good. It is not what you are commonly used to eating at home. We made the most of it. They were more than willing to try to accomodate any special requests. As a matter of fact they brought out an entire cake for my son's 3rd birthday while we dined at the Tex Mex restaurant. They turned down the lights and sang with music piped in to the whole restaurant. It was lovely. We did have a few bad stomach days. Not sure if this is due to the food or the water. We didn't get sick the last time we were in Punta Cana. We would definately go back. Had a great stay. We heard from another traveler, however, that the resort is going adults only Nov. 1. Too bad for us with kids. Have fun!  
<Date>Jul 3, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>First Class - Well Almost! We booked a week at this resort flying from Manchester. The other guests were mainly American with a few Europeans. We loved it! It was clean and everyone was really friendly the rooms are big and nicley furnished. The food was good especially the Chinese restaurant. The buffet is always a good bet but the restaurants are a hit or a miss not awful just not always great.There is a VIP package you can arrange on arrival I would say if you want room service and you like diving go for it otherwise why bother you get a mini bar with soft drinks water and beer as standard and there is a 24 hour snack bar.We found it no problem to get a sun bed at the beach or by the pool even as late as 12 noon. Definately investigate the other hotels the disco is good and the Casino not bad. The only thing that got a bit much was the Bingo every night at reception!This was our second trip to the Dominican and we would highly recommend this hotel bear in mind this is a third world country and things are maybe not as 'polished' as you would expect back home. We would book this hotel again ideal for total relaxation!!  
<Date>Jul 3, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fifty fifty Stayed at the Punta Cana Princess from 19th to 27th June 2006.On check in we were told they had no booking for us and blamed our tour operator. Our tour operator later blamed the hotel. Eventually we got our rooms.The accomodation was ok. Big, well furnished rooms that had a musty smell. This was explained by the flooding of our rooms on the ground floor a couple of days into our stay. We left a tip for the maid most days but found we actually got a better service when we hadn't left any money. Go figure.We thought the food was pretty foul in the restaurants but the buffet was bloody good throughout the weeks stay and cant fault it (Gala night was great).The female staff were friendly and polite but the majority of the male employees were unfriendly. We experimented with the bar attendant at the beach bar who was really rude for the duration of our stay. We got our wallet out at the bar one time and the next thing he was high-fiving us.The drinks were good, but you coudn't get to the pool bar due to the american contingent that set up camp there for the week. The pool was good and very clean, with not too much competition for sun loungers.The beach was breathtaking and really hot. We visted some of the other hotels which we found to be much busier than the Punta Cana Princess and not as landscaped. Had a massage which was really great and you can haggle them down too. Went swimming with sharks and rays at the Marineaquarium but be warned that they turn this excusion into some kind of ibiza party, nightmare trip with awful music and irritating staff. The sharks and rays are good though so go for that experience at least. We heard that the safari excusion was total crap where you visit an authentic Dominican household where all the kids have no shoes but each has a brand new mobile phone.The last thing is that there's the photographers that go around each day with snakes, parrots, monkies and iguanas. This is cruel and we saw him hold the monkey out over the pool by a leash as a joke. I dont know why people condone these guys by having their photo taken with them each day. Shameful.  
<Date>Jun 28, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Wonderful and Relaxing If you are looking for a beautiful hotel, large, spacious rooms with sitting area and balconey then this hotel is excellent. Very inexpensive all-inclusive. Grounds are well groomed and maintainted. The ocean is clear-blue; beaches are white, warm and wonderful with a cooling breeze (it's quite hot with out it). If you are going to the Dominican for a culinary experience-- don't. The buffets are good: The fruits and vegetables are fresh. The meat and fish was always dry and slightly tough. Breads, pateries, cakes and ice cream were okay but little flavor. Lunch meat was fine, but the cheese is not good. Three restaurants on premises were hit or miss; same goes for the five restaurants at it's sister resort next door which is much larger and much, much busier.Tex-mex: good entrees, not apps2 Italian: non-meat filled pasta is good with any of the saucesChinese: horrible all around, except the fried ice creamDominican: by far the best of all. As the saying goes : When in Rome, do as the Romans.If you are looking for a relaxing, uneventful holiday with lots of sun then this is the place. My wife and I would definately go back.  
<Date>Jun 14, 2006

<Author>ambow
<Content>Good place to lose weight My sister and I (both seniors) just returned from a week at Punta Cana Princess...We were very disappointed with the food.Our accomodations were acceptable, but the resort, while beach front, goes very deep so from the main lobby to the beach is a walk of at least 2 city blocks.Beach towels are only available at the activities center on the beach, so if you are only going to the pool it is a long walk for a towel.Our sheets were not changed for 5 days and only after we requested the service.We were told if we wanted our sheets changed we should strip the bed!!!!!We ate at the Rio Grand for Tex Mex...it was the best food we had all week, but the Cesaer salad was made with head lettuce and swimming in dressing.We also went to the Oriental Restaurant...the worst food we had all week, altho' it was a l carte, we really could not order from the menu, the courses were just delivered.Nice beach, friendly staff, lots of birds and mosquitoes.

<Author>DottyJ
<Content>Nothing could be better We stayed at the BP May 21-28th. We went platinum and our room was 2 minutes from the beach. Upon arrival the perfect vacation began. Rooms were fabulous, service at both the bars and restaurants were exceptional and of course the beach - well what can I say this was our second time to Bavaro Beach and it has to be the most beautiful beach in the Caribbean. The weather was hot hot hot - not one drop of rain. I was down on the beach at 7:30 every morning to get our Palapa (not supposed to but everyone else does) and we stayed on the beach until around 4PM. Never saw the pool. Arrived back at our room and would call room service for bottle(s) of wine and beer (no charge for platinum guests) and within 5 minutes they arrived- ice bucket- glasses etc. Sitting out on the balcony overlooking the ocean and gardens - what more could one say for a more idyllic setting. The only small disappointment I had was with the food. We mostly ate in the buffet restaurant as all other of the restaurants required the men to wear long pants (I really think dress shorts would have been suffice) and when the temp is 95 in the evening it is really not fair to the men. We ate at Licey and it was so so - was supposed to be airconditioned but was not. The Piano bar in the main lobby was beautiful. We also ate at Bella Pasta one night and the food they served was the same as what you could get at the Pasta bar in the buffett restaurant in the lobby and the service at Bella was very rushed. Other than that, 5 thumbs up for El Gaucho in the morning for breakfast. Made to order omelets a glass of wine and toast and sitting outside overlooking the beach - heaven.All in all we had a great time and would recommend this resort to anyone.Ola  
<Date>Jun 6, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great place to relax! We traveled to the PCP from May 5-May 11, 2006. A family affair, myself, my sister and her son, who is 13. Having read almost every review, we went with the VIP package - definitely a must! Well worth the $60 pp for the week. We were in 5207 - right by the pool and the beach with a fantastic view overlooking the property and beach. The room was very spacious with a vaulted ceiling, two queen beds, and the living area with the trundle bed and TV, not to forget the balcony. If you're a smoker, you're definitely not in the US. You can smoke almost anywhere you like in DR. ( Even the airport). As a guest of PCP, you also had access to the Caribe and the Tropical, we hit on the Caribe for the buffett one night, the La Cava, and the Sombrero. First, the hotel is very clean, both inside and out. We left small items for the maid in the AM with a few dollars and had everything we needed. We found out on our next to last night that you actually have 2 maids for your room. One in the morning and one in the evening for turn down etc. We were only leaving items for the day maid, and aplogized to the evening maid for not knowing. Gave her a few dollars once we realized our error. The staff, in general, were extremely helpful and friendly. They definitely remember you when you have tipped them a dollar or two! I did find, however, that it definitely helpful if you speak spanish. There is a trolley that goes from each sister hotel if you perfer not to walk, but it is also extremely difficult to know where to go as the maps at the PCP are not legible. Once you're in the Caribe, to find your way back is a maze! There are no posted maps and while they have arrows pointing you to different places, find one first! The not so great - the food, most definitely. Breakfast was the best buffet meal at the PCP. Don't expect an American hot dog or pizza! At lunch, the freshly cooked chicken or pork cutlets were your best bet, the rest of the food was not kept hot when it was a hot dish. The Caribe had a buffet that was almost three times the size of PCP. Definitely worth going to one night, otherwise, do the a la carte. With the VIP package you can schedule your dinner reservations ahead of everyone else. We did the La Cava and the Sombrero at Caribe. Unless you like a lot of heat, stay away from the Sombrero and their menu was misleading. The La Cava was great! At the PCP they have the Tex-Mex which we went to twice - great beef! The filet mignon was excellent.The casino - let's say I went every night - came home a winner a few times, but as with most casinos, they want your money and they will get it. Met a couple of really nice people, and a few hard-core gamblers who need to realize this is a vacation resort - not Atlantic City or Vegas.The market by the Red Tower Casino - let's say I didn't buy much on the island. Found their prices too high, even if I did barter it down. I don't particularly care when I'm followed around or coerced into someone's store. You find it in one, it's in all the others. I bought another bottle of rum and a box of cigars at one place, only because I wasn't harrassed when I walked in to look around.Overall, the location was excellent, very quiet at night. Security was around and checked that you were a guest at that specific hotel before you went through the lobby. You have access to the other hotels if you want to party, or you can stay in to relax. If I ever decide to go back, would I stay at this hotel - most definitely.  
<Date>May 21, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Puta Cana Princess - Excellent Place To Stay My wife and myself stayed at the Punts Cana Princess the last week in April 2006 We made the right choice and took the Platinum Club option. Check in was at the Platinum Club lounge. It was easy and no line ups to get in. This lounge featured breakfast and drinks throught the day everyday. The Platinum club rooms are all down clost to the beac and pool. The shuttle around the grounds is great but we did not have to use it to go to the beach or pool. because we were right there. The dinners at the ala-carte restaurants were the best. We are both fifty and have travelled throught the Carribean. This is one of the best all-inclusives that we have stayed. A1TWTT@aol.com

<Author>thepaintmaker
<Content>Thank you Trip Advisor authors - place was awesome... This was our first trip to the Carribean and our first all-inclusive resort and we could not have been more pleasantly surprised with the Punta Cana Princess. The resort was beautiful, clean and just the right size for a relaxing family vacation. The rooms were larger than expected and the friendliness and attitude of the entire staff was EXCELLENT...it made the trip. The beach is beautiful and the food selection, quality and availability were very good also. It was hard to think of a complaint and we hated to leave - we will be back. Try a 'Punta Cana Princess drink at one of the bars - it quickly became a family favorite! Thanks to everyone who wrote reviews on the PCP as it was the sole reason we chose this resort over other properties.

<Author>ptflynn
<Content>Punta Cana Princess Just OK No major problems, but not real impressed.VIP - A great deal for the right price, but be careful. Loved the massages, dinner at La Cava, and some of the other benefits. Here's the problem. The Travel Agent couldn't get it in advance, PCP told them it wasn't available. Price quoted in advance by the TA was $50 per person. Travel agent suggested asking at check in. We did and INSTANTLY were told fine, it was $17 per day per person, which came to $68 each, which was still a good deal. If you do it this way, GET IT IN WRITING. At checkout, they tried to bill us something over $100 per person. Luckily, the person who checked us in was there and remembered what she quoted us and said they would fix it, but it took over AN HOUR to get a manager to do that. We had to enlist the help of our contact from Coco Tours, who was GREAT (see more on that below). So it worked out fine, but was a big hassle. Felt a little like a scam.The Room - you MUST get the top floor with vaulted ceilings. Gives the room a much more spacious feeling. The layout is fine, but the 'suite' description is bunk. The 'sitting area' is great if you have kids, it is really a trundle bed, and is VERY uncomfortable as a sofa. Room is very clean, no bugs. The Property - beautiful, very well maintained.Beach - positively beautiful, the best. Very limited equipment for 'non motorized water sports', we have had much more available at other resorts. Also limited choices for the 'one motorized' that is included with the VIP. We chose the catamaran and it was great because there was a staff member to steer. The other choices were with groups, one is riding a big 'banana' that is sort of a thrill ride, we watched and they always went very fast and knocked people off. Probably fun for the spring break crowd, but not for us.The Staff - all super friendly, not one will walk past you without a cheerful Hola.The Bars - the bartenders were not trained to do anything well except pour beer. The worst Pina Coladas I ever drank. We stuck to Bloody Marys or Margueritas, thinking they were 'standard' and couldn't be messed up. Those drinks were OK, but almost EVERY time, they were OUT of some ingredient, and had to hike somewhere to get something while we waited. Pain in the you know what.The Food - the buffet was fine, not great but more than sufficient. It does get a little boring every day. What saves it is the omelets to order at breakfast, carving stations at lunch and dinner, those things were the best. The Italian restaurant was just OK, the cheese bread there was fabulous. La Cava over at the Caribe was GREAT, order the lobster which is included as part of the VIP, it's twin lobster tails and was great. Bread at La Cava was good too. Funny, while the bread was SO good at the speciality restaurants, there's a BIG bread station at the buffet, which was worthless, nothing but various white breads - boring!!!Casino - awful, the worst, don't bother.Guest Services - wish I could remember her name, she was delightful and very helpful with dinner reservations, which was part of the VIP deal. You MUST make your first reservation as soon as you arrive, they have some system where they turn them in WAY in advance, so be aware of that.Entertainment - almost non-existent at PCP. Hubby went to the Caribe, and entertainment there was inconsistent. Once it was awful, he said everyone was walking out. Another time he went, he said it was pretty good.Bottom line - we would not stay there again.PS - we traveled with Vacation Express on Xtra Airways from Sanford FL, it was GREAT and I will definitely use them again. $50 bucks per person gets you upgraded to First Class, with free drinks and FOOD (sandwich or great chicken caeser salad). They were on time in both directions. The transfers in PC were through Coco Tours, and our 'guide' was Domaso and he was OUTSTANDING. He was at the hotel every day, just to be helpful. We didn't book any tours, but he didn't care. He was very helpful with the VIP overbilling problem that I mentioned in the beginning. We were really appreciative of his assistance with that mess.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>peaceful, restful holiday Several mothers and their senior high school daughters visited this lovely place over Easter and spring break. We all had a wonderful time. We upgraded to the VIP package which was well worth it. The staff at this facility is unbelievable! We have never seen people work so hard and be so pleasant all of the time. They are also very helpful. It is amazing that they can take care of people that speak so many different languages too. They don't make much money, so we tipped them regularly. The beach is very beautiful and the water sports available are lots of fun. The water is shallow and clear quite a ways out. The pool was also very nice and like everything else, very clean. There are bars everywhere offering free drinks of all kinds. There are also many restaurants. You can always find something to eat, but we felt this was the only area that was lacking. The food seemed to appeal to the Europeans, but the Americans......we just didn't care for most of it. The Italian restaurant was pretty good. The cheesy bread and the pizzas are ok. Also the chef at the morning buffet made eggs to order. The french fries and grilled chicked are pretty good. Our girls lived on room service, which is free with VIP. There is very little shopping, t-shirts, caps, necklaces, trinkets. There is a casino, we never went. and a discoteque, our girls went every night. The spa turned out to be fabulous!!!! We all loved it! Our Punta Cana, Princess All Suites experience was a good one. Cincinnati, Oh.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Beautiful Setting, Terrible Food! My boyfriend and I stayed at the Punta Cana Princess in August of 2005. The trip was amazing but there were a few things about the resort that were not so great.First of all let me start of with the GOOD:The resort location was beautiful! Though small, the resort was very cozy and convinient to get around on because it was very small. The pool was warm and spacious. The beach was incredible, not a rock in the sand, and the water was glorious; hot and clear. There was never a problem getting a chair at the beach or the pool. The weather was great all week, very HOT and it never rained. We had the benefit of using the facilities at the other two resorts, which was great, and they were easy to get to. Reservations were never hard to make at the restaurants and the food was much better than at the buffets.The best part of our vacation was the wonderful people we met. In our first five minutes we met a couple from Toronto, Steve and Keisha, who we spent the whole week with and now we're planning our next vacation together. What a BONUS! Along with others, such as the nicest couple from Florida, Pete and Lynne, who we had a great time chatting with in the water.Now, for the BAD:Check in was quick but we got a double bed room and they did not accomodate us by changing it to a King size bed. Then they brought the wrong luggage to our room. The rooms were nice, but felt dirty, sometimes even stunk, so that wasn't to pleasant and of course the worst part about the rooms was that the balcomy doors did not lock!The food was awful! We all lost weight because we barely ate, we lived mostly on fruits (Mango and salt, as our new friends reccomended) The drinks were OK...but nothing special. The nightlife was horrible....there was nothing to do. The disco was not even worth going to and that was pretty much the only option. So we ended up sitting at the beach bar or lobby most nights, with very few people there. The casino was usually empty and pretty far, so there was no reason to go there either.There was also nothing to buy, there were a few shops but there was nothing worth spending your money on, and they were also extremely over priced!Oh....and if you like to relax and be left alone on the beach, don't count on it, because we were constantly taken away by the resort staff to go dancing on the beach or take pictures....so watch out for them, because they will get you!This was our first trip to the Carribean, and I have to say that I would absolutely return to Punta Cana, because it was stunning! But I would not go back to the Punta Cana Princess. We had a great time, mostly because we met such fantastic people but if you are looking for luxury and delicious exotic fruits, this is not the place to go!Happy Travelling Everyone!Martyna and AndrewToronto  
<Date>Apr 26, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Very Nice My husband and I have been to Punta Cana three times (we have stayed at the RIU Palace and Sunscape the Beach), this time we decided to tried the Punta Cana Princess (4/1/06-4/8/06). We upgraded to a VIP status and definitely suggest everyone to do the same. First, as a VIP the Tropical Princess and the Caribe resorts were also yours to use (stay at one, play at three). We also received a free 20 min. massage (each), free internet use (1 hour each), reservations to any of the restaurants in any of the three resorts (which was taken care of for you by the hotel), your beach towels were placed in your room every night, 1 hour free scuba diving, and 1 hour motorized sport of your choosing, all this for upgrading to VIP status. The PCP was very nice, pool (and pool bar) beautiful and the beach always great. Never had any problem getting chairs or drinks. The food was outstanding, especially the Italian restaurants. We decided to take the Catamaran Trip. This was great. You start on the catamaran to a private island, have lunch, swim and then take speed boats to a place in the ocean (about 3/4 mile off shore) where you can stand in the water (waist high) and look for starfish. We can't say enough about Punta Cana and will be back again (to another resort) in November.  
<Date>Apr 20, 2006

<Author>springbreakKY
<Content>Great resort, beautiful beach I read many reviews of the Punta Cana Princess before our trip so want to add mine for those considering going. We were a group of 10 adults and 9 children of mixed ages. A great time was had by all. We all booked the VIP package but only two of the five groups were given an ocean view room. The VIP package without a room with a view isn't worth it in my opinion. The massage, internet etc. you have to have a coupon and it is more trouble than it is worth. The rooms overall are spacious and well kept. Again, we were VIP but didn't get the nightly turn down service most nights. Food overall was really good. We tried and enjoyed all of the al a carte restaurants and especially liked the Italian and Tex-Mex. The buffet was also good some nights more so than others. Room service was an added plus even with a limited menu. Staff was AWESOME. Very friendly. Emillio in the lobby bar was the best and the animation staff kept all entertained. My husband won a contest and was crowned Mr. Punta Cana Princess so of course we had fun. The beach is the prettiest I've ever been to. I would return here over Cancun or the Mayan Riveria for the beach alone. Constant breeze and beautiful water. I hope to return same time next year. All in all a great value for the $$.  
<Date>Apr 18, 2006

<Author>BLEXV6
<Content>A great place to enjoy a quiet holiday, or party @ sister hotels. We just returned from our trip from April 8 to 15th, 2006. We attended with 3 other couples, however we went down the second of 2 weeks, where the other 3 couples were down for 2 weeks. We all had a great time. Heres a synopsis.Rooms: We were a Super VIP which gave us an Ocean view room. What a great view of both the pool and ocean. We had a second level unit. The rooms were clean and surprisingly not musty smelling as I usually find and accept at these very humid counties. The A/C worked well, the rooms had a great bathroom, very clean, keeping in mind, this resort is only 2 years old. The mini- bar was stocked every day, with bottled water, Sprite, Coca-Cola, and a beer, which was disgusting. We simply asked the maid to put in Presidente in a bottle and it was done. That is a great beer, but is better bottled than on draught. We had VIP and as such they changed our towels twice a day with a nightly turn down service. It may not seem important but it was nice. The rooms were also big suites. Another good VIP feature is the beach towels are right in the room, and as such you don't need to get cards to redeem them at the towel room. You do however have to exchange your towels as needed at the towel room. At the end of your trip, you just leave the towels in the room and do not need return the cards to the front, as opposed to trading in your towels to the towel room, getting the cards and returning them upon your departure to the front desk.Beach: What can I say, excellent. The Bavaro beach is amongst the best I have ever seen. Also, no one is allowed on your beach except PCP guests. This is not seemingly an important thing, until you go over to the Princess Caribe and Princess Tropical, (sister hotels), and see how crowded their beaches are. We have security constantly turning non guests away from the beach and property as a whole. It keeps the PCP population quite low. Also, we can go to the 2 sister hotels, but they cannot come to the PCP.Pools: Only one large pool with a swim up bar. Very nice and clean. This is because of the relatively low population at this resort compared with the sister hotels.Grounds: One word, immaculate. All publice toilets are clean and new. The layout is small and you can walk from the beach to the front lobby in 5 minutes.Lobby: Small but quaint with a nice bar.Bonus: You can use all facilities at the sister hotels, and can take a tram at the PCP or just walk over, (5 minute walk along the beach, or 15 minutes if you don't take the tram from the front lobby of PCP. You will find the food selection better and sometimes tastier at the sister hotels, but the population at these hotels is significantly larger and is more crowded and it's a bit of a feeding frenzy as a result.Buffet: Basically good quality food for all meals, at the main buffet, especially the pasta bar, but you do get tired of it, which I find with most all-inclusives. Very good deserts.Ala-cartes: We went to the Tex-Mex and I had the filet mignon 2x, (we went twice), and it was delicious. We also went to the seafood, of which I am not a big fan and I had an excellent bonless chicken. The others had the seafood which was said to be good. Both are on the PCP grounds, and one couple also went to the Italian, which they loved. There are others, but we did not attend.Drinks: At the PCP, the base beer was Presidente. As stated earlier the bottled was better than the draught but both were good. For VIPs, they had bottled Budweiser, and Presidente. IMHO, the Presidente is a better beer. At the sister hotels, they had Miller High Life and Heineken in bottles, but not at PCP. I found this strange as the PCP is supposed to be a better class of hotel than the sister hotels.The rum was good, and there were very good rum drinks. I recommend you try a Tropical. Most bartenders can make it nicely, some can not do any better than pour beer, which is tough to screw up.For liquors. VIP gets you Drambuie, Frangelico, Grand Marnier, Kaluha.This was a good trip, and if you are looking for a very good resort, clean, this is it. I have also been at the Occidental Grand Flamenco, Princess Bavaro in the last year and would recommend them all. (all on the Bavaro beach.) I liked the quiet of the PCP the best.  
<Date>Apr 15, 2006

<Author>jollyjane
<Content>you'll love it we just got back and thought that since I found the reviews to be so helpful that I should also write one. It has got to be the cleaness place I have ever been, considering once you get outside the resort , this is like an oasis in a very poor country. The resort is quiet which we really liked and there were many families with small children which was great for them also. One thing that I had noticed that the beach is so hard that many of the families enjoyed walks on the beach with their strollers, yes it was so hard that strollers moved around very well. There was lots of food and you always found something to your liking to eat. Our favorite resturant was the Italian one right at the resort El Blanca.There were theme nights at the buffet every night so actually staying right at the resort was just so convinent . The Caribe was much larger and we only made it over there once during our 2 week stay and when we did there were alot of people smoking so we didn't stay for the whole show. The people work so hard there and are always singing or smiling.We really enjoyed tipping them as we knew that it is what they needed the most.If you are looking for a nice small resort that you almost walk out of your room on the beach then this is the one for you.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>One week stay April 4-11/06 at the Punta Cana Princess Just back from a week's vacation at the PCP - relied on reviews before our travels. Overall, a nice holiday - the beach was beautiful - the resort was very clean - we upgraded to VIP and the room was lovely with vaulted ceiling and fan - beautiful view of both the ocean and the pool. Food not the greatest but managed to survive - a little difficult for the kids - they ate a lot of pasta! We were looking forward to the Tex-Mex Restaurant due to other reviews but must have been there on an off night - ordered the filet mignon which was more of a brisket that could not be cut. Enjoyed the Mexican Sombrero Restaurant, the Brazillian and La Cava. A good suggestion from other travellers was to bring face cloths - your own beach towel for comfort is also recommended. My husband on day six fell ill with food poisioning and our girls not well on our last evening - the flight home was a little rough for them as well. We would return for the beach and the glorious sun - the weather could not have been better - a constant breeze keeps you comfortable from day to night!  
<Date>Apr 12, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Well worth searching for My boyfriend and I stayed at the Punta Cana princess from March 4th-March 11th. We had the best time. We spent some time researching where to go, and this hotel had everything we wanted. We booked the VIP package, and that was the best idea. For an extra $60.00 pp we had our own personal concierge-Sandra, who took reservations for us at any time of the day and generally looked out for us and provided us with information. We had access to premium alcohol (although the presidente was fine), one hour each of free internet, one hour free of motorized sports (a boat tour for 1 hour)bathrobes, cigars,rum, a free dinner at La Cava,--- which was a beautiful gourmet restaurant. I have never seen such an ornate and classy place on an island before. The service was incredible. We had steak and lobster. The nightly turn-down service was great, because it was the second opportunity each day that our mini-bar was stocked. We left our housekeeper a dollar on the bed every morning, and a dollar in the fridge every morning, and that worked great.We ate at the buffet the first night. It was fine. Other than that, we booked every night at an a la carte restaurant. We ate at all the restaurants at the hotel (super) and at the Tropical, we tried the chinese (not that great) and the Brazilian restaurant which was fantastic! The only tour we took was the tropical snorkelling tour, which was a lot of fun. Snorkelling in 2 places (including a shark pen) and then basically a booze cruise after that. Shopping was expensive we found, even after we cut their prices in half. They were very insulted when I low-balled and were not that apt to negotiate lower (on the beach anyhow).The highlight of our night life was the tower casino. My boyfriend and I are card players, so we spent a few nights there. We won every night, and ended up leaving the island with more money in our pockets than what we came with! All in all, we had the best vacation ever. We planned a lot, and really took advantage of everything the hotel(s) had to offer. I would definetely recommend the VIP package to anyone. When we checked in, the first thing that I said was that I wanted a room in the 5000 block on the second floor, and because we had the VIP package, we were put exactly there. Our view was amazing--a combo of the pool and beach.Yes it was hard to get a chair in the morning. But all you had to do was go down early, put your towel on a chair and maybe a magazine and it was yours for the rest of the day. We walked on the beach quite far, and passed around 7-8 hotels and none of them looked as nice as the princess hotels.I would definetely recommend this hotel. I have been to Puerta plata 2 times, mayan riviera, cuba, bahamas.... and this was definetely the greatest experience.  
<Date>Mar 23, 2006
<Rating>5	5	5	-1	5	-1	5	-1

<Author>Janezita45
<Content>Beautiful Hotel with such an unconsciencious guest services staff We checked into the PCP on 3/07/06, and the mayority of the staff was very nice and courteous. The rooms were spacious, gorgeous and super clean. The grounds of the hotel were very well maintained, I found the buffet food to be very good (except for the Italian restaurant Ill Baccio, that food has tragically tarnished my husbands perception on Italian cuisine eternally), the pool was very clean and the beach was needless to say incredible. The nightlife is non-existent on these grounds, to find good entertainment you must go to other resorts. I recommend club news on the Caribe Princess grounds. Now the reason why I rated this hotel with a 2 instead of a 5 is as follows. On the first day we arrived, we headed straight for the beach and were lured by the staff to participate in some motorized water sports. The beach is swamped with hotel security virtually in every area of the property and they advised us that there wouldn't be any dangers if we left our belongings under the beach chairs. I was traveling with my husband and my friend, we went parasailing, so like the majority of the other guests we listenened to the guards advice and we left our belongings under the chairs we were using near the security stall. Upon our return from our activities, all of our belongings had been ROBBED!! (Amond them was our bag, with our room keys, my husbands cell phone, our prescription glasses, cash, and disposable cameras) The worst part of all this, when we went to file a complain to guest services, they just told us that the hotel wasn't responsible for lost articles out of the safe in the guest rooms. So we just asked them to make a report just in case the bag turned up. We also asked them if we could make a phone call to my husbands cell phone to see if someone might have picked up the bag and taken it to a lost and found, but the resort wouldn't even let us do that (and we asked several times). Since our room keys were also in the bag, they made it ridiculously clear how they were making an exception for us that they were not charging us the $2.00 fee for lost keys considering the circumstances. We stayed in this resort for 3 days, and each day we went to guest services, there was a new person attending guests, and none of them would even have any knowledge of our case, also we asked to speak to the hotel manager on several occassions, and we were refused the opportunity.So Overall PCP was a beautiful resort, and I'm trying very hard not to give a biased opinion on this resort, because overall it was a great experience. The only staff that I found to be extremely unhelpfull were the guest services, but the reception, the buffet staff, the bartenders, and the housekeepers were all extremely nice and helpful. It's sad that this unfortunate event had to ruin the entire experience for us. But we learned our lesson, in the future if anyone decides to go to this resort, maintain your cash and valuables locked up in a safe so you don't have to deal with the troubles we had to endure.  
<Date>Mar 14, 2006
