<Author>familytraveling
<Content>Amazing holiday...proud to be canadian We stayed at the PCP from feb. 24th to march 3rd and had an amazing vacation. This was our 2nd time to Punta Cana, last year we went to the Bahia Principe. Both properties are super however, we preferred the PCP as we was much smaller and in return thought it was a better atmosphere for us. The food is about comparable at both resorts. We never went hungry, actually we ate too much. The breakfast buffet was really good and if you wanted you could always get fresh omelletts, crpes ect.. made. For lunch, we always went to the beach grill. For the people who said there wasn't enough variety what else do you want for lunch??? Other than hamburgers, hot dogs, pizza, pasta, salads, ice cream and deserts!!! The pizza is always fresh and very yummy. For dinner we went to the Seafood, Tex-Mex (twice), Italian, Mexican (Caribe side) and the buffet (twice). We never had any problems making our reservations and we found the food very good at all restaurants. They also have a selection of different items on all of their menus and the service was outstanding except at the Mexican on the Caribe Side. We found the service very slow and also the property to be dirty and not well kept as at the PCP. After seeing the Caribe side we were really happy to be at the PCP. The Caribe seemed much busier and we found the layout of the property to be very space out.The rooms were great, spacious, impecably cleaned. We were in the 4000 building on the 3rd floor which gave us a spectacular view of the ocean and the pool without the VIP packages.The pool and the ocean were both spectacular.The service all around at this resort was extremely good. We never had to wait for anything wether it was drinks, food or at Guest Services. The Dominican people are very friendly and just paid so much special attention to our child. There were a lot of Canadians, a few Americans and quite a few Europeans. In general, the people were very friendly and nice however we did encounter some unpleasant situations with others (non canadians). I am pround to say that I am Canadian and I have much more respect for the Dominican people and vacationers.Advice regarding taxi cabs: One day we took a cab to go shopping at the Bavaro Plaza. Guest services organizes the cab and they told us that it 12$ US return and that we pay the cab upon return. We went and had no problems. At the end of the week, my husband returned by himself to go to the jewellers to pick up a necklace I had seen. Same procedure, same price told by Guest services, however when he got back the cab driver wanted 40$US!!! My husband refused to pay it so the driver locked the doors and would not let him out. The security guard heard the commotion and approached the car. After a bit of arguing in between the driver and the security guard, he let my husband out.We had a super holiday, lots or rest and relaxationa and fun in the sun....We would definetely go back.  
<Date>Mar 13, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fantastic Holiday Stayed at the Princess Punta Cana for one week in January 2006. My wife and I very much enjoyed our stay there. The resort is small and quiet, which is exatcly what we where looking for. The staff exceeded our expectations, they were friendly and always willing to help. At the buffett you can always find something you like to eat, and the al la carte restaraunts where fantastic. I would highly reccomend taking in all the al la carte restaraunts, none of them are bad. Our first few days, there was quite a bite of wind, but that died down after a while. The beaches are some of the best in the world, and the pool and deck are excellant. Lots of sun and lots of booze. This is an excellant resort with all the amenities, I would go back again and would reccomend this to anyone looking for a nice relaxing vacation.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Had an awesome time at Punta Cana Princess ! Just got back and had to share the great times we had at the Punta Cana Princess. There were 4 of us staying at PCP from Feb. 24 - March 3. We all agree that this was a perfect vacation place. The service we received was excellent from all employees from the friendly reception and waiters and bar tenders..all great and ready to please. The beautiful clean  spacious rooms were always touched up with fresh flowers, always a nice daily presentation to come back to after a long fun day in the sun. The food was great, no complaints there. Definately something for everyone, not to mention the great variety of fresh tropical fruits daily. The breakfast especially was nice with fresh croissants, crepes, pancakes  great ommlettes you could order to be made to your liking with fresh juices of all kinds made there fresh while you wait. Although yes this is the smaller resort of the other 3 princess resorts, it is still large enough to have a variety of ala cart rest. and of course you could still enjoy the other sister resorts next door as well if you wanted. The Animation Staff at PCP were Fantastic. They would have some activities going on all the time mainly at the beach,  at times at the pool. There would be nightly entertainment at the lobby bar usually at 9:45pm. Dance Contests, Karioke...all great fun!The beach of course ....Paridise! Always sunny  hot, the water warm and enviting.All  all. a great vacation for anyone..Would go back for sure...

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>beautiful beach, friendly and helpful staff I found the staff to be friendly and helpful and always ready to please. Only one unfortunate incident happened. I think this is because I was travelling alone. But resort security was quick to help and try to make me feel at ease. But I still felt I had to look over my shoulder for the rest of my holiday. The food was ok. Lots of variety at the buffet but not too exciting taste wise. No way would a person ever go hungry there. Most of all I enjoyed the beautiful beach and people watching. The beach bar was the most pleasant place to sit and visit and have a bite to eat and a drink. I hope that they put some kind of a finish on the tiles in the buildings as they are very slippery when your feet are wet. My friend slipped on the stairs and hurt her leg quite badly. However, the housekeeping staff were quick to her aid.  
<Date>Mar 6, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Amazing...Amazing The Punta Cana Princess was an amazing experience!!!! We stayed( my best friend and I) from Feb 7th -Feb 14th. The moment we arrived at the resort, the exceptional service and WOW factor became overwhelming, our room was immaculately clean, with a great view, the ocean  the pool. The food was awesome. Especially the TexMex restaurant( fillet mignon was out of this world) The buffet during dinner was awesome every night, somthing for everyone. They did a Mexican themed buffet one night, and as we enetered we were handed a margaita, and the buffet was incredible, we both highly recommed you go! We actually were reading some of the other review sbefore we left, and people were saying that the food was terrible and there was nothing to do, well I think those people must have had unrealistic expectations, and hid in their rooms. Everyday, all day the Animation staff got all tourists young and old involved in beach aerobics, spanish lessons on the beach, dancing lessons, and every night there was something going on in the lobby for the kids, then for the adults till 11:30pm. It was awesome... we had a blast!!!! The staff and Animation crew really made our vacation amazing, so friendly and eager to please! We both also took the VIP package, and the Spa was incredible too, the massage made us both melt like butter, the rum and cigars were great, and everynight when we returned to our room, we had fresh beach towels on our beds with cute flowers all over the place.Nice touch!!We did 2 day trips, the glass bottom boat with snorkling- was amazing.. you pay cash 38$us, for 4 hours, and you travel down the coast line and snorkel in 2 different spots, it was awesome. Great value for your buck! Also we did the Bavaro Runners $80usa it is the entire day 8-5pm, and if I could recommend any one thing to do while visiting, it would be to take this trip, you start out at a sugar cane field, and they offer samples of the sugar cane and sugar cane RUM!!! Then you go to a cigar making factory, then to the Maria house, and get to sample the freshest fruits I have ever had, and Mamawana, also pure coffee and cocoa right from the bean...beats starbucks any day!! Then they take you all throughout the country side, in the mountains and then to the edge of the island to go hourseback riding, swimming, boogie boarding and to taste a true Dominican lunch, and by the way the FOOD WAS AWESOME!!!Honestly this trip was amazing, as we were leaving we both reflected back and we could not find one thing that we would change- other than our reservation, cause we should have booked for 2 weeks- not one!!!Please note that when we were there we did notice that all the Canadiana  Europians were having a blast, no complaints at all, it was and it is sad to say, but it was only the American tourists that had issue, and they treated the staff very poorly.  
<Date>Mar 3, 2006

<Author>threefriends
<Content>Great location and outstanding staff We just returned from a family vacation, our two sons, their wives and 4 year old granddaughter. The one week stay was wonderful. Over the past couple of months we have been reading the various reviews posted by other travelers and have nothing but positive things to say about the resort.We didn't meet a single member of the staff that wasn't genuinely friendly. The entire staff from the front desk, the room cleaners, the restaurant help, the bar tenders to the ground personnel couldn't do enough for you. A couple of the previous reviews talked about having to tip the help for service - not true. Of course we tipped them at various times but they were friendly and helpful even when no tip was offered. An example, two men were trimming the coconut trees one morning and one of the workers stopped my granddaughter and me and in Spanish and sign language asked if we would like to try a fresh coconut. He yelled up to his friend and told him to drop a coconut. He then used his machette to open up the fruit for us to drink from - he enjoyed watching our 4 year old as much as I did. Everyday the workers made this kind of nice gesture.Another review talked about not being able to get served at the bar unless you spoke Spanish. I don't know what their problem was but we never had to wait and I unfortunately don't speak Spanish. The workers all knew more English than I knew Spanish and we both had no trouble communicating. We actually had fun combining English and Spanish and ending up with everything we asked for and needed.The food - well if you want true 4 or 5 star dining go on a different type of vacation. The food at the all inclusive was fine. Each morning I ordered a freshly prepared omelet, also available were a variety of fresh juices, bacon and sausage, pancakes, french toast, cheeses, etc. We ate dinner at the buffet plus all three restaurants. The dinners were fine - had lobster twice [no additional charge], plenty of shrimp, fish, steaks and they always had fresh pasta with a variety of sauces for those not wanting to try to clams, mussels or other local foods. Gourmet food - no; however, the quality was fine.Other reviews said to ask for rooms in buildings 4000 or 5000. We were in building 2000 and our room was very nice. The distance to the pool and beach from buildings 4000 or 5000 is 2 minutes, the distance from building 2000 is 4 minutes. No big deal and that's with a 4 year old walking. We had a ground level suite and used the room safe for passports  valuables; otherwise, we left our room's sliding glass door open the entire time and never had a problem. I didn't hear of anyone having a problem with thieves during our stay.The pool and beach area are beautiful. Miles and miles of white sand and crystal clear water. No problem getting a palapa or chairs if you arrive by 10 a.m. After that hour chairs were always available but you had to look. Also, no problem getting to use the sailboats or other water craft. We have stayed at other resorts in several Mexican locations but this was our first visit to the Dominican Republic. We will definitely go back in the future.The Punta Cana Princess is a wonderful place for families. Plenty of activities for kids and a very restful place for adults. I just realized it but all last week with all the young kids at the resort I never heard any adult raising their voice or any child crying - that's pretty remarkable.The only downside to the trip was the air transportation on Sunquest/Skyservice. We were supposed to leave at 6:00 a.m. and arrive in Punta Cana by 11:30 a.m. Due to a number of bureacratic foul-ups, not weather related, we didn't arrive at our hotel until 11:00 p.m. and our luggage on a direct flight got lost and didn't arrive until the next day. Not the fault of the Punta Cana Princess. The response from Sunquest/Skyservice was a $70 voucher after losing an entire day of vacation - not very good public relations. On the return flight they damaged my luggage and their response was that I should contact their Customer Relations Office. Customer Relations Office - quite the oxymorom.Other than the transportation with Sunquest/Skyservice I would highly recommend the Punta Cana Princess.  
<Date>Feb 26, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Beware of credit card fraud My In-laws and I stayed at PCP from Feb 11-18, 2006. We have been to Cuba 3 times, and DR once before. Shopping:Both the PCP and the sister resort Caribe Club/Tropical Princess have on site shops. My mother-in-law and sister-in-law both used their credit cards at the shops (only once and only at the on resort shops) and had their cards copied. We are quite sure we didn't spend $1000 each in Santo Domingo on Feb 20th. So BEWARE, there are lots of crooks, even on the resorts.Flight:As usual Skyservice left much to be desired, we had the most uncomfortable seats imaginable. We got to Punta Cana and had to wait 1/2 hour extra for a bus since the one that was going to take us broke down. The flight back was delayed 12 hours, suprise. Regardless, thats par for the course with the charter airlines. We will not be flying charter again, the extra few hundred is worth it for my back.Hotel:The PCP is a beautiful hotel with immaculate rooms (only 2 years old). Check in was simple, we were on the 3rd floor in the 4000 block, an amazing room and view of the beach. I would recommend the 4000 or 5000 block like previous reviews have mentioned, be sure you get 2nd or 3rd floor. Each room has a bar fridge that gets restocked with coke, sprite, water and beer daily. Watch the water bottles, some of ours were refilled. The water at the bars is bottled and not refilled so we got all ours there. The grounds are also amazing and are constantly being upkept by very entertaining grounds staff.Restaurants:We went to the Rio Grande (Tex-Mex steakhouse) and the Italian restaurant on the PCP grounds and had great meals. We were very disappointed with all of the meals at the Caribe Club/Tropical Princess restaurants (Chinese, Italian and Brazilian), the service was exceptionally slow (even by Dominican standards)and the food was not very good, with a few cases of GI upset afterwards. The buffet at Caribe Club/Tropical has more variety than the PCP and we usually ate lunch there. The lunchtime beachside buffet at PCP was good, Santa the waitress was very attentive and entertaining.Bars:No wait service to the beach chairs as advertised, instead they have a small tent bar set up amongst the beach umbrellas. Drinks were fine, I didn't see any that I couldn't get without the VIP upgrade at PCP. Rum and Beer taste the same after the first 2 anyway.Beach:Probably the nicest beach I've been on. Take insulated mugs as the sand gets hot and so do your drinks. Chairs are easy to come by but if you want an umbrella on the edge of the beach you have to get down before 0800. There is absolutely no snorkelling to be had for free at this beach, $20 will get you a boat ride to a reef but there is none off the beach.Entertainment:The usual caribbean shows, tennis was only available from 9-5, archery only at 1130 for some reason. Not really much to do besides lay on the beach or by the pool.Excursions:We went on a bunch of excursions in Puerto Plata so we didn't bother here, we heard the Bavaro Runners was fun, but for $80 it would have to be quite the trip. The Tour reps really push the excursions so be prepared.Overall:A great resort for relaxing, food was fine on PCP, avoid the other resort's restaurants. Echoing the other reviews, not a very fast paced resort, but seemed great for families.  
<Date>Feb 26, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Beautiful, Smaller resort, Excellent Vacation We stayed at the PCP from Jan 28- Feb 3 2006. There were 10 of us with different opinions and different views on what a holdiay should be and I think that the PCP suited every just about perfectly.I have travelled throughout the caribbean extensively and stayed at many different resorts from 2-5+ stars. I have paid top price and have did the sell off thing as well. I think no matter what you paid for the Princess you will be satified. We are not fussy people and as long as there is good food to eat - not necessarly gourmet and as long as the rooms are clean, drinks are cold, sun is hot and the company we are with is good why wouldnt you have a great time.We flew Skyservice from Toronto and of coarse the seating is very cosy how ever the flight was direct and quick. Check in took a few minutes but someone was there to give us a drink and music was playing in the lobby to get us in the DR spirit.Our rooms we beautiful spacious suites, new- clean- large bathrooms with double sinks. We left the maid 2.00us and a gift from the dollar store and a note if we wanted our fridge stocked full of beer and this was alway done with no problem. We were on the top floor and had really nice high vaulted ceilings. The food was good, I never went hungry and there was lots of variety for everybody. You also had full exchange privileges at the Caribe and Tropical so there was plenty of selections. We ate the Tex Mex restaurant 2x which was excellent, the Italian- very good, the Seafood restaurant at the beach- very good and the La Cava( which is part of the VIP) which was my least favorite but still good. The food presentation there is top notch but very rich in flavour. I order lobster and they presented me with 2 huge lobster tails. My tummy was a bit off after but I sure it was because the sauces were so rich.You have to remember you are not in North America so be adventurous and try new things and new culture- If I wanted french fries everyday I would stay home and go to Mcdonalds.The hotel is small enough that you are in the lobby, to the restaurants, to your room or at the beach all in about 5 minutes. You can take a shuttle to the other two resorts but the walk does you good and its only about 10 mins max. The disco and the theatre are at the other resorts but the way the resorts are intertwined its no big deal. The disco allows locals in and it can be a bit intimidating. We walked the beach to the other reosrts alot too. There was a bit more activity by the pool and the resorts looked busy if thats what you are into. At the PCP we never had a problem getting a chair or shelter by the pool or beach at anytime. It was quieter but they still did do activities by the beach. We also purchased the VIP package once we were there- it was good for some of us, other it really made no big differece- keep in mind the premium alcohols are served only at certain bars. The massages were good and the only motorized watersports are the banana boats.I will return the PCP as it was relaxing, comfortable and quaint. This time we will be taking our daughter back with us. The pool gradually waded in which is good for children as well as their own little play area.Keep in mind when going to another country (in this case a 3rd world country) things are different and they try to make things as close to what we expect here in North America. Dont go to the DR with high expectation and you holdiay will be better that you expected. If your expectations are high go the the BVI ( british virgin islands) Rememer having too much sun, too many drinks and different foods in the oils they cook in you system can make you sick faster than anything- you need to ease your way into your holiday and take your pepto bismal everyday as a precaution. Those who have written a negative review on this resort are uneducated about their all inclusive holiday. You have champagne tastes on a beer budget and will never be satisfied.The PCP is a perfect smaller resort for those looking to relax, kick back and watch to world go by. It doesnt hurt that the beaches are beautiful here too!!!(watch out for the topless women- they are everywhere!!! )  
<Date>Feb 16, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>great relaxing holiday My husband and i just got back from pcp and had a wonderful time. I did a lot of research before we left and there were mixed reviews aboout this hotel, but we had a blast. It is the smaller of the 3 but if you want a relaxing and fun holiday without the lineups and chaos..this is the one for you.The beach and water were wonderful and never a problem finding space or chair on the beach. The food was ok..but there was something for everyone. The staff were very friendly and most did speak english. The animation staff made sure everyone had fun on the beach and pool, but this resort has no night life. You must go tot he Caribe for the disco, but we liked not having a loud resort. I would definetly reccomend this resort and we are planning on going back. Oh ya, the rooms are great..all are suites and the 4000 and 5000 blocks are the best and either view of ocean or pool. If you like 5 star all the way, gourmet food and fast service..this is not the resort for you...if you are looking for fun, relaxation and friendly staff working on dominican time with fantastic water/beach..there try this resort..we were NOT disappointed

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Triop The Punta Cana Princess is a wonderfull place to stay. We did our research on the price we were able to pay and the princess seemed liked the best deal. I find it very interesting reading peoples reports especially when you are there at the same time and experience a totally different vacation. My husband and I were at the pcp for 2 weeks and were taken care of like I have never experienced. The service from your room, bars, buffet, restaurants, guest services and the front desk was amazing. I think people with negative reviews have unreasonable expectations and would have problems anywhere they went. The food; you can always find something to eat, yes the temperature is luke warm but the breeze is always blowing. We would have eggs and toast and they were hot cause they are made for you, to your liking if you like them cooked more just let the chef know. The restaurants are great we tried almost everyone except the brazillian. Your lucky to be able to have the luxury of eating at all the princess resorts on the property the other resorts are a 5 min walk max. There is a golf cart to take you if you don't feel like walking. We did not want for anything on this holiday. We were always full and Nelson took care of us everyday. Tipping, the average wage down in the DR is horrible so why not tip, these people are cleaning your room and doing your dishes and serving your food, its the least you could do. I thank all the staff at this resort for a wonderful vacation.

<Author>IvanaTravel
<Content>Big group - loads of fun! Just returned from a week long (too short) vacation at the Punta Cana Princess. I had a marvelous time. I travelled with a group to attend a wedding and found absolutely nothing to complain about. (The wedding was a magical, fairy tale event and the resort staff were attentive and accommodating. Their attention to detail made the whole ceremony and reception beautiful.) There was enough variety of food and restaurants that we never went hungry or had to endure something we didn't like. The suites were clean and bright. The resort was relatively quiet, but if you wanted the night life, the sister resort next door provided discos, theatre, shows, casino, etc. Be prepared to haggle with the vendors at the straw market. Don't be afraid to walk away if you don't get the price you want. Ask lots of questions, about the spa, about the water sports and other activities, and about the restaurants at the Punta Cana Princess and the neighbouring resorts. If you are fully informed, you'll be able to pick what you want to do and you won't miss out on the fun. When we chatted on the plane home, everyone from our group of 30+ said they had a blast and a lot of us want to go back again!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Overall would not recommend this hotel if you are young or American My boyfriend and I stayed at the PCP from 1/26-1/30. When we got to the hotel, we asked to upgrade to VIP. The person at the front dest hardly spoke English. We had to beg for our VIP items (cigars, rum, robes, free massage, dinner, internet, and motorized watersports) and did not recieve the vouchers until the 3rd day we were there (with attitude may I add). Also when we got to our room, it was a regular 2- double bed room (not VIP) we ased to be changed and they told us they were overbooked but will change it the next day. We were changed around 1pm the next day to a VIP room, however, it was more unkept and appeared dirtier than the other. Also, we were staying on the ground floor and the sliding door was broken. I immediately checked these doors because I read a review where 14 people were robbed because their sliding door was broken. When I called to get our room changed again, they said they would send someone to fix the door. Nevertheless, we went back to our original room because it was 3pm by this time and we wasted a day just to get situated. The waiters/ waitressess/ bartenders/ maids were very nice but the front desk was very unhelpful, especially if you had a problem. The food was terrible and i was sick the first 3 days we were there. Also, they charge $15 dollars for immodium, so I suggest bringing your own. If you need to take out money and want to change it to american dollars (because the mac machines give you peso's) the fron desk wont do it for you and will tell you you have to either go into town or the airport to change it... NOT TRUE! Go to the casino... they will change it for you. Also, they jipped us on the motorized water sports and said that it was too windy to do anything. If you are going away to just relax, this place is nice for that. I do have to say that it had beautiful beaches and the pool was very clean. However, don't bother upgrading to VIP because we didnt even get to use all of our vouchers. And be prepared to pay for EVERYTHING. Also, the people expect to get tipped for everything so bring plenty of one's. Overall, this place is good for families. The resort turns into a total ghosttown at night. There is NOTHING to do. I was very open to alot because I read the reviews and didn't want it to spoil our vacation, but everyone was right... there is no entertainment, the food is TERRIBLE, the front desk does not help with any problems, and if you complain, they ignore you even more and get an attitude. Everything is spread out so bring walking shoes... And I have to let you know our fiasco about the VIP... like I said before about the front desk - When my b/f lost his VIP bracelet and went to get a new one, the woman at the counter told him that it would cost him to replace the new bracelet, plus he had to pay for the VIP. Now, when we did not get the room, the man at the front dest told us that the VIP was free of charge because of out problems with the rooms and not receiving the vouchers. She argued with us for 20 minutes, saying that No one gets anything free here When we asked to downgrade, she said that we could, but she will charge us $60 for the resturaunt that we ate at, and will find out every bar we went to and what we had to drink and will charge us for that too. After she threatened us, I was appauled. I was never threatened before at any resort, no matter what problem I had. This is completely unnacceptable behavior, and I want to let you all know what type of service to expect. Any more questions/ comments, you are more than welcome to e-mail me. I would never go back to this resort, and I suggest to you to not even bother wasting your time here. If you already booked your trip, just try and make the most of it. Hopefully you wont have the same experience we had.

<Author>noel
<Content>Great Vacation At The Punta Cana Princess Be prepared this is a long review. We just returned yesterday, Jan. 30th, from our vacation at the Punta Cana Princess. There were six family members, all adults over 50, and we all enjoyed it very much. We tried to get rooms together but no luck. If you're going there try to get in Building 5. My husband and I stayed there and it was amazing. The view of the ocean and pool were spectacular. My sister and husband stayed in Building 1 and it had a nice view but nothing like ours. My brother and wife stayed in Building 2 and they had no view to speak of. Building 3 is the worst. You'll have a view of the buffet unless you're on the 3rd floor. Our room was 5211 and if you could get in 5213 that was an even better choice. The rooms were spacious and clean. Be sure and bring face cloths because there were none to be seen. I had already read about this problem and just picked up some cheap one and left them there. A few other great items I brought were from the dollar store, plastic clothes pegs that wrap around the shower rod or patio chairs. Things don't dry very well but if you hang them up it's a little better. Dryer sheets to put in the drawers and closet to keep your clothes smelling fresh. Of course zip lock bags for everything. Lots of gifts for the staff. We made friends with the two beach bartenders, Arturo and Martines and found out they had a son and daughter and I gave them appropriate gifts for their kids. They were extremely grateful and asked me to write my room number and name on a napkin so they could take them home. They thanked us every day for the gifts and they were both going home when we were there and loved taking their presents with them. Of course we tipped with U.S. dollars too but sometimes it's nice for them to be able to bring gifts home to their kids.FOOD - I had read a lot about cold food at the buffet and sometimes this was true but we always had lots to eat. There is a great grilling station and pasta station where the food is make hot and fresh. We ate at the Tex Mex - very good, the Italian - also good but we got too much food, Chinese - very good and Seafood beach restaurant - our least favourite although I ordered the crab stuffed beef and loved it. You'll always find something you like in the buffets. The absolute worst food was in the 24 hour beach bar restaurant. If you happened to catch it when it first came out of the kitchen it was okay but most of the time it was cold and tasteless. We tried a few times but never hit it at the right time.BARS - Lobby bar, pool bar, 24 hour beach bar on a deck, and second daytime beach bar right on the sand. Lots of choice of drinks and they were more than willing to make up any kind of mixture you wanted. I experimented every day to try something new. Definitely bring a insulated mug. I found a nice one that held about 2 regular drinks and they didn't mind rinsing it out for me each time.POOL - The water was definitely cold. On a very hot day it was okay but if it was overcast the pool was pretty empty. If you want a pool palapya or ocean palapya you have to put your book or towel or something on them by 8:30 or 9:00. The ones in the best locations fill up fast although we could always find something.OCEAN - Beautiful with nice waves. The ocean seemed warmer than the pool and although there is a strong current it's roped off where it's safe to swim and we enjoyed it every day.WEATHER - The weather could change in a minute. It's sunny and hot and then it clouds over and a short shower or strong winds and then minutes later sunny and hot again. It cooled down quite a bit at night, more from the wind than anything else. A light sweater was welcomed for a couple of the nights.TROPICAL  CARIBE - We played mini golf and had a couple of drinks there. Nice resorts but more crowded then ours. Went over a couple of times for the nightly shows but they weren't that great. I think we've seen them other times on vacation and it was just the same old thing.Finally to sum up it was a great place to stay. Small enough to get from room to lobby or ocean or pool in minutes. You'll enjoy the friendliness of the staff and a little Spanish goes a long way. They also have Spanish lessons and it's a good thing to take advange of. Keep an open mind and you'll enjoy every minute of your holiday  
<Date>Jan 31, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A great time had by all 12 of us have just returned from a wonderful week at the Punta Cana Princess All Suites. If you want a relaxing holiday in a clean and friendly hotel this is it. Yes it is quiet, however you can have all the entertainment you want by strolling or taking a trolly next door to the Punta Cana Princess Tropical/Caribe of an evening, there is entertainment a disco and transportation to the the casino if you want. We were there to celebrate a 50th birthday. Let me tell you these people went out of there way to make it a special day for our friend, more flowers in her room with a happy birthday greeting in spanish, champagne in her room, happy birthday sung not once but at all three resturants and bars we went to that day complete with a champagne toast made by a staff member. The food was fine, not gourment but fine. None of us starved or got ill. The beach was fantastic, the rooms were spotless and spacious the pool was wonderful and the staff tried their best. For the most part they speak 3 to 4 languages spanish, english, french and german in some cases. The animation staff were a hoot and kept things hopping. Drink service was slow, however you are on vacation and food and drink is available 24 hours a day......what is your hurry!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>It was good! Hey there fellow travellers! I was pretty skeptical about traveling to the DR because of all the negative reports of the staff. We've been spoiled in the Mayan Riveriea at the Barcelo Maya, but I have to say that at the Punta Cana Princess, service was great! People dont' expect to get tips and greatful when they do. But I do agree, the food at the Buffets were not that great. I'm not particularily picky. I just want a great beach and a clean room. The PCP met those requirements, but the buffets were just OK. The omlette and pasta stands were fine. We are one of those couples who try a variety of foods, so there was no shortage of items. We tried all the traditional Dominican food, so therefore, there was a variety of things to try. I can see if you are a picky eater that food would be an issue. (if you only like meat and potatoes, why would you try okra?) If so, reserve a spot at every a la carte restaurant, every night. (we went to the steak tex mex restaurant twice!)I do have to agree with most, that the beach restaurant Casa something was pretty bad. Everything was cold and old. (Of course, at 2am and drunk, you dont' really care too much)It is a relatively quiet resort. We met a few young Canadians (in there twenties) and they were bored to tears. However, we are in our thirties, we love to party at the bars, but felt like slowing down this holiday. We had the option of going to the other resorts but just chilled at the PCP. (Of the 10 minutes we witnessed of the show at the other resort, we concluded that it was pretty lame. Needless to say we drowned our sorrows in booze.)I love that you don't have to reserve lounge chairs, beg for service, nor bribe for dinner reservations. All in all, a good stress free vacation! And the staff are pretty awesome, considering we were one of those couples that didn't particpate in ANY of the activities. JUST CHILLED!Hope this Helped,ZOE  
<Date>Jan 29, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Our holiday was amazing, we just got back on the 20th I had to write in and compliment the staff at the Punta Cana Princess. They were all very friendly, helpful and always smiling. The buffet's weren't spectacular, but breakfast has the option of omlettes made to order and there is also chef's making Crepes which were extremely good. The grounds, rooms, restaurants  bathrooms were extremely clean. As for the beach grill in the restaurant down near the ocean, all of the meats displayed were kept in stainless steel bins in a bin of ice. Not only were they chilled, but they had an executives/management group come in on a few occasions with thermometers taking the temperature of the buffet items. If fruits or veggies eneded ice added under the dishes, it was done immediately. The Restaurants were excellent - hot food and good service. The Tex-mex was our least favourite (we traveled with a group of 6), the Italian was excellent and we ate there twice (Chicken  Pork entrees were great)and the Chinese restaurant at the bavaro was definately our favourite. The walk (even though there is a shuttle every 20minutes) takes approximately 5-6 minutes if your taking your time and the scenery between the resorts is rather impressive (we preferred to walk).Not only would we recommend the resorts to friends, but we look forward to visiting it again.I think if you are a person that is expecting to eat lobster, lamb and be served crab cakes on silver platters, than yes, you may be disappointed with the selection. We made it through the week just fine, enjoying the buffet for breakfast, the beach bar snacks (chicken fingers, mini pasteries, fruit, cookies, etc.) for lunch and the restaruants for dinner. Don't put too much thought into the negative reviews, if you and your family are planning a holiday here - I'm sure you'll have a great time. All of the guests that we met on our vacation were just as pleased as we were!  
<Date>Jan 25, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Good time at Punta Cana Princess After writing a rather scathing report 2 years ago about a Puerto Plata 3 1/2 star hotel I am pleased to be able to say positives about my Punta Cana Princess experience.My wife, two kids (boy of 8 and girl of 4) and I spent 2 wonderful weeks at the Punta Cana Princess from Dec 24/2005 until Jan 7/2006. Highlights? The beach was very clean with nice white sand. Rooms - we moved once to get closer to the beach and swimming pool - very clean and well kept. Housekeeping staff was first rate, albeit a little slow responding to out of ordinary requests.By far the best group of folks were the animation staff. They work well as a group. Night and day they tirelessly prodded and cajoled us to participate in tons of activities including beach volleyball, waterpolo, darts, archery, dance lessons and aerobics by the pool. Not to be overlooked were the 2 fabulous mini-club directors who took exemplary care of our 4 year old daughter introducing her to new dances and encouraging her to improve her Spanish. They were gentle and co-operative and deserve accolades.Improvements should be made to the water system. It broke down two or three times during the 2 weeks, but was promptly returned to service so the inconvenience was minor to us. More night life on the property might make the 20-somethings happy, but us parents were pleased to be able to fall asleep at night without the thumping bass we experience at other resorts.Finally, the food at the speciality restaurants were almost laughable. Our preference was for the main restaurant since the pretention was ratchetted down and the meal selection was far greater, especially on New Year's eve. We got most of what we came for from the Princess and wholeheartedly recommend others taking a path to their doors. We wish them every success in the future.  
<Date>Jan 17, 2006

<Author>pankel
<Content>Punta Cana Princess = Punta Cana Garbage Just returned from this resort...if you are thinking about traveling there, think again, DO NOT WAIST YOUR TIME AND MONEY AT THIS RESORT...I will admitt that the beaches in Punta Cana are beautiful, and the rooms in this resort are quite spacious and nice. In addition, the resort does seem to be fairly clean, and maintained...now on to the negatives..1) Food = ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING...now i know for a fact that this is not only my opinion, but also the opinion of just about everyone else that we talked to. These people screw up the easiest of items, rice is undercooked and crunchy at times, french fries and pizza is often cold, alot of the meat has some greasy mysterious sauce that looks awful. In the morning the eggs taste horrible, and depending on the day they are barely cooked. If you want to get a decent meal you must walk 10 minutes to the other princess resort next door to get anything half decent. In addition, I was scared to eat many of the meats because of the poor food handling at this resort. The guys by the grill have huge tubs filled with chicken and meat, yet they don't keep it cold with ice or cooler packs. Who knows how long that food has been left out, and exposed to the warm humid air.I will say that the El Rancho steak house is decent on the resort, don't waist your time at the italian ala carte it is complete garbage. Again, if you want decent meals for dinner you must walk to the other resorts...pay the 30 bucks and get the lobster dinner at La Pasquedor Restaurant (sp), and try the Mamma Mia restaurant it is good too.2) Nightlife...this resort turns into a virtual ghost town after 11 pm. I don't know how anyone could find these clowns in the lobby entertaining. If you want nightlife, again you must walk to the other resorts or go into town to a nightclub.3) Drinks...if you are a serious drinker, and will be boozing heavily than pay the money for the vip deal and get the international liquor. I was very disappointed with the dominican rum, and the El Presidente well get very old very fast.Finally, I cannot express in words how bad the food is in this place...if you are prepared to eat 1 or 2 meals a day, and go on a heavy bread and butter diet, than good luck, have fun! This resort caters to older couples, if you are young and looking for an exciting upbeat resort than THIS IS NOT THE PLACE FOR YOU!!!! I paid over 1200 for this resort and that is too much. I wouldn't even classify it as a 4.5* that is an absolute joke, this place is more like a 3.5*...if people have never been to a real 5* all inclusive they may actually think this place is great, but those who have really seen a resort know that the Punta Cana Princess is pitiful.spend your money elsewhere this resort is garbage-bob  
<Date>Jan 16, 2006

<Author>cathydee
<Content>Good Holiday, but ............. After spending Christmas and Newyear (2 weeks) at the PCP I have to say that we had a great time, the staff were friendly the weather wonderful and great company (traveled from Canada with my Husband and two teenage kids, to meet my sister and her family from the UK) The kids had the best holiday ever and met with lots of other kids and played volleyball all day everyday! So we were really happy. I have travelled a lot and didnt really have high expectations since I realise that I could spend at least another $6,000 for true 4 or 5 star hotel/resort, especially at this time of year. So we were prepared that not all will be upto a standard that we are used to and that was fine, we were prepared mentally. All we really wanted was to get away at that time of year and to relax in the sun and meet with our family. After visiting DR before (stayed at the Flamingo) also Mexico and Cuba Tunisia, and Turkey (all places are similar in the standards of hotel ) I think I have a lot of experience in knowing how to stay well with regard to the water and what NOT to eat. My family of four were all well and I think it may have something to do with my rules..... NO fruit or salad (usually it gets washed in the tap water) Never eat anything that has been left out at the Buffet, we always eat FRESHLY cooked food and if non available I would grab the chef and insist on it in a friendly way that is. The reason I'm telling you this is that my brother -in- law didnt stick to these rules and was very very ill just two days before the end of his holiday. He got home and he was rushed to hospital and it was realised that he had contracted the dreaded Salmonella poisoning, he was in hospital for 8 days and now is recovering at home. Since he is the chef at his own Bed and Breakfast this has serious implications for his business and life. His son was very sick for 6 days of his holiday, sick, runs and fever. I have never writen a review in my entire life since I really think that you will always find something you dont like, and it's only your OPINION anyways so why bother.I think if I'd paid top dollar then I would expect top everthing ! On the food..... Christmas and Newyears was really good, Lobster, dressed crab etc etc...fresh and good! I found because of my rules on eating I pretty much had a crappy diet for 2 weeks but it only took me a week to shed it when I got home. I ate french fries (insisted that I got fresh ones) for lunch at the beach and always found something at night, something fresh off the grill is the best way to go! Fresh eggs cooked by the chef and toast for breakfast. The Ice is fine as they use bottled water. Keep away from milky desserts too. My normal diet is salads and veggies so this is hard for me! The main reason for this review is to just warn people of this serious danger and if your going be careful.... If anyone wants to ask anything you can email me. The same rules would apply for me at any resort and I have found that I'm never sick when a high percentage of people are. At the flamingo two years ago people were being sick too.  
<Date>Jan 13, 2006

<Author>suemel
<Content>Nice quiet resort Just returned from a week at the Punta Cana Princess. This was a clean, quiet resort with a beautiful beach. As other travellers have remarked on before the food was not all that great. We could usually find something to eat for breakfast and lunch at the buffets. At least the soup was hot! The Italian restaurant was the best. Everything was very hot. Even with a scalding hot plate the Tex Mex could not deliver hot food. Amazing!Beach was wonderful you could walk for hours. The service was hit and miss and it didn't matter if you tipped them so we stopped after 3 days. We had to chase the maid for clean towels every day that we were there. We paid about 1/2 price for this vacation so won't complain too much. Went for some RR and that's what we got. If you go don't set your standards too high and you will be fine. Unfortunately if you din't get the VIP package the drinks were local brands and not very good. The solution is to buy a bottle of good booze duty free. There is Coke and Sprite in the room and ask the bartender for ice.

<Content>Tropical Princess (Caribe Side) Dec8-Dec16 Just returned from PuntaCana had a great holiday, yes beaches beautiful and food was very good, especially at the Cava Restaurant (French cook) for the extra $50 well worth it. Ha, smart ah!Enjoy we did.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Another great Dominican holiday Stayed at the Punta Cana Princess from Dec. 4 to 11, 2005. This was our 3rd vacation in the Dominican Republic, specifically to Punta Cana in the last 4 years. As it turns out it appears we return here approximately every other vacation south.Previously we have stayed at Occidental Grand and the Fiesta Resort just a little south of the Punta Cana Princess. We would return to any one of these resorts but it is not likely as we try to go to different places.Punta Cana Princess is smaller than other resorts but that makes it quiet which appeals to us. We had no complaint with the selection or taste of the food and ate most of our meals in the main buffet restaurant. Unfortunately sometime on Thursday we ate something that disagreed with us and threw our stomachs off for about a day and a half. We think we narrowed it down to a hotdog at the beach restaurant. Staff was friendly and helpful. One exception was one day at lunch when we arrived near the end of the lunch period and most of the staff was involved with cleaning up the tables. No one noticed that we needed drink service. After waiting over 10 minutes we approached the bar and mentioned this and within a couple of seconds a waiter was at the table. This was the only glitch in service all week and it certainly was not a big deal and was dealt with as soon as they knew about it.The beach is superb and great for walking. Never appears to be any stones or coral to worry about when swimming. Because there is constant wind and surf at Bavaro beach it stirs up the sand and snorkeling right off the beach is a useless exercise. There are snorkelling excursions you can take to some great coral reefs but we didn't bother this time.Lots of para-sailing takes place right off the beach and every time I visit I'm tempted to try but haven't quite worked up the nerve yet. I am sure there will be another time.We took the shuttle to the sister resort and walked into town from there one day. Found many of the merchants quite aggressive and for me it took much of the pleasure out of what was meant to be a relaxing stroll. We had better luck avoiding the merchants on the beach who have shops set up a little ways north and south of the hotel. All you have to do there is walk down by the water and look the other way. You have to do the same thing with the time share salespeople. One time share scout approached me when I was walking by and asked the usual questions; Do you speak English? My answer: No German? A. No.French/ A. No. Chinese? This time I answered Yes and the salesman broke into a big smile and did his best imitation of someone chattering away in Chinese. We both walked away laughing.We found the service did not change whether you tipped or not but we have got into the habit of tipping, mainly with U.S. $1.00 bills. From what we hear the people there do not make much money and a few tips can make a big difference to them. After 3 trips to the Dominican and being pleased with the service every time I really have to wonder what kind of an attitude the people who write some of the blistering negative reports take with them when they travel.If you want wild partying and lots of action this is not the hotel for you. If you want peace and quiet and relaxation you will find it.  
<Date>Dec 18, 2005

<Author>audiogal
<Content>Good Trip But...... I've been to several all inclusive resorts. They are all variations on the same theme and the Punta Cana Princess is no exception. The pool is nice and clean. The beach is beautiful. The rooms are just fine. The shower has plenty of hot water and the A/C is cold. I booked the VIP package and it was well worth the extra $100 per person. We enjoyed having bathrobes (not a big deal but nice), a massage, better alcohol and a very good dinner at La Cava restaurant. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. We had a few glitches with our room reservation and all was taken care of in a timely and friendly manner. The resort is smaller than others we've been to and I liked that. The staff at the water sports area was great. The food is mediocre at best. Anyone who says that the food was delicious has never had a good meal. There are some items here and there that are fine. One day at lunch there was a perfectly roasted chicken. Rice and beans were good. Some fish was OK and some smelled off. Some desserts were tasty and some were odd like a prune mousse tart. Maccaroons were very good. Fried chicken at the beach buffet, at the afternoon tea, was quite tasty. I ate a mushy shrimp and was very sick for days. My sister-in-law is a vegetarian and she went home with a sick stomach too! One can get food poisoning anywhere, but since two of us got sick eating different things I have to believe there's a problem. The hot food is not hot enough and the cold foods not cold enough. Cheeses and cold cuts sat out for hours. I had no tasty fruit except for a banana and grapes. Omelettes at breakfast were cooked to order and were fine. The breakfast meats looked awful. If you pick and choose your foods you certainly won't starve. Dinner at the gourmet restaurant La Cava was a glowing exception to the otherwise poor food. It costs $25 per person, but it is included with the VIP package. Everything we ate was really good and the wine was better too.Martin the bartender in the lobby bar was my husband's favorite, but everyone there was great. There is no theater at this hotel ,though you can go next door ( walk or ride on a small tram or golf cart) to the sister hotels theater. Since the shows at these places are usually poor we stayed in the lobby most nights and enjoyed the festivites ( karaoke, dancing). We had a really good time here with the exception of the food poisoning!! I won't go back however because of the food. You can e-mail me mamie56@optonline.net  
<Date>Dec 15, 2005

<Author>IKRYSIA
<Content>Great week in the sun We just returned on Sunday Dec 11. After having been in Punta Cana this past January for my son's wedding, I was doing quite alot of comparing. The Punta Cana Princess is a wonderful resort for those who want to relax, enjoy the sun, experience the layed back people in the Carribean.A few words of advise..Avoid the Casino!!! take plenty of sun lotions.. very expensive there, and also they don't have wash cloths, other than that, and that isn't a big deal, everything was wonderful. Rooms, very spacious and clean, food was great!!! there was three buffets and 7 al a carte restaurants to chose from. The variety is there, don't expect the food to be what you get in the large cities here.. ITS THE CARRIBEAN!! The people are so wonderful, tip them.. they deserve it, and the smiles you get is worth every penny.We also took alot of coloring books, crayons, pencils for the small children and toiletries for the women, once ago...worth the effort.Remember where you are.. respect the people and their culture, and you will have a great time!!!  
<Date>Dec 12, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great little resort Just came back from a week's vacation at the Punta Cana Princess. Must admit that I was somewhat disappointed at first, given that I thought I had booked us in to the Bavaro Princess, which I had been to before. I found out at our arrival at the airport that in fact our hotel was the Punta Cana and not the Bavaro. When we first arrived at the hotel, our first reaction was so,so... The Punta Cana is much, much smaller than most of the resorts I have been to in Punta Cana (other resorts I visited are: Bavaro Princess, Flamingo, Barcelo Beach and Bahia Principe). But I must say that we really enjoyed this hotel. It is small and cosy, so one does not have to walk on and on to get from the beach to the reception. The fact that you also get access to the two Princess sister hotels (Caribe Club and Tropical) provides the same opportunity as the larger resorts.Rooms are very spacious with lots of storage space (I never travel light)with all the necessary amenities such as: fridge, coffee maker, iron and ironing board, hair dryer, etc. The only negative about the room was that it was a little smelly. Our room was in block 5000 on the second floor. It offered a great view of the pool and ocean. I would recommend asking for a room in block 4000 or 5000 on the second or third floor - third flood would provide best view of the ocean.Food is fine. The buffet is ok for breakfast and lunch but must admit that the best food is that which they cook on site such as omelettes and pasta. Other food tends to be on the cold or warm side. The resort offers access to 8 restaurants which are easy to reserve and you can go as often as you want. The one we preferred is Mama Mia which is located on the Caribe Club complex.Service is exceptionnal. Quick service and always with smiles. You even get bar service brought to you directly on the beach. No need to even get up from your lounge chair!!!The resort also as Spa which is the most beautiful one I have visited in the Dominican Republic. It is even better than the one at the Bahia Principe... Great massages at a reasonable price ($60 US).So all in all, we had a great time at the Punta Cana Princess.  
<Date>Dec 11, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fabulous!! We stayed at the Punta Cana Princess from Nov 26-Dec 3, 2005. Three girls, all 25. It was amazing. Like most other reviews said, the beaches were beautiful. There are bars everywhere, so you are never left without a drink. Lots of bottled water is always available too. Our room was in the 4000's on the 2nd floor. We had no problems at all. We usually had the buffet for breakfast and lunch. I enjoyed the buffet. There was a great variety and the food was really good. We had the dinner buffet one night, and it was actually pretty good too. I seen other reviews that said the buffets were horrible, but I didn't find that. If you have a chance, check out the lunch buffet at the Caribe (next door) its a little bigger and its really good! We ate at the a la cartes every night except for the first night. Just make your reservations each morning between 8-12 and you can get into most of the restaurants. The a la carte food was fabulous. All of the staff and the animation crew were amazing. Expecially the animation guys. They were so much fun. :o) The disco was great too. The only thing was that you had to pay for your drinks after midnight. So, word of advice, just drink lots before midnight. If you still want to party after the disco, you can always hang out with the staff. And, there is a 24 hour bar right on the beach and you can get food and drinks there. The staff at the 24 hour bar are always happy to see people and they will probably ask you to dance. Go for it, make their night go by faster. :o) Well, that's all I have to say for now. Punta Cana Princess was great and I would go back there.  
<Date>Dec 7, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Had a good time but ... My husband, two young daughters (6 and 3) and I just returned from a week at the PCP. We spent most of the time at the beach and the pool and our daughters loved it. The beach was beautiful, the pool was clean, and the staff were great.Now for the not so great:- When we arrived at our room (3004), it smelled really bad, a combination of mold, mildew and bleach. I am assuming it is because the rooms had been closed up for the renovations and had not been aired out. I went back to the front desk and we were given a new room in the 2000 block that did not smell as much - still a musty smell.- The safe in our new room required reseting so that we could reprogram the access code. After telling 4 or five different staff members (including the front desk) about our problem and spending the first day carrying our valuables around with us, it was fixed.- The food in the main buffet was edible but was only luke-warm at best. The pasta bar was good in that the food was heated up when you ordered your personalised pasta (our girls loved it). The a la carte restaurants were good and the food was hot.- There was always a nice breeze in the buffet eating area and we did not have a problem with the heat. The non-smoking area was not well defined and it seemed to change every day. There would be a few non-smoking signs on some tables that seemed to be surrounded by the smoking section.- We tried the buffet by the beach for lunch a couple of times but the food was very limited.- The rooms were cleaned daily but one day when we returned to our room to shower before dinner, we had only one clean towel for the four of us. I found the maid but she had no clean towels left. It took about 30 minutes before we had 4 clean towels. We also had to wait for clean beach towels one day.- On one of our 7 days there we had no hot water in the shower. All other days were fine.- The drinks at the bars varied by bartender and service at the pool bar was sporadic. Each time I ordered one of their advertised drinks (Coco Loco), the contents were different, varying from great to horrible.My girls were in and out of the kids club in the afternoons, but I did not leave them there unattended for any length of time. There is a small play structure outside that they could use, and some games, a play kitchen, a tv with VCR, some colouring papers with crayons and tables and chairs inside. My girls favourite activity was filling balloons with water in the kids club and carrying them around for the rest of the day.All in all we had a good trip as we were there for the beach, the ocean and the pool which were great. The staff were always friendly and helpful. It had the advantage of being small and on the quiet side, with the accompanying resorts (Caribe and the Tropicale) accessible for the nightly entertainment and some more a la carte restaurants.  
<Date>Nov 28, 2005

<Author>JenniferUxbridge
<Content>Good resort, great people, great beach My husband and I just returned from the Punta Cana Princess (we travelled from Nov 15-22, 2005) where we were on our honeymoon. We booked 2 weeks prior to our departure and needed to pick up our tickets at the Sunquest counter at the airport. The ticket printer was broken, so anyone who had booked the night before had to have their tickets hand written. This was not the case for us, but we ended up waiting in line for 20 minutes waiting for those in front of us. Normally this wouldn't bother me, but there was another person behind the counter who wasn't doing anything, but wouldn't look at any of us in the line. Perhaps he didn't have the authority to hand out tickets?? I had read reviews for this resort prior to leaving and was a bit nervous, however I was pleasantly surprised. Sunquest has rated this as a 5 star, which I don't agree with (more like a 4) compared to other resorts I have been to. I read reviews of other resorts in this area and it seems that they all have similar issues. The two areas I was disappointed in were the buffets and the room cleanliness, but even these were not absolutely terrible. We did have some run-ins with cockroaches in our room...but it is a tropical island, so I guess this can be expected. This resort had been closed for a while so they could upgrade things - I know that the mattresses were new, and they were very comfortable. We were there while they were still filling up the resort, so it was pretty empty at the start of the week. I think they were still working out some kinks as a result of the closure. On to the good...the airport is beautiful and it took very little time to get through customs, pick up our luggage, and onto the bus. We were on our honeymoon, so we presented a photocopy of our marriage certificate to get the honeymoon package (rum in your room, bathrobes, extra beach towels, fruit, turn down service, romantic dinner in the seafood restaurant). The concierge was very helpful as we originally got a room with two double beds (even though our travel agent had specified king bed when we booked). Anyway, we ended up with a king bed that faced the lobby and gardens - a nice view, especially compared to our first room which kind of looked into the back of a building. Ask the maid or front desk for facecloths; they don't seem to put them in the rooms otherwise.The people (both staff and guests) at this resort were all wonderful, very friendly and helpful. The entertainment staff and bar staff were great and funny. I have read reviews that people don't like when staff doesn't speak English very well...remember you are going to a country where the language is Spanish! Take the opportunity to learn some - the staff seem to enjoy teaching Spanish and learning some English in the process.The a la carte restaurants were very good, our favorite was the Tex-Mex steakhouse, the Rio Grande. The filet mignon was fantastic. We found that we liked the restaurants at our resort better than the ones at the Club Caribe, but we were not able to get into the Brazilian restaurant, which we heard was good. The beach was gorgeous, beautiful soft white sand. There were always plenty of chairs, even towards the end of the week when the resort appeared to be fuller. It was very nice that we could visit the Club Caribe, but those guests could not visit our resort. As a result, our resort was never crowded.You might want to take a taxi back to the airport - $28 US for 5 people - well worth the money - the bus ride back to the airport was extremely bumpy and rough - not good for anyone with motion sickness of any kind! I wish that we had taken the taxi instead of suffering at the back of the bus. At airport check-in - Each of your bags cannot weigh more than 20 kg, or you have to pay (around $5US/kg) - this was not a problem for us, but there were many frantic people who only had the $20 US/pp they needed to leave the country, and not enough to pay for the overweight baggage. Your carry-on can weigh as much as you want, but the size does matter!So, good resort, great people, great beach!Feel free to email if you have any questions.  
<Date>Nov 24, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Paradise Spent 10 days with 5 members family, three teenagers, lodged in two bungalows in first range front to the sea, privacy guaranteed, in the middle of a garden with palms, luxury flowers alleys, rose flamngoss...The beach was very large not as some neighbour Hotels having very narrow beaches.Free sailing Hobbie Cats, snorkeling to Coral reefs at very cheap prices, excursions to protected islands were you are the sole person in miles, hot water, pelicans fishing just aside you, hundreds of incredible different fishes in colors eating bread form your hand...Many restauants or a buffet, too much to eat, specially very fresh mangos, pineapple, chinola (Maracuya),aguacates, and all tropical fruits.Obsesive rythms of bachata or merengue, caipirinhas, drinks, and long soft nights.The best of all is that we didn't need the assistance of employees, and even we didn't realize they were close to us taking care of everything and guranteing our security without our notice.The Dominicans are gentle with a permanent hapiness, an incredible sense of humour, enjoying life day by day.And finally here I am, in Barcelona, dreaming of this paradise and planning when to return to this wonderful Hotel.If you speak spanish, talk, meet and joke with Dominicans, they will return you twice more, and you will have a lot of fun...

We were leaving in less than 20 days and they call to tell us this. This issue here is that it is for a wedding and there is more than 50 people going and now all the wedding plans have to be changed 20 days before the wedding day.Some of our friends had to book at the 'sister' hotel - The Caribe Princess and they aren't being moved because they didn't boook at the PUNTA CANA PRINCESSS because it was all booked (the travel agents were booking the hotel even though they new it wouldn't be ready yet)The issue here is that now we are over 5 minutes away from some of our friends and we can't go to their hotel and they can't come to ours.I can't believe that they didn't inform us of this prior to 20 days before the wedding. If they had told us that the PUNTA CANA PRINCESS was under renovations then our friends would of never booked at the neighbouring 'sister' hotel but instead the hotel they were going to move us to.Very unhappy.

<Author>Redlightrita
<Content>Closed for Renovation My husband and I celebrated our 5 year anniversary at the Princess, Sept 2 to Sept 9. On our last day, guests were being moved to the Bavario since the Princess was closing for renovation on Sunday the 11th. The Princess was also very empty. We are from Orlando, Florida and are big beach people. We thought we could deal with heat. It was unbelievably hot the week we stayed. The night of our arrival we had to eat at the buffet restaurant since we had not made reservations. There are no paddle fans in the buffet restaurant or the lobby and we had to use our napkins to keep the sweat out of our eyes while we ate. My husband also had to wear long pants to dinner once we had made our reservations. It was terrible to see him sweating all the way to dinner at 8:00 at night.Ahhh...the buffet! This is the only bad thing I have to say about the resort. The breakfast buffet was the same just about every day. They have a made to order omlette bar, waffels, etc. But after 2 days the rest of our breakfast was toast and fruit. Lunch was not much better and room service (ham  cheese sandwich) was even worse. The evening restaurants were good. The two (tex mex and Italian) located at the Princess were very good. We also ate at 3 restaurants at the sister resort that were also good (La Cava, Sombrero and Chinese). Our appetites were not up to par since the heat was so bad. Toward the end, we booked any restaurant we could get as long as it was air conditioned.The people...could not have been more fantastic. The majority of the guests were from Spain. We speak very little spanish, communicating with them, although sometimes difficult, was a pleasure. They were so friendly and we made some very good friends. For the staff, 4 became very dear to our hearts. They went out of their way to make us happy, be friendly, and to help me work on my Spanish. The ladies of the lobby bar could not have been more wonderful. The best part of our entire trip was getting to know them. Please remember that a tip goes a long way. Change in US dollars is very difficult to get so we took $100 in ones and $100 in $5 and $10. Just their sharing of their culture was well worth a tip.The beach was beautiful. The sand is very soft and light which adds to the turquoise color of the water. There was never a problem with chairs at the beach or the pool. Excursions - we did the Lobster Tour and the Snorkel with Dolphins tour. As I stated earlier, most of the guests were from Spain. We were the only people that spoke english on the Lobster Tour and I thought the bus ride was going to be difficult. By the time we got off the bus later that day, everyone kissed and hugged us goodbye. Our television showed video of the Snorkel with Dolphins tour. The tour was so Not what the TV showed. Once on site, they suggest you don't even wear a mask and snorkel. The only thing different between your general swim with dolphins and the snorkel activity is that they let you float free in the center of the dolphin pool and you can pet them when they swim by.The room was great. Never a problem with water or power. We were in the 5000 series which is the building closest to the beach. I will say that out of all the people that we met, either one or both of them got sick during their stay, as did we. I tried to blame it on the Rum, but it seemed to happen to many people. Please remember to pack any medication you may need. I would not return to this resort since there are many other places that I haven't visited. They would also have to do something about the buffet food. On our last day, we actually celebrated that we didn't have to look at it any more!They estimate that the resort will open again for the Holidays. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact me. I'd be happy to help.  
<Date>Sep 12, 2005
