<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great place, except for the food We were at the Punta Cana Princess for a week during the winter of 2004-2005 for the wedding of a couple of friends. Being a while back, consider this a time-mellowed review that covers what we remember nearly a year later.Arrival - Getting off the plane, passing through customs, finding the bus, and handling our baggage went quite smoothly. Customs consisted of handing-over your money for the tourist card. Being a small airport, finding the bus to the resort was a no-brainer. Check-in - Check-in was also very smooth. The staff were ready for our arrival, and processed the group quickly. The baggage was sent to our room, and a drink was in our hands before we'd taken-in the setting. It was obvious that they were aware of the importance of first impressions. The room - By the time we booked, the better rooms weren't available. We had a ground-floor room looking toward the pool. Despite being on the lower end of the room scale, the room was large and comfortable. The pool and pathways on the grounds outside were set far enough away that we weren't bothered by noise, or folks strolling by. The A/C worked well, and the fans provided good air movement. The climate control shuts-down without a keycard in the activater-thingy, so expect a ten-minute delay before it's comfortable. Our only complaint about our room was that the patio and entry door weren't sealed all that well. A half-inch gap under the front door provided a freeway into the room for the endless parade of caterpillers. We found ourselves on tiptoes each time we were back in our room until we had time to de-bug (sorry PETA-folks, catch-and-release was not maintained... crunch-and-wipe was the order of the day).The grounds - This resort is not a large one. It's very well maintained, and the effects of the nasty hurricane season were only visible if you strolled down the beach and looked at some of the neighbooring resorts. The beach was fantastic. This resort has one of the best spots in the area, which we found-out while strolling a few klicks in each direction. The dive master related to us that the weather had been unusual since the hurricane seasion, kicking-up a lot of sand in the water. The waves were a good size, but never so large as to make swimming unpleasurable. However, if you're looking for crystal-clear water and picture-perfect snorkelling, you will be disappointed. The pool, swim-up bar, grounds, and beach were all excellent. I can't be certain of the capacity that they were running at during the week, but being late December, it must have been nearly full. Despite that, we never felt crowded. There was always ample room on the beach and by the pool. There were never line-ups for food or drink. This gave the resort a relaxed, comfortable feeling. The lobby provided an excellent evening spot for relaxing and chatting with friends. The open-air buildings were always cool, and the mosquitoes seemed to have taken the week off elsewhere. I've read other reviews complaining about the lack of A/C in the dining area and lobby. We didn't find that to be a problem at all, and likely would have preferred open-air to A/C if given the choice. Then again, if you're planning on going in June, you may want to pull-out an atlas and make note of the tropical location. I hear that Alaskan cruises are great...Activities - Being a smaller resort, there wasn't much in the way of activities. We enjoy relaxing (rhymes with 'lazy'), and so this didn't bother us at all. With a limited population at the resort, the staff, despite their best efforts, were hard-pressed to drum-up the usual fun games on the beach. Every day they would try to coax us into it, but were never pushy. If you're looking for an amusement park of a resort, this isn't the one for you. If you're adept at the max-relax, you'll love this place. Activity-junkies can always take advantage of the sister resorts, which are larger, and more crowded. Better yet, book a room at a resort that advertises the activities as a feature, and leave the snoozing on the beach to me, rotating every 15 minutes... ahhh, the bliss!The food - Alas, even nine months later, the food is still... memorable. Sunquest gave the resort a '5-star' rating. Either that rating was out of 6, or their reviewers survived on rum alone. The food was sub-par, at best. The buffet was best avoided, save for the made-to-order pasta. Of the resaurants, the Tex-Mex was the best. If gaining weight on a trip seems inevitable to you, this resort will break the pattern.A basic problem appeared to be that the food was designed to be bland, and North American. I would put dollars to doughnuts that the staff could have made excellent local food. As it was, cannaloni made with fish, and a dirth of flavour, shouldn't be tried at home, let alone in the DR. I understand why resorts try to cater to our tastes, but this resort was a good example of why that's a policy that should be followed with great care. The staff - Excellent. I can't say enough positive things about the staff. From the dinning staff, bar staff, diving team, lobby staff, and cleaning staff, excellent. The guest to staff ratio was solid; not once were we searching for a friendly staffer. Now, keep in mind that this isn't a thousand-dollar a night place. You aren't going to get wine recommendations with your dinner. If you need a somelier, you've spent about a third of the required money. Heck, if you want a choice beyond 'red or white', you're still only halfway there with your vacation spending. If you order the same drink every day, expect a wild variation in what actually makes it into your glass, if you venture beyond rum and coke or beer. The lobby bartender at night knew his stuff, and was obviously the senior bartender at the resort. The beach and pool bartenders were... creative. If you appreciate a decent scotch, then book ahead and get the upgraded bevie package. Then again, if you fall into that category, read about the food before you book.In any case, the entire staff was extremely friendly, helpful, tolerant, and attentive. No reasonable request was turned-down. If you want your mini-fridge in your room stocked with something, leave five dollars and a note for the cleaning staff (we did that once, and for the rest of the week the fridge was stocked with cold water and beer, even though we expected that to be a one-time thing). The policy seems to be all smiles, all the time, and they execute on that policy. Overhearing one decidedly ignorant guest get a dinning staff member's attention by yelling, Hey, amigo!, I was surprised to see him smile and do his best to make the guest happy. As with all resorts, a well-placed fiver, a modicum of spanish, a little patience for 'island-time', and a smile will get you just about anything you need to make your trip a good one. Even without the tip, spanish, and smile, I'm sure that the service would be great.Overall - We're not planning on returning to this resort. That's not to say that it was terrible, overall it was a very good trip. It's a solid 4-star resort. To gain a half-notch, or even a full notch, the quality of the food needs to make a stellar leap. A little weather stripping on the doors of the ground-floor rooms wouldn't hurt either. I was torn between a 3 and a 4 rating only because of the food. I've decided on a 4 because our positive memories of the resort outweigh the negative. Basically, the staff and the beach tipped the balance toward a 4, despite the cringe that the phrase 'seafood canalloni' still produces.If you're a couple looking for a medium-small resort with an excellent beach, great pool, and winning service, without spending a fortune, then go for it. If food is a major part of your typical vacation experience, give this resort a year or two to adjust (which I hope they will).This year we're looking at trying Secrets in Punta Cana. The food reviews look promising... maybe this time I'll get home a pound or two heavier, not including my liver.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Would go back again and again Went to the bavaro princess resort from August 19th to the 26th. There was a group of 15 of us and 4 of the 15 were children from ages 5 to 12.We all had a wonderful time. The food was great, the beach is fantastic and the people were very nice. If you are vip and want to make reservations for the restaurants you must do this at the vip conceirge stand. NOT AT THE FRONT LOBBY. We ate at a different restaurant every night and never had a problem with our entire group eating together. The kids even liked the food. It is a very big resort. It took us a day to find out where everything was but we had alot of fun doing it. We had no problems checking into our room or with any of the service. Our shower was broken and when we called it was fixed within 15 minutes. VIP has some benefits. My husband had all the Heinken and Miller beer that he wanted. If you order room service you can get an entire bottle of unopened wine or champagne. Their white wine is great.As far as a hut on the beach we got up early to get one, but if you go out to the beach around 2 there are many huts available. At night it is nice to sit under one of the bar huts. Very nice breeze. Better than sitting at the lobby watching the shows where it is too hot. If you tip the bartenders at the beach restaurant they will come out to the beach hut and wait on you. If you are good to them they are good to you. Bring a radio if you have one since there is no night life on the beach. All of us loved the resort and the food. Try the Chopin buffet. It was excellent. The El Gaucho restaurant had a very good filet mignon. We would all go back again.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great resort and location My wife and i just returned from the Bavaro Princess and I have to say we loved it. I am extremely particular and have been to the Dominican Republic several times. The beach, service, food, room and landscape was excellent. The nly complain I have might be that some people were a little noisy on the beach and there were many people from Spain partying in the pool that were very loud. Otherwise it was great. Here are my reviews by category:Beach: Excellent sand, beautiful water for swimming and scenery.Rooms: Large suites. AC was excellent. The bed was firm and very comfortable. Cable TV and mini fridge was stocked and included. Room was very clean. Food: Buffet is available for every meal and the selection and freshness was great. Allways a Pasta station and grill where you can have pasta, steak, fish or chicken made to order. In the AM, there is a juice bar where fresh juice is made to order and an omelette bar. There are several ala carte restaurants that are all good that require reservations, however i preferred the selection of the buffet. The buffet dining room was very nice.Service: Outstading and allways with a smile. Really nice people. Give them a dollar a day since the average wage in the DR is $200 per month. They were allways filling glasses, taking dirty plates away, etc. Landscape: Immaculately maintained. The gardens were spectacular. There are also exotic birds roaming around like Peacocks and Pink Flamingo's and odd varieties of ducks. Great for kids and even adults like me!Entertainment: A bit better than expected. They were amateurish, but fun and funny. Better than other resort entertainment offered by staff. Every evening there's a band that played for around 20 minutes including merengue, followed by a show.Activities: Sailing, wind sailing. activities all day by the pool including water aerobics, dance lessons (very entertaining), volleyball, shuffleboard, soccer on the beach, etc.I highly recommend this place. I was considering the Secrets Excellence resort that cost almost 50% more. No need to go there. This is a great place. Not sure what people with the bad reviews expected.  
<Date>Aug 30, 2005

3	16(food):1	63(drink):1	544(horrible):1

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Traveller's Disease waiting to happen! The following is my review of the Punta Cana Princess All-Suites Resort in Punta Cana, Dominican Republic (I visited this property 8/15-8/22/05): After a great deal of shopping around, my girlfriend Heather (24) and I (23) chose Punta Cana Princess (PCP) All-Suites resort for our vacation. We used the reviews on Debbie's (and another site) and prices provded by our travel agent to shop around for the best value. We specifically wanted a 5-star property. This review is going to be long and detailed, as I just returned two days ago and have quite a lot to say. We were originally interested in Jamaica or Mexico. However, Dominican Republic seemed to offer far better value. Since our prime interest was relaxation, Dominican Republic seemed to be the best choice for us. We arrived on a Monday at about noon. As we had been told ahead of time, check-in time was 3pm. Onto the review! Check-in:Check-in was rather smooth for us. Based on my previous experiences, we sat near the front of the bus and were the second in line for check-in. There were only 2 desks open for two busloads, and it seemed to be taking 5 mins per check-in! I doubt the people at the back of the line felt as good about their check-in. We were supplied with our room keys (cards), towel cards, bracelets, and a sticker to put on our luggage so it could be delivered to our room. We were not supplied a map of the resort. If you want a map of the resort, go to the Guest services desk to the left of the check-in counter and ask for one. This is NOT a 5-star Right away I noticed it. Right on the bracelet was marked * * * * sup. Sunquest lists this resort in their catalog as 5-star. This was clearly false information.By 2PM, we were hot and tired. We decided to try our room. Alas! It was ready early!The BuffetRight after check-in, we made our way to the buffet. The very first thing that caught my eye - The buffet is NOT AIR CONDITIONED. There is a nice breeze going through, but it is hot and humid nevertheless. The food was TERRIBLE at the buffet. I'm not a snob. I don't eat at expensive resteraunts at home, and my standards are not very high on vacation. However, it was nearly impossible to eat at this buffet. Breakfast is a hard meal to mess up. Made-to-order omellets are generally good anywhere you go. However, when the chef douses the cooking surface with what must have been 3-4 tbsps of oil for each omelet, what results is a fresh omelet that tastes as much like oil as it does like egg. On the buffet itself was bacon, which was poorly cooked and almost pure fat. The eggs on the buffet were terrible. All of the pastries were mediocre. The fruit was not fresh, nor was it any good. After trying everything to find something good to eat for the first few days, I ended up settling for toast with margarine and jam. Very dissappointing. Lunch and Dinner were equally awful. My girlfriend is a big vegetable lover. She was terribly dissapointed by the poor quality of the vegetables, and the very limited choices. All of the prepared salads had HAM in them. The lettuce was not dried - it was literally SWIMMING in water at the bottom. The creamy dressings that were available were cloppy messes. There were various oils and vinegars, which were okay. ALL of the cooked vegetables were the same. They were all made in some sort of butter sauce (and thus tasted like nothing but butter). Don't expect any good healthy choices, not even fresh/grilled/steamed vegetables.There was a pasta-to-order chef cooking custom pasta at lunch and dinner. The pasta was okay, probably the most edible thing available on the buffet. I personally enjoy beef. I was terribly dissapointed in this respect. A few times, there was no beef dish at all. A few other times the beef dish was empty and was not refilled in the entire time I was at the buffet. When I did get beef, it was fatty, chewy - basically your standard poor quality meat. The chicken at the buffet was perpetually over-cooked, though it was probably the best prepared of any of the meats. The fish was mediocre, and (pardon my pun) had a fishy taste to it. There was often a chef grilling fish fresh-to-order, but, similiarly to the omelets, it tasted like oil more than fish.I should also mention that despite heat lamps, most of the food was only luke-warm, and was often old, having sat out for way too long. The french fries (a no brainer, right?) were always cold and mushy, as if they had been cooked hours ago. Deserts were mediocre. The ice cream was good, although there is only one scoop, so it can often be an exercise in patience while you watch seven little Spanish-speaking children with no manners cut in front of you. The cakes were generally bad - it seems hard to mess up a chocolate cake, but alas it was awful. The cheesecake was good - but they only had it on the buffet 2 days out of 7 that we were there. Most of the pastries, including the cookies, were mediocre. How do you mess up cookies? I have no idea... but they did.I should say that other less discriminating folks seemed to be piling food onto their plates and enjoying it. I don't consider myself picky, but I guess to some people A LOT of food equals GOOD. However, if you value food quality, or you have any desire to eat even somewhat healthy, I don't think you will like the food on this buffet. Notably, if the buffet area was air-conditioned, food would probably be better as humidity has a way of degrading food quality. On a positive note, the waiters at the buffet were good-to-excellent. Most of the time, they were quick to server water (or coffee) at breakfast. They would also get you any drink you wanted on request. They would even take bar drink orders for you. If you like coffee, I suggest asking for a cappucino. The regular coffee leaves a lot to be desired, and the espresso-based beverages are much better.To briefly describe the smaller buffet near the beach - it was disgusting. The hotdogs were TERRIBLE. There were hamburger buns, but they never had any hamburgers. Overall, a terrible disappointment. This smaller resteraunt is also the only 24hr food source - in short, unless you're desperate, wait until breakfast... A La CarteOn the first night, due to arriving after noon, we were not able to make a reservation at an A La Carte resteraunt. The second day, I woke up in the morning and made a reservation for the that night at the Rio Grande (Tex-Mex) and for the next night at the Mexican Restaurant (which is at the next resort over). Rio Grande offers the best food anywhere on the resort. When you arrive, you are served hot corn chips along with salsa, green salsa, guacamole and cheese sauce to dip in. Excellent start. The appetizers were decent. I had the taco, which despite it's description is just some paste of a sauce wrapped in a soft taco shell. It was okay, so I don't care that they described ingredients and just used a paste. The main courses were excellent. I recommend the Beef Filet. It was the best piece of meat available at the resort, in my opinion. Heather had the Filet Mignon, which was decent, although she ordered it medium and they cooked it well-done. On our second visit, Heather had the Cheeseburger - and they forgot the cheese! Nevertheless, it was very decent meat. Also, notable is that the A La Carte restaurants are air conditioned, which is a pleasure when you're used to eating outside in the humidity.The Mexican resteraunt (located on the neighboring property, 5-10 mins walk away) was a disappointment after our first night's experience at Rio Grande. The Appetizer menu seems nice, until you realize that all it is is a desription of the dips that are served with your corn chips (the same as the Rio Grande serves). There are no actual appetizers to be ordered. The food here was okay, nothing special, and the Rio Grande was better. On our third night, we tried the Italian restaurant. The Calzones were okay, if you like meat. The only vegetables that they had were brocoli, cauliflower and carrots - strange choices for calzone fillings, in my opinion. The pasta dishes and pizzas/calzones are full size, so don't expect to be able to have one as an appetizer. We tried, and they told us that it was a main course and we couldn't have both. Overall, the Italian was decent, but the Rio Grande remained our favorite. One thing - whatever you do, DO NOT order the carpaccio. I know ... what was I thinking? I'm not sure if it was a coincidence, but it was the night after I ate the carpaccio that I got sick. Then again, Heather did not eat the Carpaccio, and she got sick one day after me ...The RoomOur room was excellent. The first thing I noticed - within seconds of putting my card in the slot (that activates the power and AC in the room), there was a very nice stream of cold air coming out of the Air Conditioner! The room was very spacious. We got the King-size bed that we requested. There was also a pull out bed in the living room area. We had a balcony that faced the pool with a little bit of ocean in the distance. The decor in the room was simple yet very nice. The mini-fridge was stocked with beer and soda, but strangely no water. No problem - we just got bottles of water from the bar, two at a time, and stocked it ourselves. The bathroom had two sinks, which was nice. The bath/shower was spacious. The water temperature left a lot to be desired. It took a good two minutes for anything other than cold water to come out. Even with the water set to the very hottest setting, the water was just-warm at best and barely luke warm at peak times. At one point, the water was dead for about an hour. I called guest services, and they apologized and said there was a maintenance issue and the water would be back shortly. It was back within an hour.Closet and drawer space was plentiful. You won't have trouble finding drawers for all of your stuff, no matter how much you bring. We were on the second floor. Sound proofing of the rooms was decent, as long as people kept their doors closed. Unfortunately, some very rude Spanish folks across the hall from us like to make noise at 7:30 every morning. Their favorite thing to do was to knock and then yell through the door. A dirty look from me and they stopped. There is no soundproofing to speak of between the floors/ceilings. If you're not on the top floor, expect to hear every step, every dropped item and every loving-bed-thump from the people above you. Lucky for us, the people above us were creatures of habit and always stopped making noise about half an hour before we liked to go to sleep, so it was no problem for us. Maid service was slow. We were never out of our room early enough for the early run (usually we took of the DND sign at about 10:30am) and so we had to wait until around 2-4pm to have the room cleaned. One day, it wasn't cleaned until 5:30pm! We tipped every day, and were treated to towel-animals, decorated with flower petals. On a side note - the maid never once refilled our toilet paper, even when it was COMPLETELY EMPTY - we constantly had to go ask for it as we ran out.The PoolThe pool was beautiful and well kept. There were always plenty of empty chairs, and plenty of sombreras to offer shade if you choose. The pool bar is nice, however at most times there was only one bar tender to handle both the in-pool side of the bar and the adjoining bar for those not in the water. Towel service is NOT at the pool, it is on the beach. This is annoying, because you are forced to get your feet sandy to get towels. It didn't make much sense, but the towel service was decent nevertheless. The pool bar attracted all of the loud day-time drunks. Situate yourself far from the pool bar if you want peace and quiet.The BeachOne word - beautiful. The white sand and crystal blue water left little to be desired. There were plenty of chairs. I never tried to get drink service on the beach, so I can't comment on that. The ToursI did not take any tours, so I can not comment on these. The excursions are rather pricey, and to be honest I personally went to the Carribean to relax and so tours just aren't my thing. We did, however, go parasailing. We paid our $80 (for 2 people) and showed up at the designated time. Five minutes later, we were picked up by a boat and taxied up and down the coast while we picked up a few other passengers. We then met up with the parasailing boat, and were asked to change boat mid water. This was fine for me, but it might be dangerous for older folk and young children. Parasailing was fun - a nice relaxing 10 min float. However, as they were lowering us back into the boat, they slowed to much, and we were pulled under water for about 1 second. I thought it was a bit strange, and after I got back I looked into it - it turns out that dunking is extremely unprofessional and dangerous. I thought so. Getting pulled under water while harnessed is very bad. As such, I would not recommend the parasailing in Punta Cana. The GymHeather is an avid gym-goer. On the first afternoon, we made our way to the gym. It was very small - one treadmill, one eliptical machine (that was broken for our entire stay), dumbells, a couple of barbells and two weight machines. We figured that this was the gym for PCP, and so we asked where the gym was for the other two larger resorts. There was none! This was it! The amazing thing is that the gym was ALWAYS empty. There was never more than a single other guest working out when we were there. I guess most people just don't go to the gym on vacation ... All in all it was adequate, but only because we had the place to ourselves. If there had been 3-4 guests there, it would have been very crowded. The InternetI paid $7 for 30 mins of Internet access half way through the trip just to check my e-mail, etc. I was amazed - in a world where a decent, basic Logitech keyboard costs $10, this $12/hr internet cafe had a keyboard that could not have cost more than $2. It was honestly terrible. I'm a 65 WPM typist and I could barely type. Aside from that, the internet worked fine, connection speed was fine ... no complaints. The Service in GeneralA friendly hola is required by all staff as they walk by you. It's a nice touch. The staff did not speak English. Some couldn't speak a single word. Generally, I don't care - I don't need to converse with them, and the staff with specific jobs that required speaking (such as the waiters) spoke just enough to do their jobs. The problem was the you could not special order your food (easy on the grease, for example) nor could you enquire about it (What's the best crepe on the menu? for example). The staff was friendly, which matters more than anything. Do expect a thick language barrier, though. One interesting thing that we noticed is that roles are divided by genders. All of the waiters were males. Women were only allowed to serve drinks. I just thought it was a bit odd, but I guess it's cultural.ConclusionTo begin, despite the shortcomings, Heather and I sucked it up and made the most out of our vacation. However, I would never return to this resort. I was tricked by Sunquest into going to a 4+ when it was a 5* I was seeking. In fact, I could have gone to another resort owned by the same company in the same part of the same town, the Bavaro Princess for EXACTLY the same price, and that resort is actually a 5*. The food was awful. It only took 4 days for me to get traveller's disease (known more commonly as awful, endless diarhea), and I did not even drink the tap water! I like boast that I have an iron stomach, because I can eat just about anything in abundance and I NEVER get sick to my stomach - yet I found myself visiting the toilet for 20 mins every 2 hours for 18 hours one day during my trip. Not pleasant. The buffet was not air conditioned, and the buffet food was terrible. It's hard to mess up on pastries, for example, but the Princess Pastry department has no trouble mucking them up every day. If you like food just because it's food, or if you have a disorder and don't eat, this would be the resort for you. Everything aside from the food was just fine. However, the food was SO bad that I really couldn't recommend this resort to anyone with ANY TASTE AT ALL. Sorry for the harshness.In closing, I'd like to answer to the reviewer who wrote if you can't find something to eat here, you're just too picky. You are correct. The bread and butter were just wonderful! Please feel free to contact me at jordancohen@sympatico.ca if you have any questions.

ef):3	1577(monday):1	1597(appetizer):2	1621(dead):1	1630(float):1	1644(mess):3	1706(desert):1	1707(department):1	1739(hamburger):2	1825(humid):1	1841(refill):1	1910(terribly):1	1939(yell):1	1971(dangerous):2	1980(seek):1	2034(description):1	2085(wrap):1	2133(sauce):2	2183(butter):2	2262(vegetable):2	2420(jamaica):1	2424(shell):1	2430(crystal):1	2437(parasail):4	2568(lover):1	2614(trick):1	2633(cultural):1	2683(dissappoint):1	2711(omelets):1	2762(medium):1	2769(oil):2	2829(abundance):1	2960(bracelet):1	3109(rio):1	3134(unprofessional):1	3178(filet):2	3269(boast):1	3395(divide):1	3691(ingredient):1	3717(hotdogs):1	3730(snob):1	3975(grande):1	3989(mignon):1	4078(alas):1	4548(sunquest):1	4646(buns):1	4741(taco):2	6156(made-to-order):1	6166(paste):2	6195(role):1	7056(mushy):1	7113(fishy):1	7919(2pm):1	8164(coincidence):1	8186(creamy):1	8595(pun):1	8830(dressing):1	10230(muck):1	10250(poolthe):1	10742(brainer):1	10777(pardon):1	12626(dunk):1	12815(well-done):1	
81	5(time):1	19(price):2	21(excellent):1	26(people):2	37(review):1	42(pay):1	47(eat):1	49(shop):1	62(expect):1	68(travel):1	72(resort):3	81(value):2	89(offer):1	97(internet):1	107(choice):4	124(expensive):1	130(standard):2	131(vacation):3	141(home):1	145(amaze):1	160(relax):1	165(start):1	166(own):1	175(cost):2	180(actually):1	181(tour):1	187(quality):2	192(site):1	197(fresh):1	214(property):1	239(town):1	257(decent):1	272(world):1	275(cafe):1	331(poor):2	352(basic):1	354(notice):1	390(adequate):1	469(guess):1	498(despite):1	510(limit):1	514(dominican):2	523(gym):1	546(pricey):1	551(begin):1	586(exactly):1	650(list):1	677(meat):1	704(opinion):1	719(bavaro):1	734(excursion):1	760(company):1	766(agent):1	767(ourselves):1	790(basically):1	1052(personally):1	1058(strange):1	1108(honest):1	1134(republic):2	1239(princess):1	1371(dissapoint):1	1548(carribean):1	1572(beef):1	1662(relaxation):1	1774(prime):1	1810(specifically):1	1831(5-star):3	1902(suck):1	1910(terribly):1	2262(vegetable):3	2294(healthy):1	3971(designate):1	4259(shortcoming):1	4439(keyboard):2	4548(sunquest):1	5052(resteraunts):1	7475(fatty):1	7634(carrot):1	8690(chewy):1	9769(debbie):1	10498(catalogue):1

84	0(staff):3	2(night):3	5(time):2	6(breakfast):1	8(day):1	9(service):1	10(restaurant):1	12(friendly):1	16(food):1	23(little):1	26(people):1	31(front):2	34(feel):2	36(desk):2	43(leave):1	44(experience):1	46(free):1	53(arrive):1	56(morning):1	63(drink):1	69(tell):1	72(resort):2	77(buffet):1	85(wait):2	91(guest):1	102(near):1	120(bus):1	127(speak):3	144(short):1	148(request):1	152(english):1	156(reservation):2	169(sit):1	171(able):1	173(please):1	188(line):2	225(la):2	242(care):1	245(watch):1	247(min):1	259(due):1	267(traveler):1	277(child):1	284(base):1	286(check-in):8	373(previous):1	382(happen):1	394(question):1	405(unless):1	481(job):2	531(matter):1	547(ice):1	554(wake):1	649(information):1	675(mexican):1	681(carte):1	713(contact):1	722(require):1	724(map):1	735(waiter):2	873(cut):1	952(doubt):1	976(ahead):1	1001(counter):1	1188(cream):1	1309(noon):1	1400(smooth):1	1459(exercise):1	1721(manner):1	1848(specific):1	2295(male):1	2730(desperate):1	2987(patience):1	3109(rio):1	3197(source):1	3897(24hr):1	3975(grande):1	5069(resteraunt):2	5092(converse):1	6227(scoop):1	6548(tex-mex):1	6855(3pm):1	7698(disease):1	8350(spanish-speake):1	
207	2(night):1	4(nice):2	5(time):6	6(breakfast):2	8(day):3	9(service):5	10(restaurant):1	15(recommend):1	16(food):17	22(pool):3	26(people):1	27(bar):7	30(beach):2	38(lot):2	47(eat):4	48(wonderful):1	50(bad):2	51(enjoy):1	53(arrive):1	57(water):9	62(expect):1	63(drink):4	65(visit):1	67(call):1	72(resort):6	76(try):1	77(buffet):14	81(value):1	89(offer):1	90(coffee):3	91(guest):1	93(easy):1	113(fine):1	114(hot):2	117(dinner):2	125(towel):4	134(available):2	145(amaze):1	162(hard):2	164(air):2	169(sit):1	174(serve):4	178(probably):3	187(quality):2	197(fresh):1	208(special):2	213(meal):1	234(set):2	236(warm):1	238(bottle):1	244(mention):1	248(consider):1	249(luggage):1	252(lunch):2	253(tried):2	257(decent):2	261(swim):1	263(condition):2	265(issue):1	267(traveler):1	292(card):2	297(note):1	299(quick):1	300(maid):1	329(entire):1	339(key):1	356(comment):1	358(italian):1	359(allow):1	364(afternoon):1	389(type):1	397(forget):1	402(foot):1	412(egg):2	416(loud):1	423(menu):2	432(terrible):3	439(taste):2	441(cheese):2	443(beer):1	452(suggest):1	453(okay):3	455(slow):1	458(positive):1	460(prepare):1	469(guess):1	497(bread):1	498(despite):1	523(gym):4	532(third):1	539(heat):1	540(catch):1	550(cook):3	566(woman):1	599(stock):2	607(realize):1	631(deliver):1	632(chocolate):1	651(somewhat):1	665(literally):1	677(meat):4	695(annoy):1	698(language):1	704(opinion):1	724(map):1	735(waiter):1	736(awful):4	744(regular):1	767(ourselves):1	779(figure):1	810(empty):2	816(dish):1	850(bottom):1	859(supply):2	875(toast):1	896(nearly):1	926(picky):1	941(piece):1	949(chicken):1	954(example):1	966(handle):1	970(nor):1	977(eye):1	1002(plate):1	1005(green):1	1020(barely):2	1029(cake):2	1050(folk):1	1057(bacon):1	1102(sense):1	1109(result):1	1143(pasta):2	1149(maintenance):1	1169(impossible):1	1219(desire):2	1302(chip):2	1308(soda):1	1334(beverage):1	1361(chef):2	1412(adjoin):1	1414(settle):1	1458(barrier):1	1485(apologize):1	1502(aside):1	1504(tap):1	1540(server):1	1550(force):1	1572(beef):1	1593(leaf) 13	32(check):1	33(trip):1	42(pay):1	73(etc):1	97(internet):2	113(fine):2	159(access):1	190(complaint):1	247(min):1	283(half):1	932(connection):1	1170(speed):1	1502(aside):1	

<Author>jaluck
<Content>Great Vacation!! My husband and I just got back from the Punta Cana Princess and we cannot wait to go back again. We went from Aug. 8 - Aug. 15 and the weather was perfect!! Everything about the vacation was amazing!! The Hotel Size and our room- Perfect!! There are around 215 rooms and every room had a beautiful view. We had a 30 second walk to the pool and a 2 minute walk to the beach. (We visited another resort that was huge. People had to take a shuttle to the beach from their room.) We had a really comfortable king-size bed and also a huge couch that was in front of the tv. We were both shocked because there were great channels such as ESPN, Cinemax, HBO, Showtime, news, etc. The rooms were also cleaned to perfection everyday. We had great air conditioning. We were extremely pleased with our room and everything about it. The Pool and Swim-up Bar - The pool was a nice size and there were activities going on all day long such as water volleyball, water polo, and water aerobics. The swim-up bar was never too crowded and you always could get a good cold drink. We were disappointed that the pool closed at 7pm. My husband and I really wanted to take a swim most nights after dinner, but couldn't because it was closed. Hotel Grounds - Breath-taking!! They worked very hard everyday to keep the grounds manicured to perfection all over. The palm trees are larger than any other place we have ever been to and plus there are a ton of them!! There are some really cool statues all over the resort too. The Beach - My favorate part. The beach is such a beautiful blue. There is a small amount of seaweed, but what beach doesn't have that? There are small waves that make the water a fun place to play. This resort has kayaks, boggie boards, snokeling gear, hobie cats, and more that is included for the guests. Take advantage of all of these activities because they are really fun. There is also a dive shop on the resort on the beach. We actually went diving to a ship wreck and that was really cool. The dive master was really good and able to take us through the interior of this huge ship. I recommend diving in Punta Cana especially with this place. The sand is white and very fine. It is almost like a powder. Also very important, no matter what time of day you go to the beach, you will always find plenty of chairs to relax in and plenty of shade. The sun is intense so I recommend bringing lots of sun block. The Food - Not the greatest, but we always found something to eat. We really liked their pizza for lunch and the tex-mex restaraunt for dinner. They had great filet mignon cooked to perfection!! We did not get sick at all from the food which was a concern of ours from previous reviews. Tipping - Not required, but we tipped all the time. Before the vacation, we went to the bank and got $100 in ones. Everyday, we gave the maids candy and some money. At the nice restaraunts we would give a couple dollars. We gave the bartenders some money here and there. We ended up tipping around $75 the entire vacation and it was worth it. The employees work very hard to make sure our vacation is enjoyable. The workers have lots of enthusiasm and are a real pleasure to be around. They have great personalities and really enjoy their job!! Tips - Avoid the gift shops. Try to take everything you think you would ever need. The prices in the gift shop were insane. Our friends bought a disposable camera for $20 there and sun tan lotion for $25. The worker would not come down on the price at all. I tried to buy a tiny bottle of solarcane and they wanted $18 for it. I was shocked at the outragous prices in there. Bring all types of medicine and sun block just in case to prevent from having to pay those rediculous prices. Also bring some snacks from home. We really wanted some potato chips or just a taste of something from home. I hope this helps and you will not go wrong from picking the Punta Cana Princess.  
<Date>Aug 17, 2005

<Author>Trobers
<Content>I want to go back! My husband and I went to the Punta Cana Princess from July 30 - August 6 and we we loved it.Arrival: The flight was very long as well as the bus ride so by the time we got to our resort we were hungry and tired! We were greeted with Pina coladas and friendly staff. Check in was quick and simple. Rooms: We had our room in the 5000 builing on the second floor. It was very nice, exactly as it is pictured on the website. Kind size bed, sunken living room, balcony with oceanview. AC worked perfectly and the maid refilled our room with drinks and new towels everyday. She also make a cute design with my night gown and my hubby's PJ's.Pool: Didn't go into the pool the first few days as we swam in the pool but the last few days that we did go in it was clean. Our room overlooked the pool and every morning I saw staff cleaning the pool and the surrounding area. Never had to save chairs even the ones under a palapa.Hotel: This is a quiet hotel which I didn't mind at all. The grounds of the hotel were very nice and clean. The gardeners worked very hard in the hot weather, trimming and cutting and landscaping daily.Food: We never went hungry staying here! The 24 hr all-inclusive is a real plus as well as being able to eat at the sister resorts. Food at the main buffet was good, the made to order eggs and pasta were great. They had a theme almost everynight with different selection of foods. we didn't eat at the main buffet much though because we preferred the larger selection at the sister buffet. We also booked a la cartes for every night. We wanted to try all the a la cartes but couldn't make it on 2 nights. We did try the Tex Mex, the Italian, The Mexican (CCP), The Dominican (TP), The Chinese (CCP). Our favorite was the Mexican restaurant. The Dominican restaurant wasn't so good. Had the filet mignon at the Tex Mes which was recommended by many and it was perfect, my hubby had the ribs and he said they were delicious. Lamb at the Italian were also very good as well as the Salmon filet. We also tried the beach restaurant at the PCP for breakfast and snack and they had very good pizza and fried chicken! Tried the beach restaurant at the TP as well, not a very large selection but good as well. The Buffet at the PCP/TP was where we ate our lunches and breakfast mainly. Very good selection, wasn't very busy but compared to the PCP I guess it would be. They has a pasta station and 2 grill stations making fresh meat all the time. Drinks were always refilled, never had my glass empty for longer than 2 minutes before someone came and brought me a new drink or asked me if I wanted another. Same as plates, they were cleared seconds after finishing it. Food was always hot and fresh when we went. Bars: Always got a drink in under 1 minute. Never watered down, once they gave me 1/3 rum in my pina colada! Too strong for me. Service was fast and friendly.Beach: Picture perfect! I did see them clean the beach very often, raking seaweed and combing the sand. Also there were staff cleaning the beaches of litter everyday round the clock. Once again, never had to save a chair. PCP/TP: The sister resorts were nice as well, they had 3 pool altogether but we didn't go in any of them as our pool was big enough. The tram that goes aroundt he resorts came probably every 10 minutes, sometimes we had to wait but other times we like to walk along the beach or across the paths to the other resorts. The grounds were very nice to walk through.Overall: Very nice and clean hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful, always got a friendly Hola from any staff that walked by. The shared ammenties is a real plus. There was plenty of variety of good food, especially with the 8 a la cartes, 3 buffet restaurants and food 24/7! It's hard not to be able to find anything that you liked! We loved the PCP and would go back any day!  
<Date>Aug 12, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not the best, but not the worst We visited the Punta Cana Princess the first week of August. Overall, the resort was good value for the reasonable price we paid. I would rate it a solid four...it is definitely not a five as some sites may rate it.Here is the break down:Resort - the resort itself was very clean and well maintained. However, if you are looking for fun and excitement, this is not the place. It was very quiet and activities were minimal.Food - the buffet was average, but please be careful what you eat. Many people, including us, all got sick at one point or another. I would recommend eating a la carte every night for dinner. Lots of options because you can visit the restaurants at the sister hotel Caribe next door. TexMex Restaurant - the filet mignon was greatIl Baccio (Italian)- calzones were amazingShangay (Chinese) - deliciousMexican Restaurant - good, but they don't have soft tortilla shellsBrazilian - great and unique dining experienceMare Nostrum (Seafood) - different, but goodLa Creperie - awesome! Bars - keep this in mind...no one at the resort speaks English so knowing basic Spanish will go a long way. There is no drink menu so when you see someone with a drink that you like, ask them what it is so you can order it too. Be cautious of the mashed banana drinks that may upset your stomach.Beach - absolutely perfect. Gorgeous white sand beach and chairs are always available.Pool - pools were good, but definitely more going on at the Caribe. If you like peace and quiet, stay at Punta Cana Princess. If you like activity, go the Caribe pools. The pool at Punta Cana Princess was much cleaner. The pools at the Caribe had too many bugs.Weather - the weather was great the week we were there, but can be unpredictable. A lot of humidity, so ladies don't even think about trying to straighten your hair. I went curly all week with lots of de-frizz.Other tips to rememeber:- Building 4 or 5 are great; closest to the pool and the beach- Use bug spray in the evening to avoid bug bites- Book your restaurant reservations at least one night in advance to avoid disappointment- Visit the Bavaro Princess at night - this is definitely a 5 star and the shows are so much better here than at the Caribe- Visit the Casino if you like gambling - pretty impressive and there are coupons for $5 matching your playOverall, our visit was good and it served its purpose of some rest  relaxation in a nice environment.  
<Date>Aug 11, 2005

<Author>diamondsuz
<Content>PCP Paradise Vacation Just returned back from our first vacation in DR on Monday. My daughter (18 yrs. old) and I had a great time. We were a bit concerned with weather, sickness and hurracaine issues but turned out had absolutely nothing to worry about.Flight by Skyservice went very smooth. Only complaint was how cold the plane was and lack of blankets. Arrived at PC Airport and was quickly transported by Sunquest bus to resort.Check in at resort went quickly. Offered us cold drinks while we waited in line. Front desk greeter was very friendly and met us with a big smile and a bit of personal chit chat. Room was not ready but only a 45 minute wait. Gave us a chance to grab a cold drink at the lobby bar and walk around for our first look at the resort. Bags were brought right to room by Bellboy when ready. Room was exceptionally clean and cool as AC was already running. Room had two double beds, ceiling fan, sunken living room with sofa bed, television, bar fridge that was stocked daily by maid with beer, coke,sprite and bottled water. Had our swimsuits on and were in the pool within minutes of getting our luggage.The PCP is so quiet and private. Never a problem to get a lounge chair at the pool or beach. No lineups at the bar. A la carte could be booked every night if you wanted. Food at a la carte restaurants was great. Especially enjoyed the fillet mignon at the Steakhouse and the Calzone at the Italian. Booked four nights of restaurants, ate buffet 1 night and enjoyed dinner on the beach at the Saturday night Beach Party. Always lots to eat and plenty of selection. Neither my daughter or I suffered any sickness. We did make sure our tetnus shots were up-to-date and got a hep A shot on the advice of our doctor.My daughter and I both did well purchasing souvenirs at the local beach vendors booths. They love to barter. Word of warning...their prices start very high, however, they are happy to negotiate. PCP guests have the opportunity to share all of the facilities of both the Carible and Tropical and yet they could not use ours. That meant great restaurants, bars and entertainment to use there with quiet and private facilities at our resort. The best of both worlds. The shuttle to Caribe was convenient and kind of nice on a hot, summer evening. Walk was very short if you didn't want to wait for shuttle. We went to see the entertainment every night. The DR people really put on some great shows. Nothing more relaxing than sitting under the stars with a cold drink and watching a show.Beach was beaaaautiffffulll! Blue water and soft sand. We enjoyed a few long walks along the beach shore as well as swimming in the crystal clear water. Weather made it all the better. Sunshine ever day of our vacation. Very warm but who can complain when you have a cold drink in your hand and the cool water a step away. Staff at resort were very friendly. Never had to wait to be served for food or drinks. First night there, realized sliding door lock was broken. Probably nothing to be concerned about but being two females travelling alone thought it best to get fixed. Went to lobby at 10:00 pm and told them problem. They had a repair man in our room within 5 minutes. He replaced both sides of the door lock and had it locking properly within 15 minutes. Maid left lots of clean towels with pretty fresh flowers laying on them each day. Fridge was stocked and room was clean including sparkling clean sliding door windows. We made sure to bring a lot of goodies so that we could leave her gifts every day. It was very much appreciated. Flight home was smooth. Biggest complaint about whole trip was Skyservice handling our luggage. We waited at the carousel for over an hour. When approached by us as a large group of concerned travellers, the reps had no answers and actually left their booth to avoid us. Skyservice will undoubtedly receive lots of complains about this and lose some business. It was a fantastic holiday! We will definitely return to the DR again some day and this resort would be at the top of our list of choices to stay!  
<Date>Aug 10, 2005

<Author>manateeboy
<Content>Will Not Return to the Punta Cana Princess Just returned from Punta Cana Princess and it was the first vacation in a long time that we were more than ready to leave. First let me say that this was our second trip to Punta Cana this year. We stayed at the Ocean Blue in March for one week and loved it, including the food. The OB main food buffet was always very FRESH and the alacartes were very good. Not so at the Punta Cana Princess. First of all the GOOD:The weather was perfect, not a drop of rain all week.Checkin and checkout were no problem.The resort is layed out nicely (very much like Ocean Blue) and the staff for the most part were helpful and friendly.The room was spacious with plenty of closet and drawer space, double sinks and nice balconies. The air conditioning worked well. We stayed in building 4000 on the second floor.The beach, as we already knew, was great and the ocean was the perfect temperature.Dinner reservations for the alacartes were easy to make - we made them all in one day. Guest Service desk was good.Now for the BAD:The food at the main buffet was terrible. Perhaps the lack of air conditioning was the reason. Some of it (especially the cheese and fruits) looked like it was recycled from the last meal. The breakfast buffet was probably the worst. The OJ was from a can and not cold. The pancakes and waffles were never made fresh, always laying in a cold tray and tasted like rags. When I asked one of the cooks to make me a fresh waffle, he said, No. The bacon was all stuck together and tasted terrible. The breads weren't great either -- not much taste and sometimes they were stale. The sweet buns were Yuk! The only thing that was OK were the eggs, that were cooked to order. Although, they were fried in a lot of oil. The lunch buffet wasn't much better. Hope they repaired the pizza warmer by now. You couldn't get a hot slice of pizza. The Caribe buffet was a ZOO! We didn't eat at the buffets at night, we ate at the alacartes. They were hit and miss -- mostly miss. One night we were at the Tex Mex and ordered filet mignon. They served it ROAR! And the waiter said that's what we ordered! We said, Medium Rare, not Roar. As far as the drinks, we only drank wine which was OK. The bar drinks were awful. We did have more than a touch of illness (both of us) as did MANY of the other guests we talked with. Most did complain about the FOOD! This did not happen at Ocean Blue. Luckily we had an antibacterial prescription with us that we both took for 3 days.Don't count on the shuttle to the Caribe - it's quicker to walk.The Pool: The first day we arrived the pool was a little murky and was green. People complained and by the third day it was better. The pool was not as clean as Ocean Blue. Before we went to the Punta Cana Princess, we read all the reviews on Trip Advisor and it's hard to believe that in most cases, the reviews were so Positive! We have traveled to many countries in the Caribbean and in Cancun, Mexico and have never gotten ill from the food. Will we return to Punta Cana -- not sure. Will we return to the Punta Cana Princess - absolutely NOT.On a high note -- we met some very nice people from Indiana: Todd and family and from Toronto: Anne and Richard. Also from Canada: Keisha, Steve, Andrew and his lovely girlfriend.MANATEEBOY (Pete and Lynne)  
<Date>Aug 9, 2005

<Author>JD17
<Content>R  I travelled to the Punta Cana Princess July 4 to 11, 2005. I traveled in a group of 9 people. This is a spectacular resort, in a spectacular destination. We booked our group through Sunquest Vacations, and flew with Skyservice. Flight  Transfers: Smooth, a lot of leg room, and quick baggage pickup. Very impressed with Skyservice. Our transfer to the hotel was pretty rocky, and a little nauseating. However, we made it to the hotel safley and with all of our luggage, thats the most important thing.Check-in: We were greeted at the hotel with cold drinks, which was great, because it was 38 degrees. We did have to wait about 40 min. to check in, but we did sit on the back of a full bus on the transfer. So, thats our fault. Resort: Perfect spot for rest and relaxation. The lobby was beautiful, big and had the open concept idea. The grounds were kept immaculate. The resort itself was smaller compared to the neighbouring resorts, but still pretty big! Rooms were all suites. Which had 2 queen size beds, a big bathroom with double sinks, a living room, mini-fridge, and balcony. Rooms were very clean and spacious. The pool, was very nice, it did get a bit dirty after a storm went through. You get exchange privlages at the Tropical Princess and the Caribe Club Princess. Nighlty enteFood  Drinks: The food was amazing!! Between the buffets and the A La Cartes, if you cannot find something that you enjoyed, then you know that you are too much of a picky eater. The food was fresh and plentiful, different themes at the buffets everyday! Plus you get to use the restaurants at the Caribe Club Princess, and the Tropical Princess, so LOTS OF SELECTION. Drinks were also very good. Huge selection, from espresso to a huge variety of alcohol. Try the Punta Cana Princess and the Wazzzzup.Entertainment: Hotel was very quiet, with an option of entertainment. This is what we wanted! The animation team was there, and they had a daily outline of activities for everyone in the family. They were not pushy if you did not want to participate. The hotel is very quiet at night, you can go to the Caribe Club Princess (by complimentary shuttle, or 10 min. walk on path) to see their shows, which were excellent!! Very talented for a resort venue.Staff: Most staff were extremeley friendly, with the occassional odd-ball. It is a huge plus if you know basic spanish as only about 50% of the staff could speak fluent english. But very kind for the most part.Tipping: It is not required, but it is accepted. I only tipped our maid, only because she was very nice, friendly, and courteous. They only make an average of $50US per week, so take that into consideration, when you consider tipping. Beach: Big and beautiful!!!!! Clear blue waters, crystal white sand!! Just perfect. Bonus: No need to reserve lawn chairs or palapas, there was always a bunch free! TOPLESS BATHING ALERT!! There was not too many topless from our hotel, it was mainly those staying at other hotels walking along the beach.Day Tours: We did the half-day shopping tour, and the Bavaro Runners. IF you enjoy shopping, definetly go on the the shopping tour. Souvenirs at the resort are very over priced. The Bavaro Runners, was phenomenal!! Experience culture, day to day life, food, beach, agriculture, horse back riding, and much more, all in one day. I highly recommend it!! PS - don't forget to heckle with the store clerks, they try to scam tourists. When they quote you a price, cut it by 60% and work your way up from there.Overall, I highly recommend the Punta Cana Princess, if I had to stay here again, I would not be disappointed.  
<Date>Jul 17, 2005

<Author>lorochka
<Content>It was great, but.... Punta Cana Princess resort.We went there in July 4-11,2005. Basically, we liked that resort, espessialy our room and room service. No complains at all. Food was not so bad. We were not hungry. But I had some problem with my stomack, after visiting restourant, but not so serious.Beach-is amasing! The best impressions! Not forgetable.Before going to this resort I read some peoples review and opinion about everything. It was very usefull, especially about stolen stuff on the beach. We tried to be carefull, but anyhow someone stole my hasband's googles at the first day on the beach, while we went for swimming. One more thing about watersport. You should be ready to pay for everything there. We thought that the only scuba is not included, like in most of resorts and didn't expect that we should pay even for catamaran. And one more thing. Resort is not big. There is no theatre, disco, dance there. You should go to next resort. Of course, It is not a big deal, but....We liked being there, but we don't go there again. This is not 5 star resort, like our travel agent told us, that's for sure.  
<Date>Jul 14, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Excellent and Beautiful Resort!!!! We just got back from a 4 night 5 day vacation at the Punta Cana Princess and loved it!!!!!!! Can't wait to get back. When you first get there you are greeted with a cold pina coloda and the resort is beautiful. You must make reservations at the Ala Carte restaurants, the Tex Mex restaurant was delicious , get either the chicken or the steak or both!!!! The buffet food was alright but you will find something you can eat. The weather was nice!!!!!!89 degrees everyday. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Make sure you do the Jurastic Sufari tour and if you buy anything always negotiate the price, I got a large canvas painting and mask for $100 and he originally told me it would cost $175. Anyway you will have a blast, you can go to the casino by hotel shuttle and you also have access to 2 of their sister properties, the one you want to spend a lot of your time for entertainment is the Caribe princess. The Punta Cana princess is very kid friendly, we don't have any kids, but it was a very quiet resort which we liked. You won't be sorry, our stay was excellent!!!!!!!!!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>not terrible, but not great I just got back from the Punta Cana Princess just a couple of hours ago. I must admit that it was not my favorite vacation although many of the less than satisfactory conerns were not the fault of the hotel. We were scheduled to arrive in the mid afternoon of July 1, but due to problems with the charter airline, we had an 11 hour delay, and we did not get to the resort until about 2:AM. Once we did arrive check in was pleasant. The gentleman at the front desk was very polite, helpful, and efficient. Staff members promptly delivered our luggage to our room. However, the A/C had been turned off in our room, and it was hotter than blue blazes. In fact, even with running the A/C full throttle for the entire week, the room never did get cool. Literally, it was hotter in the room than outside. On a more positive note, after we unpacked, we were delighted to find out that there was an open snack bar. The gentleman working the grill made us a pizza, and it was pretty good, and since we hadn't eaten in many hours, it actually tasted wonderful.We got off to a late start on Saturday, sleeping in a bit to catch up from the late night. As soon as we could, we went to the beach. The beach at the Punta Cana Princess is very nice. The water has a pretty color, and there are plenty of beach chairs. In fact, of all of the all inclusive Carribean trips I have taken, the Punta Cana Princess is the best in terms of easily accessing a shaded beach chair. No matter what time of day I went, I could always find one. Although, the water does have a pretty color, it is not as clear as I had hoped on the beach. If you are standing in knee deep water, you can not see your feet in the water. This is mainly due to the waves, which are not big, but just big enough to stir up sand in the water to limit visibility.The drinks are not very good. We purchased the super VIP package which claims to give you top shelf liquors, but those are only served in the lobby bar, and even there, they don't have Bacardi or Captain Morgan Rum. For the most part, the bartenders were very freindly and so you didn't want to complain. The exception to that was a female bartenders serving female guest. For some reason, she did not want to serve other women. My wife told me that she couldn't get served at the lobby bar, and I found it hard to believe, but I went back up there with her and saw it for myself. A couple of other ladies I spoke with told me that they had similar problems. Also, if you go expecting a good tequila drink, don't.Food: Our first dinner was at the Italian restaurant. I ordered the steak, and my wife had the chicken. My steak wasn't terrible, but it was tough and over cooked. The chicken was terrible. I did speak to some other guest who ordered the shrimp, and they said it was excellent. So, if you go to the Italian place, avoid the chicken and get the shrimp.Our second dinner was at La Cava located at a sister property. I'm not going to say it was outstanding, but it was pretty good.Probably our favorite restaurant was the Rio Grande. We ended up eating there twice. I highly recommend the mixed meat platter.I also enjoyed the Brazillian restaurant located at a sister property. While it is a far cry from some Brazillian restaurants, it was very good.The Mama Mia Restuarant, also located at a sister propery, was very good also.Of course, there were other restuarants that we didn't get the chance to try, but to be honest, I had heard negative things about the Mexican place, the oriental place, and the domincan restuarant as well. The breakfast buffets are good, and the lunch buffets are OK.Service: Freindly, but not overly efficient. During meals, glasses stay empty too long, and in general, once the food is brought out to you, you might not see a waiter/waitress again. When you do see them, they are very amiable though. Same thing for drink service on the beach. Your best bet is just to walk to the bar. If the rare occurence happens that someone does take your drink order on the beach, you might see that drink in a half hour, or you might not see it at all.Weather: Bad, but that's hardly the hotel's fault. If anything, it's my fault for planning a Carribean beach vacation during hurricane season. Lesson learned. Out of the 6 full days we stayed there, it rained 4 of them. I will say that the resort is laid out very nicely. While avoiding the feel of just a hotel, everything is very convenient and easily accessible. It's also a fairly pretty property.Overall, compared to other resorts I've stayed at (and maybe that just says more about the other places), I didn't like it. In all fairness, though, had we have had better weather and had we not have lost nearly a full day of our trip due to an airplane malfunction (neither were the fault of the hotel of course), I might would have been able to overlook some of the hotel's negatives and have a more favorable impression of the Punta Cana Princess. However, I won't be going back.  
<Date>Jul 9, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Absolute Perfection I stayed at Punta Cana Princess from the 12th June up to the 25th June and I only have one word for it - perfection! We went on our honeymoon, and when we arrived in our suite there was a bowl of fruit and a lovely welcome letter, together with a fantastic bottle of rum. The hotel is the smaller one of the three Princess hotels, so I would recommend that for night life you jump on the buggy car and hop over to the other hotels. The suites at this hotel are large, you have the main bedroom with a queen sized bed and on another level you can find the living area, a very comfortable sofa with a nice sized TV, coffee machine and this leads onto the verandah. The food in Punta Cana Princess is wonderful, it affords a buffet restaurant (Buffet Casabe) which have themed nights, i.e italian night, french, dominican, mexican, but apart from the huge selection of international food they offer, they also have two chefs (one normally carves meat i.e lamb pork or beef in large quantities) and the other one makes freshly cooked pasta with the sauce and filling of your choice! I think this was my favourite. They also have the sea food restaurant at the beach called the Mare Nostrum which is fantastic, we always used to go for lunch there as it is open 24 hours. They have an italian restaurant and a mexican, both very very nice. Every single person working there is so so nice, please say Hi from me to Yanira, Delia and Rosary, amongst many others of course. Julio Cesar from the Mare Nostrum is fantastic, as is Santa, she makes the meanest cocktails! Always ask for a frozen cappucino and a Bahama Mama, they are lovely. The grounds of the hotel are fantastic, and the pool is to die for. Ruben is in charge of cleaning the pool, he is really friendly. Tipping is always recommended, $1 perhaps, if you are happy with that employee's service to you they really appreciate it. Remember, tipping does go a long way. You also have a swim up bar in the pool serving the most lovely cocktails. I also recommend the spa, they have loads of beauty treatments on offer, they have competent beauty therapists which make you really relaxed about everything. The decor of the place is absolutely breath taking as is the beach on the grounds of the hotel. Beautiful white sands, crystal blue water....... If you walk towards the left for about 10 minutes, there is a beach market selling everything you might want to buy regarding souvenirs, but beware, on the dominican republic, never pay more than 50% less of what they are asking for. Always haggle, they will rob you blind. I recommend buying the Larimar which is the official semi precious stone of the island and only located there. Its similar to turquoise but lighter, worth taking a few items back home with you. Regarding the restaurants, you can book the restaurants in the other hotels as well, there is a chinese restaurant (do not order the Locomoco rice, you will have a nasty surprise), dominican, mexican and the best one of all the fish restaurant called the Pescador. For the Pescador you have to pay a small fee of 25$ per person, very worthwhile, as you can choose the freshest lobster, and they serve it with a wonderful sauce. I really cannot recommend it enough, so go ahead and book this hotel, its fantastic!  
<Date>Jul 7, 2005

<Author>girlygirljenn
<Content>Loved it! Great for Honeymooners! We went for 2 weeks July 2004!!!We absolutly LOVED IT!The rooms were exactly as pictured in the brochure! <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great but not Perfect My husband and I (both 27) stayed at the Punta Cana Princess June 11-18. We were looking for a small, quiet resort - without the adults-only prices. We have only been to the RIU Tequilla in the past, so we are not well-travelled by any means. After talking to many Europeans, Americans and Canadians, we have realized that some people are too picky and should just stay home. And it was usually the people who paid $500 for the week who complained the most. Yes, the service was a little slow at the bars some of the time, but we were on vacation and not in any hurry.Here were our observations:BEACH - The beach was beautiful. You can't go wrong with the entire Bavaro Beach. However, the PCP seemed a lot less busy than the other resorts. And we had the biggest swimming area in front of our resort. ATTENTION all romantic couples - the beach at night is amazing. We felt completely safe to walk up and down it at night. And we often saw people taking a late night swim.BUTLER SERVICE - This is where we were disappointed. Sunquest advertises the resort as having butler service for drinks on the beach. There was not a server to be found. We complained to our tour rep, and he said that they could not guarentee it because we were there in the off-season. However, a bunch of other nice Canadians made a bigger fuss, and the problem was solved by the end of the week.POOL - Clean and warm with a wonderful swim-up bar. There were lots of chairs and shady spots surrounding the entire pool.BARS - Find the menu at the loby bar and remember the names of drinks you would like to try - if you don't know any Spanish this will make your vacation a lot easier. The service at the loby bar was probably the slowest, but this is where you will find the premium brand drinks (VIP only). But, if they didn't have it at the beach bar or swim-up bar, they would just send someone to deliver it - it just took about 10 minutes to get a drink. We made friends with Nelson at the swim-up bar and he took care of us for the entire week. You didn't even have to ask, he would just fill up your drink.RESTAURANTS - The Buffet Restaurants for breakfast and lunch were okay. We always found something we liked. The omlets at breakfast were awesome - as was the pasta bar at lunch. We went over to the Caribe for lunch a few times because the selection is bigger. However, the service wasn't as good (maybe because it is A LOT busier). Our biggest complaint was that there are NO fans to be founds - very hot in June. We often ordered room service just to escape the heat.The A La Carte Restaurants for dinner were AMAZING. If you are soo picky that can't find something to eat here than you should stay home. The food was great, and the service was fantastic. We ate everything from lobster to tacos to sushi. If we didn't like it, we didn't eat it. All the restaurants (except the one on the beach) are air-conditioned.They served food all night at the beach restaurant - a very small selection, but we always found something to eat after coming back from the Disco.ROOM SERVICE - We had it included in our VIP package. We ordered it about 6 times, and they messed it up 3 times - basically because the guy at the other end couldn't speak english. We ordered it to escape the heat, but we saw people taking food from the buffet to their rooms, so it wasn't necessary.SERVICE - The service at all the restaurants is amazing. We never had an empty glass of water or wine. And they will bring you whatever you want from the bar. The service at the front desk is hit and miss - it all depends who is working. We had the VIP package and didn't receive any special check-in, but that was fine with us. Service at the bars was either really slow or really fast - it all depended on who was working.ENTERTAINMENT - It was pretty quiet at the PCP. The animation staff would try and get people to particiate in morning stretching, volleyball, dance lessons, spanish lessons ..... but they weren't overly annoying if you didn't want to particiate. We didn't see any of the evening entertainment at the PCP, apparently there was something in the loby every night. We went to the show at the Caribe every night. Some nights were really good, and some were just good for a laugh. They would always start their show with the Ice Breaker where they would get audience members to participate. We often avoided this because there were a few annoying employees trying to get you on stage. The Disco was fun. They played merengue music, hip hop and techno. Locals go to the same disco, so be prepared for lots of touching on the dance floor.Overall, we had a very relaxing vacation with lots of good food to eat. We will be returning with our kids next year.Enjoy.  
<Date>Jun 22, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Very Good My husband and I visited the PCP from May 22-29. After surviving our hard landing courtesy of Skyservice, we were pleasantly surprised with the PCP. The resort was beautiful and clean. We had a suite on the first floor and were worried about bugs coming into our room but surprisingly there were none. The only time we were bothered by mosquitoes was on one night after it had rained. It only rained one afternoon when we were there and other than that it was extremely hot and sunny. We spent most of our trip sitting on the beach and swimming in the ocean because it was too hot to do anything else. We did squeeze in 3 games of mini-golf at the Caribe Club Princess. We tried to use the facilities at the Bavaro Princess as was specified in the advertising by Sunquest but were not welcome to use any of their facilities other than their Casino. We were disappointed by this so beware it's really STAY AT ONE, PLAY AT TWO. I complained about this and since returning I've noticed that the advertising now specifies that the facilities at both the Caribe Club Princess and Tropical Princess can be used. Good luck getting to the Tropical Princess because it's definitely not a walking distance away. Other than that, the food at the a la cartes were fantastic especially the seafood restaurant where they served lobster without any surcharges. There was no limit on the number of a la carte dinners you could have for the week. The buffet was ok but basically we were a little scared to try most of the food so we stuck to omeletes for breakfast and pasta for lunch. On Saturday night there was a beach party which consisted of a Dominican Buffet on the beach, a Dominican marketplace also on the beach, and dancing and games on the beach as well. It was wonderful! A tip really does go a long way there and all the staff were very friendly and mostly all spoke English. The waiters especially loved saying Very Good and by the end of our trip all the resort guests were saying VeryGood in their best Dominican accents. Our suite had fresh hibiscus flowers in it everyday and also cute towel animals. Overall, we had a great time but probably would not return to the PCP as there are so many other resorts and countries to explore.  
<Date>Jun 9, 2005

<Author>drumleyhill
<Content>Honest Review Well, we arrived at the hotel at midnight, and we were welcomed by cocktails and very quick service. The room we had was the best room ever, stayed on the top floor overlooking pool room # 5203. Bar replenished everyday, linen on bed changed each day and always fresh towels left, very happy with room and room service. Pool clean and well designed, with a nice swim-up bar. The pool area was quiet with soft spanish music playing in background. The louder music was down at the beach area near bar. Grounds to the resort very well maintained, lush and clean. The sauna room was fantastic, hottest one I have ever been in and it had a great jacuzzi just outside the building. Beach beautiful and we walked the beach day which is unusual for us, miles of white sand and close to the markets that is set-up on the beach. You can buy anything you need from the stalls, cigars, booze, t-shirts, gifts etc., be careful the locals always ask way too much for their stuff but you can barter big time. My brother traded his old t-shirts and ball caps in for cigars and rum. Night life is basically in the other resorts which a shuttle runs every 15 minutes to which resort you want. We kept in the Princess and did not go to the other resorts but my brother and his friends did, they loved it especially the disco's. The only disappointment we had although we did not expect to get the same quality and selection was the food. The soups and deserts were very good, and the breads were freshed baked. For a small resort and the price we would recommend this resort to our friends etc. Where can you go for $1000, we enjoyed our stay.  
<Date>May 29, 2005

<Author>suedon61
<Content>We'll be back!! My husband and I and 2 other couples stayed at the Punta Cana Princess from April 14-28. We had an awesome vacation. Our maid was Digna and she was wonderful. We left a tip and a little gift everyday. I can tell you a tip goes a long way. We tip at home for good service so we should do the same elsewhere. We had excellent service everywhere in the hotel. If you can't find anything to eat I can tell you, you don't eat much. There was every kind of food you can think of. Say hello to Isabel and Martin at the Mare Nostrum bar and the Pool bar. And Hello to Adonis in the buffet. FROM CANADA!! These people made our stay at this hotel a wonderful experience. We did just about every excursion they had Bavaro Runners, Bavaro Splash(ask for Indiana Jones), Caribbean Festival, Maniti Park, The Underwater Sea Aquarium(unbelievable), Deep Sea Fishing, and Parasailing. I would reccomend them all. Our Sunquest rep was Luco and he was great. anything we needed he was there for us. (Great Guy). If you plan on taking travellers cheques be aware that you can only get Pesos for them even at the bank there. I would suggest american cash. We had a safe in our room and your money is safe there. No worry's. I would reccomend this hotel for everyone. Feel free to contact me for more info.

<Author>TeamTaz
<Content>Paradise in Punta Cana My family and I spent two weeks at the Punta Cana Princess from April 14 to April 28th. Our Room was located in the 5000 building on the second floor which overlooked the pool and had a partial ocean view. When booking this hotel I would request a balcony room as other guests who had ground floor rooms complained of mosquitos in their room at night. Once the staff was informed they sprayed the area affected and everything was fine for them after that. Our maid (Digna) went above and beyond to take care of us. We left her a tip every morning and when my boys (8) found out that she also had a son left her some toys they brought to give away. On the day we left I also gave her all of our uneeded medication we had brought with us. We booked the VIP package and personally feel it was well worth the extra cost. It allowed us priority booking for the al-a-cartes and the massage was awesome. The buffet always had something you could eat. My son and myself are picky eaters and I can tell you we never went hungry. My only complaint regarding the buffet is that the food in the main section could have been a little hotter. We became friends with a server named Adonis and once again he went above and beyond to make our vacation the best, he even met us in the lobby on the afternoon of our departure to say good-bye. We really liked the Tex-Mex and Mexican al-a-cartes. Having two boys aged 8, I was a little disappointed with the kids club as it was more geared for kids under 5, but can one really complain when they have a beautifull pool and awesome beach to boogie board at!! We went on two excursions, the Manati Park and Bavaro Runners and would recommend both. On the Manati Park we paid the extra money to swim with the dolphins which I must say was one of the highlights of our vacation. In closing, we would return to the Punta Cana Princess in a heartbeat.  
<Date>May 17, 2005
