<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Excellent Vacation My family spent Mar27 to Apr3 at the Punta Cana Princess...and loved it. After researching many vacation spots, I ended up choosing one that I knew nothing about (mainly because it was a Deal of the Day and got an excellent price).... lucky for us we were very happy. The resort is small (compared to the Caribe), but we liked it because it wasn't as crowded. The rooms were very spacious, with a sunken living room and pull-out bed. We found the whole resort very clean and the staff was very accomodating. Having a 9 and 11 year old, the smaller resort allowed us to feel comfortable letting the kids go on their own around the resort (security was good). Kids Club was definitely not good for their age..... mainly for toddlers, but there was enough for them to do otherwise. We made use of many of the daily activities which were available...beach and pool aerobics, dance lessons, spanish lessons, kayak races and much more. The activities instructors were fun and sociable...and got people involved (but not pushy). We liked being able to visit the Caribe for the shows and restaurants, however it was impossible for us to reserve a restaurant...they were always full (a little disappointing), but we did try the crepe restaurant...excellent. We didn't mind the buffet for breakfast and lunch, but only went once for dinner.... we're not buffet people. We REALLY enjoyed the Tex Mex restaurant... ate fillet mignon twice! The Italian was good too. The beach was amazing... very clean and BLUE!!! This was our first vacation with our kids and now they're hooked!!! I would definitely recommend this resort to anyone looking for a relaxing family vacation!!  
<Date>May 3, 2005

<Author>bonbini1
<Content>loved it! Four of us spent April 15-18th at the PCP and we all had a wonderful time. It was a near perfect vacation! We all loved the rooms, the pools and the beach. The food and drinks were delicious. We had the VIP package and we all felt we got our moneys worth. The massages were great. It was my 9th visit to the DR and I would rate the PCP as one of my very favorites. I loved the size of the resort and the bonus of having the use of the 2 resorts next door- they really did a great job with the layout. The employees were very friendly as usual and the service we received was top notch. I honestly can't find anything to complain about. The PCP is a great value for your vacation dollar and I wouldn't hesitate to return.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great place to stay First off, let me tell you that last year my husband and I stayed at the the Caribe Club Princess which we really liked. We decided we would try the Punta Cana Princess (PCP) this time since it is a much newer property (just over a year old) and you still have full access to the Caribe. We loved the PCP because it was much smaller so you could get to everything you wanted quickly. The food options at the Caribe are better but again, you still have full access to them at PCP. Check-in was quick and our room was great. Very big, clean and a great view. The buffets had a huge selection. The omelettes made to your order were delicious. We loved the smoothie bar at breakfast (banana, watermelon, pineapple, etc.) We also loved the grilled items at lunch and the pasta bar. For dinner we have eaten at almost all of the a la carte restaurants between the two properties and here is our review of them.PCPThe Italian restaurant is very good.The Tex-mex restaurant is okay. I didn't enjoy the beef but that is just because the beef there is different than US beef. If I had ordered something else I might have liked it.The Mediterrean restaurant was also okay. My meal was much better than my husbands. He felt like the seafood on his plate had been frozen and wasn't fresh like you would hope.CCPThe seafood restaurant was our favorite. The lobster is excellent.The Italian restaurant is great. Probably better than the one at PCP.The Brazilian restaurant is also very good. You get to try many different meats so it was pretty neat. I was very stuffed by the time dinner was over.The mexican restaurant was okay. We ate there last year and can't remember much other than we decided to leave it off the list this year.LaCava - steak restaurant is very good. I got lobster there and it was excellent.The crepe place is also very good. The Domincan restaurant was okay. My husband ate goat for some crazy reason and it messed with his stomach.The Chinese restaurant is probably the only one we never tried.The buffets at both places are very good. We would eat late and usually stop by the buffet before dinner to see if there were any items we wanted to try as an appetizer. There usually were. I'm sure some people won't be happy with the food but we enjoyed it. There was such a huge selection that it would be hard not to find something you liked,The property at the PCP is so clean. They are constantly cleaning things. The grounds are pretty but the Caribe's grounds are spectacular. Since the PCP is so new, the trees and landscaping aren't as mature as the Caribes. The entertainment is pretty good and the animation team does a good job at trying to get people involved and have fun.The staff was so friendly. We enjoyed getting to know several staff members and would look for them throughout the day to cut up with. The PCP did have beach service for drinks. They didn't have that at the Caribe last year so that was pretty good to have. We also tipped throughout the week. If we had good service or really liked a worker, we would give them a tip. The beach in Punta Cana is probably the most beautiful beach I have ever seen. Definitely wear lots of sunscreen because the sun is strong.When we go back we may stay at the PCP again or may venture off and try someone else but I would definitely recommend the Princess hotels in Punta Cana to everyone.  
<Date>Apr 22, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Disappointed Room was good. we did run out of hot water one night. Plenty of food but not very good. Our friends were given a room in building one and it was NOT acceptable,unclean and damp. They were given another room after putting up a fight.The staff serving food are very good. The beach is great. If you go to the shops outside of the resort property be prepared to be mobed by merchants wanting to sell there goods. We did buy some things but you must bargin.DONT pay what they ask,give them 65-75 percent less and if they say no walk away. Be very careful about what you eat and drink. Bring something to clean your hands with. Two in our party of seven got sick. DONT DRINK THE WATER,NOT EVEN TO BRUSH YOUR TEETH. We will be back to the Dominican Republic ,but not to any princess or 4 star resort. 5-6 star only. We were told by other tourst we met that the 5-6 star resorts are MUCH BETTER.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Well worth it Just came back on March 8th from a 2 week stay at the Punta Cana Princess. We loved the resort. The resort is fairly new, so nothing was old which is nice. You have full access to 2 sister properties next door (Caribe Club Princess and Tropical Princess) but they could not come to ours. We went there for the evening entertainment and tried a few restaurants but we preferred the 3 ala carte restaurants at our resort. There is the Italian, Tex Mex Steakhouse and the Mare Nostrum (fish restaurant). The filet mignon was excellent. We enjoyed the food at all 3 and the service also. Alot of attention was paid to you on being served and our wine glass never went empty. The food at the buffet was okay, but we definetly preferred being served on at the ala carte restaurants. We met people from all across Canada and Europe and everyone we talked to really liked the resort. It is a quieter resort but its nice because people are not ontop of you at the beach or around the pool area. Lawn chairs were always available at the beach and pool side no matter what time of day it was. We noticed walking along the beach, how at many of the resorts people were sunbathing and everyone seemed so cramped together.The beach is beautiful and such soft golden sand. I have never seen a beach that nice and there always was a breeze so you were never sweating while sunbathing.If you are looking for a quieter resort this one is for you.On the way back on the plane we overheard many people complaining about various things at their resorts. I was sure glad that we had no complaints.I would definetly go back there for the food, the cleanliness and the beach. The staff were also very nice and hardworking.P.S. A tip goes a long way there, so don't forget at the restaurants or at the bars. They really appreciate it.  
<Date>Mar 23, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>If you like food- go somewhere else We stayed at the property in Feb 2005. The hotel itself was fine, the rooms very nice, clean , the common areas always clean also. However, the food was another story. It ranged from revolting to not bad. The buffets that we tried were absolutely awful. One Chinese buffet (the first night) was so awful we couldn't eat much. The next morning at buffet breakfast it was equally as bad--cut up hotdogs with ketchup was not too exciting. The fruit was not the greatest and the coffee was Nescafe. We had stayed at the Riu up the beach last time and the food was exceptional and the coffee was fabulous. You might ask why we stayed here this time, a neighbour who is a foodie stayed here when it opened and stated the food was fantastic, it was worth a try , we thought. We approached each meal with wonder- wonder what this will be like. Their Tex-Mex restaurant was fairly good. Their Mare Nostrum (seafood) was acceptable, so we stuck to these. We had heard from others that their Domincan buffet was dreadful as was a couple of the other places at the Tropical next door.The bartenders tended to ignore you quite regularly in favour of those who were Spanish speaking or those, as we discovered, who had tipped them regularly. One bartender tried to sell me marijuana, maybe this is not a bad thing if you want this but being a total non smoker and adverse to drugs on the whole, I was not impressed.The wait staff in the restaurants we attended were extremely nice I must say.The beach and weather , of course, were wonderful. In spite of our misgivings about the food we had a pleasant enough stay. I would, however, never recommend anyone to stay there.They claimed this was a 5 star, I don't think so.Next time, back to a Riu.  
<Date>Mar 17, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Amazing My name is David, Im from Spain and I Just returned from a week long stay at the Punta Cana Princesa with my 8 companions of university (7 girls and 1 guy); We stayed at the Punta Cana Princess February 22 to March 2, 2005. The resort is wonderfoul, its a small resort, there is always a chair at the pool or beach, the buffet is never too crowded and not much of a wait at the bar! But if nightlife is important the Areito Disco its in the next door Princess Resort with free transport or only 10 minutes walking over a beautiful manglar, the disco its open to the first hours of the morning and in it there are a good dominican people. The service in the Hotel are the best, smiling all the time, I speak Spanish and it is an advantage but if you dont speak Spanish dont worry they speak English too (like me hahaha..) The rooms are plenty of space and they were so clean all the time, the king size beds are so commodes?the Beach (Playa Bavaro) are so clean, deep and light blue all the day with her white sand?the animation staff its the very best with her aqua-aerobic in the beach or pool, bachata-merengue-salsa dance lessons, stretching and more. The food buffets were great, they had different themes, with a lot of cakes, ice creams, fruis, natural juices? We were to the restaurants (3 in our resort 9 in the next door) two times in our resort: Italian, Tex mex and Mare Nostrum?the food and the service excellent.P.D.: My e-mail its speedy.one50@gmail.com and ------- if you were during February 22 to March 2, 2005 please write me, we have too many photos and videos and things that to say, and I need to practise me English, specially I remember I girl (she speaks in French and I don know his nameaybe TEFFANI?aybe from Canada??please write me!) <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>very good holiday just got back from the punta cana princess feb 22 after one week of avarage weather this resort has everything you need and more.arrival front desk check in was smooth we had the vip package which is a big plus for the extra money . rooms very large and clean ask for rooms closer to the ocean if possible if not they have a good transportation system to get you around the resort .meals were very good in all the restaurants they all have a different variety of food .make reservations well in advance you can book upto four days in advance at the vip center near main pool .beach was very nice you can walk for mile in each direction very clean had no problen geting lounge chairs .service was very good with no problem with anything the people would try to do anything for you . we had them singing a dancing . tips will help not alot but a couple of bucks here and there go along way . edwardo at the beach restaurant was alot of fun rosita in the restaurant alot of fun .they all would try and help you have a great time.entertainment was done very professional dont miss the lion king if still there . casino just at the end of the drive to hotel 2 minute walk they will shuttle you back to you room at night.suggestions . if vip go to vip center as soon as you find your room to make reservations a restaurants and information on what is available to you .if you want to go deepsea fishing make sure it is calm and you see the boats .we went and the waves were very big the boat was a mess washrooms disgusting not usable . it was not fun at all we came back after 3hrs instead of the full 4hrs.have a great trip if you have any guestions email me at kevin.huskie@mts.net  
<Date>Feb 24, 2005

<Author>BeachBirthday
<Content>Run don't walk to book the Princess My husband and I were at the Punta Cana Princess from Feb 12 to 19. Really just got back. It was fantastic! The front desk staff Diana, Karen and the rest were helpful, pleasant and fully bilingual (Spanish/English). Any problems with your room go see them. Our shower was blocked and not running properly, it was fixed within the hour of our telling them about it.The food, oh my! My mouth still waters when I think about it. The buffet was nice, lots of choices. The a la carte restaurants, of which you have 6 to choose from, at least the ones we ate at, were great. The Rio Grande is the tex/mex, the filet mignon was done to perfection each time we ate it. The Brazilian restaurant, over at the Caribe Princess, was very nice. The salads were a buffet and then the meat and fish (six different kinds) are served right off the skewers. Very nice flavours. La Cava (extra$$, 25 per person) was worth it. The carpaccio melted on my tongue. My husband's t-bone took up the whole plate. It is a meal that in Montreal would have set us back $150 or more. The house wine is a Spanish wine, very palatable. The bar staff were all wonderful, especially Julio, the head bartender. Remember to ask for the Pina Colada's con Rhum otherwise......no rhum.As to the language issue, try, learn a few phrases before you leave. As long as you try they will try. Smiling and being polite goes a long way.The only difficulty we had was with the tour operator, Sunquest Vacations. Their representative at the hotel was more concerned with selling excursions than helping us solve our VIP booking problem (not the hotel's fault). We will have to think twice about using them again.I would go back in an instant. Next year's vacation will be two weeks, hopefully at the Punta Cana Princess.Enjoy!  
<Date>Feb 23, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Wonderful time I can not believe some of these reviews I have read. My husband and I got married at the Punta Cana Princess on August 17, 2004. We stayed there from August 14-21 with 12 of our members of our family and friends. It was absolutely wonderful! The best vacation I have ever had! The wedding coordinator Gabriel was very helpful. He took care of everything for our wedding...it was so beautiful and completely stress free. Our wedding was right on the beach. We could not have had a better location!  We had a few small problems with the service but there is a slight language barrier. It's a foreign country with their own language....be patient with them. We found that if you are friendly and try to speak a little of their language they are very helpful. A few of our people got sick. Once again, you are in another country. Be careful what you eat and drink lots of water. Take some ammodium just in case.  The resort itself is absolutely beautiful. Nice, spacious rooms with frequent maid service. The landscaping is gorgeous. You have to give these people credit. It is very hot under that sun and they work VERY hard to make it beautiful inside and out for their guests. Showing genuine appreciation goes a long way with them. The animation crew and bartenders were great! Nelson, Ariel, and Mercedes were a lot of fun and tried their best to make sure we had fun. Some of the food wasn't what we were used to but once again, it is a foreign country! Be careful and you should be ok! The a la carte restaraunts were very good...with excellent service.  Overall, we had a great time. We will definately return, hopefully for our one year anniversary! Aside from a few small problems, that occur during most vacations, our trip was wonderful and memorable. It was adventurous at times, yet while on the white sands of their beach it was also so relaxing. It is worth the trip!  
<Date>Feb 8, 2005

<Author>ChaCha6095
<Content>A great dissapointment!!!! My family(husband and two kids aged 13 and 11) went to the PCP from Dec 24 to Jan 8.We are very easy going people and do not get upset about alot but in one word this resort was HORRIBLE!!!We travel each year at the same time so the fact that it was Christmas and busier did not influence our opinion.The food was really bad. The first 3 days we had to fight flies and eat food that the flies were crawling in. After a few days the wind picked up and it settled down. The quality of the food was really poor but we found the a la carte restraunts a bit better.Both my husband and younger daughter were quite sick for a few days.As a previous post mentioned we did not get all of the services we were supposed to be offered and it seemed that you had to work to get anything. Our rooms were a very nice size and were clean on our arrival but the maid service in our room was really bad but we didn't worry too much about that.We called the front desk one evening after one of the pop bottles in our room fell out of the fridge as we opened the door. It hit the tile and glass flew everywhere. My daughter and I were both cut in several spots and there was glass everywhere. We needed someone to bring cleaning tools up to clean up the glass. After the 4th time of being hung up on by front desk my hubby went on a hunt for mops and brooms himself.My daughter left her shoes and shirt by the pool one afternoon(totally our fault) and it took 4 days and about 8 trips to the front desk before they would take me to the lost and found. They kept just saying we'll call your room if anything shows up but I was a bit skeptical because they did not even ask me what they looked like. On the last request I was a little firm and asked to be taken to the lost and found. After waiting at the front desk for almost one hour someone showed up and we walked about 200 feet to the lost and found room!!!! Well, my daughters stuff was right on the table. If it had dissapeared I would have totally understood since it was my daughter's fault for leaving it there but why did we have to try so hard just to see the lost and found. On our second week it took three days of asking to get our VIP massage tickets- they just kept saying that they would bring them up to our room but never did.The service at this resort was very poor overall.We have been to the Mayan Riviera and Hawaii and absolutley had wonderful trips!!! This time around at the PCP we were soooo glad to go home. We spoke to many, many families who shared our view. I am not sure why the big difference in the reviews posted but I would definitley not go to this resort.I will say that the Bavaro Runners tour was an absolute blast and well worth the money.We also parasialed at the resort and it was a great experience. Our friends stayed at the Iberostar Punta Cana in November and they said it was quite good.  
<Date>Feb 1, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Is this the same Punta Cana Princess? Just returned from PCP on Jan 30.We also had the VIP Package.I'm not sure what happened to the previous reviewer but we found the resort to be excellent.(except the weather, but we can't blame anyone for that.Can we?) We had premium liquor(try asking),beach service was fantastic and available every day, turn down every night,massages,beach towels ON ARRIVAL as the brochure states,(not every day),excellent rooms stocked daily..........The resort is very quiet. A short ride over to Caribe,which we had full access to, brings with it the theater, disco and of course more people. If you like a bit of action it's available but nice to stick around and enjoy the relaxation. The food was excellent and included the usual all inclusive assortment. And if you looked at the fresh fruit juice bar you'll find at least 6 different fresh juice jugs made every morning,including orange at least 3 days. The Tex-Mex was an excellent meal and for VIP a gourmet meal was included.We chose La Cava at Caribe and went away stunned by the great service and meal. The presentation rivaled any 5 star in North America.(A member of our party is a chef!)The staff were fantastic. Try a little Spanish (although English is common with staff)and treat them with a bit of respect and they are truly wonderful people. A couple bucks here and there also goes a long way. We heard of no-one being ill but it can happen anywhere. We have been to theDR 5 times to different reorts and the Punta Cana Princess is up with the best. If you prefer small, quiet and friendly resorts, go for it.  
<Date>Jan 31, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not a 5 star rating! I was at the resort January 1st to 8th. The food was always cold or salty. When you expect fresh orange juice and instead you get TANG...you know something is not right with the place.There was no entertainment for adults...you had to go to the next resort for that. The only entertainment for kids was 'mini disco' at 8:30 pm every night...for 15 minutes....thats it folks!!The resort itself is nice, the rooms are clean, and the staff are helpful, if sometimes they don't understand you.but all in all....I will not go here if I were you.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not a Five Star 11 of us travelled to the Punta Cana Princess for 14 days over the Christmas and New Years holidays. Not only were 4 of our travellers extremely ill with vomitting @ diaherria, we had to have the doctor visit with needles and pills. They were all extremely ill for 3 days, at first we thought that they had contracted food posioning but later found out that it was a virus that was travelling the island similar to Norwalk. My son is still not feeling well after being home for almost 10 days and will see our family physician again this week, he is still suffering from bad stomach cramps and diaherria. We also had one of our travellers get a serious cut to his leg and he needed stitches, we called the front desk of the resort 4 times and yet could not get any help. We carried him to the doctor's office ourselves where he had his leg stitched, somehow I thought that this would have been an important issue and perhaps help would have been available. If you were travelling on your own this could have been a potentially dangerous situation. Aside from all of this we all had VIP packages, it was impossible to get Premium Brand Liquor, no nightly turn down service, all motorized sports were unavailable to us as the boats were out of service. We did not have daily beach towels in our rooms, there was no disco on the resort for the young adults and there was no nightly entertainment. The food was definetley not that of 5 star quality although the buffet was clean, the selection was very limited. There is no butler service to the beach for drinks and I beleive that the VIP package was just a joke. When booking my sons massages I was told that he had already used them! What a surprize that was, to refrain from arguing I just gave him mine. Aside from this the resort was quiet and the sun was great. We have travelled to other resorts in the Dominican previously and would tell others to shop around!  
<Date>Jan 18, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great little private resort Just got back from the Punta Cana Princess on January 15. All in all this was a great resort. It is small, you never wait in any line ups, there were tons of beach chairs. The resort is very clean as are your rooms. One word of advise, if you don't like bugs and crawlers ask for the 2nd or 3rd floor. We were on the ground floor and a lot of bugs climbed in, not a big deal.The Beach is beautiful, the water is warm. We were there December 31 to January 14 and there was a lot of seaweed in the water, but we did not care. The pool is great. The animation team was fabulous as was the kids club.We did venture to the Caribe for mini golf. Tried the mexican restaurant at the Caribe, I got food poisoning, never puked so much in my life!! We gave the Caribe one more chance and tried the buffet, the resort is so huge you had to stand in line for food for 20 - 30 minutes (pasta). After that we stuck with the Punta Cana Princess, the buffet was always great and the specialty restaurants were wonderful as well.The only negatives were the first day our room was cleaned and we came back my brand new bottle of beautiful perfume was gone. I reported it but nothing was ever done. Lesson learned lock whatever you can in the safe! Also the wind was bad, I knew it would be windy but not like that, we could not lay on the beach as the sand just blew in your eyes and everywhere. Other than that great trip, I recommend the Punta Cana Princess if you want, little action, quiet, and no line ups.  
<Date>Jan 17, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>small, compact, with all the features It been a year since we have been to the PC Princess, Jan 2004. At that time we looked for reviews to help with our choice. It was a 50/50 split between good and bad. Most of the bad reviews were results of bad weather, language ect. The staff did their best to communicate, and we enjoyed learning from each other. Many of them know a few languages; maybe we should do the same?The bus trip was short (20min), nothing worse then spending the early morning in the airport, the rest of the morning in the air, picking up your luggage, walking into the sunshine and warm weather, then jumping on a bus for another 2 hours, only to get to your resort in the late afternoon. You can buy a nice cold beer at the airport and bring it on the bus, and sometime there may be someone selling by the buses. You can bring them on the bus and start your vacation relaxed.Upon arrival, check in was quick and easy. We were given our keys and off we went. The room was exquisite, king size bed, sunk in living room, balcony and nice size bathroom. We had noticed water on the floor of the bathroom and living room, we called and a short time later all was clean up. The room came with a coffee maker and mini fridge, great for coming off the beach for a late afternoon/before dinner cocktails or special coffee. We were on the beach by 1:30pm!The resort itself is not large, however that a plus for 2 reasons, 1 - quick dependable service everywhere, 2 - no crowds. The resort has 2 or 3 sister resorts, all within a short walk or golf cart bus ride. Eating, drinking and entertainment is included and at that time, we at the princess could go there but there patrons could not come to our resort.The food, not 5* and not a great selection, however what was there was tasty and in abundance. The buffet was clean and the staff was always pleasant and eager to please. They even came to know us by name, where we like to sit and in the morning, coffee the way we liked it.For quality, we rank this up with our visit to sandals in Jamaica. The beach and the sun are 5*+++ and thats what we went for.Like any trip, have an open mind, enjoy the different culture and smile, its catchy.  
<Date>Jan 13, 2005

<Author>JGL37
<Content>Very nice place My husband and I (in our 40s) and our 12 year old just got back from a week at the Punta Cana Princess Hotel. They rate themselves a 4 + and I would agree with the 4 but maybe not the + part. We had a wonderful time and would return, if there weren't so many other places we would like to try.The hotel is relatively new and so the folliage will need to grow in somewhat, but that isn't a criticism, just a fact. The rooms are great, with a sunken living room area with a huge day bed and a trundle bed under it. Lots of hot water, double sink in the bathroom, lots of towels, hair blower and shampoo etc. The mini bar has Pepsi, 7Up and beer and was restocked daily. I did have a problem getting some Diet stuff in the room, but not at any of the bars - by the way, it's called Pepsi Light, but given the accent, it sounds more like Pesi Lie! Facilities are very very clean and everyone is very friendly. Front desk staff and Guest Services staff speak very good English and although some had less English than others, between my Spanish and their English, communication was never ever an issue.This is not the place if you are looking for much night life or swinging singles but the Caribe is next door. However, it's perfect if you want some serious R and R. There is only one pool, although it's very big, with swim up bar, volleyball net etc. There are two or three areas there you can just walk in, or the kids can sit and play. The mini club seemed good but we didn't have any need for it, so I can only tell you what I thought. The animation staff is very nice, but they are lacking some experience. I also found that if you weren't on the beach (where the animation staff is), you could easily miss out on activities as they didn't always come through the pool area and if they did, it was rather subdued. There was the usual dance classes, Spanish lessons, volleyball etc.There are two good a la cartes restaurants one TexMex, one Italian. We tried both and liked both. The buffet restaurant is a nice open airy place with lots of room and a nice variety of food - although a word of advice - don't try and sample everything cuz by the end of the week you will be bored. Be selective. If you feel like fish, have fish, but not the fish, and the beef, and some chicken with a side of pasta - Breakfasts: they have the usual hot dishes, but they also have a smoothy bar, chose your mix of fruits and they will make it for you. They also have an omelette station.Lunch/Diners: they have themed nights like Dominican, Chinese etc. They also have a carvery for the carnivores (my husband became very good friend with the staff at that station!). They also have a pasta bar with 4 different types of pasta, 3 types of sauces and a whole bunch of stuff to chose from, anything from smoked salmon (not always) to capers and onions and peppers and ham etc.By the beach they have a smaller place with pretty well runs 24 hours a day. You can almost always get pizza, fries etc, and it has bar as well.Bars: in the lobby (nice place to sit around talking or playing cards), in the restaurants of course, at the place near the beach and one ON the beach as well. We were there over the New Year and on the morning of January 1st, they had drapped the beach bar as a first aid station - it was very funny.our 12 year old was usually the first in the pool around 9am and you never had problems finding beach chairs, either by the pool or on the beach.The staff is extremely friendly, the place is very very clean, the beach is great, the drinks were cold, what else could you ask for.  
<Date>Jan 6, 2005

<Author>Deni
<Content>Loved the place...Can't wait to go back We are a family of five ( 3 teenagers) and just returned from a week in paradise. The kids had a great time meeting other kids from all over, as well as bonding with the friendly staff. We were there from December 17 to 24th. It was definately a hard place to leave.On our arrival we were greated by the reservation staff and had an quick check in. Our luggage was immediately taken to our room. We arrived late Friday night so we took sometime to wander down to the beach and have a swim.Our rooms were adjoining and were very clean and bright. In this resort the nice thing is that it is quite small so from anywhere you had a short distance to walk to eat, go to the pool, or to the beach. My husband's brother stayed at a much larger resort down the beach and had at least a 20 minute walk to the beach from their room. The maid kept the rooms very clean and she appreciated the gifts and money we left for her. The mini bar was always stocked and fresh towels daily. The staff was phenomenal everywhere we went. From the lobby staff, to the restaurants, pool bar and animation. We got to know the staff very well and formed great friendships. The kids enjoyed the animation staff and the daily activities offered. There was always something to do. Even though there is the language barrier it helps to practice your spanish and try to use the common phrases and their staff also tries very hard to speak english. The beach a grounds were kept impreccable. Every morning the place looked like it had never been touched the day before. The beach was beautiful. There was never a problem getting a lounge chair either on the beach or by the pool. It didn't seem to matter what time you went. The pool bar was very entertaining and always had people visiting from all around the world. The restaurants: We ate at them all. We enjoyed the Tex Mex and the Italian. The meals were very good. We also ate at each of the buffets and there was always lots to choose from. I must admit that after awhile the food tended to taste the same. Unfortunately each of us got sick at one time or another. I happened to get sick after I ate at the buffet at the sister resort (Caribe). My three kids and I got sick for about a day, however my husband was sick for about three days. We are usure of from what, but he sure didn't feel well and had a terrible flight home. It has left a sour taste in his mouth even though he loved the place. The staff at all the eating establishments were fantastic at the PCP. The Caribe Princess next door is much larger and we didn't experience the same friendliness from that staff, although it too is a beautiful resort.The Bavaro Runner: we chose to go on only one excursion and we were very happy in this selection. We had a blast and ended up with a great group of people. I would highly recommend this excursion.The market: make sure you barter with the people. They will lower their prices. My kids were able to get some great souvenirs. My kids can't wait to go back....We loved it. If you need anymore information please do not hesitate to contact me. scotdeni@yt.sympatico.caPS Make sure to take a lot of american $1.00 bills for tipping. A dollar goes along way for these very hard working people.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Everything was perfect at the punta cana princess My girlfriend and myself went to the PC princess Dec 19-23 and had a wonderful vacation. Check in was a breeze, we got there around 5pm and went straight to our room. They transported us by golf cart. The VIP package is worth the extra money. We got a great room on the third floor by the pool. Room was clean and the maids did a great job of cleaning. We always had clean towels. The food was much better than the Catalonia Bavaro Resort that I stayed at last year. The TexMex restaurant was great get the filet. With the VIP package we decided to dine at the seafood restaurant and it was also excellent. I had the lobster and it was really good. The pool and the ocean are amazing. We had a great time lounging by both. The PC princess was really laid back and definitely for couples. the other princess resorts were where a lot of the night life and activities were held which was within walking distance. The staff was great, we don't speak spanish except for the basics and they went out of their way to try to speak to us in english and make small talk. Hector at the beach buffet was really professional and kind. Last year I was ate alive by mosquitoes at the Catalonia, this year I had bugspray with me and I never had to use it. Don't spend too much time worrying about the malaria. Sometimes things just get blown way out of proportion. Not worth going to a doctor and spending hundreds of dollars for medication. Be more frightened of the airplane ride there if you go through US Airways. The massage package is really great. We upgraded to the 55 minute massage and it was well worth it. There is no longer horseback riding. The half day trip called the Marinarium is well worth the $72/person. We swam in the shark/ray enclosure and should have some really great pictures. The staff there is also great and we always had drinks. Capt Cooks is the best place ever to get seafood. Go during lunch and eat outside on the picnic tables. In closing, Punta Cana is a wonderful place. The Punta Cana Princess was VIP all the way and well worth it. Don't drink too much, don't eat too many strange things you're not use to. Brings some $1 bills for tips and bartering. My girlfriend and I agree, we will be back for a honeymoon hopefully sometime soon in the future.  
<Date>Dec 26, 2004

<Author>WindsorTraveller
<Content>Good Value, Good Vacation Stayed at the Punta Cana Princess from Dec 5 to Dec 12, 2004. Great weather, great beach. This is certainly a four star resort, given that it is a smaller resort than the Tropical Princess and the Caribe Princess which are both next door. You can eat or participate at all three resorts if you want to.The food was excellent for a Carribean resort, and this is our seventh trip to the Carribean. The Tex-Mex steak house did a fine job on beef or chicken, and the Italian restaurant at the Punta Cana Princess was excellent, far better than the Italian restaurant at the Caribe Princess. The buffet had a different theme every night, and if you didn't like the night's theme then you could take a five minute walk next door to the Caribe Princess and sample their buffet, which was larger because the resort is larger. No premium booze unless you paid extra, but the Spanish wine was better than passable, and who needs a lot of premium brands when you can sample the local rums and liquers for comparison. Nice rooms, average maid service, the front desk could not change a US20 into smaller bills to use for tips, so I didn't tip for the first few days. Finally got them to change US$ into Dominican pesos, and spread a few of them around, but it didn't seem to make much difference, the service was average if you tipped or not.We read about the malaria scare before we left, and found out it was not people at the Princess resorts who had contracted it, so we went with some heavy-duty deet stuff just in case. Never saw a mosquito all the time we were there. We will be going back for sure.  
<Date>Dec 16, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>misconceived notions We were given definate misconceptions. When we booked our package we were offered horse back riding. when we arrived horse back riding was no longer an option. as compensation for no horse back riding we were offered 24 hour room service and 2 hour internet service. our stay was only four days and the room service was of no use and I for 5 minutes of internet time that i used i was charged 1hour. i think the compensation should have been something a little more useful. some of the restaurants menu choices did not equal the offered choices when we were served.I think that the personel was wonderful but the hotel should be moe accomodating for people with a shorter stay and update their promotions on a regular basis.

<Author>CDN_traveler
<Content>A little piece of Heaven Hola! I just returned from a wonderful week at the Punta Cana Princess (Oct 29- Nov 4). I honestly was concerned about being moved from the Tropical Princess to its sister, the PCP, but once there, all concerns flew right out the window. The Resort: Magnificant! The staff work very hard to keep the resort clean and the grounds are very well kept. The overall landscaping is very nice- you really feel like you are in paradise! Although the resort is fairly large, everything is within walking distance- no need to take trams anywhere other than to the sister resorts (Tropical and Caribe). The rooms: We thought the room was very clean and updated (new resort after all). The maids did a great job of tiding up and making sure the fridge was fully stocked with bottled water, beer and pop, as well as giving us fresh towels everyday. There is air conditioning, so you can always have a good sleep. There were fresh flowers daily, which really added to the decor.The food: There were 2 breakfast and lunch buffets, and both served good food, and offered many different options. They tried very hard to be as western as possible, but of course it still has a taste of its own. There are 3 different a la cartes at the PCP and 3 at the Tropical Princess. We never went to any at the Caribe. Of all the a la cartes, we tried the Italian, the Tex mex and the Mexican (at the Tropical). My favorite was the Italian restaurant. I had a shrimp dish that was by far the best thing I ate all week! And comparable to some of the best meals I have ever eaten! Over all, the food is deffinetly edible and you have alot of selection, so Im sure everyone can find somthing they like.The pool and beach: Both outstanding. When you think of a tropical paradise- the crystal blue/green waters and the white sand beaches, this is exactly what you get here! The beach was very clean and had hundreds of louge chairs and grass hut coverings, and it was never a struggle to find the perfect lounging spot. No need to wake up at the crack of dawn to get one! The ocean was very warm and the little waves made swimming in it alot of fun. Too bad the waves were not larger for boogie boarding! The Pool was huge! They have just one pool but the size makes up for it. The pool also hosts a swim up bar with the funniest staff (Nelson Gasoline!). It also has pool volleyball, basketball and water polo nets. Again, many lounge chairs and not once a struggle to find a seat.I would highly recomend this resort as it truly is a piece of heaven on earth. You cant ask for a more picturesque tropical paradise. The staff are very friendly and work very hard to ensure you are well taken care of. Lastly, some words of advice. It is much appreciated by the staff if you make an effort to speak a little spanish. Just the basics is enough, and overall it is very helpful. Be prepared in terms of stomach medications- pepto, immodium, etc. If you plan to do some shopping, american currency is best. You seem to get better deals and it is much easier to barder when you dont have to be doing the coversion. I found that doing the shopping on the beach was far better than at the plaza because it was kinda scary with the pressure of the store owners at the plaza than at the beach. In fact, when my friend was about to pay for an item , the store owner tried to get his fingers (literally) on some more money right out of her wallet. Not the best experience with the dominicans at the plaza! Be very careful when it comes to cigar purchases. I recommend buying them from the resort directly. I dont smoke myself, but wanted to bring some home for friends and family that do, so I bought some Cubans from a beach vendor, but later found out the cigars I bought were rolled up banana leaves. I noticed after that, that 99% of the vendors, both at the plaza and the beach sold fakes- so BEWARE! Also, when it comes to shopping, dont be afraid to haggle. I was suprised that thing were much more expensive than I anticipated, so its best to shop around and get a good idea of what you can get items for. Try some of the excursions if you can- they are well worth it. We did Bavaro Runners and Trackers as well as Marinarium. All were great in there own way. Best piece of advice: Go with an open mind and remember its your vacation, so dont let the little things ruin your few days in paradise.  
<Date>Nov 9, 2004

<Author>bobclark
<Content>Great Time!!!!!!!! Got back yesterday Oct 30.Well, I read all the reviews, and was quite worried about our trip. My advice to you is to read the reviews for amusement purposes only. Judge the resort for yourself, once you get there!It is beautiful!! The beach is great, the sand is soft, the drinks are plentiful, and the staff are great! There are a few who speak ok english, and some who don't speak english at all, but I don't speak any spanish, so who am I to complain. Oh ya the pool is also fantastic, Nelson and Martin are a lot of fun at the pool bar, You will laugh all day long with them. Try and get them to have a few drinks with you, but make sure your discrete about it, so as not get them in trouble. The food was edible, It's not Canadian though. The a la cartes were great. I don't know how people can complain about the service, These people get 3 days off a month, so sure they might have a bad day every once in a while, and if your rude to them on their bad day, then they'll remember you and you won't get great service, and I would be the same if I were them. A 1 dollar tip every few drinks will go a long way. People complain about flies, while eating, lol!!! The buffets are outdoors, what do you expect. Have these complainers never had a barbecue in their back yard? or never gone camping? Give me a break! Bugs in the rooms, again lol! Have you ever had flies, ants, spiders, mosquitoes in your house? some people just live to complain. And all the people who say they got sick, we never got sick, but did have an upset stomach a couple of times. The people who got sick, did they drink tap water? were they in the sun too long, and got sunstroke, but blamed it on the food?, did they drink too much? did they drink to many sweet drinks (bahama mama, pina colada) which are laxitives, because of the coconut? Did they eat too much greasy food? you get the point, people can be sick for various reasons, but they all choose to blame the food.My advice to you, bring lots of sunscreen, drink plenty of bottled water, don't read the reviews and believe them, judge it for yourself, and have fun.contact me if you like.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Relaxing honeymoon with pros and cons We just returned from our two week honeymoon at the Punta Cana Princess. I was disappointed as we were supposed to stay at the Bavaro Princess but were moved over due to hurricane damage. The Bavaro looks much bigger with a nicer beach and higher rating but the Punta Cana Princess was still very nice. We were VIPs, which is worth it I must add, so we had our own desks and staff who would help us book dinners etc... The massages that we received were excellent and the spa itself was beautiful and calming, with the best English spoken out of the whole resort. We were in the 5000 building, which is closest to the ocean and had a great view of everything from the top floor (3rd). Maid service was consistent and they have no problems adding 7-up or whatever you want more of. Do tip them though as they don't make much and they are thorough (we were in the room a few times when they cleaned). Lots of closet space and drawers in the room and the air conditioning worked very well. I saw some tiny tiny ants on the bathroom floor once but that was it plus what do you expect? Once you see outside the resort and what they live in, you will be happy with the great accomodations we get! To see the countryside we recommend the Bavaro Runners excursion. It's $75 US and worth it. You get a real taste of the Dominican life and it really humbles you a bit, yet isn't totally depressing. The only other excursion we went on was Manati Park where we swam with the dolphins, which we enjoyed.Beautiful beach and clear warm water was the highlight. Some other resorts had more seaweed but the sand is soft and white-you can't beat it! Take a walk both ways as it's neat to see the other resorts and there is some shopping on the left side of the beach from the resort. We found that the best deals are on excursions and Bavaro Plaza (short taxi ride from resort). The Plaza had lots of stores and a bank which we recommend getting your pesos from instead as the rate was way better than the resort, which was strange. Note: there is also an actual bank, not just a machine (which was not working by the way at our resort) right next door to the left at the LTI resort with, again, better rates.Unfortunately I have to be honest about the biggest disappointment, the food. We were OK for the first 4 or 5 days but heard that lots of people did get sick quite bad. The food didn't taste too bad and they did have lots of selection, even having a theme in the buffets some days but we figure because the resort was full and they weren't totally prepared from the hurricane, this is why the food became a problem. We had to stick to buns and pasta for the last week as we decided to stay away from the meat, which seemed to help. We didn't get cramps, only your typical stomach-ache and diarrhea. It's hard to pin-point but I really don't think this is typical of the resort and wouldn't suggest basing your decision on this info. It's a lot for our bodies to adjust too with the heat, humidity, different food etc... so keep an open mind and don't expect the worse! The a la cartes are great, the service can be good and bad (just like home though) but there's a few different choices:Italian, steakhouse, Chinese, gourmet, Mexican. Try as many as you can (some are in the next resorts over).All-in-all we did have a great time and it really does depend on your attitude. We saw some people who just seemed determined to be unhappy and complainers and it looks bad and doesn't make the workers there feel very good. They do everything they can to help and don't deserve some crabby tourist yelling in their face, especially after they just went through one of the scariest natural disasters!Have fun, enjoy and relax-that's what it is all about. If you want more entertainment I would suggest another resort as this one is meant to be quieter and relaxing.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Mixed feelings... NOT like last year Hi there...This is my second posting, my previous one was for the Princess resort, which is next door.Now bear in mind that my review will be as objective as possible considering we've experienced a great week last year and a not-so-great one this year. My review is objective in the sense that i will compare last year's experience with this present year but with the special circumstances that affected this year's trip, they are:Hurricane Jeanne:Jeanne threw a fit around Punta Cana, by talking with the local people outside of the resort and keeping in mind the exchange rate and the prices of various essential commodities; Jeanne did a lot of damage to the infrastructures (roofs and some buildings) since they are not adapted to the hurricane-force winds. Some resorts were closed and their booked clients were relocated to open resorts, causing congestion of the equipment, workforce and hotel infrastructures. Bottom-line: The hurricane did a lot of damage; hotels, resorts and tour operators underestimated the damage; sent their clinets to open resorts as to minimize financial loses but these resorts had staff only for their low-season period. Some staff membres were just transplanted from other (closed) resorts and had no idea of the policies and procedures of their employers resulting in a lot of eroneous information to customers.Sickness:Upon departure for the resort, out tour operator representative informed us that more than half of the clients staying at our resort have been sick during the saty and that this did not occur in any other resort in Punta Cana during that same period.I myslef was sick for 4 days and took my prescription of Cipro on the 3rd day of sickness because of the gut-wrnching cramps. (note ot all the people who say that bringing Antibiotics is superfluous: I'm NEVER sick during travel and I've experienced pain to incredible levels in my life so i'm not one that complains about belly-aches. I would like to see how you endure these cramps during your holidays).On the first day i got sick i noticed (talking with other guests) that a lot of people were sick too and upon further investigation, the sickness was not related to a specific food or drink. The patern of distribution of the symptoms hinted for a larger, common source. I beleive that the hurricane dammaged the water-treatement plant or infrastructure rendering it less than optimal. It is the only way i can explain wide-ranging contamination.Besides, at 160US$ per patient, the doctor and the hotel made a nice sum treating patients...Okay, these were the subjective aspects of my trip.Service:Service was generally great, people were friendly and always in good spirits and sported the world-famous dominican smirk. Always pleasant!Food:Food was NOT as good as last year, when we were staying at the Princess (next door, same resort). Food was often bland and uninspiring.A La Carte Restaurants:That's where we are not really happy with the resort. Last year we ate at the Mexican and Dominican restaurants at the Caribe Club - Princess resort; these two restaurants were simply GREAT! Now we were supposed to Stay at one, play at three meaning we had access to all the infrastructures at the Caribe Club - Princess resort, (including the restaurants) but since Hurricane Jeanne damaged the resort, we were told:a) the restaurants were not open tonight, but will be opned tomorow, cause it's their day off;b) The restaurants were damaged and were undergonig repair work;c) The restaurants were not open for us, staying at the Punta Cana Princess.On the second-to-last day, we tried to book at the Dominican and were told that we could not for reason (b), but my wife and I took a walk after supper and found not only the restaurant to be opened, but people were eating there... We were NOT amused.For the A La Carte Restaurants that WERE open;The Tex-Mex:Very good steakhouse. Excelent presentation, excelent guy working the grill who knows how to cook a steak on a hot plate (not a BBQ...). Service was prompt and very efficient. Staff friendly and funny. The Local Mariachis were there one night and were EXCELENT, they offer to sing Happy or Love song and have a great repertoire including international spanish classics and the three of them have GREAT voices... very soothing...IL Baccio:Okay, i'm a Italian food connaisseur... Short of being Italian in body, I left my heart and soul in Italy during a short, one-week trip there in 1992... Forza Italia!!!The food was suprisingly excelent, i've had a Carpaccio which was, in all honesty, one of the best ones i've had in my life (And I never miss a chance of having it!!!! - By the way, the best one in Montreal is at La Spagettata on Laurier Street). Pizza (second course) was excellent. Procsiutto was exactly like the one we eat in the old country and NOT like the one we have in North America!I was very impresssed, ate untill i couldnt swallow another piece of food...Bravissimo!Beach:As alway, gorgeous, beautifull and fun. Only problem are the other guests who thrwo their garbage on the beach; some people just dont give a crap about others and think they own the world. And more often than not, they spoke german... funny coincidence? I also did a little investigation: after talking to maintenance, security and service staff, they all told me the same thing about the German lack of respect. Of course the staff cannot comment openly about that because they do not want to loose their job which is to my observation, to pick up after them. But if just for the sake of other customers, they could make an effort to pick up after themselves. I regularly picke up junk burried in the sand (Cigarette botches, empty plastic glasses, cigarette packs, lighters, empty sunscreen bottles.... ugh...Rooms:Equal as last year, always very clean and neat. The maid service was better than last year. We were very pleased.Guest service:They were clearly overworked; these poor guys and girls were just flooded with guest complains concerning some underqualified staff or sickness-related complains. They were nonetheless very pleasant and more often than not, helpfull.Language:I've noticed that this year, most of the staff either spoke French or English; which was helpfull because our spanish is very limited but we nonetheless always made the effort of speaking the whole conversation in Spanish. A lot of the Haitian staffers were of great help since they learn French and English in school...Shopping:ALWAYS NEGOCIATE; as a rule of thumb go for a quarter of what they ask for. if they are difficult, tell them that you are not interested and you'll get your price at the next store anyways. They will telll you that the next guy does not have the same things... (ha ha). So dont be shy to say no, to bargain. (we bought 3 bottles of rum, a nice necklace for 20 US$; they asked for 95 US$ for the 3 bottles at the beginning...)Taxi:Get the hotel to call for a taxi; when the guy arrives, negociate the price BEFORE entering the taxi. To get to the shopping mall DO NOT pay more thank 8$ regardless if it'a a car or van. If the guy does not want to lower the price to a reasonable 6 to 8$ tell him to go back; he'll change idea pretty quick.Again ALWAYS NEGOCIATE before entering the taxi.Tourist Police:DO NOT RELY on these people; one guy begged us for money to pay himself a drink while on the job. The guy was sporking a nice .38 handgun that was unloaded and did not seem to have any ammo on him... As precaution, i would leave my wife and daughter get into the shops and I would wait outside and scan around for some trouble (which NEVER occurs, but i'm the prudent-type). I would also check the vendors to see if they'd try to slip something into my wife's or duaghter's pockets in order to cause a situation that could be solved by blackmail. I kept the girl's backpacks on me and restricted the shopping to the street-side stores, I NEVER GO in the Alleys... I might be paranoid but i'm in another country, i'm a gringo, I have money; you do the math...Last words:In all fairness; eventhough we were sick and a bit dissapointed in comparisson to the previous year's experience, we still had a great time! We enjoyed ourselves. ASK QUESTIONS BEFORE: to your tour operator, if they dont give you answers, turn them down. Be specific (Ex: Is the Kid's club open during our stay, if the answer is positive, ask them if they spoke to a hotle staff.) ALWAYS NOTE the time, date and name of person you're talking to and make a short note on the content of the conversation and validation of the information. Intel gathering depends on clear information. If you are not satisfied or misled, you can fire back with muscle.You can write me if you have other questions...

<Author>Toronto_Gal1009
<Content>Not a 5 star Beautiful resort. We stayed in the 5000 building which was at an excellent location....close to the pool and beach; the rooms are clean and spacious. Our favourite restaurant was the seafood restaurant at the PCP......seafood was very fresh. However, we receive indifferent services from their staff. The service from the a la carte restaurant was excellent. Same cannot be said for the bar in the pool. We went to get drinks and we were told they were closed (before 6pm) and therefore would not serve us. However, when we turned around, the bartender continued serving his other guest who were mainly spanish speaking. Also, one of our excursions got cancelled and we were never notified of it. We waited in the lobby before 7am the day of the excursion for nothing. The concierge said that they try calling our room the day before but no one was there. They left us no message or note.... nothing to notify us. Very disappointing. Not what you would expect from a 5 star resort!  
<Date>Oct 17, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Holiday from Hell The proverbial holiday from hell.What a disaster,problems are too many to go into,however when you see hot dogs,and hamburgers on the buffet at a 5 star hotel,then you know you have a problem. My wife and I are not picky eaters,and have spent 10 years vacationing in Cuba,so we are able to compare the Islands. and their local standards etc. You could not even get fresh orange juice,just coolaid!!No entertainment in the evening,indifferent attitude of many of the staff,even when tipped (there was the odd exception).This resort has a long way to go to live up to its 5 star rating given by Sunquest. My advice would be..really check this over before you commit; we will never go back.My advice in two words.. Don't Go.

<Author>Jamee
<Content>Lovely!!!! My boyfriend and I just came back from a week stay at punta cana princess. We were there from Sept 6th to 13th. If you are looking for a lively loud, crowded resort then this is not the place for you. Stay at the Caribe Club next door. Punta cana Princess was just what I was looking for! a beautiful quiet resort, I went to relax not to party. The service was phenomenal, the beach was gorgeous, rooms were clean and spacious, no bugs! Food was great at Tex Mex and the seafood restaurant, buffet was okay, but we preferred the a la carte restaurants. No evening entertainment at the resort you just to go next door to Caribe club, we saw Lion King at the theatre there and it was great!!As for the excursions we went on Marinarium,(70US pp) where you swim with nurse sharks and sting rays that was alot of fun! and we went on Bavaro Trackers(55USpp) you ride on a dirt bike along the coast and you get to do some horseback riding very adventurous if you like that but remember to bring sunglasses cause the dust gets in your eyes, be prepared to get very dirty.We stayed away from tap water, but we had drinks with ice cubes, which is what got us in the end. All in all Punta Cana is beautiful and we would go back in a heartbeat!!!  
<Date>Sep 19, 2004

<Author>DAJ88
<Content>Relaxing and Beautiful My husband, myself, and a couple of our friends returned from a 7 night stay at the PCP on Spetember 6th. The Resort is Beautiful, we liked that it was smaller then some but still large enough. We had requested a specific room on the 3rd floor in building 4 and it was perfect. The view of the ocean and the pool was great from our room. The specialty restraunts were better than the buffet, we tried all of them. We liked the steak at the Tex Mex and the seafood at the Mediterranean the best. We also ate at the Chinese and the Mexican at the Carib, they were okay but nothing to write home about. Who would expect to go to the Dominican Rep. and eat authentic Chinese and Mexican anyway?The bars were great and we did not receive any watered down drinks. Try the Banana Mama it is great! We spent most of our days around the pool which is lovely. Everyone went out of their way to make our stay a very pleasant one.We went to get some well needed RR and it is the perfect place to get it.Punta Cana is very simular to Playa Del Carmen, the resort layouts are designed alike. The beach at Punta Cana is the best.We would go back!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The Truth About the Punta Cana Princess My husband and I spent a week at the Punta Cana Princess (September 4-11, 2004) for our honeymoon. We were a bit apprehensive at first, after hearing many negative reviews about the place. I travel at least once a month with my job, so I have seen the best of the best when it comes to hotels, resorts  customer service. I have also previously worked in an upper scale restaurant for 8 years as a server, and know what good customer service entails.CHECK INWe arrived at the hotel at 12:00 noon and were standing in the check in line for less than a minute, when we were brought over two tropical slushy drinks during check in. I dont' know how they knew that we were new people to the hotel, as the bellman had previously taken our luggage from us. We were very pleased that they were so prompt. We opted for the VIP package, so we were then immediately taken to a seperate table where we could sit down and check in without having to wait in the line (which was only 2 or three people anyways)Our room was not going to be ready until 3:00, so my husband and I went and ate lunch, walked around a bit, returned only to find our room was ready at 1:45! (Over an hour earlier than anticipated). It may be a good idea to carry some beachwear in a seperate carry on so you can change in the bathroom and go to the beach right away, if you like!ROOMSWe got to our room to find that the bellman had brought our luggage up for us (we didn't have to lug it around), which was very convenient. Our room was on the top floor, so the ceilings were about 22 ft high (making the room seem HUGE!!!), ask for the top floor if you don't mind hearing the rain fall at night, but want a bigger seeming room, and it was very big already. Sunken living room with the TV and mini bar and a day bed (which folds out from underneath to become an extra bed).Very clean, no ants, flys anything like that.FOODWe ate mostly at the buffet restaurant which had PLENTY to choose from. You picky people I can't believe you can't find anything to eat here. They have made to order pasta  omelettes, plenty of chicken, fish, beef, cereals, breads, potatotes, nachos, rice, desserts, soups etc, no what is there not to like?We also ate as part of our VIP package at Le Cava restaurant and had the grilled lobster which was FABULOUS!!!! I don't know why you people say it doesn't taste like the lobster at home, of course it doesn't, it tastes way better! Fresh from the Carribbean Sea.The servers are PHENOMENAL. Never have an empty glass, or lack anything. They gio ABOVE AND BEYOND for you and love what they do, even though they only make about $50 US per week. We enjoyed tipping the waiters $1-$3 US dollars at a time. One night we even gave one of the waiters $20 bill because we enjoy giving to others.ENTERTAINMENTThis would be my only complaint. If you are looking to party, you will be disppointed, because the night life here is next to none. There was some bingo, other crowd games in the lobby one night, but thats it. The next door resort, Caribe Club Princess had the entertaininment which varied every night. They have a huge outdoor theatre, ranging from low scale crowd icebreakers to a really phenomenal production of the Lion King.There is a disco at the Caribe too - lots of locals and plenty of Spanish  North American music, where your drinks are free until 2:30 am and you pay no cover, although the locals pay to come in and also to get their drinks.THE BEACHSoft white sand and clear blue waters, plenty of beach chairs and huts, never have to race down in the morning to reserve one.Because they are trying to keep the Punta Cana princess the quiter resort, people from the Caribe Club Princess  Tropical Princess can't come over to use the beach, but we could go over to use theirs.THE PEOPLEAmazingly friendly. Do whatever they can to please you. Language was sometimes a barrier as some people spoke very little English, but they will try and teach you some of their language and are not uncomfortable trying to communicate with you, so have the decency to try and talk back to them, even if just in small phrases.It saddened me to see how little the people had. we tipped a salesguy on the beach $3 after he sold us two beaded necklaces for $13 US and he had tears in his eyes. They have so little, so $3 to them is like a days work.Thats it. We had an enjoyable time. I highly recommend this resort to someone who is looking for a quiet place to relax.  
<Date>Sep 14, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Wonderful Vacation My wife and I spent a week at the Punta Cana Princess, and we couldn't have enjoyed it more. We had asked for a room with a king size bed, but none were available on the day we arrived. Jose Maria was an excellent help to us at the front desk and gave us a great room overlooking the ocean with a king bed on day 2. The food was excellent, always something different to choose from. We tried the Tex Mex Steakhouse, the Mare Nostrum, and the Mexican Restaurant (at the Caribe Club) and all were very good, especially the mixed grill at the Mare Nostrum. The Beach was beautiful and the Market on the beach was excellent for getting souvenirs. My wife and I bought several paintings, and jewlery for a very good price. When bartering, go down at least 75% of what they first offer. You will usually meet at about 60% less. For an excursion we took the speedboat/snorkel cruise and it was excellent. We were the only english speaking couple on the trip, and thus had our own tour guide for the duration of the snorkelling session. We would certainly not hesitate to go back to the PCP. It truly was an excellent vacation.  
<Date>Aug 26, 2004

<Author>Ortiz8384
<Content>An excellent Vacation but .... My family and I just returned from vacation Aug. 9 - Aug. 13 and we all had a fun time. The staff was extremely friendly and had many activities for all the guest to participate in. The beach was beautiful with white sand. We did pairsailing, snorkling, and the banana boat ride. The rooms were very spacious and the mini-fridge was always stocked. We tried two of the specialty restaurants in addition to the buffet and also went next door to the Caribe Club Princess for breakfast. Now, the only bad thing I can say about the whole experience is that we all got sick on the last day of vacation. As much as we prepared for this with all the different medicines we took down there, I believe we ate something at the Tex - Mex Steakhouse that didn't agree with us. Overall, for the price you will be satisfied with the resort. Let me know if you want to see pictures.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Didn't want to leave I can't stop talking about the great time I had. The sand is undescribably soft, the resort is so clean, the staff were extremely helpful and the food was a great experience. There is so much to do that my friend and I couldn't fit all the activities in (Marisol was a hugh help!). We had none of the problems listed in some of the other reviews. We did bring our own washclothes after reading previous reviews, but were brought washclothes almost everyday. I would recommend bringing a few snacks, the restaurants were sometimes closed between lunch and dinner and our reservations weren't until 9:00 pm. We had no problem making reservations for restaurants up to two days in advance. I also recommend the extra money for the VIP package. The 20 min massage at the spa was wonderful. I wanted to go back for some of the other services but couldn't fit the time in.I went down with one of my girlfriends, but I'll definately be going back with my husband.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>food lovers beware Just returned from 1 week at the puntacana princess resort,The resort itself was nice,It was smaller then most resorts, the pool was very large with a swim up bar, the room we had was excellent, the beachfront was very nice other then next door their is a piece of private beach which was a little dirty,(I suggest the caribe princess and punta cana princess put their hired hand to keep it clean).The buffet is very mediocore for a 4 plus to 5 star resort(sunquest rating)The salad selection consists of iceberg lettuce, that tells you the story.The food at the allacarte restaurants wasn't bad,It would be overcooked or under cooked, the waiters do not speak english and do not want to learn, I am italian and they also do not speak italian.La cava and il pescator reataurants were very good but you have to pay extra.Would I recommend the place NO.There are so many nice places in punta cana why chance it.I would recommend, the melia tropical/caribe, the riu resorts especially riu palace or riu bambu, the iberostar bavaro, melia paradisus,I have been to all three of these chains and I have been satisfied with them.Choose wisely, spend the extra money and you won't be disappointed.Punta cana princess you are lucky punta cana is such a popular destination and eventually everything good sells out and then people have no choice but to choose you.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Highly recommended hotel and facilities My friend and I stayed at the Princess for 6 nights, we found the hotel to be excellant. We are Carribean travelers and stay at only 4 star or better facilities. We found the service to be excellant, the facilities to be excellant and very clean. The beach was immaculate, the seaweed was swept off the beach daily. The staff worked incredibly hard to ensure all your needs were met. All rooms were at least two room suites with a living and bedroom. The frig in your room was stocked daily. You had the run of three hotel facilities which gave you lots of food choices. The Princess Caribe had the seafood restaurants, the Princess Punta Cana had the steak houses. Don't be shy visit the other hotels buffets and restaurants. The Caribe hotel had a MUCH bigger buffet for breakfast and lunch. We ate there several times for a larger selection. The Caribe hotel also had more children activities and facilities, where the Punta Cana was more adult in environment. Punta Cana Princess was perfect for rest and relaxation. The Caribe had entertainment at night as well. Keep in mind, you walk out the front door of Punta Cana hotel, walk 5 minutes to your left and your at the Caribe hotel (right next door). There is also a shuttle that runs door to door. So don't be afraid to stay at the Princess and shuttle over. The Caribe had LOTS of people, LOTS of noise and more competition for food, bars, and service. So think about what your needs are. Personally, I liked the Princess Punta Cana because is was less noisey and less people, better service and more facilities available (the service people to vistor ratio was better at the Punta Cana Princess). It was also the newer facility.Alcohol was plenty. You could have just about everything you wanted, when you wanted it. Every drink was very strong, at times you had to ask them to make them weaker. Drinks were everywhere. Pina Colata's and Margaritas were premade and ready for pouring on request. The presidente beer was the favorite on the island. The only thing I feel that could have been improved was the selection of wine. They offered a red and white table wine, both were a little bland, selections for wine to purchase was limited. If you have a favorite you might want to bring it with you.I enjoyed the trip, I'd do it again in a heartbeat.This one is worth the trip.  
<Date>Aug 17, 2004

<Content>Excellent Excellent Excellent!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Don't believe all the bad reviews about the PCP. My family and I went for a 4-night, 5-day vacation last week and all we can say is EXCELLENT! <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Don't believe the bad reviews I just got back from my honeymoon at the PCP. I must say that we both had an amazing time there.The beach is absolutely stunning and very clean. The resort grounds and rooms are immaculate and well presented. The service is great if you go there with a positive attitude and treat the workers with respect. The food at the a'la carte restaurants is better than average, and resembles the level of service and quality of a fine establishment. The buffet is ok, nothing to brag about, but this is expected of all inclusive resorts. There are several tours that can be taken through the hotel. We did Aqua Safari and Bavaro runners -both were awesome and totally worth the money!!If you are going here on your honeymoon, don't forget to bring your marriage certificate for a free upgrade and some special bonuses!Thanks to Ahmed, Frandy, Mariesol, Ramon, Franklin, Felipe, etc.. for making this a memorable and special time for us!
